Author: Anna S.
Content: Matteo was our server The food was good just not exactly our style tapas that we are used toThe garlic shrimp was amazing and the sangria was great to the Rose oneOur server Matteo was amazing he was so nice and pleasant and helped us in every way needed and accommodated us He was very sweet  I would come back just for his service Environment was nice and quiet also

Author: Liz K.
Content: I have been wanting to come here for a long time since I Loooooove Tapas and sangria of course I spent a few days before going over reviews drooling over pictures and making a game plan for the day HahaWELLit was the most disappointing dinner ever First service was great I ordered a Sangria flight and I loved the variety and WOW was it strong I usually only like white sangria but I was surprised how great the rose  red sangria tasted If you are not sure what sangria to get I recommend their flight They also have a great wine flight Their cocktail drinks are also greatwhich is a plusDessert was probably our favorite part of the night We ordered xocolate y avellana It had a lot of different flavor going on but the bits of saltiness made it goodUnfortunately our food was not good Patatas Bravas Looks greatbut Small portion and there was something weird about the Aioli The potato was good but the sauce was notSetas de Horno I love mushrooms I just didnt like the texture of these mushroomsvery rubbery I think they were overcooked Plus this dish was very very saltyOxtail Ravioli VERY VERY small portion 3 Raviolis for 16 but it was probably the most decent tasting tapas of allPork belly Horrible Waste of money because most of it was left on the plate In one word it tasted dirtyTortilla Espanola another major disappointment I think they worry about presentation on this one and forgot flavor We ordered another tapas but I just cant remember much about itOn a side note the main room in on the 2nd floor and is very opened so it was a little loud but you can still hear your table Unfortunately the bathroom is downstairs and it is a very creepy dark bathroom The bill does not equal the quality of the food and it was a waste since food was basically left on the plates after a few bites Everything looks so good on the menu and I love trying new thingspresentations were great but the food just was blahhh Â It was one of those nights were you didnt really drink a lot but left drunk because you didnt really eat anything

Author: Araba O.
Content: I have to say that our overall experience at Mercat was excellent despite a little hiccup in the beginningWe planned to have a large party dinner at Mercat as the last night of our family reunion a couple of weeks in advance  Not only was I excited about the menu but knew that it would be a great experience for a few members of the family who would not otherwise have Spanish cuisine or the seek the variety that tapas offersThe skinny on the hiccup has to do with the reservation and accommodations not being what was previously discussed arranged or confirmed but Casey quickly made sure that everything was set right and we had a wonderful time During the reservation process we were told that the family reunion name could be printed on the menus Casey came through with that and it was a great little keepsake as well For all of that I could not give less that 5 stars it was a pleasure dining thereFrom Casey extremely nice intuitively accommodating and professional restaurant manager a true rock star Naomi our amazing knowledgable and humorous coordinating waitress our guide on the tapas trip to the additional serving staff and the hostess we were quickly made to understand that they would care for us and do so well Casey and Naomi put us at ease and allowed us to trust in the dining experience SOO happy we didThe food was delicious I mean REALLY delicious We had the La Mesa De Jose Tasting Menu and were pleasantly met with top fresh ingredients spices and flavors for each and every item It was a absolute treat Â In our party we had a couple of vegetarians and pescatarians easily accommodated with individual adjustments in the menu Some of the favorites still being talked about days later Pimientos De Padron Gambas Al Ajillo Verdosa that salad will give you pause just wow Pelotas Veneras and the Ribeye The desert was the PERFECT closer Croquetas de Xocolata A member of the family may or may not have foraged for these on the other end of the table because there were being consumed too slowly UnconfirmedThe table wine and cocktails well matched the food The accommodations exceeded our expectations as we had planned to be on the main dining floor Naomi even brought in a couple of small speakers so that we could enjoy the music during our dinner a couple of elders hinted they may be moved to even get up and sambaCheers and thank you to Mercat for adjusting and hosting us for this pleasurable dinner The staff is top notch I highly recommend you go and explore the variety of tapas offered its a delight If I lived closer I believe I would be a regular at Mercat

Author: Kim W.
Content: I made a last minute reservation on Open Table based on good reviews on Yelp and from the attached Blackstone hotel I like the upbeat atmosphere and creative menu The complementary bruschetta starter was delicious For dinner I loved the butternut squash ravioli I was less impressed with the diver scallops They were cooked well but just too salty for my liking The sangria flight was a nice way to taste the trio I liked the RosÃ© best Id like to try dessert but Ive been sitting at my table for a ridiculously long period of time with no service If management sees this review tonight please send the waiter over to the hungry looking girl stat neglected girl is getting grumpy

Author: s r.
Content: So what is this place Is it a loud dark club or is it a restaurant The place looks like a night club This place is all about decor and not at all about food Pretty much every plate was subpar Look like it is firmly aimed at diners who care only about landing up at some hip concept spot Its good for tourists and locals who like to eat with tourists Emilios has far better tapas if not the glitz and glamor of this fake spot All style and no substanceOh yeah the pork belly was the only good thing but how can you screw up pork belly

Author: Tina L.
Content: We grabbed dinner here with a rather large group I think there were 10 of us late on a Saturday night so Im glad they were able to accommodate us We ordered a couple pitchers of the white sangria which was delicious Just a little priceyI liked pretty much every dish that we ordered The one that sticks out the most to me were the bacon wrapped dates you can never go wrong with those and the garlic shrimp It was so juicy and flavorfulOh yeah the paella was amazeballs I really loved the black rice

Author: Ed H.
Content: Came here for a work event that was hosted in their upstairs area so I had quite the experience The upstairs dining area overlooked the main dining room downstairs so it was fun to look down and see what was going onThe food here was outstanding Almost everything I tried was delicious Im guessing the restaurant put together a tasting menu for the event and there were quite a number of dishesPimientos de padron  love me some peppersDatiles con almendras  bacon wrapped dates with marcona almonds This was a different twist with the addition of the marcona almonda Gave it a nice crunch to the biteCheese and ham plate  everything was deliciousVerdosa  a great salad mix Especially love the use of asparagus and the cheese to give it a bit of saltinessPelotas de calabaza y cordero  this was good but I wasnt a fan of lamb so I avoided the lamb partRibeye  great flavor and the dipping sauce was a nice touchChorizo  didnt care too much for this dish really because its sooo processedColiflor amb mostassa  love cauliflower so really enjoyed this dishThere was more that was served All in all a great dining experience

Author: Lara D.
Content: Just got back from dinner at Mercat which came highly recommended by no fewer than three people Yet my husband and I found the whole experience to be on the whole rather disappointingThe menu is long and a little overwhelming Lots of things looked tasty but we were torn between choosing our own selections and going with one of the tasting menus We asked our waiter Jerry about the difference between the standard and luxury chefs menus and were told that the luxury version featured more exotic selections I wasnt sold but my husband riding high on a recent dinner during which we had and loved beef tongue and frog legs wanted the more adventurous option So we went for it even though I was nervous about flying blindOur meal started with the baconwrapped dates which were warm and salty and sweet and helped get the meal off on the right foot It was followed by the Serrano ham Cadi Urgelia cows milk cheese with a bacon caramel and thin green apple slices and a tricolor quinoa salad with pine nuts raisins and a lemon yogurt sauce  all very good Before we received our first course I ordered the Menta Cidro Grey Goose Citron St Germain mint fresh citrus and soda  it was fantastic but I pretty much fall in love with anything that has St Germain in it I finished it by the end of the this round of dishes but Jerry never asked me if I wanted another or followed up with me about any of the wines The empty glass sat on our table until right before the check came Next up we had some flashfried peppers eh oxtail ravioli with aged manchego in a tempranillo reduction delicious sauce  one of my favorite bites grilled baby octopus surprisingly tender a flatbread with more Serrano ham some microgreens tomato slices and cheese good  my husband liked it more than I did We were given the roasted cauliflower next which we likedand then came the proteinsThe lamb chops and accompanying sauces were excellent  the meat was super tender and full of flavor But the half lobster that was served with it was completely overcooked Im talking rubber lobster to the point where we actually sent it back Jerry apologized insincerely  he looked at us like we didnt know what we were talking about and ordered us up another lobster half This one was inconsistent in some places the lobster was cooked fine and in others overcooked again I have a hard time sending the same thing back twice so we just picked at it trying to find the less rubbery partsI should mention that in the middle of the meal I went to use the ladies room and it was a horror show The room is dark and by dark I mean there are literally three small orange lights in the room one by the sink and one in each stall The walls are painted black and you can barely see anything One stall had water all over the floor and two rolls of toilet paper sitting in the water The other stalls door wouldnt close I had to force it shut The sanitary trash cans lid was broken the sink wouldnt drain and even the woman who was using the facilities before me remarked This is disgusting Why is it so disgustingSo when the lobster incident occurred and our waiter Jerry seemed so detached from the whole thing almost annoyed I started to feel soured on the experience Even without the overcooked lobster I definitely dont feel like I got my moneys worth When you pay that much for a nice dinner you expect the whole package  great service perfect ambiance impeccable food Ive had that at other places with similar price tags and just last night I had that to the nth degree at a higherquality restaurant with a much smaller price tag When Jerry asked us about dessert I mentioned the issues with the second lobster He said You shouldve told me I couldve done something about it Well we did tell you about it the first time and you didnt do anything except give us another overcooked piece of shellfish We asked for the check and leftIf the dinner had cost even half of what we ended up paying which for the record is the most amount of money Ive ever spent on dinner for two I might have been able to overlook the lackluster service bad dish and gross bathroom But I didnt I forked over a lot of cash for a meal that ended up leaving a bad taste in my mouth literally and figuratively And thats really disappointing

Author: Melissa M.
Content: If you are even the slightest bit of an adventerous eater or just someone looking for something a little different than your usual spot Mercat should be on your list If youve been to Cafe Baba Reeba Mercat is like that Only sophisticated With flair With style And with way more flavorA great place for a date with friends or even brunch I hear Such a cool spot and some pretty great servers as well

Author: Nick C.
Content: My wife and I were having dinner with our friends another couple We were having a great time The food and drinks were very good Skip to end of dinner and dessert We recieved our check and settled our bill We were contemplating having another drink at the bar when the manager came over and asked how our meal was About a minute later he came by again to grab our payment He returned in one more minute and said I hate to do this but My friend said You must need the table The 4 of us started to get up when he said Yeah most people take about 22 12 hrs to eat and you guys have been here 3hrs WTF We just spent 375 and got insulted and embarrassed He could of said Folks we really need this table can we move you to the bar or perhaps Buy you a drink at the bar WOW

Author: Kirsten A.
Content: The food was excellent and our table service was great BUT I had made a reservation a WEEK in advance for a party of 15 and when we arrived there was no record of us in their system despite having emailed credit card authorization forms to their private events manager We had received confirmation via email day ahead of time only to find that we were not in the system at all The staff scrambled and accommodated us but I was very disappointed and would discourage large parties from going to Mercat

Author: Dave G.
Content: Full disclosure here I only had breakfast at Mercat so my review and star rating is limited by my brief exposure Mercat was a nicely appointed dark wood and white table cloth sort of place They served a really nice latte and plate of brioche French toast The food was good The service was quick Quite nice Accessible for a nonupscale hotel crowd The house restaurant for the Blackstone hotel

Author: Jie S.
Content: Pretty cool place I was trying to find a place along the red line where I could have a nice kidsfree dinner before the show at the Chicago theater One of my city friends recommended this place We all loved our dinnerSangria flight I wanted to try everything a bit so I got all housemade Sangria I loved the Blanco and Rose better which have a more crispy taste without too much sugary stuff Ladies you will like thisTapas Tapas Everything we tried from the Tapas menu was delicious Flash fried pepper was fresh with a nice spicy kick Spanish Octopus was solid and tender which contradict each other but that was how I felt Garlic shrimp was so juicy and flavorful Â Ham and Chorizon Croueutte were fried so nicely Perfect crunch outside and soft in side If I could have a second round of those four tapas dishes Id suggest the Octopus The flatbread with shot ribs was pretty good but not that impressive Then the main one for us is Paella Negro Truly a dark dish The picture looked awful when the black Â rice filled dish on the top of a black table We ordered this by the time we sat down Took about 55 minutes to cook for us Seafood in the plate was fresh and meaty The rice tasted great at the beginning but I realized it is a bit salty for me No worries guys quickly finished everything in the panHorchata bon bons for dessert Perfectly bite size so you wont feel guilty i loved the unique combination of texture among ice cream rice crisp chocolate and burned brown brittle on the top Services were professional and on the point which made our once of the year kids free dinner much more enjoyable

Author: S M.
Content: Gorgeous venue with nice wines and sangria I rarely say this but overpriced for portion sizes neither of us are big eaters 24 lamb chops were delicious but more of a 15 portion  two midsized chopsAlso no matter what the server says dishes here are heavy on olive oil sometimes added post cooking before arriving at your table Â Would prefer they just leave that offOverall very nice decor but prices beyond reason for portion size

Author: Ivan D.
Content: Must Try Restaurant Efficient service delicious food intimate ambiance and zero complaints from this guyTapas were served within minutes from ordering My wife and I ordered the DATILES CON ALMENDRAS bacon wrapped dates and the GAMBAS AL AJILLO garlic shrimp  worth every penny I could eat these all day but id be in debtFor our main entree we shared the PAELLA NEGRA a skillet of black calaspara rice mixed with a sea of seafood just delicious Dessert  CROQUETES DE XOCOLATA and HORCHATA BON BON 11 on a scale of 10 mouth wateringWe will return

Author: Perla C.
Content: Their sangria is hit or miss food is average and service can be friendlier

Author: Kenneth R.
Content: Mercat a la Planxa was a singularity in my lifeI bookmarked this establishment weeks ago on the recommendation of my friend Mark G Â It turned out that the two of us were going to be in Chicago at the same time so it was natural for us to visit Mercat together Â I told him that Id defer to his recommendationsTo my surprise he suggested the tasting menu which normally I would never have chosen Â Not only that he wanted us to order the luxury tasting menu Â With wine pairings Â I felt a bit out of my league but I consented without much further discussion Â Our server complicated things by pointing out that we wouldnt get much wine with our pairings which were 40 apiece Â I can put you into a really good bottle for your 80 bucks Â We ended up with a 2007 Rioja which was only 75  I immediately felt a rush of virtuous moderation Â Actually I was baffled because I thought that it would be natural to start with a glass of sherry or maybe a vinho verde Â No said the server the house cuisine calls for red wineWe sat back relaxed and enjoyed the show Â The iberico ham was pretty darn good but it didnt match the ham Id had in Barcelona Â Everything else was good to excellent and there was a lot of food that passed the top of our table Â Someone served us a plate of grilled peppers that were declared to be padrÃ³ns Â I could see at a glance that they were shishitos and asked if they werent possibly shishitos instead of padrÃ³ns Â No sir theyre padrÃ³ns Â I was sufficiently puzzled that I asked another server who passed by our table to ask how everything was Â She told us that the house gets its padrÃ³n peppers from Wisconsin  but that the growing season is very short no surprise there Â I was right we were eating shishito peppers and enjoying them tremendouslyMercat a la Planxa is definitely worth visiting Â I suspect that youll get more bang for your buck if you order individual dishes and stay away from the tasting menus Â But maybe Im wrong about that Â I had a headache the next morning but it went away after a few double espressos

Author: Steven H.
Content: Pretty darn excellent food Mixto Croquetas delicious fritters Conill Amb Castanyes rabbit pasta and Ropa de Cabra roasted goat in a delicious saucePretty darn good food Bruschetta served upon seating a la planxa calamari and scallops calamari was better had a nice char andPretty forgettable surprised I remembered I ate it Cepes y Butifarra mushroom and sausage flatbread although it didnt seem like there was any sausage Throw in some great service and overpriced drinks and you have an experience well worth 4 to 45 Yelp stars in the South Loop

Author: E M H.
Content: We live In the neighborhood and this place is delish Great tapas and so many to choose from Highlights for me included the octopus flatbread wagyu and shrimp Oh and the red sangria  the pitcher is huge and never ends Pretty room My only hesitation is that they probably dont change the menu often which makes it hard to return 100x better than Cafe Babareeba

Author: Tony M.
Content: Fantastic service and tasty tapas for a Friday night I felt like a judge eating most of the flavorful tapas from the owner Iron Chef Jose Garces Most of the tapas are full of flavor and the seafood fresh from the sea I can taste that they marinated almost everything from the lamb to the mushrooms All of the food was prepared right and you get what you pay for I never asked for a refill on my water cause it was always refilled so quick Great selection of drinks to choose fromThe lamb melted in my mouth and full of flavor from the grill The mushrooms had great flavor and could not get enough of it This place has the best desserts Flavorful desserts like horchata ice cream and fried chocolateYou should expect to pay for Iron Chef owner Jose Garces quality food Nice upscale atmosphere that you can have a conversation with your friends and hear them without the loud music

Author: Krishna P.
Content: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago for breakfast at least I had the brioche french toast which was great It came with a vibrant orange marmalade and a smoked honey butter which was also quite good We also had the 2 eggs any style with turkey sausage which was AMAZING Their turkey meat is the best Ive ever had the turkey bacon specifically is so good and cooked perfectly Cant vouch for lunch and dinner but Ive heard good things Also came at a very reasonable price

Author: Padma A.
Content: This post is 2 weeks late we went on Friday may 30th with a group of friends from Texas Our guests loved the experience of the tapas there were a couple of vegetarians in the group too but for me the highlight was the lamb chops and the desserts We picked up the bill for a whopping 300  i forgot my creditcard after paying and yet to go get it Highly recommended for anyone wanting the Michigan Ave grant park Â view experience at a restaurant

Author: Michael S.
Content: We were in from outoftown and were staying at the Blackstone next door We came in around 915 on a Tuesday night so that was our mistake although the restaurant is open until 1000 PM We went with the chefs tasting since it was already fairly lateLets get this out of the way the tapas were all excellent I would recommend the mushroom flatbread the bruschetta baconwrapped dates garlic shrimp and many of the other things that we had The sazerac made at the bar was very goodThat being said our service was really really really bad The restaurant was pretty empty we were asked if we had a reservation we didnt because it was a Tuesday night and we were in the adjacent hotel and were seated in a corner with very little space We were barely checked on by the wait staff and they seemed annoyed to be serving us at all though they were perfectly happy to be serving all the other patrons We went for a while without refills on drinks then five tapas would be brought out at once We were made to feel unwelcome for coming in late I think our server recognized there was a problem at the end and tried to pull it together but we really just wanted to leave at that point The food was great but being treated poorly soured the experience substantiallyMy recommendation is to tell patrons that your last seating is at 900 PM if you dont have any interest in new customers at 915 PM This goes double if you want to associate yourself with a hotel

Author: Kate K.
Content: This review is based on brunch because thats the only meal Ive ever eaten here but I highly recommend it for big groups or visitors Mercat takes reservations for brunch but the best part of this place is that you really dont need them  there is never a wait for Sunday brunch I dont understand why but definitely not complaining They have a small a la carte menu featuring pretty normal options eggs pancakes Benedicts but the way to go is the tasting menu The menu changes daily but its usually six to seven dishes total plus charcuterie and pastries Its TONS of food for only 28 such an unbelievable deal The food is pretty solid i usually love most of them and feel okay about a couple Our menu today was manchego chorizo churros cupcakes and cookies charcuterie and pastries bacon wrapped dates Â  almond pancakes first course appetizer sampler plus chorizo eggs benedict second course then finally scrambled eggs with pork sausage and veggies  pork shoulder and potatoes third course They have an amazing makeyourown Bloody Mary bar too with pickled veggies and gazpacho So tons of delicious tapas style dishes no wait and all for the price of an average brunch entree YES

Author: Chrissy W.
Content: I found my happy place Obviously the happy place involves cheeseSo I usually avoid ordering cheese plates at restaurantsnot always but I definitely think extra carefully about it Mostly because its fcking expensive and I can go to one of my favorite cheese shops and pay significantly less for a larger portion of fancy cheesy goodnessAt Mercat a la Planxa they made the cheese board well worth my time Each cheese selection is carefully paired with an accoutrement Each cheese selection offers its own unique flavor combination And my happy place Came in the Monte Crudo paired with truffle lavender quince compote I seriously wanted to pick up the ramekin and lick every last drop of it As classy as I am thoughI merely pulled it over to my plate as the busser was taking the mostly empty save my compote happy place cheese platterand then I used bread to swirl the remaining contents into my mouth I have zero shame The other cheese and accoutrements were tasty but the truffle lavender quince I want to Sinead OConnor that shit and start singing to it So the server recommended that we order 3 per person and that we order it all at once Were not really the type to follow directions apparently While three of us waited for two others we ordered baconwrapped dates and our server brought out the tomato bread which was really good We also placed an order for the paella knowing it would take the longest Im pretty sure our server was super annoyed at us for not listening to her and for going out of orderbasically our paella was going to come out before most of our food which turned out to be a really good thing While we were eating the paella we ordered a few of the tapas a cheese and charcuterie and a salad We did not order 3 per person We didnt even order 2 per person And because the paella was so filling we were down for the count a little past halfway through the tapas with just enough room for dessert A quick rundown of the mealDINNERDatiles Con Almendras  you can never go wrong with bacon wrapped datesPaella Valenciana  my first venture into the world of paella The BF doesnt do seafood so we went with the chicken and sausage option OMG This thing fed an army and tasted AMAZING The chicken was juicy and flavorful The rice and seasonings were perfect YUM Mixto Croquetas  ham and chorizo thingies Very delish Patatas Bravas  if I told you they were just okay would you believe meVerdosa  this green salad was super refreshing and full of flavor Queso Mixto  HIGHLY RECOMMENDEDOr just order 3 of the monte crudo Â I dont actually know what the other two cheeses were The were not near the limelightCharcuteria Mixto  It was okay The mustard creme fraiche was quite tastyDESSERTCroquetas de Xocolata  OMFG I cant accurately describe how sweet and delish these little pots of gold sitting on marshmallow clouds were Blueberry Creme Fraiche ice cream  tasted like blueberry cheesecakeCarmelized White Chocolate ice cream  my fave of the ice cream trioBlood Orange Cava sorbet  this was nice but nothing to write home aboutI really wanted to give it 5 stars but I just couldnt The food was really delicious but the service was really rushed Our server was nice enough but I feel like all of the items being brought out at one time is a waste I cant imagine having ordered FIFTEEN dishes that all ended up on our TINY table at the same time With five of us crammed around a table that should only seat 34 we barely had room for the plates It was a race to make room at the table Additionally I think that the 3 per person recommendation is off I guess it depends on what youre ordering but with a paella we were good for 1 other tapas item each

Author: Cameron B.
Content: Came here with a big group for brunch on a polarvortex type of day in Feb We went with the prix fixe menu and a couple of pitchers of sangria to share The atmosphere was bright and welcoming The open kitchen warmed the space with the steam and smells of sizzling dishes and the food was plentiful But it was just ok To be honest i cant tell you about a single dish or the sangria it was all kinda just good Still with excellent service and a great space Id recommend a group brunch at Mercat especially on a day when you need a bit of spice in your frozen bones

Author: Janelle C.
Content: This is another great find in Chicago Â Every dish we tried was amazing Â There were four of us and we each ordered two dishes Â That left Â us all feeling pretty sated Â Every dish was fantastic and loved how the first tastebites came out just as the server was finishing explaining how they would course everything out for the table Â  Also liked the dÃ©cor  very cool looking restaurant

Author: Tricia F.
Content: So goodHeres what we got and my faves Oxtail Ravioli holy goodness Â not big but SO goodWrapped Dates I could eat so manyShaved Brussel Sprouts LovePatats Bravas you get a lot of these for the price YumFlatbread goodBacon Wrapped Lamb good but not our fave Â 2 sticks of meatGarlic Shrimp not bad but not a highlightDessert something with marshmallow and chocolate balls Â It wasnt bad but Id rather have spent those calories on more of the ravioli or wrapped dates Atmosphere is great too Â We went for restaurant week but ended up just ordering off the regular menu left full and spent way less than the prefix Lastly we had to ask for the complimentary bread Â It was very good too so dont forget to ask for it if it doesnt come out early

Author: Ramnath S.
Content: Amazing foodand great location Everything I ordered was amazing specially the Colorado Lamb La Planxa and the Grilled OctopusThe place had a great vibe even on a weeknightI ordered the Sangria sampler and they were OKmight need some adjustments as I have had much better Sangrias in other Spanish placesAlso the entrance is a little confusing because as soon as you enter all you see is a sorry bar The main dining area is on Level 2 and its hard to know if its your first time So I was just hanging out by the door waiting for someone to help me If some random waitress had not stopped by I would have thought that the bar area was the restaurant and would probably have leftBut once you get to the restaurant I forgot all about itHighly Recommended

Author: Demitri P.
Content: One of the best meals Ive had Creative unique beautifully presented and so delicious Its on my permanent list of restaurants to eat at whenever I visit Chicago

Author: Betsy R.
Content: Friday night the huz and I decide to try this place The room is pretty awesomelooking and its location inside the Blackstone wins it a few points We were seated quickly which worked because I was approaching serious levels of hunger I noticed that the table next to us got some pan con tomate so I asked if perchance we would be treated to some as well I cultivated a true love for pan con tomate while in Barcelona so I was feeling like this was a good sign of what was to come We were brought the pan fine pretty good actually probably the most authentically presented thing we ate all night and ordered a few other items from the menu to share They were out of one thing we wanted and our server had some trouble recommending something to replace it but we figured it out Then inexplicably our server took a turn from being decently friendly to not giving a crap about us anymore He could not have been less interested in giving us an enjoyable experience He obviously cared deeply for the two outoftown ladies sitting next to us They were being fawned over by not only our server but basically the entire male staff while Stuart and I are sitting right there feeling like outcasts Let us in to your revery We came for a good time tooThe rest of the food came It was definitely good Was it amazing Not really Was the saffron aoili that came with the patatas bravas seriously like crack cocaine as said by our server Definitely not Also dont compare something to crack to your customers We asked for and were given the bill with NO final thank you have a good night thanks for coming NADA He basically tossed it on the table and ran away Pretty par for the course at that point At that price point or at ANY for that matter service like that was just plain rude Add that to food that was not as special as it should have been and we wont be back Damn I wanted to love you Mercat

Author: Shan D.
Content: Not your run of the mill Spanish tapas restaurant Many of the dishes are creative and packed with flavor I am addicted to their empanadas They also have some of the standard tapas that you would find at a place like iberico Prices are on the higher side but not unreasonable either Great spot for any occasion

Author: Brandon B.
Content: This is the best tapas Ive ever had bar none Â I tried the chefs tasting menu and I wasnt disappointed with a single plate Â They were incredibly accommodating to my shellfish allergy Â This place is rather pricey but was worth every penny

Author: Alice H.
Content: As I was writing my last review I thought it would be nice to revisit this place since it had been about a 6 months since I had last been hereThe food was again of course delicious Â I especially liked the endives and the jumbo prawns which are super juicy and flavorful However this time I got the Sangria sampler there was literally about 1 oz of sangria in each cup and the rest was all ICE Â The red and rose sangria were really watered down Â I was shocked Â The last time I had been here each sangria was unique and full of fruity flavors Â  This time it tasted like kool aid water Â Not happy Â  As a result we opted to switch out the sangria sampler for Â pitcher of the white sangria since this was the only one that had any flavor left Â It was ok but we didnt finish it Â Disappointed with the sangria Â I dont know if I should point the blame in the preparation of the sangria or just the preparation of the drink by our server Â Nobody wants to drink a cup of ice with dinner

Author: Sharon C.
Content: Nice ambiance and location Service was disappointing The waiter seemed put out by our groups questions about serving sizes and tapas ordering once he found out we werent going to order the chef dinner Food was good not spectacular

Author: Alan G.
Content: Food is first rate tasty interesting well prepared Â But the abysmal service destroys the experience Â After getting our first course we were told the second was on the way Â Yep an hour later after the manager had to take Â over to get the kitchen going Â Never saw our waiter again not even to apologize Â After giving us some olives big whoop when the food finally came I was so upset I couldnt eat it Â Was tasty though Â And this was no coincidence or bad night Â The place was not crowded and the exact same thing happened the last time we were there last year Â Something is very wrong with this place They wont be seeing us again even though I love their food Â KEEP AWAY

Author: Jason H.
Content: I have been here twice and loved each experience was top notch Â I definitely recommend going with the tasting Menu and treat yourself to the wine pairings Â Since the person I was with does not eat a lot of seafood they tailored the menu so that she could enjoy the experience as much as I did Â Wonderful staff will make your evening grandI can not wait to come back and try their brunch

Author: Erika G.
Content: Well its no longer called Bodega No 5 but this downstairs bar has not lost its sexy vibe Still a great place to hole up with with a muy guapo companion for some cocktails of interest The Sangria is as delicious as ever and the snacks are just as tempting

Author: Doug B.
Content: Phenomenal menu and cooking Â Every dish was virtually the best of its kind weve ever had Â Leave room for dessert  incredible creations

Author: Lisa H.
Content: There are so many different tapas restaurants scattered across the Chicagoland area but Mercat a la Planxa was one that has been on my list for a while that I havent tried Â Due to the high recommendations from my foodie boss and knowing that Chef Jose Garces winner of Iron Chef is the executive chef I knew I would have to give this place a try Â So during restaurant week my two friends and I decided to take advantage of the discounted price Â But when we arrived we just decided to order a la cart because the pre fixe menu didnt offer enough varietyWe started off with some complimentary focaccia bread which was amazing Â It is probably one of the best tasting complimentary bread offered at any restaurant I have been to Â Everything on the menu sounded delicious so we kind of ordered quite a few dishesColiflor Amb Mostassa roasted cauliflower toasted with pickled mustard seeds raisins and paprika bread crumbs Â The cauliflower wasnt overcooked so it retained its crunchiness which I liked Â I also enjoyed the different flavors that were tossed into this simple vegetable dishGambas Y Chorizo Flatbread marinated shrimp with chorizo cantimpalo garbanzo bean puree tomato escabeche and manchego Â This was very similar in flavors as the focaccia bread Â The only difference was that there was shrimp that topped off the bread Â We liked it but were disappointed that it had a similar palette as the complementary breadRopa De Cabra goat ropa vieja and goat cheese served with baguette Â This was way too rich for me Â Something about the mixture of the meat and cheese made the whole dish really hearty Â I couldnt bear to eat more than one tiny baguetteDatiles Con Almendras dates almonds and la peral wrapped in bacon Â This is one of the dishes I was looking forward to because my boss kept raving about it Â I thought it was just ok Â To me the dates werent sweet enough to balance the saltiness from the bacon but I did appreciate the surprise almond in the middle Â It gave everything a good nutty after tasteGambas Al Ajillo garlic shrimp served with guindilla chilies and toast Â This is one of the best dishes we ordered Â Everything about this dish was just right Â It was piping hot the shrimp was very succulent and the sauce seemed to be seasoned wellMixto Croquettes serrano ham and chorizo croquettes served with a romesco sauce Â We ordered this based on the reviews of many Yelpers Â There was nothing about this dish that stood out but it wasnt badPatatas Bravas spicy potatoes served with smoked paprika aioli Â This is a staple whenever I eat at a tapas place Â I thought these potatoes were just mediocre Â It didnt have enough kick to them but I did like the crispy textureFor dessert we orderedHorchata Bon Bon horchata ice cream cinnamon and puffed rice dipped in dark chocolate and garnished with coconut cream and marcona brittle Â Oh this was so delicious Â Anything dark chocolate lures me in Â I enjoyed the freshness of the ice cream spice from the cinnamon and sweetness from the chocolate Â So many textures and flavors made this a winning dish for meCroquetes de Xocolata milk chocolate croquettes with banana marshmallow rosemary infused caramel and olive oil Â I didnt enjoy these croquettes as much as the bon bons but it was still goodThere are a handful of delicious tapas offered here but there was also a lot I wasnt too fond about Â Was this place worth the hype Â I dont think so Â I appreciate how they play with flavors and textures that you dont usually see in traditional tapas but some just didnt work that well Â Also the price tags on each dish are more expensive than other tapa places approximately 1225 a dish Â I wouldnt mind paying the extra bucks if this place offered something spectacular but it wasnt consistent across the board Â If Im ever back in the area I might stop in for a quick bite but I would not make the extra effort to come here

Author: Doug B.
Content: Phenomenal menu and cooking Â Every dish was virtually the best of its kind weve ever had Â Leave room for dessert  incredible creations

Author: Angus L.
Content: Way way way Â over priced everything Â  Ordered the bacon wrapped datesthey show up 4 of them for 9 Â Thats 225 for each one Â 9 for one angry orchard cider Â Food was tasty but Â I could have the same meal at other tapas places in the city for way less

Author: KC M.
Content: Fabulous food Â Excellent service Â We had a party of 7  opted for the chefs luxury tasting menu and it was delicious  some of our favorites were the bacon wrapped dates spanish prosciutto Â the goat dish Â quinoa salad new york strip and lamb chops Â Save room for dessert Â The bon bons and leche frita were amazing The only reason I didnt give it 5 stars was because not everyone in our mixed group loved the ambiance Â  Very high ceilings added to the loud volume level in the dinning room Â We would definitely go back again and recommend to anyone who likes tapas style dinning

Author: Paula N.
Content: Had the set brunch menu Delicious and really good value for what you get The almond stuffed Â bacon wrapped dates were amazing

Author: R B.
Content: Definitely underwhelming A 645pm reservation wasnt seated until 720pm Even more frustrating because I saw open tables The food was average for tapas with a much smaller tapas menu than other similar restaurants in the city The server wasnt particularly attentive and even though she said they will pace the food coming out if you order several items at once everything came at the same time The pro is that the food does come out quickly Id say skip it

Author: Nerri Y.
Content: My friend and I had dinner here on recommendation from a fellow foodie friend Overall it was a good meal but didnt quite live up to the hype  and nothing kills my impression of a restaurant quite like unfulfilled expectationsWe started out with a complimentary bruschettatype dish that was garlicky and delicious The crispy brussel sprouts and bacon wrapped dates were easily my two favorite things on the menu I was sorely disappointed by the patatas bravas  I had high expectations after eating them for almost every meal while in Spain At Mercat they were incredibly bland and the seasoning on it tasted like flavorless seaweed Not my favorite For the meat dishes we ordered the mari y montanya and a pork belly dish The short ribs and scallops in the mari y montanya were to die for  absolutely worth it Pork belly is usually my favorite but the texture was not what I am used to Instead of a crispy exterior the whole thing was soft and was more of a boiled texture The flavor was great though so no complaints thereWe washed everything down with a pitcher of rose sangria that was light and refreshing All in all there were a few soso plates and a few great plates If I lived in Chicago I would definitely come back to try out some of the other dishes The price point is a little high but for a special occasion its worth it

Author: Shelly A.
Content: After skimming through some of the other reviews it looks like most of us are in agreement here Overall Ive really enjoyed the food both times Ive dined at Mercat However its not worth the pretty penny youve got to drop to try many things and fill yourself up here Each dish is priced like a full entree 1520 each approx but is extremely tiny  even with a group of 4 youll need to order multiples of the same dish Now that Ive tried a lot of the menu here are some specific thoughtspatatas bravas  one of my favorites made better than most other placeswild mushrooms  delicious but 15 bucks reallyempanada de verde  tasty only comes with 2 flatbreads  all of them are good again small for the price but easy to shareoxtail ravioli lamb meatballs bacon wrapped dates  all are delicious There are a few Im missing but these are the dishes that really stand out to me The space is great and I like the location especially for hosting visitors that want to be near Milennium Park and other parts of downtown The desserts and cocktails are also fantastic and relatively reasonably priced so overall this place will offer you the whole package However  bib gourmand is a bit of a stretch pricewise The quality is great but their whole 40 for two principle is just not going to happen here

Author: Merete M.
Content: If you have money to blow on a fancy night out I would recommend Mercat a la Planxa Our table of 9 kept ordering and sharing and had a lovely time Ill agree with some of the reviews Ive been seeing and say that some of the prices are a bit much for what you get However we loved everything we had Do not go if youre eating on a budget Eating here is definitely for those who can afford to splurge

Author: Michelle D.
Content: a little on the pricey side and the portions being tapas are on the smaller side Â But the food was incredibly good I had the red wine sangria which was flavorful but not overwhelming Â For food I ate the Shrimb  Chorizo flatbread baconwrapped dates and the chocolate croquettes Â I was by myself and wish I was with others so that I could taste more dishes Â The dishes I had were absolutely fantastic and just enough for one person

Author: Emily C.
Content: Love the food at Mercat but wow is it pricey for what you get Â The bacon wrapped dates are delicious  we kept ordering more because you dont get that many Â When we got the bill we realized we had spent 27 on dates Â Portions are quite smallLove the beef shortrib flatbread octopus garlic shrimp anything the servers recommended was good Â Try the sangria flight  you get to try all three sangrias they have and they are all good343365

Author: Haley J.
Content: First off its inside a hotel and we had a hard time trying to figure out how to get to the restaurant once inside the hotel The restaurant is beautiful but I did not enjoy the food The portions are small and pricey I got the Spanish omelette and did not like it at all It was very bland and there was too much of the sauce on top which I did not think tasted good at all

Author: Julie D.
Content: Nothing works up an appetite like strolling thru the parks of Chicago Â We stopped by Mercat at lunchtime for much needed sustenance Â And this turned out to be my favorite meal in Chicago Â I had watched The Next Iron Chef  America when Chef Jose Garces competed and very happy when he won the competition Â So I was more than happy to try his restaurant Â And as an added bonus chef de cuisine Cory Morris was born in Salt Lake City Utah Â So I consider him to be my home boyWe werent sure of the location of the restaurant other than it was in the Renaissance Blackstone Â When we arrived I was thinking it was located on the first floor which is really the lounge area and was deserted Â I called and we were directed upstairs to the second floor and was greeted right away by the very friendly host staff Â We got a table over looking the dining room and near a bright and sunny window Â The tall arched windows are beautiful lighting is cheerful and so it the use of color in the roomOur server was extremely professional and helpful and we knew that we were in good hands and even trusted him to assist us in making our choices for lunch Â BJ started with a local beer I tryed a La Mora which as Bulleit bourbon agave nectar blackberries mint and black pepper Â When my server noticed that I was not a fan of my cocktail he asked about that but I refused a replacement Â But he took it upon himself to select me a different drink Â He got me a Menta Cidro which was Grey Goose Citron St Germain mint fresh citrus and soda Â This drink was amazing and I loved itFor my meal I started with Arroz a la cazuela which is a saffron scented broth with shrimp chicken chorizo artichoke confit and piquillo aioli Â This is the best soup that I have ever had Â The very best Â It was very filling full of flavor so incredible Â BJ got an ensalade verde the salad was mixed greens asparagus avocado green beans topped shaved Mahon cheese Â The salad was also very goodFor our meals BJ got a hanger steak sandwich which was a perfectly grilled medium rare Â It was topped with la peral cheese caramelized onions and tomatoes Â It was really a good sized sandwich Â I got the shrimp  chorizo flatbread with garbonzo bean puree and tomato Â It was so good Â The only blip in our perfect lunch occured when somehow my flatbread got confused for a short rib one Â The kitchen quickly worked to make me the correct one Â No complaints from me mix ups happens Â But our server felt the need to reward us with a dessert Â Croquetes de xocolata was a welcome sight at our table Â These little balls of yummy goodness  milk chocolate croquettes banana marshmallow rosemary infused caramel and arbequina olive oil Â Perfect finish to a perfect lunch Â We loved Mercat

Author: Kris G.
Content: The food was all pretty good with the exception of our paella it was extremely salty we couldnt even finish it Â If you want the real feel of tapas this is not your place Â This place is more about making the food look nice presentation Â It was cute I cant deny that but that is definitely not was real tapas look like Â My patatas bravas looked like tater tots with a pasty cream on top of it I so wasnt expecting that They tasted pretty good for the most part but Cafe Iberico takes the cake with patatas bravas oh and the sangria too Â The biggest disappointment was the pitcher of Sangria it had more than half ice and was extremely watered down Â Not to mention the pitcher was extremely small and costed nearly 40 so not worth it Â You are not supposed to serve sangria WITH ICE it waters it down typically you get a small pitcher of ice to add on your own Â My RED sangria honestly looked pink We wont be going back and now Im craving Cafe Iberico

Author: Helene L.
Content: Location  2nd floor of the Blackstone Hotel Â 1 mile south of Mag Mile Drinks Lo Mora cocktail and rose sangria are well made Food Portions are tapas size but they pack flavor I highly recommend the chefs tasting menu great value 3 course meal with 34 plates per course I highly recommend the scallops and braised short ribs duck breast and xoxolate y avellana chocolate with hazelnut nougatine etc and horchata Bon Bon I would pass on the lemon cheesecake next time Service at the restaurant on a Wednesday night at 9 pm was fabulous Servers and support staff were all attentive Bar service downstairs could be slow on a Friday night Our bartender was forgetting our requests

Author: Judy K.
Content: So delicious Â Bit pricey Â But worth it

Author: Bradford G.
Content: Black angus ribeye rare Served sliced with three saucesOn the side spinach with currants sherry reduction and apples And a Vivant Solitude abbey ale Fantastic

Author: Ralph P.
Content: Mercat is a tapas place like no other Did not really know what we were in for when we got there but we were quite excited when we heard that the Owner was an iron chef winner Â This restaurant did not disappoint at all The staff was very welcoming and accommodating often helping us increase the table size as our party grew immediately upon request Â The server staff was professional courteous and knowledgeable Their tapas recommendations were so good we just requested that they just keep the food coming until we could not handle anymore I doubt we could rename anything we ate last night but one thing is certain we could not stop talking about how excellent the food was Â If you are in Chitown you dare not miss this place Mercat is too good to pass up Thanks again to the staff for a memorable night

Author: David Y.
Content: We had empanadas which was very flavorful Â The spicy potatoes were interesting with the aoli sauce on top Â It has a unique texture to itButternut squash with truffle oil was tasty and sweet Â Chorizo was not burnt but charred with good flavorFlatbread with short ribs was excellent Â It had some sauerkraut on top which meshed well with the ribsOverall service was great and a great place for tapas

Author: Eugenie Y.
Content: Foods are okay but overall a way too salty Garlic shrimps are awesome Other than this I dont find any foods are impressive and worth to recommend

Author: Carol S.
Content: We set out to eat at a convenient spot near the Blackstone theater reserved via opentable which told us we had to eat at 530 Too early but ok its a hot spot When we arrived the place was empty except for a few folks at the bar They sat us upstairs overlooking the dining room which was emptyfelt like we were in the back fortyThe food was great for the first two courses then we had undercooked sea bass had to send it back Got lobster instead The waiter was so uninterested in us perhaps because we did not order any alcohol The lobster was served by man who took it from the shell but dropped it on the tablethen he put the dropped food back on our plate YuckThe waiter did check to see if we liked the lobster Then the manager came by asked about the returned sea bass and apologized Unfortuantely she told us that was not a good dish Too much infoOverall this was an expensive meal the service was poor We did get an adjustment from the manager but without explanation We called out the discrepancy in Â the price on our bill versus the charge card to our waiter who said she gave you some money off Im not sure whyWe will not return

Author: Holly B.
Content: Go There Now I found this restaurant via Yelp as I was sitting exhausted in my hotel room next door after flying in from China in coach I was starving as plane food was well plane food  inedible The server was both energetic and kind as he pointed out the many many delicioussounding tapas on the extensive menu Tired and hungry as my eyes rolled back in my head at the realization that my brain was going to be called upon to make further choices he suggested the chefs tasting menu Bingo It was incredible Scrumptious food soon started appearing from the magical kitchen and as my blood sugar level started approaching normal I realized that I had found food nirvana I chatted with the ladies next to me who were enjoying completely different dishes and they loved everything they tried Absolutely get the lamb and the almondstuffed dates Cool space Great service Outstanding food Thank you Yelp

Author: Cameron F.
Content: The food and service was excellent Â I ordered the tasting menu to fully experience the restaurant and left completely satisfied Â The lamb chop was by far the best of the 7 different dish that I sampled For drinks I also did a bit of sampling and went with the Sangria flight Â While my list of comparables is small I would say this sangria was the best and will likely remain at the top for some time Â Service staff was very kind and Â knowledgable Â The only draw back that led to a 4 and not a 5 was the interior by no means lacking in character I was just not amazed

Author: linda-lou n.
Content: Expensive but totally worth every single biteOur hotel in Chicago was literally right next to this restaurant and even though we walked past it and yelped it the very first night we decided to wait to experience this restaurant toward the end of our trip When we arrived there were no seats available so we sat at the bar with the bartender He was super friendly and suggested we get some appetizers while we waited So we ordered some bacon wrapped dates Devoured Then we ordered some shrimp rolls So good And next thing we knew our table was available but our bartender was so welcoming that we gave it up and stayed at the bar That is a first for meNot only was the food amazing but it really helped that the bartender gave us tons of suggestions and what his favorite least fav options were While the food was amazing the exp made it all the more so Would absolutely eat here again In fact cant wait til my next trip

Author: Francis R.
Content: Found this place less than a block from our hotel and it was amazing Food and service were wonderful For lunch we chose the Catalan Express deal which was a choice of a first course and second course plus a nonalcoholic beverageThe host quickly sat us at a table with a view of Grant Park and our server Antonio was very knowledgeable and his suggestions were great The Arroz a la Casuela soup scallop dish and hangar steak dish were delicious and everything was plated artistically There was even a Hollywood celebrity sitting a few tables away Really glad we found this place and will definitely recommend it to our relatives in Chicago and visit again on our next trip

Author: Emily B.
Content: Mercat dining room upstairs is a nice addition for tapas in the South Loop The most memorable thing I ate was the baconwrapped date with bleu cheese fondue sauce drizzled on top go figure why this was memorable My second favorite menu item was the goatour server said it was the sleeperdark horse of the menu and he was rightIf you are a sangria fan go with the pitcher Shared between 3 friends I nabbed 25 glasses from it Not a bad dealService is friendly Atmosphere is a little loud and crazy but all in all a fun time with friends

Author: Yancey K.
Content: Dont be fooled by the awkward patio or empty bar on the ground floor this place is busy and outstanding We had a party of 5 that included a picky 7 year old and a true Spaniard all were more than satisfied and said it would be a place to come back to on every visit to Chicago

Author: Scott L.
Content: OK Huge hype about this place and I have eaten here before enjoying every morsel of food presented Key word in that past sentence was enjoying This time its said to say I did not have the same experienceFirst the food was coming so fast you couldnt find a spot on the table for it and the waiters continued to circle like vultures circling road kill in the summer heat looking for any empty dish they could takenothing like having someone stare and you with the are you finished look I wanted to have a little bread with some of the drippings on one of the plates but I feared I would lose an appendage if I tried to grab the empty plateSecond due to the fact that the food was shooting out of the kitchen like tennis balls from a machine during a practice session the food on the table was getting cold Once you went to have as taste it is all tapas the portion at the table was cold Third can you be more over priced Seriously I eat at some very nice restaurants from coasttocoast and Im not opposed to paying for great food service atmosphere or something unique but come on It was 95 per head and we werent boozing it up with wine or cocktailsWhat once was a fun inviting place now feels like an overpriced corporate food shack

Author: Tom C.
Content: This place makes some really good tapas The patatas bravas were really clever and delicious we ordered a second serving The pimentos were outstanding The garlic shrimp were disappointing but the spanish tortilla was a really nice take on the classic dish The wine list needs some workI would give the place four stars but unfortunately we had mediocre service Our waiter was hard to get a hold of and before dinner we sat at the bar for a half an hour Before our first order of drinks arrived notice I said we were there 30 minutes we were moved to our table I also thought the restaurant was too crowded

Author: Jessica M.
Content: Mercat has all that you need for a fancy date night or girls night out Our party of three were invited to dine at Mercat at the courtesy of Yelp As part of the event we were served with two wine flights and two appetizers I cannot recall the name of the wine but one was a red wine and the other was champagne A shrimp on skewer and bread with goat cheese was served to pair with the wine Wonderful zealous bites Aside from Yelps treat we opted to order a few tapas off the menu We ordered the monte enebro fermin jamon serrano ham and chorizo croquettes and bacon wrapped dates Our favorite was the goat cheese and croquettes The cheese was smooth and pungent It was excellently paired with the pear slices bread and saffron compote The croquettes were meltinyourmouth bites The bacon wrapped dates are slightly different from the other ones that I have had These are a little less crispy but sliced almond are tucked within the bacon It gave the bite an extra texture and layer of flavor Â Service was set at perfection Our server remembered our orders by heart and was enthusiastic when introducing and explaining the menu

Author: Hiromi Y.
Content: I ordered a chefs menu Â A lot of plates to fill your stomach indeed but none of them surprised me and mostly not inspiring Â I should have ordered my favorite a la carte items instead

Author: Jeanette G.
Content: Ive had a yelp account for some time and have NEVER taken Â the time to write a review on a restaurant Needless to say I must have had a pretty bad experience to start nowRight off the back I will say this the food was delicious and innovative albeit over priced My issue was NOT with the food but with the serviceI arrived at this restaurant prior to 8 last night It was busy but I was seated right away Once seated it took several minutes for anyone to even acknowledge my presence Eventually someone came over and offered me water Waited some more Then my waitress arrived She was friendly enough so I didnt hold the wait against her I ordered an iced tea and 3 tapas And then I waited And waitedAnd waited After about 30 minutes my first tapas came out It was a clam dish and it was excellent Unfortunately I didnt have anything to wash it down with because my server never once stopped by to check on me or offer a refill even though she walked right by me several times Â So I waited And waited And waited As plates of delicious looking food whizzed by mean without stopping for more than 30 minutes At some point a random server literally tossed a bowl of olives on my table and almost ran I called out to stop him and told him I hadnt ordered olives He quickly said they were compliments of the chef and jetted off So I waitedFinally someone showed up with the 2nd of my 3 tapas By then Id stopped tracking the time As I shoved the food in my mouth starving my waitress magically appeared For the FIRST time ever she apologized for the wait Blamed it on the kitchen The same kitchen that had been cranking out orders for everybody else Interestingly STILL NO OFFER TO REFILL MY DRINKNow here is what sent me over the edge When the waitress came over I promptly cancelled my order for the 3rd tapas Given the wait that should have been a CLEAR indication to the server that I was ready to get the hell out of there But rather than applying good common sense let alone good customer service and bringing me my bill the waitress disappeared AGAIN And there I found myself waiting AGAIN It took all my self control not to lose itI spotted her as she came to service the table immediately in front of me and then started to walk off without even looking in my direction I called out to her and requested my check handing her my card at that time so that she would get the sense of urgency She came over with the bill immediately after that and gave me another half hearted apology for the wait I actually contemplated not leaving her a tip Ive never done that before But I decided that the problem wasnt just her I do believe that something went wrong in the kitchen that contributed to the delay But that was no excuse for her poor service either I left exactly 10In the end I walked out of that place feeling like an outcast That is not a good feeling And I dont care how amazing the good is if I dont feel wanted in an establishment Ill never return I will not pay money to be ignored or abusedTo Management there are many excellent restaurants to choose from in Chicago Folks on this site consistently complain about your prices One of the ways you can make them feel that the prices are worth it is to make them feel like THEY are worth it And you do that by treating them with attentiveness and respect

Author: Heidi K.
Content: I was curious about Mercat a la Planxa so the hub and I decided to check it out during restaurant week We werent disappointed We got there early and they didnt have a table for us yet so we took a seat at the bar Both bartenders were very friendly and helpful with the menu I had the sangria flight because I couldnt decided Hub had a gin and tonic with house infused gin and kumquats which was hands down the drink winner of the night It might be one of the best gin and tonics Ive ever had I enjoyed it so much that after I finished my sangria flight I drank gin and tonics for the rest of the night Hub had a couple of other cocktails as well but we both agreed that the gin and tonic was divine After hanging out at the bar for a bit they had a table ready for us The dining space is really cool and comfy We were seated in a little rounded booth The tables are small and space is limited but since its tapas you dont really need tons of room at the table and I didnt feel cramped at all We knew going in that we wanted the restaurant week menu Its a great set up You get three courses of small plates and a dessert Everything is perfect sized to be shared The first thing that came to the table was complementary bruschetta It was deliciously salty and acidic and a great way to start things off Then there was a salad with serano ham and figs And one of my favorite things of the night the bacon wrapped dates drizzled with fondue I could eat a whole plate of them They are the perfect little umami bite of sweet salty savory and yummy The second round of dishes included my second favorite thing of the night which was a mushroom flatbread with manchego cheese The flatbread was a perfect crispy texture and the nutty cheese really complemented the earthy mushrooms We also had garlic shrimp with the second course that came out sizzling hot They were garlicky and Â really well prepared The third round of dishes included lamb chops prawns and patatas bravas All three dishes were really good The lamb was cooked perfectly and had a tasty romesco sauce with it Im not sure I really needed a second shrimpprawn course but the prawns were really large and very flavorful The patatas were really good toosort of reminded me of tater tots for grown ups Now Im a dessert girl and honestly I wasnt super excited about dessert based on the menu However when it came to the table and I took a bite I found I didnt really want to have to share with my hubby anymore haha The marshmallow was like the stuff in the jar but a thousand times better and the little chocolate croquettes were a really fascinating texture with the crispy outside and gooey inside All the flavors really worked together to make a very playful but grown up dessert I loved Mercat a la Planxa Often times we try places and theyre good but with so many other amazing places in the city its always more tempting to try something new rather than return to a place weve been But that said well be going back to Mercat sometime very soon Between the perfect cocktails and so many delicious little dishes there are more things that Im dying to try

Author: Stacey N.
Content: Food food and more food how I would describe the Luxury Tasting Menu enjoyed on my birthday Some tasting menu highlights bacon wrapped dates and I dont usually like baconwrapped anythings braised goat my new favorite meat the mushroom risotto and the ferrel salad I know all of these things were pretty phenomenal because I visited Mercat a la Planxa 3 days ago  these delectable items are still on my mind Next time I go I may order like a peasant so that I limit my food intakeTip The bread they automatically give is better than any orderable dough

Author: Kevin L.
Content: Let me start off by saying that it was the BEST meal we have ever eatenWe went here for my fiancees birthday last night and it was wonderful Â As soon as we walked in the service was top notch Â I didnt know what to expect for dinner because I have only eaten breakfast here and they did not disappoint We started out with the bacon wrapped dates top with bleu cheese and they were incredible Â If those were amazing we couldnt wait to try the rest Â Everything was delicious especially the lamb Â  The lamb was so juicy and had so much flavor that we were contemplating about somehow getting a whole rack of it Â  Special thanks to Chef Cory Chef Louis and the rest of the staff for an amazing night Â My fiancee loved everything

Author: Tony C.
Content: Had the pleasure of eating lunch here today and it was a pleasant surprise Â Unknown to me at the time this is one of Jose Garces numerous restaurants in this city Our server Antonio was cheerful and knowldegeable Â We had the ARROZ A LA CAZUELA Saffron Scented Broth with Shrimp Chicken Chorizo Artichoke Confit  Piquillo soupoutstanding dish with complex and hearty flavours Â The spinach and serrano ham salad was similarly outstanding Â We tasted the shortrib flatbread and as well as the mushroom soup Â Flavors are distinct and complex rather than one note melanges of taste Â Easily one of the best places Ive eaten at in Chicago Â We threatened to kidnap the chef but had to be satisified with purchasing his cookbook The Latin Road Home Â I may be headed into my Latin phase of gastronomy

Author: Lydia L.
Content: This is my second time here The food always scrumptious but the service today is excellent Cant thank Shawn enough for the great service and positive attitude Try Iberico Secreto Iberico pork fromSpain it melt in your mouth My fav dish so far

Author: Bo Y.
Content: Seatings People seat very close to each other I made reservation the day before and got a tiny table on Thursday nightFoodprice Tasty nice presentationPotato Bravas is delicious 5sangria flights is so good too 3 cups of half portion sangria for 13 regular 1 cup9 pitcher 36 ham croquette 8the main entree is very small we ordered the short rib with scallop the rib is so tender love it 18We ordered the chocolate croquettes Its warm inside olive oil milk chocolate10Service Our waiter is very busy but attentive

Author: Alisha H.
Content: Totally overpriced and mediocrecute atmosphere and nice wine list but definitely not worth the price

Author: Maria L.
Content: I should have known better not to have picked a place on Michigan Ave for Mothers Day brunch If you live in the city there are way better tapas places for bang for your buck I see Mercat now as just another overpriced touristy restaurant situated in a hotel We did a 35pp Sunday brunch and were essentially served nine dishes Also the small buffet they advertise was a joke It was just sliced up manchego cheese and chorizo 2 items in a buffet RUDE There was dessert included in the buffet but it was just a big display of the same items boring cupcakes cookies and muffins Also a joke Most of the dishes were tasty and the bacon wrapped dates were prob my fave The icing on top of the cake for me was that they brought out all the dishes really rapidly but then we waited for awhile for the paella In my head I thought oh they must be cooking up a big batch of the paella since it takes time To my chagrin our server plopped down on the table a miniature stone plate barely enough for an infant filled with dryass paella RUDE Overall super overpriced and small ass portions for decent tapas Go elsewhere in the city

Author: Nicole E.
Content: OMG Amazing Went here tonight and probably tried almost every tapa Â My absolute favorite was the dates but the eggplant shrimp buscetta and mushrooms were also awesomeOur server was extremely friendly and attentive My iced tea never got to empty because someone was always refilling it Â One of our party had allergies and they took care to make things so he could eat them or warn him if he couldnt Â I have no complaints and would gladly return

Author: Denise S.
Content: I came here for brunch on a Saturday before going to the Art Institute It was surprisingly empty just 23 other tables which we didnt mind I guess unless the patio is open its hard to tell theres an awesome tapas restaurant in here from street level I had heard good things about the brunch although I didnt realize that the charcuteriecheese buffet is only available on Sundays No biggie Saturday offers a Catalan Express menu which includes 1 appetizer 1 main and a iced tea or fountain drink for 18 Not badI had the Spanish omelette  a classic tapas dish and a good gauge for any Spanish restaurant It was cooked to perfection  moist and flavourful eggs and potatoes with spices with a crispy outer layer I tried one of my DCs mushroom soup which was very rich and delicious too Another DC had the jamon serrano over salad  a very big portion but not the most exciting option you could easily make the same dish at home For the main I had grilled sea bass with spring peas and red quinoa Everything was very fresh and bursting with flavour with nothing too overpowering Service was a little scattered but not so much to distract from the amazing Catalan food Location is great 2 of my DCs said it was better than any restaurants they tried in Barcelona Not sure I would go that far but I would say the dishes seemed authentic and the quality was on par with some of the better restaurants I tried in Barcelona This place is supposedly busier and pricey for dinner so brunch is a great way to sample what they have to offer

Author: Pearl S.
Content: Chefs tasting menu was AMAZING and you feel like youre on an episode of Iron Chef getting served by various wait staff with all of these cool unique dishes There are 4 plates and 3 courses They are typically small servings but it was definitely filling Yes they are busy and it seems like some of their staff may be newer or not able to handle the volume I know our waiter was pretty absent but there were other members of the waitstaff that cleared our empty plates refilled waters and topped off our champagne Because it is so large it takes away from intimacy of the restaurant we were having our anniversary dinner there which was a bit disappointing but it was certainly worth the experience

Author: Jennifer L.
Content: Good tapas but the portions are too small and the prices are too highYou are dining at an Iron Chefs restaurant located in the South Loop so the high prices are to be expected Â The restaurant is located in the Renaissance Hotel right on Michigan Avenue Â You can get great views of the lake from the restaurant as well since it is on an upper levelMy boyfriend and I shared five tapas while my parents each got an entree Â For our tapas we started out with the bacon wrapped dates the goat ropa and the lamb meatballsThe bacon wrapped dates were unlike any other bacon wrapped dates that I have ever eaten Â This was because they were stuffed with an almond Â I loved the crunchiness of the almond mixed in with the sweet and salty flavors of the dates Â Delicious Â I could have seriously just eaten these as my mealThe goat ropa was excellent as well Â The goat meat is shredded in a way that resembled pulled pork Â It was served with goat cheese and grilled baguette pieces Â The goat was absolutely delicious and was cooked perfectly Â The tangy and creaminess of the goat cheese were nice additions to the meat Â I liked mixing it all together and topping the baguette pieces with it Â However there could have been more baguette pieces served along with the meat Â We had to request more bread so we could finish itThe lamb meatballs were OK but definitely not anything to write home about Â I really didnt enjoy the way that they were prepared Â It was served with a sherry foie cream and peas Â I didnt care for the sherryNext our server brought out the salad which comprised of Catalan spinach currants pine nuts and thinly shaved green apple pieces Â I really wish that he would have served us the salad first instead since my stomach was already very full of meat Â The flavors were good but the portions were too largeLast we had the diver scallops which I didnt enjoy Â It was served with some sort of basil and pesto sauce Â I thought there was just too much sauce on them Â They were cooked well but the sauce ruined it for meFor dessert we shared the ice cream and sorbet trio Â We tried the pink peppercorn strawberry vanilla peach and blueberry creme fraiche Â You must try the blueberry creme fraiche Â I wanted to ask if I could take a pint of it home to go Â It was creamy and tangy with a nice hint of sweetness from the blueberries Â The pink peppercorn strawberry was good but it could have used more peppercorn Â The vanilla peach was a solid ice cream but nothing out of the ordinaryService was fine but he didnt check up on us much Â I think that would have been different had we each did the tasting menu 65 per person Â The ambiance was just OK as well Â It definitely was not as lively as other tapas restaurants that I have been to Â Maybe this was because we dined on a Sunday night but nevertheless Â It was way more mellow and subduedOverall Im glad that I got a chance to visit and eat at an Iron Chefs restaurant Â But I dont see myself rushing back any time soon due to the small portions and the high prices

Author: Magen R.
Content: Wasnt a huge fan of this placeI came here a few months ago for brunch with some friends and it did not live up to the hype The included meat cheese and dessert table was disappointing at best There was only one kind of meat pretty pathetic if you ask me There were also no crackers to put any of your meat and cheese on Kinda strange The several courses of brunch were just so so There were a few standout items like the bacon wrapped dates but on the whole it was pretty meh and definitely not worth the priceId definitely come back to try the tapas at night so I could pick and choose though Maybe Ill be amending this review someday

Author: Mel Z.
Content: No wait for brunch on memorial day weekend Its nice but then also alarming Got seated very quickly and our waiter was nice However they got all of our orders wrong I ordered my steak medium rare and my friend ordered medium When the dish came they just assumed that he got the medium rare and I got the medium When I asked them how mine was done they said medium well and that my friend had mediumerrr Very irritatingThe dish were OK The ingredients were fresh but my steak was wayyyy too salty Could not finish the dish The soup I ordered was quite unmemorable Overall a very underwhelming experience

Author: Victoria G.
Content: I have heard about this place so many times and finally this one cold winter night we went there to celebrate special occasion It was a wonderful experience They kept bringing food more and more we ordered tasting menu with wine But every bite was simply delicious I was surprized that desert was not included in the tasting menu but we ordered separately the cheesecake with some fancy sauce and berries was melting in my mouse Definitely would love to go back one day again

Author: Allison M.
