Content: I came here on Passover so I was extremely limited in the things I could eat Â All I had was the espinaca a la catalana and it was so great Â Garlicky and savory and sweet and piping hotThe decor and the atmosphere here is so warm and welcoming Â Easily one of the most inviting restaurants Ive been in Â Cant wait to come back and try some of the dishes with leavening or one of their fancy cocktails

Author: Jeni P.
Content: Fabulous place to eat Love the atmosphere the food everything Â Bit on the pricy side 200 for 4 people and its definitely not a place where you go if youre in a hurry 130 hrs to eat Â But overall a great relaxing evening out for dinner

Author: Shereene M.
Content: I am OBSEESSED with this place I literally love love love it We entered on the Michigan Ave entrance where you walk into a cute little lounge that would be cool to chill in Then we walked upstairs and was wowed It is so much bigger than you expect It is seriously the prettiest restaurant I have ever been to Its beautiful The dÃ©cor is really pretty but my only complaint is the tables are pretty tight If you are wearing a jacketcoat check it Also the bathroom is in the hotel that is attached but that wasnt a big deal to walk toSo I went with one girlfriend so we shared a bunch of items and were STUFFED to the MAX We got drinks but I honestly cant even remember what we got The food is amazing The portions are small so I wouldnt go with more than a group of 4 Our waiter was a guy with curly hair He was super animated and used his hands a lot He was very knowledgeable and helpful when we needed recommendations I wish I remembered his name This is what we orderedGoat cheese with shredded goat with bread really yummy if you like goat cheeseBacon wrapped dates good but super smallCalamari was expecting fried but was still very good the sauce is delishLamb lollypops the star of the show You must get itDessert so we knew we had to get dessert even though we were going to burst Our amazing waiter recommended this dish not on the menu but is on the tasting menu which is a small bite of something hot and something cold Get it if you want something sweet but not huge All I remember was two delicious bites and horchata ice cream being involvedBill came to 120 I believe with tip not badI cant wait to go back I made a reservation right on Yelp the night of but it was really busy on a Thursday night Its super cute but we were casual and felt like it was ok

Author: Jules H.
Content: Came here for a late Sunday brunch after a trip to the Chicago Art Institute Low key casual roomy place Greeted promptly and led to a nice corner table After a helpful explanation of their Sunday brunch menu the egg tapas and other treats starting arrivingSunday brunch is a prix fixe menu of 25 with 3 courses of well made small plates and a small but nice Charcuterie buffet that included cheeses and desserts Everything tasted great we really liked the bacon wrapped dates and beet salad My fellow diner had a top notch self serve bloody mary One thing that was a little off and disappointing was the lack of plate clearing Service was polite but we had to keep stacking our used tapas plates onto the empty table next to ours I hate busing my own table when Im paying 50 for brunch Our waiter would disappear for 20 minutes at a time But then hed come back with another round of tasty tapas plates and all was forgiven Really great food nice bloody mary bar too

Author: Eric Y.
Content: We had dinner with a group of 8 Â We got to sit at the large antique table in the center of the restaurant the one with the regallooking high backed chairs Â We felt special even though the chairs were not the most comfortableOur meal was delicious Â We ordered a variety of tapas Â Highlights included the baconwrapped dates stuffed with an almond Â The grilled baby octopus is outstanding Â The foierabbit rillette on toast with quince paste was delicious Â Blood sausage  earthy salty and grilled to perfection Â We were disappointed by the jamon iberico  it was not up the deliciousness that weve come to expect from this rare product Â The sauteed peppers are tasty but dont need the sauce that comes with themHighly recommended

Author: Samantha K.
Content: OK I lived in Barcelona and this is by far one of the BEST tapas places in Chicago Not only is the decor scream Catalonia and inspired greatly by Barca and all of its nuances but the food is done in such a delicious and upscale way My best friend and I went here about 3 years ago after my college graduation We enjoyed many tapas A few jarras of sangria which they have a seasonal on barrel and several different red and whites too I have not been back to Mercator a la Planxa YET but I have not stopped talking about how blown away I was with the food decor and staff I plan on getting back in there very soon to see if what I experienced 3 years ago still holds true

Author: Christine S.
Content: I had extremely poor service at Mercat a la Plaxa While I usually dont like to do this I spoke with the manager who took a few cocktails off our bill which was greatly appreciatedThe food was fine but definitely not worth the price pointI will not be going back and definitely not recommend spending the money here

Author: Erika K.
Content: January is acting a fool this year providing you with all the more reason to treat yourself to a warming meal during Restaurant Week in Chicago Theres nothing quite like braving negative wind chills to gorge on tapas that are much more appropriate for warmer weather Its as close were getting to a vacation I tend to feel skeptical towards tapas theyre so tiny that youre smart to arrive with a semifull stomach and arent there always a couple of blah dishes Not at Mercat where nearly every course is fresh and flavorfuland you almost leave fullFull review and pictures at thebuckwheatercommercaâ¦

Author: Ian L.
Content: in the south loop a nice upscale restaurant with an excellent view the views of millenium park are amazingthe only downside is the small portions common at these tapas places Spend 50 per pax before drinksWe had themonte enebro  goats milkpear  saffron compoteThey were well executed but nothing really stood outfoie amb conill rabbit and foie gras rillette truffle lavender quince The foie gras was phenomenal and we would definitely recommend thisdÃ¡tiles con almendras and baconwrapped dates stuffed with almonds ahh one of the highlights sure many tapas places do this as well however these were perfectly executed and came with some costillas de ternera and beef shortribs horseradish parmesan  bacon marmaladegood the serving of shortribs was miniscule still it was sufficient to whet our appetite escalivada dalberginia and eggplant fritters with roasted red peppers tomatoes and cipollinis goat cheese and lavender honey Excellent the hint of lavender honey balances and enhances the otherwise too salty eggplants all in all it could work better as an appetizer ended with morcillatraditional catalÃ¡n blood sausage spainGood first experience with catalan blood sausage a must try

Author: Comensal A.
Content: I had wanted to try Mercat for quite some time but had been put off by the prices Recently I threw frugality to the winds and paid a visit Sorry to say I was disappointed  the place just didnt deliver value commensurate with the pricesWe ordered the 65 tasting menu so we could sample a variety of dishes On the plus side there was plenty of food A few of the dishes we sampled were OK but none really stood out with the exception of baconwrapped dates which were quite nicely done Octopus was tasty enough but a little tougher than it needed to be A salami plate and a cheese plate were enjoyable Prawns had a faint ammonia character as happens all to often A steak plate was flavorful but very gristly The vaunted spinach with currants  apple was much too salty Saltiness was in fact a theme as can be the case at Spanish restaurants Patatas bravas was nicely presented and tasted fineDrinkwise I had the wine pairing and was underwhelmed by the quality my suggestion start with a glass of nice garnacha then have a glass of tempranillo There is a fairly comprehensive selection of Spanish wines by the bottle but they seem a bit pricey  based on my experience buying Spanish wine at retail there ought to be a few decent bottles of garnacha and tempranillo in the mid30s not the mid40sService was admirable in one respect pacing  our courses came in a timely fashion and we got out in time to make a show without rushing The plate runners were courteous but spoke so quickly that we couldnt really understand what they were presenting The bussers were similarly courteous The main server did a decent job of introducing us to the menu but seemed rushed  briskThe ambiance was not to my taste We were fortunate to have a fourtop table  if we had been at one of the tiny twotops it would have been miserable trying to fit all the dishes on the table The noise level was OK when we arrived but built throughout our visit to the point where trying to converse was unpleasant by the time we leftThe whole experience reinforced for me why Im about done with hotel restaurants overpriced soso food unrelaxing ambiance rushed service and an overall food factory feel There are Spanish dining options in the city that deliver much better overall value and Ill go to them when I want a tapas fix

Author: Laura A.
Content: This place is pricey but the food is so worth it I first came for restaurant week and tried one of the flatbreads  delicious The next time I came was for tapas  the bacon wrapped dates were fabulous and the sangria was really good

Author: Amy R.
Content: Mercat tries to WOW you with the plate presentation but fails to deliver on taste and portion size for the prices charged Â Our party of 4 enjoyed the ambiance and service of Mercat but decided to stop eating when we realized we were never going to get full on the extremely small portions being servedOur samples and I do mean samples because the portions are SO SMALL included Olives Â the only decent sized portion served to us all night Â Its a good variety of olives Pimentos se Padron Â this is an impressive tapa and also one of the few decent sized portions served Â Very good Gambas y Chorizo Flatbread Â This could have been a slice of pepperoni pizza and we would not have known the difference Â The ingredients all just blended together into something really boring Â And it is so small that saying a slice accurately describes this underwhelming and tiny flatbread at 14 Â  Costillas de Ternera Flatbread Â Again the flavors that enticed us from the menu description just blended together on this slice and it was like some shredded BBQ on a tiny piece of bread Mixto Croquetas Â this is definitely the smallest croqueta Ive ever been served Â It was fine but one person would need their own plate to really get a taste of it Datiles con Almendras Â Four dates for 9 which meant one per person at our table which was not enough to even really taste it Â The plate served to us was more greens than dates and they cleared it from the table before the greens could be eaten Patatas Bravas Â The biggest disappointment of the night because the plate is just 7 little thimblesized potatoes with a squirt of sauce Â No spice no flavor and very little potato Â HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT for one of my alltime favorite tapas Garrotxa Â three tiny pieces of cheese some thin apple slices and some bread with a small portion of bland sauce  BORINGI might try this place again but I would not want to eat with a crowd because these plates arent meant to be shared by more than 2 Â And then that pretty much defeats the point in enjoying tapas with friends Â We left feeling hungry underwhelmed and robbed

Author: Andrea B.
Content: This place was one of the best spanish places Ive tried I love tapas and mercat was everything I hoped for I wish we wouldve done the chefs tasting but it was a little on the expensive side so we stuck to choosing our own tapas The potatoes were the best thing I got The bacon wrapped dates were also amazing The place was upscape and trendy but the staff was a bit snooty Would definitely go here again

Author: Kim N.
Content: Being right next to my hotel this was the last meal before leaving Chicago for home We ended up going right as they opened for dinner Not my usual time for eating but since I was going to be on a 5 hour plane ride I didnt want to be clamoring for plane food on the way back We met Jenn our server and told her of our time crunch The space is large and beautiful Very open dining room and kitchen As we sat down a bunch of people with name tags started filling in the spaces Must be convention timeWe got some recommendations from Jenn and ended up withPULPO CON PATATASSpanish Octopus Confit Potato Smoked PaprikaGAMBAS AL AJILLOGarlic Shrimppintxos muranosColorado Lamb Brochettes wrapped in Bacon Lamb JusBOQUERONESWhite Anchovies with Pine Nuts Olive  Anaheim PeppersALBONDIGAS DE CORDEROLamb Meatballs Sherry Foie Cream PeasROPA DE CABRAKilgus Farms Goat Ropa with Goat Cheese and Grilled BaguetteArroz a la CazuelaSaffron Scented Broth with Maine Lobster Chicken Chorizo Rabbit Shaved Artichoke Salad  Piquillo AioliVarious cured meatsFERMIN JAMÃN IBÃRICO DE BELLOTAFERMIN LOMO EMBUCHADOJAMÃN DE PATOBUTIFARRA CATALANASome of this certainly brought back memories of Spain though the execution is obviously American influenced Jenn took really good care of us and basically got us out of there in an hour Looking at the full menu there are so many things I still want to try Tapas is just not enough

Author: Anne F.
Content: Went here for date night The night was really slow surprising for a Saturday so we were seated right away even though we didnt have a reservation Highlights were the sangria baconwrapped dates yum rabbit pasta yum lamb meatballs short rib flatbread and the salmon Not so much of a fan of the spicy potatoes kind of dry Dessert was delicious as well Our server was kind of nonexistent at first but she got better throughout the evening probably had more time for us once some of her tables left Overall I would definitely return though it is a bit overpriced I can think of equally good restaurants that are significantly less expensive

Author: Mandi G.
Content: This was my favorite brunch spot in the city However they no longer do bottomless mimosassangriabloody Marys It is now 5 per drink So what used to be a 33 brunch has now turned into a 50 brunchThe food and service were still great If you are not a total lush like myself this is a nice place to do more upscale brunches and they do have a separate seating area if you have a large groupPlease please please bring back the bottomless drink option It breaks my heart to have to take you off my brunch list

Author: Alison Y.
Content: I was really looking forward to eating here ever since I ate at Chifa in Philadelphia another Jose Garces restaurant We came here for lunch since my brotehr recommended it and told us they had a cheap lunch option The Catalan Express allows you to choose an appetizer and entree plus a fountain drink for 18 dollars I chose the serrano and chorizo croquettes and the hange steak The hubby chose arroz a la cazuela and the salmon The arroz was really really good and the croquettes were fine My steak with potato croquette though was really really greasy So much so that I couldnt finish it and thats saying a lot The serving was not even that big The service left much to be desired as well There were only two tables at tha hour but I found the waiters inattentiveAlthough the food wasnt too expensive I was expecting a lot more Will not be back

Author: Seth F.
Content: The Serrano Ham and Fig Salad and Bacon Wrapped Dates were good but honestly Im pretty sure an instance of bacon wrapped dates not being good is a surefire sign of The Apocalypse so Im gonna use this little time we have together to talk about an issue thats very important to me the ordering of an entire animal at a restaurantThe last time I was here we ordered a pig for a friends 30th birthday Â Now I know that sounds like a great idea on paper and Gd knows there are few more effective ways to firmly establish yourself on the top of the food chain but take it from someone who has walked this path too many times its ALWAYS a better idea in theory than in practice Â When you order an entire animal at a restaurant you make the chef focus on the arduous task of cooking a very large thing and not the act of making the meat that you get from that animal taste as delicious as possible Â This has been true every time Ive done this from multiple times at Frontier to getting a goat leg at Girl and The Goat and here Â Seriously just dont do it Â Thank you for listening to this very important public service announcement

Author: Layne S.
Content: Good food yet expensive Â Highlights were the rib eye and the bacon wrapped lamb Didnt really like the fried peppers or the cinnamon dessert Its a good place to go for a special occasion yet there are better places for me to go when spending 250 without alcohol Â Last visit made me learn Id rather go to a nice steakhouse or Shaws

Author: Niraj G.
Content: Went for lunch and had the fried peppers spanish omelette wild mushroom soup wild mushroom flatbread and patatas fritas Â Food was excellent especially the soup as it had nice hints of truffle Â Heard the dinner menu was even better so well definitely be checking that out

Author: Jason S.
Content: Pretty nice jointCame here for a postwedding dinner Â Didnt really get to try the food to start but that was OK I had plenty of time to cozy up to a vat of sangria Sangria Sangria you ask incredulously Â No no not Riunite Lambrusco and Sprite with sliced oranges Â Imagine a wooden barrel of delicious fruits paired perfectly with the appropriate wines and then add wait for it brandy Â Oh yeah that just happenedSo after swimming in the limitless supply of three different varieties of boozy punch they could have served me anything afterwards and I would have loved it Â Good thing their food is amazing too Â I was stuck with the selection that was preset for the party would have loved to venture out and hit the menu on a nonparty nightNot sure about the whole Iron Chef thing dont really follow the whole celebritytv chef thing but this place is solid

Author: Erica P.
Content: We had an absolutely amazing time here went 5pm on a Friday night for an early dinnerhappy hourGreat service food was absolutely amazing there wasnt anything that we tried that we didnt like and we ordered 10 dishesHighlightsWhite sangria tastes like water with fruit goes down way too easyGarlic ShrimpMeat and Cheese SelectionCroquetasJamonSpanish OmeletteList goes onCheck it out this place is fantastic highly recommend

Author: Tommaso S.
Content: The Experience was perfect Paella the best I have ever had since Spain Gracias chef

Author: Rosa N.
Content: I have been to this place twice and it was very good each time Â Bacon wrapped dates cheese platter short ribs mushroom risottoyou name it is was good Â  Now the warning here is on the calamari Â It is grilled Â That is no bueno for me

Author: Diana R.
Content: Came here on a weekend the food was good but the service needed work our waitress was hard to find and disappeared for most of our meal Â I tried to get a refill of drinks but the service was nowhere to found Â I had one of their cocktails about a month ago and it was good so naturally I wanted another one it was called the sombra or sombrero at 13 its a little pricey but its downtown prices what can you expect Â Overall they need work on their service they have a good product The empanada with spinach was really great

Author: Bob H.
Content: In Chicago for a conference We enjoyed it so much we returned two nights later with friends The tapas were excellent and varied The spinach and fig salad wrapped with jamon was delicious the lamb rib chops with romescu and octopus were both really enjoyable Â The wine list featured Spanish wines and were reasonably pricedI would recommend it to anyone traveling to Chicago looking for Spanish cuisine with Â  a flare

Author: Christine K.
Content: Came with a fairly large and shared a couple dishes Â I did some research before going and ordered for usall 3 types of the flatbreadsetas al horno paella valenciana patatas bravas 2jamon de patobacon wrapped dates 2dessert croquettesI wanted to try the sobrasada y boqueron coca but one of my friends who was sitting next to me and with whom I was sharing the coca wanted to try the braised short ribs one instead Sigh shes such a fastidious eater so I was disappointed to have to forego the sobrasada y boqueron coca Â Everyone seemed to enjoy the paella jamon de pato and setas al horno the most Â Mercat definitely prepares its setas al horno dish differently from other tapas places but its the positive type of creativity in the food Â I will come again to try the butternut squash dumplings arroz de coliflor mar i muntanya and lunch menu Â The ambience and interior decor are perfect for dates or gatherings with friends Â Make sure to reserve your seating early on if you have a group Â Otherwise youll have to wait a bit

Author: Leslie H.
Content: Great service Great atmosphere Great foodWent here for lunch and was pleasantly surprised with the chefs tasting menu My hubby and I had shared about 78 courses and it was priced at 30pp The food was incredibly good My hubby absolutely loved the flights of sangria as well

Author: Eric M.
Content: I wasnt blown away by this place Â The atmosphere is less tapas bar and more Vegas style with large multi level stations not warm not foodcentric and programmed presentations by the waiters who I gather have not been to Spain based on their nonanswers to my specific questions about the food and wine Â The food was good not great and the fact that we were stuffed in a corner at an odd shaped table for an important business dinner told me the host had a tin ear when it came to the seating and comfort of guests Finally the olive oil ice cream was a big disappointment I raved about the wonder of this dessert to my table mates and it was a tasteless powdery lump I order olive oil ice cream whenever I see it its an index dish that tells me a lot about a place I recommend they remove it from the menu

Author: Fei W.
Content: Just tried this place with a friend Â We hadLamb meatballsSpanish omeletteAnchoviesLamb curryHorchata bon bonsThe lamb curry was the best but everything was way too salty except ironically the anchovies Â They were the least salty and our least favorite Â I think maybe we didnt know what to expect but they were just served on olive oil with some pine nuts and the texture and taste were not greatThe horchata bon bons were a great finish though Â Overall I think Cafe Iberico is a much better value

Author: Tawnya P.
Content: Food every single thing was fabulous Bacon wrapped dates a signature for a reason Cheese selections delicious Lamb pops magnificent and moist and terrific sauce selectionsThe only thing I didnt give this another star for is that you have to know going into it that youre not able to pick anything off the menu unless youre prepared to stay for a long long time I wanted a short rib dish that takes 90 minutes to prepare so if we wanted to have a less than allevening event we had limited choices There are plenty to choose from just perhaps not what your heart may desire if it takes too long to cook

Author: Alex K.
Content: If you like tasty tapas an open and inviting atmosphere and hexagoninspired decorations Mercat a la Planxa is the place for youAs basically everyone else here has said the baconwrapped dates are incredible Strangely enough my first bite tasted like the most delicious corn dog I could ever imagineThe variety of flavors across all of the dishes was probably the most impressive part of the meal Every bite of every plate offered up something new and excitingOur waitress was very helpful in navigating the menu And the complimentary dessert she foisted upon us despite our protests ended up being delicious as well and a perfect way to finish off the meal

Author: Harpreet K.
Content: Because Im a hater I must first note that there were a few WTFs up in here First and foremost one of my pet peeves is walking into a restaurant with 15 ornamental staffers hangin out and still waiting ten minutes for a menu Get to steppin folks Im here to eat Second what up with all the wireless headsets The restaurant was half empty at 6pm on Sunday but there were still a lot of frantic emergency sitchos being handled via walkytalkies with nary a celebrity in sight Kinda diva Plus earpieces are so Whitney in The Bodyguard And we all know Whitney is an IdontdocrackheadBecause Im also a lover lets move onto the good The specialty drink menu was fantastic really refreshing fruity drinks with HEAVY POURS I was knocked the fck out after one and Im 6 2 with a booty motherfckers I had the Shoco Cocktail peach vodka fresh sour OJ cucumber and sage leaves and my friend had the Merengue fresh strawberries lime and passion fruit puree grapefruit vodka Mine was good hers was insane We shared a couple tapas because we were just there to sample the goods specifically the Higo Con Almendres baconwrapped figs stuffed with almonds and Alcachotas y Seta flatbread artichoke and wild mushrooms black truffles and manchego The dates were wonderful if a little small Perfectly crisp salty chewy bacon wrapped around warm sweet soft figs The flatbread though HOT DAMN where you came from Hearty heady flavors the vibrancy of a strong spanish cheese with truffles with light hints of lemon to offset the richness It was makeyournight deliciousDo it

Author: Caroline A.
Content: I finally got back to Mercat nine months after a mediocre experience and enjoyed it I was with two of my besties and we had a fantastic night of delicious food cocktails and laughs I still think it lacks a certain level of refinement but I enjoyed the energy and crowd on a Thursday nightWe did the chefs tasting and while it was way too much food for me it was very good We hadSerrano Ham  Fig SaladCana de Cabra  Goats Milk and Balsamic Strawberries  This was fantastic I could not stop eating the balsamic strawberry spreadThe beef shortrib flatbread  How could you go wrong It was beefy cheesy deliciousnessGarlic Shrimp  VERY GARLICEY  You do not want to eat this if you are on a date Jumbo PrawnsSeafood Ceviche  This was probably my favorite It was light and refreshingRabbit Ravioli Lamb  This was probably my second favorite It came out pretty rare tender and flavorful For dessert we had the chocolate croquettes with banana marshmallows It was definitely something to try but a bit disappointing The three of us were not satisfied so we got ice cream  The drink menu was good but what do I know I got drunk on half a glass of wine Service was a little slow but not bad The lighting is excellent

Author: Swatee G.
Content: Brace yourself for a long review dear reader I am an angry young woman and I shall YELP to ventYelp Disappointment PERIODThe ambiance is good the service was the worst I have ever experienced and the food just blatantly overpriced over hyped and useless So we walk in with reservations I am impressed by the decor and Â the size of the place I have heard good things from Yelp and I am excited about trying this placeSo our hostess walks us over to a TINNNNEEEEEE believe me TINEEE table in a corner for two people so much so that my friends and i have touching knees  not cool  and worst so the couple right next to us are right in our face too We are embarrassed they are embarrassed I mean there is no way enough space for 4 people and we dont know what to say The hostess has mysteriously disappeared we wait for our server to appear 5 minutes wait server comes could we have a different table please No we are full up Umm I see some tables empty right there Weeell those are reserved ok I gave up Uncomfortable as we were by this breach of personal space I was not going to let it ruin my soon to begin superior culinary experience Well I am about to be disappointed I will begin with the bestComplimentary Tomato Flatbread Maybe they should make this a menu dish It was really goodVerdosa Mixed Greens with Green Asparagus Avocado Confit Cherry Tomatoes  Shaved Mahon Cheese The only highlight of my so called culinary experience I would have it againSpanish Omelette with SpinachPotatoes  Saffron Aioli  Would be a decent dish maybe had it got Salt in itPatatas Bravas Spicy Potatoes with Spicy Paprika Aioli PLEASE dont call this a dish It is a side and a poor mans over hyped over priced one at thatCatalan Spinach Raisins Pine Nuts  Apples  umm blanched spinach stacked with green apples is NOT an appetizing dish you DO NOT have to be Gordon Ramsey to realize that pleaseArroz a la Cazuela Saffron Scented Broth with Maine Lobster ChickenChorizo Rabbit Shaved Artichoke Salad  Piquillo Aioli By far the ugliest and most tasteless dish I have ever eaten It was like they dumped all left overs together and brought it to us in a bowl with a n enormous price tag Please please avoid this dishI dont even want to talk of the desserts now sigh I have a terrible memory of the horrors I will never ever go here againBut I must say the service sucked We had the two dishes on our tinee tablea nd the server unceremoniously dumps another one then one more and now there is no place for the 5th please can we finish one at a timeThe server appeared ONLY when we had waited atleast 10 minutes each time for him to grace us with his presence never explained any dish and was just blatantly unconcerned And with this I cannot go on any more I hated the placeand ohhhh the Seasonal Sangria have it only if you LOVE Cinnamon thats all it has And the Margarita with cucumbers BITTERsigh now I am done venting

Author: Nick M.
Content: This is a MUST experience for food lovers on Yelp  Uh where to begin Mercats food hits your taste buds like a falcon punch to the groin or an Amy kick to your nuts women  pajengo or whoo ha its a slap to the face twist the nipple fantastic Warning This was a dramatisation PLEASE do NOT perform any of these acts to myself or others This Tapas Catalan inspired menu is over whelming at first but after a dish or two plus some of their tasty Red Sangria youll be a pro rolling your Rrrrrrrs and everything Also prices can be a little deceiving but after all is said and bellies are full its really not that bad My recommendations Verdosa Mixed Baby Greens with Green Asparagus AvocadoConfit Cherry Tomatoes  Shaved Mahon Cheese Pimientos De Padron Fried Peppers Salbitxada  Sea Salt Gambas Al Ajillo Garlic Shrimp Arroz Can Morels Morel Mushroom Bomba Rice Green Asparagus  Lemon Oil Cepes Y Butifarra Porcini  Catalan Sausage Roasted Garlic and Manchego Patatas Bravas Spicy Potatoes with Spicy Paprika Aioli And for desert that has beaten ALL of my other desserts EVER Probably going to lose my man card again but this dessert made me close my eyes Croquetas de Xocolata Milk Chocolate Croquettes Banana Marshmallow Rosemary Carmel Arbequina Olive Oil Each plate design was colorful and creative as the next Great use of scale not only in food design but the decor of the restaurant itself Even not for the food the service was exceptional and or waiter recommended half of what we ate The staff really make you feel welcome and important I really want to go back for the chiefs selection he plans your whole menu and they have an option to include a wine or beer pairing with the dishes Im only upset that Ive just now discovered this vision of Barcelona for the senses I dont normal say this but I would give Mercat a la Planxa 10 stars if I could

Author: Ryan L.
Content: I am not a big fan of tapas as i am always left pretty hungry and this was no exception Â I had friends visiting and after tearing into some sausage from Hot Dougs earlier they decided tapas was a good idea Â I heard good things from friends but I was very disappointed in my meal Â Food was good sometimes great but not enough moments of greatness Â Service was seriously lacking Â It was a busy night but doesnt give them a pass for the sometimes lousy serviceWhen we arrived we were told there was a 45 minute wait Â No problem my friends wanted to sit in the lounge anyways because it was more private and secluded Â Sure enough it was so secluded a server never showed up Â We waited 20 minutes and asked twice for a server but got nothing Â My friend got up and asked the hostess who was very gracious and apologized and then suddenly a table was open for us in the main area Â Funny how this worksOther comments about the flatbreads are right they are very good Â The porcini and catalan sausage was quite tasty Â Other selections braised rabbit pasta  i think this was my favorite in terms of flavor but the portion was smallslowcooked shortribs and diver scallops  i was disappointed in this the meat was a little rough and lacking Â The scallops were ok not enough to save the dish thoughpatatas bravas  spicy potatoes were flavorful but not spicypaella  it took almost an hour for the paella to come out Â In fact we ordered the potatoes after the other dishes came out and even that came out before the paella Â For that long of a wait it better have been the greatest paella ever but alas it was mediocreWhen finished we asked the waiter for dessert menus Â 15 minutes later nothing Â We flagged down a busser to retrieve menus and he got them quickly Â We ordered the chocolate croquettes with banana marshmallows Â Pretty flat and disappointing but it is a dish to try Â It was pretty busy for a Thursday night but the service misfires were too much to overcome Â I hope others had a better experience than I did Â Skip

Author: Phillip C.
Content: my friend comes from New York a few times a year and stays at the black stone we eat here every morning the first table next to the window on the left hand side food is good service is great atmosphere is wonderful i just wish they would change up the menu its been the same for over a year we started coming here when I started college theres never a morning special or a surprise overall i love my experience and i love being able to always sit at the same table

Author: Vivian Y.
Content: If you come here definitely opt for the 58 tasting menu Youll be amazed how they can prepare 20 dishes and the variety for that price Â We had everything from cheese to meatballs shrimp octopus lamb beef butternut squash raviolisMMMAll the food was good and about 4 were mind blowlingly good Â If you dont do the tasting the head for the australian rack of lamb for sure Â it was delicious and perfectly preparedDrinks are expensive Cocktails are 1150 and a pitcher of Sangria was 32 Â Yes you can get more for your money at Babareeba or even Emilios but youre paying for Michigan Ave and a MUCH nicer ambiance Â At the end of the night each couple spent 250 on food and drinks Â I dont normally spend this kind of money on dinner but it was for a friends birthdayService  I think our server was a little overwhelmed  he was running around like a mad man and by the end of our dinner he almost forgot about us it took about 20 mins to get a round of coffee at our table If you enjoy Baileys in your coffee  order one because they offer a very large glass of it Â oh but watch out coffee alone here is 395 YIKES

Author: Kelly S.
Content: I popped in here for dinner with my dad around 830pm on a Thursday Â It was a 30 minute wait for a table but we found a seat in the alcove in the upstairs bar which serves the entire menu as wellI had continuously heard about the avocado margarita here and could not wait to have one Â Oh My Goodness Â Sounds a bit odd right Â I assure you its the best darn margarita you will have ever Â I easily could have had two more of these but I restrained myself due to the impending early alarm the next morning Â El Bolero  Patron Reposado Orange Liquor Fresh Lime Fresh Avocado Â 11 Â  GET ONEThe tapas we savoredBacon Wrapped Dates Stuffed with Almonds  the hit of the meal hands downGarlic Shrimp  OK Â We both agreed that we could have done without this oneFlatbread  Beef Shortribs Horseradish Parmesan  Bacon Â Really good A perfect filler if you have a large appetiteCatalan Spinach Raisins Pine Nuts  Apples Â I wish my mom made spinach like this when I was a kid Â SlowCooked Shortribs  Diver Scallops Shaved Parmesan Artichokes Â The second hit of the meal Â Although I AM a scallop addictService Â Our waiter was super friendly and efficient Â Our food came out in stages but all very quickly Â Wed almost be finished with one plate when the next one would arrive Â Decor Â Red black tall ceilings single light bulbs hanging from the trusses a water feature under the stairs Â The loungey electronic music was a bit too loud but it wasnt bothersomeHighly recommended for special occasions or when you are looking to take an out of town guest to a restaurant with a big city feel Â Something they definitely cannot experience in their hometown

Author: Kyle H.
Content: Im never in the know but my partner in crime is all about trying new places and its a great addition to my tired bag of Nacho tricks Had Friday 8pm reservations for two and waited just long enough in the bar to order Sangrias and admire the updated 70s decor We were seated in Â 2nd floor the party room looking over the main dining area and it was an amazing view and our room had nice decorating touches that really added to the experienceI had the Seasonal Sangria and it didnt knock my socks off so I ordered the Red Sangria later and that was fabulous Up there with the BEST For Tapas we went withMixto Chefs cheese selection of 3 cheesesCroquetes de Jamon Serrano Ham CroquettesHigos con Almendras Bacon Wrapped Figs wAlmonds the Star of the showTucino con Xerez Pork Belly Sherry Glaze  Green Apple  Truffle the sauce and presentation was out of this worldEspinacas a la Catalana Spinach wraisins pine nuts  applesThe waiter also recommended the Rabbit but we couldnt handle eating a lil bunny but he said it was greatThe waiter was quite helpful always attentive and each server I think we had 5 different people bring our food was polite and informativeYes its expensive for Tapas which were lucky to have plenty of in Chicago but the atmosphere and food are worth it

Author: Kim J.
Content: A friend and I had a fantastic dinner at Mercat a la Planxa last night Â We were in the mood for tapas and Iberico honestly just doesnt really do it for me so we figured wed try somewhere new Â Our server was Jerry and he was fabulous Â He recommended a few things off of the menu based off of what we said we were in the mood for let us spend as much time as we wanted just enjoying our food and ordering more and was attentive but not obtrusive Â We started out with the seasonal sangria Â It involved chiles and cilantro which sounds kind of bizarre but it was wonderful Â It had a nice bite but was really refreshing Â We started out with the chefs cheese plate Â It comes with 3 different types of cheese  1 with goats milk 1 with sheeps milk and 1 with cows milk Â Each of them also came with an accompanying sauce  in this case we had a peach jam an apple jam and a black olive caramel sauce Â I ended up using the jams on the accompanying bread and eating the cheeses alone as they were quite good on their own Â Our next course was baconwrapped dates with almonds with a bit of blue cheese drizzled on top Â Oh Â My Â God Â These were phenomenal Â We tried to convince the server that we just wanted a bucket of those for the rest of our meal Â Theyre smoky and sweet and just melt in your mouth Â They were so good that we actually ordered a second order of them Â After that we had the flatbread with shrimp chorizo and garbanzo bean puree Â Also surprisingly good with just a hint of garlic and butter Â Our next choice was the paella Â It was perfect  seafood and crunchy rice on a hot metal platter Â Its so easy to screw up paella but they did a wonderful version here Â And my friend is from Miami  she knows good Paella and good seafood and she raved about what we had here Â Our final dish was a dish of spinach apples nuts and a few other things Â It was probably my least favorite of the night  it was nicely done but the spinach seemed a bit overwhelmed by all the other flavors present Â All in all a wonderful addition to the tapas scene Â A bit pricey for my liking but well worth the cash

Author: Mahsa T.
Content: Wow Best tapas Ive had anywhere Amazing flavors and elegant presentation Each dish is a work of art And each bite packs a punch Portions are tiny but the taste more than makes up for it Â Baconwrapped dates stuffed with almondsAMAZINGCatalan spinach raisins pine nuts and applesDELICIOUSFlatbread porcini Catalan sausage garlic manchegoGREATDiver scallopsHEAVENLYGrilled calamariDELECTABLEButternut squash dumplings over lamb ragout mushroom black truffleMMMMMMChocolate croquettes on banana marshmallow with caramel and olive oilHow can I best describe the croquettes Like a chocolate ball explosion in your mouth mixed with ooey gooey marshmallowAs I mentioned before the portions are really tiny even for tapas My friends and I had worked up an appetite salsa dancing across the street at the Chicago Summer Dance Festival so we were still a bit hungry at the end of our meal I would recommend getting at least 3 dishes per person And definitely try the sangria My favorite was the white sangria pear and grape which had a great sweet taste Our server Juan Carlos was friendly and attentive and guided us through the menu The restaurant itself located in the Blackstone Hotel is beautifully decorated sleek and modern fun and cheerful with large windows overlooking Grant Park With such steep prices I wont be a regular here but Mercat is definitely worth trying at least once

Author: leyla a.
Content: 35 stars Â I shave a 12 point for priceim tired so this may be my absolute shortest review Â I am going to number everything1 I couldnt find the damn door2 when I finally found the damn door I couldnt find my way upstairs to the damn main dining room3 once i got upstairs everything was fine4 I was a little surprised by how tall the ceilings were Â 5 I neither liked or dislike the light bulb light fixtures hanging from the ceiling 6 we ordered a bunch of small plates7 I liked the potatoe omlette8 I liked the wild striped bass9 I thought the cocktails were unoriginal10 I thought the service was pretty good nothing special but on par for a restaurant of this type11 I thought the desserts were mediocre12 I liked the cheese selection13 I thought it was very expensive Â We spent about 350 for 4 people inclusive of taxservice and we had 1 drink each an NO entrees just small plates14 I think if I went back I could get a great meal for a lot less by ordering more efficiently

Author: Orack B.
Content: Yea I ate here an yea I dropped a lot of money but yea I ate over half the menu Â Me and my boy dropped in here for a casual dinner on a freezing January Saturday night Â It was late I might add and the place was loud lively and packed with the standard lookatme jackasses Â The space is huge and the music was to my tastes excelente Â Kind of Euro vibe loungy funkyetc Â Well we started with some excellent charcuterria Â From there we moved to the prawns  probably the best thing we had that night we ordered it three times over all told briny and charred perfectly Â It was nice to have them served headon because sucking the brains and head out was tasty Â The chibarones were charred nicely al planxa  their specialty  but lacked that last hit of salt Â The pork belly was swimming in some kind of glaze that overpowered everything on the plate and did not do the protein proper justice Â The rabbit was good but again drowned in butter and the whole foam thing is so played out Â The lamb chops once again from the grill were recommended and for good reason Â Cooked to perfection and a palette pleaser no doubt Â Patatas bravas  SmokeyCebollas Rellenas  CheesyAbsinthe  DreamyRed Wine  PerfectWhite Wine  RefreshingBeers  Standard GoodnessIll be back with 30 in my wallet

Author: Dennis S.
Content: Another fivestar experience Â But I dread trying to get a table on a Friday or Saturday night during the summerWe had another great experience at Mercat Â And this time the service moved up to 5stars too Â On a Thursday evening the place was packed Â So when warm summer nights arrive its going to be difficult to schedule a table here Â But I willKey tapas we had Porcini and Catalan sausage flatbread with roasted garlic and manchego cheese Â Outstanding Serrano ham  fig salad with la Peral cheese baby spinach spiced almonds and sherry vinaigrette  terrific again Â I cant imagine coming here without ordering this dish its so good Wild mushrooms confit potato and shallots Â A perfect compliment to the other dishes Garlic shrimp Â Tasted great but lost in the competition with the other dishes Pork belly with a cider glaze green apples and truffle Â Delicious not overcooked just the way a simple pork belly dish should tasteWe had a few other dishes  breads olives and a couple tasty but very small desserts Â Plus two bottles of Spanish Albarino white a great Spanish Orobio red and a few after dinner drinks Â It made for a perfect three hour visit with friends over wine and tapas

Author: Kathleen M.
Content: This restaurant had me at a Catalan name When I saw that there had been a Yelp event here I was1 Â  Jealous and mad that Â I hadnt been included didnt they know I spent my Jr year of college in Barcelona Â 2 Bound and determined to come here myselfAfter reading the reviews we decided to make it our second Brunch Adventure Sunday Â Our only problem was the parking  there wasnt any signage to indicate that the valet was around the corner at the Blackstone Hotel so we had parked at the Hilton across the street hoping for validation alas there was notOnce we were in the restaurant we liked the airy look and feel of the place Â We had a great table and started with the Roasted Suckling pig buffet yes and yum Â We enjoyed that with cheese plus juice and coffee Â We then had the melon and almond first course both fabulous Â The second course of shrimp and eggs was even better  best Eggs Benedict of my life Â The third course wasnt my fave but my husband really liked the duck confit croissant french toast and the brussel sprouts Â I made up for it by tasting all the sweets on the buffet and the mini dark chocolate tarts were worth the trip aloneOur waiter was very earnest and we liked the laid back vibe Â Jody Weis came in and no one bothered him at all Â That must be such a relief to him after all the shouting protesting and picketing he used to get and that was from the police officers Â Everyone was very cool and interested in their own table companions If Brunch is this fantastic what must the other meals be like Â We shall come and find out

Author: Crystal N.
Content: Bottomless Mimosas and Bloody Marys Need I say moreWhy yes I can Â How bout Duck Confit with a cherry reduction sauce Â diesSeriously Â Get your ass to Mercats Sunday Brunch IMMEDIATELYOn second thought dont Â More food for me

Author: Jesse A.
Content: Could Flatbread really be this good Really Never in my wildest imagination Not at all I had a fabulous meal at Mercat The service was great  attentive but not over the top the decor is fun and the food and drinks were spot on top quality and Im a harsh judge of these things We had the serrano ham and fig salad  top notch and the seared scallops we received accidentally were fabulous too I confess we gobbled them up before they could realize their mistake  and oh the flatbread as I said was unexpectedly incredible and the paella de mariscos was overloaded with seafood  cooked very nicely not chewy or canned silly stuff and NOT overloaded with rice Also they have a great red wine selection and we had the seasonal sangria with mango cilantro and chili  mmmmmmmmm is all I can say to that The other patrons at the restaurant left a little to be desired  snobs and whiners at least those sitting near us

Author: Andrea H.
Content: Apparently all bets are off for lunch Â My friends had been raving about this place so when my friend suggested it for lunch I was definitely in Â I checked out the website before very cute btw so I knew that the menu was different but I still thought I would have the chance to get a taste of what they are all aboutThe lunch menu is a pretty good deal 3 courses for 18 Â I started with my favorite pimientos de padron Â My friend had the spanish omelette Â She enjoyed the omelette but I was disappointed when my peppers came out smothered in a very heavy sauce Â They are great the way they are why mess with emFor the second course I tried the Australian sea bass Â My friend had the scallops Â Nothing too creative about either dish Â The sea bass that Id heard rave reviews about was very fishy and smothered in another really heavy sauce Â The scallops were also fishy and more heavy sauce Â Im starting to see a pattern hereFor dessert we tried both the crema catalana and the chocolate croquettes Â These were actually very good but nothing specialI would really like to come back for dinner so that I can see what everyones been raving about Â As for lunch very disappointing skip it Â Everything was drowned in mayonnaisey sauces and you couldnt actually taste the foodor maybe that was the plan all along

Author: Sean D.
Content: Another great addition to the South Loop Â Mercat offers Catalan tapas that are simply fantasticThe decor is very cool and fitting for this festive atmosphere Â The music is a little loud but still bearableThe spanish cheese selection is impressive as is the wide range of meats offered in addition to the small plates Â Perhaps my favorite thing about this restaurant is the whole roasted suckling pig Â I am definitely making a return trip for the experience you need to give 48 hours notice

Author: Jennifer Y.
Content: Back for the first time in a while Â We booked dinner for 6 for my husbands birthday and were hoping for a very special night Â Service was beyond terrible Â Food rushed out at first our table over crowded with old plates no one picking them up etc Â In fact we had to start clearing it ourselves and insisting that the army of people crowding the food on our table take them away Â Then we hit a food drought Â Nothing came out for what seemed forever and again we stared at a dirty table while no one came to check on us Â Final straw was that after we finished eating our main server was doing the Absinthe demo at the table next to us and again NO ONE came to check on us Â We sat waiting for someone to see if we wanted dessert or after dinner drinks for so long that we decided to go elsewhere Â The food was not as good as remembered Â EVERYTHING had saffron aoli and was way too heavy handed Â The only good thing about the night was the lamb chops and they really were amazing Â Our dinner for 6 people was 600 Â Our server Â did find time to add a 19 tip to our bill Â At this price point that type of service is unforgivable Â At no point during the night was it acknowledged that it was a special occasion despite my calling several times to mention it Â  We werent looking for anything free but just something to make it more than just a dinner out Â Dessert at Hot Chocolate made us all smile again and remember what awesome service could add to a night out Â We will NEVER dine with Mercat again

Author: Jeff G.
Content: Went to Mercat last night and any of the early reviews with criticism of staff their silly headsets and any other nonsense must be ignored Â They have smoothed out the kinks and there was only one earpiece in evidence on what I assume was their railthin managerAs background I was in Barcelona with my wife and parents last summer and we found some amazing places to spend our devalued currency Â From the classic Taller de Tapas to a new fusion joint Bar Lobo we tried everything Â As a side note I would not be surprised if the decor in Mercat was inspired by Bar Lobo  my wife and I both noted some great similaritiesThats just the tip of the iceberg Â We were four the magical number where tapas is no longer a wasted effort and you get to try a wider variety Â And what variety  Jos Garces has maintained a very close relationship with traditional Catalan style and yet pushes the boundaries of those traditions with insightful inspired plates Â We ordered ten or twelve plates to split between the four of us and only one was a disappointment Â The samplings of cured meats from whoever serves as their charcuterie were excellent the seafood was impeccably prepared and the seasoning was outstanding on all the dishes Â We selected the Black Angus ribeye as our meat course and I ate a full helping of morcilla just cuz Im a greedy mug and it did not disappoint it was perfectly prepared Â Brilliantstandout dishes include 1 Squid in Its Own Ink a challenging dish and when it comes to the table your jaw will drop but the flavors and textures are perhaps some of the finest I have ever had the privilege of experiencing and 2 BaconWrapped Dates which beyond the fact that the strong flavors are so delicately balanced comes draped in the most amazing cream sauce imaginable Â Note the beloved classic staple Patatas Bravas fails to taste like anything but soft barbecue chips Â They are oversalted and underimagined Â If Jos could read this review and know that I love what he does but wish he made different potatoes Id be happyOur server was enthusiastic knowledgeable and personable Â I cannot point to any missteps she or the service staff madeSo in all this really deserves a 42 or 43 because of its nearly flawless execution on ambiance and food with no notable bumps in service

Author: Jen R.
Content: Oh sweet flatbreads I would marry you and have your babies if I could Â Between the two flatbreads I got my greedy little hands on  the margherita one and the shortrib one  Â my ass was in heaven Â To me they tasted fresh different and damn good Â The rest of the menu  Ive gotta admit I was a little wtf Â A lot of cool tasty looking variety but def not cheap Â Since Im a total pussy and the last person to try something new I stuck with the flatbreads which of course didnt stop my fat ass from sampling everything else that came to the table Â It was all tasty as hell Ive gotta admit Â On the stupid fruity drink front I rocked their mojito which was tasty tasty  but totally fucking weak Â Seriously I downed two in minutes and I didnt even feel a buzz or remotely slutty  which equals fail on the drink front Â Especially when I blew 24 on the two of them Â And the entire time we kept having to turn away other peoples food which was mistakenly brought to our table Â At first I thought damn am I really ordering all this shit and cant remember anything  maybe those drinks were stronger than I thought Â But no and of course they mistakenly brought some flatbreads  way to screw with my mind Mercat Â Anyways totally dug our server who was super knowledgable about the menu and was free with the good suggestions Â Next time Im in the mood to satisfy my flatbread whore tendencies  this is where Ill be

Author: Nancy H.
Content: Usually at a small plates kind of place I spend a lot of money for food that rarely impresses me Â At Mercat the 58 chefs tasting menu consists of various plates off the regular menu and there wasnt a dish I didnt like Â It is served family style and they are conscious of how many people will be sharing these dishes so that everyone gets 12 of each dish Â Yes it was expensive but I thoroughly enjoyed my meal and I didnt leave hungry Our menuCheese plate paired wapple marmalade and sliced raw applesTomato  garlic bruschettaSpinach salad wserrano ham  sherry vinaigrette dressed just enoughShellfish croquettes IMO was fried for too long because the crust overpowered the fillingGarlic shrimpPrawnsSpicy potatoes wpaprika aioli I thought these were a little dryPorcini  sausage flatbreadRabbit dumplings wcandied cherries a favorite for some of my friendsWarm spinach wraisins  pine nuts nice light accompaniment to the meatsRack of lamb my favorite  very tender and very little game tasteRibeyeThe sauce pairings for both red meats were perfect Â However I thought the shrimp  prawns were overly salted and not very innovative Â We also tried 2 desserts the chocolate croquette with banana marshmallow and the Crema Catalana figs with orange whipped cream  and a golf ball sized scoop of berry sorbet Â The latter was the most disappointing a dining companion said it was like eating air and the former was just ok Â Desserts dont seem to be their strong pointMercat is suitable for mediumsized groups and intimate parties Â The smaller tablesbooths are along the perimeter of the sunken main dining floor and the larger tables are in the center Â There is a bar in the corner with high tables which is appropriate for people gazing

Author: Shradha A.
Content: You know the restaurants that are such a great experience that you have absolutely fond memories and recommend to others for their special occasions too Yeah not this one One of my besties was in town just for one night from Calgary and she was celebrating a new job I decided to try out Mercat which is where I almost went for my birthday dinner this summer had Girl  the Goat not opened that same week The ambiance is nice although a little too brightly lit The music was really good The food was quite delectable although nothing in particular was memorable But the reason Im not coming back here is the service Absolutely terrible service The guy was so busy flirting with a neighboring table of 5 girls all night that he couldnt care less to make sure our tapas had arrived at the table our glasses of water were refilled or stop by to ask if we wanted to order dessert He was exceptionally rude and threw around an attitude that had no place to be there I completely disagree with all the Yelp Talk around the fact that service shouldnt be part of a review only food should be When you pay such premium prices youre doing so for the experience and service is an integral part of that experience How can a restaurant such as this not have better training for their staff and ensure stricter enforcement of warm and cordial behavior with guests Server bad day or distractions notwithstanding

Author: Jeff S.
Content: Another day another celebrity chefs restaurant I recently ventured over to Mercat a la Planxa with 3 others for my birthday so I knew I would have the opportunity to try a lot of foodFOODTomato bread for the table basically like pico de gallo on top of buttery bread Delicious and light only the ends of it seemed to be at all greasy Great way to start I loved this so muchPulpo con patatas I love mollusks they taste delicious This dish had a lot of paprika in it with some acid from what I would assume is lemon juice which together combined for great flavor I dont know if the potatoes really added anything as the dish itself wasnt very strongly flavored and not at all salty However the octopus was awesome and would strongly recommend this to anyoneBacon wrapped dates My friend told me a few different time about these dates  Im not sure if it was because she didnt remember telling me about them or if she just loved them so much Well it was probably the latter because these things were my favorite dish of the night It was a classic sweet  savory combination that worked so well Get theseTruita de patata I was surprised at how much I liked this dish  very creamy well seasoned and not a lot of saltiness All good things Im glad Chef Garces went with a goat cheese for this one  the subtle and soft flavor went really well with the creamy lentilsAlbondigas de venera scallop and shrimp meatballs Some might not agree with mushing up scallops and shrimp into ball form but I think it was genius I like meat balls I like seafood I like this dish Like scallopballs not to be confused with scallop testes with chunks of shrimp in it if that makes senseSerrano ham and fig salad ant go to a Spanish restaurant without getting some of that jamon right The jamon de Iberico de bellato or something like that basically Iberico porkbelly ham was a bit much on el dinero side but we got this ham and fig salad based on a recommendation from a friend Very good although I didnt taste much fig until I went digging around looking for it Serrano ham was delicious albeit extraordinarily salty I guess Im more used to the more subtle flavor of proscuittoPinxtos muranos lamb brochettes wrapped in bacon Well this was good But bacon wrapped anything is good One point here is that I didnt get much of a lamb taste I hope this wasnt due to being two pitchers of sangria deep but I felt like the lamb was overpowered by the bacon  sauce Sauce was sweet btwPaella valenciana chicken  chorizo paella wartichoke and tomato salad I love paella I usually like rice dishes Good flavors chorizo in here was great but the chicken was pretty bland on its own Probably a good thing considering that my salt sensing buds were in overdrive I prefer paella del mar I think I can speak el espanol I really cant though and I actually prefer Cafe Babareebas paella to this one However I we was were really full at this point so maybe that impacted what I tastedDESSERT Croquettes de xocolate chocolate and caramel filled croquettes So good Deep fried balls filled with chocolate and caramel YEA GIMME Shove one of these with the banana cream into your fat face and wait for a gush of awesomeness and sweetness There were 6 croquettes and 4 of us I decided to grab two Someone else was smart enough to grab the last oneSERVICE Fast friendly and very helpful with recommendations They also werent very intrusive but were around whenever one of us needed a refill or we needed some more sangria Our server was also very personable and just funVALUEOVERALLI think that for a tapas place owned by an Iron Chef Mercat is a pretty good overall value Its more expensive than some of the other tapas places in the city but not by much Alot of it could be the inherently more expensive ingredients used in Chef Garces menu Overall this was a great dinner Ill definitely be back if for nothing else but to get my hands on those dates again

Author: Amy H.
Content: I dont know what it was that I didnt like at Mercat Â Maybe it was the limited variety of food Â Maybe was the way they served everything family style from a preset menu and you had no say in the what you were being fed Â Maybe it was because we had to flag down a server more times that we should have had to Â Something about our brunch just felt a bit off Â The food was decent and a good value for 25 plus the bottomless mimosas or bloody mary bar will give you a nice zing were a mere 8 extra but I really would have liked a few madetoorder options or had some input into what I was being served Â This brunch was also heavy on the lunch and light on the breakfast which was disappointing to me

Author: kahee y.
Content: saturday late dinner 930 6 friendsOh Jose Garces WTF having dined at a couple of his philadelphia restaurants I really had high expectations for Mercat Â i would give this place ZERO stars if i could Â in comparison to his philadelphia restaurants i could not believe Mercat was one of his food  The food was just NOT tasty not one dish wowed us it was all very boring it was the biggest disappointment Â  octopus fritters  um ok not really Â it tasted like straight up batterflash fried peppers  how is this on the menu lifeless peppers with NO flavor literally tasted like nothingpaella negra  the taste of the ink overpowered every other flavor in this dish reminded me of nyc chinatown yuck and everyones teeth turned black Â hotbrussels sprouts id rather go to whole foods and buy a pound for 799cauliflower finally a unique and flavorful dish but beware its gross once it gets cold Â scallop over shortribs its mayor bloomberg level salty Â oh my god i thought i was eating straight up salt Â the scallops were overcooked greatpork belly  everyone in the industry is doing this how can it be so mediocre Â step it upbeef shortrib flatbread  ehred wine sangria  if watered down red punch is your thing go for itservice  in a huge space with high ceilings and chatter everywhere not one person in our party heard our server say anything Â and being a tapas place you would think they would announce each dish as it is being served nope Â i had to request every time for the name Â and our sangria came out after our first couple dishes um Â would i go back  hell effin NO

Author: Dan D.
Content: I went here for Valentines Day and had quite possibly one of the best meals Ive had for many months Having lived in Barcelona for a period I am quite familiar with Spanish food and tapas Mercat a La Planxa does not serve your typical tapas menu Rather they take the Barcelona food and place a very unique spin to the classic dish Each dish has a wonderful taste and makes you wonder  just what else did they add to this to make it soo darn goodSeafood is important for Barcelona cuisine as it is at this restaurant The grilled shrimp prawns were superb Not doused in sauce but spiced just right and laid right on the plate The beef entrees are a real treat as well although not truly a common Catalan staple but they do it wonderfully Fillets are cooked just like a great steakhouse Come here to try a new Spanishstyle restaurant Leave here knowing you ate amazing food with great modern flair to old spainclassics

Author: T O.
Content: Great food great service excellent wine choices yummy cocktails Every time Im in Chicago I stop here

Author: Slu S.
Content: This place is what tapas should be everywhere I went with high expectations and they were certainly met If nothing else the lunch that Garces puts on is better than most anywhere in the loop areaWe ate the mixto of queso which included Cado Urgelia cows cheese with apple and lavender Gorrotxa goats cheese with garlic and dulce de leche and Ombra sheeps cheese with orange marmelade Then I moved on to the Serrano and Fig salad This salad was completely awesome The salty serrano and the sweet fig worked so well together Wild mushrooms and shallots were up next They were great but I was getting filled up by this pointWe finished with the chocolate souffle that was spectacular One of the best desserts in the loop Perfect with a little sherryI look forward to coming back to try the entire pig

Author: Sabrina M.
Content: Went back here last night for a friends birthday and am happy to report that they seem to have resolved their service issues That and the food are the only reasons Im giving it an extra star from the first visit But I still wasnt blown away by this placeI cant put my finger on it but somethingsoff The food being delicious is not the issue My friends and I feasted on scallops outstanding dates wrapped in bacon gambas al ajillo paella duck also outstanding But theres just some kind of disconnect with this place It wants to be upscale and charges upscale prices to be sure But it is not consistently outstanding The servers all wear uniforms but then the guy who actually delivers the food to the table is wearing jeans and looks like a bumAll of our backs were hurting by the end of dinner because the wooden chairs are so blasted uncomfortable It took forever to get our duck but it was very good Theres a certain charm a certain warmth a certain consistency thats just lacking This experience was definitely better than when I went for my birthday but Mercat is still not a destination spot for me in the neighborhood

Author: Janet E.
Content: We came here for dinner and my stomach and my wallet both left empty after leaving this restaurantThe food Four stars for flavorThe portions Two starsThe price Two starsThe service Four starsI know tapas are small plates but this was ridiculously small We shared our tapas between two people and ended up with one bite per personWe started off with the complimentary garlic and tomato bread It was delicious Â The biggest portioned dish out of our entire mealNext was the bacon wrapped dates Â Total four dates two per skewer Flavor was excellentWe continued on with the Shellfish Croquettes Â Five little tiny shellfish on top of a bed of rice Surprisingly this was very good It was something in the rice We then tried the butternut squash dumplings These were OUTSTANDING My favorite dish of the night There was only three small pieces I wish there were moreFor substance we ate the shrimp chorizo and garbanzo bean puree flatbread I made sure to drink lots of water hoping this would expand and fill my stomach To end we ordered a cake with plum sauce and almond ice cream It was the least memorable part of our meal Four tapas one dessert and one martini was over 80 After we left I wanted to hit up Dairy Queen for some dinnerOne last thingmake sure to head upstairs for the restaurant The bar is at the bottom and there is a podium that looks like a hostess should be standing there but no one will ever come We stood there for a while and no one attended to us

Author: Ramya P.
Content: TRUFFLE EXPLOSIONBeing fans of the Iron chef me and the hubby decided to have a date night here recently and made our reservations for an early dinner While my husband was parking the car easy to find space on Wabash I ordered a mocktail of the bartenders choice and she gave a me a refreshing concoction not listed on the menu After the two of us were seated our gracious waiter explained the various options for us vegetarians He explained that the chefs would be excited to please diners with dietary restrictions and make dishes that were not listed on the menu if we got the Chefs tasting menu We were convinced and then it began three courses of delectable tapas designed to please the palate First course  1 Laperal cheese and bread with Apricot cider mustard YUM2 A simple frisee salad with asparagus and tomatoes dressed generously in a vinaigrette3 An assortment of imported olives4 Frittata with spinach potatoes and saffron aoili 5 And a dish that reminded us of a bruschettaSecond courseIncluded all the dishes mentioned in their Verduras vegetables categoryThird course1 Risotto like dish with cauliflowers2 Assorted mushrooms roasted with potato confit and truffle oil3 Butternut squash dumplings 4 Flatbread with mushrooms and truffle Its a LOT of foodSo go hungry and you will be impressed

Author: Shazza B.
Content: YUCK This place was really rather awful The plating was absurd and overly dramatic The way my salad was served was pretentious and inedible  Dont bother

Author: Rachelle B.
Content: I met up with two friends for dinner at Mercat a la Planxa Chicagos only Catalan restaurant on South Michigan Avenue I was up on North Michigan between work and dinner and I thought oh Ill just walk down for dinner Right Thats a long walk from Chicago Avenue I ended up arriving wet from the rain blistered from my shoes hot late and frazzled My friends were having drinks in the bar and I joined them for one before we headed up for dinner Nothing like booze to calm the nervesMercat a la Planxas bar is on the first floor street level The dining room is one floor up I didnt realize beforehand that the restaurant is located in the Blackstone Hotel The interior is really beautiful Warm colors Modern touches I thought it was cool how the kitchen is wide open making it almost part of the decor a show of the processChef Jose Garces is the the owner of Mercat a la Planxa Id heard of him from the Food Network where he won the Next Iron Chef challenge Think what you like about the Food Network and its challenges but Chef Garces also won the James Beard Award for best midatlantic chefOur waitress that night was a firecracker And really good at her job Funny but not trying too hard Friendly And she knew her stuff too She mentioned to us that Chef Jose Garces was in the kitchen I commented that I was suprised since he owns 6 restaurants in Philadelphia and only one in Chicago Our waitress said Chef is in Chicago a lot and told us that hes from Chicago and attended Lane Tech and Kendall CollegeFor dinner we decided to split 6 small plates and a pitcher of the seasonal sangria We were first served tomato bread which was so light and fresh and delicious Next up we got the chefs selection of 3 cheeses Each of these cheese were served with a special side The goat cheese was paired with a garlic dulce de leche The sheep cheese with a orange marmalade The cows milk cheese came with a pistachio truffle side So good The pairings were right on and just as delicious as the cheese itselfNext we had some delicious croquetas of potato and cheese with some jamon ham inside We also had pimentos de padron flash fried padron peppers with salbitxada and sea salt The croquetas were very rich and salty but in small little pops were so good My friend had a dish similar to the peppers somewhere in New York and ordered them to compare She said the ones at Mercat were better than the ones she had in NYWe were loving this food so far So it was no surprise after eating this deliciousness pondering over how local the Chef is and how much hes accomplished we were forming little foodie crushes We looked up and Chef Garces was standing next to our table talking to a few people Someone at our table may have made some saucy gestures behind Chefs back and been really embarassed when our sassy waitress called her out May have happened Or may have just been a sangria daydream but it would be quite a coincidence then when we saw the waitress talk to Chef and then when he came over to our table to introduce himself Blush blush blushAhem Back to the foodIt was coming out fast and furious at this point We had the pinones con boquerones which was a flatbread with white anchovies pancetta goat cheese and marinated pine nuts We also had some slowcooked pork belly with cider glaze green apples and truffle There was also a dish with mussels All very very goodFor dessert we had croquetes de xocolata  milk chocolate croquettes with banana marshmallow rosemary caramel and arbequina olive oil OMG These were so good There were six little croquetes and I remember sitting and talking a bit before eating my first when my friend interrupted me and yelled to just eat it already because she had eaten hers and it was THAT good My other friend was making a face while she ate hers I couldnt tell if it was pain or pleasure Turned out thats just how good they were Make sure you get this dessert if you visit MercatThe food at Mercat a la Planxa was really well done Great dinner And not too expensive We were stuffed at the end and including the drinks the bill was about 45person So a nice dinner but not going to kill you when you get the bill

Author: Janet X.
Content: WTF Â I cant believe nobody ever took me to Mercat for brunch before this weekend and Ive been in the city for a whole TWO YEARS Â This place is amazing Â Well outside of the fact that they dont believe in opening doors Â I literally wandered around for fifteen minutes trying to figure out how to get in before giving up and going to the Starbucks Â Turns out that even though there are doors that say Mercat a la Planxa from the outside you actually have to go in the main entrance of Blackstone and then take the stairs up on the right Â The space is airier than I expected  maybe Ive spent too many frightful nights at Ba Ba Reeba being jostled by waiters from all sides Â As soon as we sat down the server welcomed us and told us we were welcome to the buffet Â The charcuterie was AMAZING the tenderloin was literally perfect Â The person behind the counter also introduced us to all the cheeses Â In addition to this there is a dessert table full of luscious cakes and tarts and fruits Â AND THEN we came back to the table to find out that we actually get ALL the tapas on the prix fixe menu starting with a delicious eggs benedict Â Eight goodsized tapas later I am stuffed Â I wanted to lie down on the table and take a nap Â Spanish omelets POTATOES Â AND SPINACH biscuits with manchego and bacon pork belly All this for 25Add a 8 allyoucandrink assortment of mimosas sangrias and bloody mary bar and youve got yourself an incredibly decadent threehour brunch Â OMG Â Im drooling just remembering itSo the only thing that doesnt make it five stars is the fact that they charged us 5 for tea Â I mean Im all for restaurants making money and everything but really that was the most egregious upcharge Ive ever seen in my life

Author: Luna P.
Content: After being referred to Mercat for its beauty I was excited about having dinner with my family and friends there Â  Â The place is absolutely stunning and we were seated quickly our reservations were for 630pm on a Wednesday night things were going fine however our waiter looked like he belonged in an episode of Entourage beauty did not come with the brains Â He was not very knowledgeable about the things on the menu was vague about the menu in general and we never heard about any specials of the night or suggestions on what to order even when asked he seemed very preoccupied by things going on around him and not at all focused on usWith eight of us there we decided to order two tapas each to start with Â tapas ranging from 918 we thought that we would have plenty to start with and share Â The bread that they served was topped with a tomato bruschetta was so sodium filled it was inedible one of my dishes the Arros con Morels tasted like a combination of soap and dirty dish water Â When trying to ask for help or get our waiter it was almost completely impossibleI had to get up to find someone to fill my water glass after waiting for 10 min with an empty one Â As a group we decided not to waste anymore money on the over priced tapas and substandard service we all agreed we were still hungry and thought of going to Harolds chicken Shack Â around the corner for some real food however my sister who is a restaurant owner herself wanted to see if they could redeem themselves with dessert and coffee service so she offered to treat us all to dessertWe ordered desserts and tried to order espresso and cappuccino wouldnt ya know a Spanish tapas place without an espresso machine Â I asked the waiter what type of coffee they served he came back and said he was unable to find out and did not know so we ordered coffee it was served cold and you could tell it had been sitting around a while The desserts on the other hand were amazing we had the Bread Pudding that was served in a filo shell and not your typical bread pudding we also had the Chocolate Hazelnut dessert that was very good Â This did not redeem them from having a soso meal and sub standard service 18 tip was already added to the bill so our waiter the cute and elusive one got an undeserved 56 and it is unfortunate but I would not recommend Mercat to anyone that I knowIts a pretty place in the beautiful Blackstone Hotel but other than that    save your money if you want good tapas and better service go to Cafe Iberico or Harold Chicken Shack

Author: Carol K.
