Content: Im back to loving this place just dont go at lunch if you want the full experience and the tapas menuDinner the other night was fabulous Â My favorite server JC Juan Carlos took care of us with his friendly attentive and fun style and the food was top notch as always Â Check out my earlier reviews if you want some food suggestionsAlways a good choice if you are looking for a fun night out as Mercat consistently delivers

Author: Jason L.
Content: So we decided to check out Iron Chef JosÃ© Garces place    thats how they describe it when you call the restaurant and get their recording Â This is Iron Chef JosÃ© Garces and thank you for calling Mercat a la Planxa    We had 915 reservations on a Saturday night and the joint was jumpin  still waited 20 minutes for our table Â The problem is that theres no real way to get a drink  there was no place to sit no way to even get to the bar no one to take our orderask if we wanted a drink Â Minus one starWhen we were finally seated we got our menus and  OK the waitress was stressed overworked busy  but does she REALLY have to explain what tapas are to people Â Really Â Maybe soSo we ordered cocktails and ordered several tapas and I said to her Since paella takes some time to make we should probably order that now Â She came back and told me the paella would take an hour Â So we skipped the paella kitchen was backedup and ordered a couple of more tapas    The first two tapas arrived before our cocktails Â OK so the kitchen wasnt backedup the bar was Â Minus another starThe waitress returned to tell us a the cocktails were on the way and b that they were sold out of the baby octopus and the Jamon Iberico Â    Â so we ordered two different tapas     Uh  I dont know Â The food  what they DID have and when we DID get it  was quite good Â The cocktails were very good Â The wine list was OK nothing too exciting and NO sherries  tapas and Fino or Manzanilla is a classic pairing and they dont have anySherry DID appear but only on the dessert menu  why a Fino is on the dessert menu when its an aperitif is beyond me    This restaurant has potential Â As I said the food we did get was quite tasty but the service was off the kitchen and bar disjointed and as it is no more than 3 stars

Author: Natasha P.
Content: Flash fried Padron peppers Black Angus Hanger Steak and Chocolate Croquettes that lay in a bed of warm caramel and melted marshmallowsFOR LUNCH Yes there are picturesThe first time I dined at Mercat was this past summer and my best friend and I decided to go with the Chefs Tasting Menusimply phenomenalToday I decided to take advantage of Chicago Restaurant Week and I grabbed my sister for a prix fixe impromptu lunch at this South Loop gem Under the pretense that my sister had never dined here my good friend Griffin C and fellow fan of Mercat and Slooper extraordinaire said it best you are going to rape her pallet And though I found out my sister has been here for brunch only the lunch menu sure did just thatFor Chicago Restaurant Week Mercats lunch menu allows you to choose one item for the first course and second course as well as dessertand iced tea andor pop is included What a steal I had the fried peppers for the first course and they were refreshing unlike any pepper Id ever tasted before not spicy but certainly light and memorable The second course was the hanger steak that was prepared on top of a layer of short ribs which then lay quite amazingly on a crisp potato croquette It was quiet the getaway from the office but also worth much much more than 22pp The service is always great attentive and informative And I love the decor of this place bright and eyecatching just the way I like it

Author: Dima M.
Content: If you are a frequent tapas restaurant patron Im not sure this is a good place for you Â I go to tapas restaurants a lot and I am used to getting a lot more food for my money Â The food is amazing here very flavorful and presented very well Â But in the end I think of it as tapas and cant justify paying 3 times as much if not moreThe biggest shock was the paella Â If you have had traditional Paella that comes in the big paella pan youre going to fall over when you see how small the paella portion is Â Not to mention that it did not even have saffron in it to give it that paella yellow colorThe atmosphere is great and if you can ask to be seated in the upstairs room as it provides a lot more privacy and its a lot quieter than the main dining room Â They also let you sit there forever and they dont rush you out of there like most restaurantsThe service is OK Â The servers are very friendly but they are so caught up in being fancy that they forget to bring you some stuff Â Just make sure you dont get charged for it

Author: Emily D.
Content: Wow Â This place was amazing Â We went on a Saturday night to celebrate a friends 30th birthday Â Since there were 9 of us we knew we wanted to get the chefs tasting which would make deciding what dishes to get and splitting the bill much easierWe also knew we wanted Sangria Â And lots of it Â We wanted to try all of the three different varieties but our waiter convinced us to get the seasonal and then just one more Â He said we would love the seasonal and shouldnt even get another type Â We should have listened Â There was nothing wrong with the red but the seasonal was really amazing Â So amazing in fact we ended up getting 6 carafes by the end of the nightOk on to the food Â The Chefs tasting was amazing Â The food came out consistently and with enough time to enjoy it and say Â oh my GOD after each bite Â Out of all of the items the prawns were the only thing that we probably could have done without Â Highlights include Â Baconwrappedwalnutfilleddates tomato flat bread chorizo and cheese plates beans with pine nuts and the lamb chopsoh the lamb chops Â We couldnt quite figure out what made them so good but then determined that they must have been dipped in sx Â That really could be the only explanation Â They were that good The atmosphere was very hip but without feeling intimidating Â There were some tables of people that Im pretty sure thought they were in Vegas but we honestly were too focused on our food to really noticeOverall we loved this place Â Highly recommend the Sangria and the Chefs tasting and would jump at the opportunity to go back again

Author: Samantha H.
Content: I havent updated this in a while Â Ive been here quite a few more times now and theyve upped their game Â Chef Cory is just amazing Â The lamb lollipopstry themyoull thank me later Â And OMG the Iberco ham Â OMG Â That about sums that up Â I also have now been here for both breakfast and brunch and both were amazing Â I think they could up their bloody bar a bit but oh well

Author: George M.
Content: Extremely disappointing The table for four that we were assigned to was very small and uncomfortable with wine bottles sangrias and tapas The tapas are overpriced for the amount of food you get Im not expecting huge bowls of pasta and overflowing baskets of bread but when you order bacon wrapped dates and get only 4 dates smaller than your standard olive that is a little ridiculous Â The flatbread was okay but still only four pieces per orderThe worst was the scallop appetizer  ONLY 2 scallops cut in half and put on a mini skewer Please  Not much taste to scallop appetizer Grilled calamari appetizer was sosoBottom line  I will not be returning to this restaurant nor will I be referring this restaurant to any friends or families There are plenty of Tapas restaurants in the city of Chicago that are much better ie  Cafe IbericoTIP  Throw a little more food on the plate so we do not have to look for another restaurant after the Symphony we went to Millers pub around the corner for beer and wings

Author: Tricia L.
Content: Do you know why pirates wear an eyepatch Â Its so that when they go from a brightly lit space to a dim one they already have one eye adjusted to the light when theyre in a dangerous situation or when they enter Mercat a la PlanxaExpect a dimly lit lively interior alongside an open kitchen Â Plenty of staff around service was fine Â Our table got the 3course tasting menu Â It was kind of hard to hear what the declaration of what each dish wasThe tapas ranged from meh to omg I could pop those braised rabbit dumplings with brandied cherries like candy Â Besides the rabbit dumplings the other highlight of dinner was the tender lambchop and Im not a huge fan of gamey things either Â Other tapas served just seemed like fancy versions of flatbread pizza bruschetta goat cheese and prosciutto spinach salad with alright flavors Â The garlic shrimp and prawn smelled better than they tasted Â I liked the idea of the paella croquettes but I thought the flavor was lost next to the crispy texture of the croquetteNo sightings of Iron Chef Garces here Â o Â PS 14 valet is at the Balbo entrance to the Blackstone hotel Â Also book on Open Table

Author: Kirsten A.
Content: Knew we were off to a good start when they brought this yummy free flat bread brushetta type thing to start of the evening Â Things got better from there Â The menu is a bit confusing to look at so we went with the tasting menu Â For like 80 a person they bring you amazingly delicious tapas more than I could count Im thinking it was around 14 different things and 5ish wine parings Â Everything was delishThe only bummer is that the tasting menu doesnt come with dessert or a sparkling wine and it is kind of loud in there Â We went on a Monday night and it was almost packed full Â The decor is nice and swanky though and the service is excellent

Author: Ernie K.
Content: I had tried real tapas in Spain I think this place is as close as you can get from being authentic and amazingly good Â Everything we had was delicious And dont regret a penny actually our bill was 300 so kinda regret a bit but eh it was for work Â Wine selection was great but beer wasnt Â Service was good no long wait and waitress was super friendly and even rushed some of our orders Â Things you should definitely trybacon and datesshrimppork bellyrice pudding and no its not because I am Asian Â It was really good hereI highly recommend this place although its not really a good place to take your clients out to eat

Author: Tim S.
Content: Hmm I have to say I was kind of disappointedI enjoy a tapas place for the fun it brings to the dining experience For the prices I was expecting a little more Maybe it has been a while since I have been to a tapas place but the selection was less than I wanted We had a cheese selection and only got 4 small pieces I had a beef on bread which was okay and my friend had the octopus paella which was rather small for the price and hardly sharableHighlight the staff Willing to offer suggestions accommodating and very friendly Â Its okay if you are in the hood but not something I would go out of my way to visit again

Author: Kori E.
Content: I loved this restaurant You walk in and are just in awe of the space The huge windows the wall decorations the music in the background the great service Mercat definitely has it down it was a great experience There were four of us and we just kept the tapas coming We started off with a pitcher of Sangria It was pretty good just staple Sangria if you ask me but we werent here for the drinks We had about 10 tapas and each was just as good as the last I think my favorites were the spicy potatoes garlic shrimp bacon wrapped dates and the cheese with the caramel bacon dipping sauce The standout to me was the dessert We ordered the chocolate empenadas with the banana marshmallow on top and OMG I am still dreaming about that dessert This dessert was by far the best dessert I have ever had Â Each of the dishes had such a great flavor profile We were never sitting and waiting for food We always had at least 2 of our tapas on the table at all times The service was great My only gripe was a cappuccino was 5 coffee was 4 and the espresso was 450 Everything else seemed to be a great price point until we came to the after dinner drinks 4 for a coffee Seems to be a bit of a rip off to me I would definitely come back the food was absolutely amazing but next time I would not order a coffee or espresso

Author: Ryne D.
Content: How far can you really expect 35 to go at a place like this Im not really sure But thats Mercats weekly special for their Iron Chef Mondays where they recreate all the dishes from an episode that Iron Chef Garces competed inWell after our dinner I went home and pulled up the very episode our dinner was supposed to be based on  Battle Truffle Now I know truffles expensive I know that But I noticed a few key differences between what we ate and what the judges ate1 Much less truffle Ok some of the dishes on the show had piles of shaved truffle and theres no way 35 could cover that But maybe a couple slices at least2 Straightup substitutions We got wild boar instead of veal and there were places where the IC used some truffle variation of an ingredient that we didnt get3 Again I know it was just 35but the portions were really disappointing With 4 of us we had to split either one or two of the sizes that the judges got Trying to split one egg and four small pieces of steak four ways is both simple and sad It made me wonder what I wouldve received if I came by myself and ordered the same specialI think this couldve been better if we were told ahead of time that itd be wise to order something to accompany the special or even if they had a more expensive option that let us have moreI wrote in my last review of this place that my dad joked about going to Wendys after coming here There being no Wendys in the south loop my friends and I hit up White Castle No truffle there but we were happy all the same

Author: Christina P.
Content: Momma likes Mercat is hands down my favorite upscale restaurant in the loop Its modern sleek sexy and innovative Im a big fanThe downstairs bar area is good to meet friends at before you head up to the dining room Highly recommend making reservations as this place gets bumpin There is also another barlounge area to sit in if you dont want the feel of table seating  it serves the same menu with the same great serviceThe food is deeeeelicious Authentic yet updated Interesting infused flavors to old staples I loved the pork belly bacon wrapped dates the flatbreads any of them and the strip steak You leave full without feeling buffetstyle stuffed Overall its a classy place with wonderful service and spectacular food to boot

Author: Krutic A.
Content: What a colossal waste of time and money We went here for late dinner on a snowy evening expecting to be blown away by some good Catalan food It turned out to be one of the most disappointing dining experiences weve had in a long time The ambiance The restaurant is on the first floor and looks like it used to be a club or something The seating area is in a pit that probably was a dance floor Everything was too dark and sort of loud for a fine dining restaurant The tables were too small and too close together We were easily within a foot of the people sitting next to us and it was uncomfortable to say the least The Service Decent enough Although they brought out everything we ordered at the same time Which is unacceptable at anytime but especially so because of their lilliputian tables We spent most of the evening maneuvering our arms and hands around plates and glasses just so we could eat without knocking something over and probably into the laps of the people next to us The food Terrible Everything was cold Nothing lived up to expectations We got a charred green onion dish and it turned out to be something one can make at a campfire Take a bunch of scallions drowned in olive oil and throw em over a fire Although then you wouldnt have the pleasure of paying 8 bucks for it We couldnt eat it and had to send it back but they did not take it off our check The raw cows milk cheese wasnt very good either and came with a strange assortment of lavender jam which tasted like everything but lavender and sliced stale baguette and applesnot sure how one eats apples cheese bread and jam together The only decent dish was the confit tomatoes and roasted cipollini onions Â  I dont think its important enough for me to look up the actual names of dishes since they all sucked anywayThe drinks Simply crap 10 bucks for a caliente which was supposed to be mango nectar and orange liqueur and soda water and chilli powder The drink had no taste of its own  the only thing I could taste was the alcohol The Sangria wasnt great either  had too much ice which diluted it further They either dont have a dedicated bartender or the bartender they have should be a janitor because heshe definitely cant mix drinks All in all a mediocre at best dining experience at an exorbitant price This place is an insult to Spanish food hell  to food in general to bartenders and more importantly to my taste buds Did I mention it was a colossal waste of time and money

Author: nikki s.
Content: A friend and I Â decided to go here after seeing it reviewed on Check Please Rarely do I think to hit hotel restaurants but Mercat Â was outstanding serving up yummy tapasdrinks and good vibe It totally exceeded my expectations of what the new and improved Blackstone has to offer  I hear Blackstone and think old and creepy but au contrare mon frere The decor was sophisticated and plush with warm glowy lighting that makes everything look lovely Ceilings are way up there and the main floor is open and airy When we initially checked in with the hostess she told us there werent any tables until 10 and to try the lower lounge Did that and the next thing we know we were being escorted via elevator to the 3rd dining area It was less glitzy more secluded with mellow brazillian tunes piped in It would be the perfect area to dine with kids but we were satisfied just to get in on such a busy saturday nightWhile we were waiting on our mojitos to be delivered the customer service got even better We were asked if we wanted the best seat in the housea quaint little spot in the other dining room overlooking the main floor We took a look and made the move Stellar Let the feast beginMy companion gave me full liberty to order for the both of us and the menu accomodated us well Im the adventureeater but hes darn near vegetarian They had a wide variety of tapas and everything we had was presented well Let me say this they had me at my cranberry mojito and the little toasted bruschetta like starters Â Everything was tasty but I cant rave enough about the pulpo con patatas octopus wpotatos cooked perfectly The standout for me was the bacon wrapped dates Wasnt incredibly impressed with the dessert menu however the dessert croquettas are like nothing Ive ever tasted like a truffled explosion in my mouth Not a bad way to finish off a mealThe vibe of the place was very hip yet not pretentious As we scanned the crowd it wasnt so much the beautiful people kinda crowd but seemed Â more like the midthirty something and over professionals Really wish I could get a copy of whatever loungey tunes that were piped inMercat has set itself apart from the other tapas places Ive been to Ive heard the place compared to the feel of Barcelona If our visit is any indication of what Spain has to offer Barcelona here I come

Author: Donna K.
Content: HUGE disappointmentWe had a late Saturday night dinner at Mercat Â Parking was hard to find and we missed the little red door couple of times Â We were allowed to go ahead and sit although two of our party had not arrived Â The lounge area was small and we wondered how big the restaurant will beWalking upstairs into the restaurant we were surprised at how large it was Â High ceilings cute interior decorations our hopes were highThen our waiter arrivesHe mumbled all night and the food runners were more helpful in describing our food they also seemed more than happy to explain what our dishes were Â Do people not talk to themThe foodOctopus Fritters Â We wanted the other octopus dish but they were out of it Â The server instead recommended the special of the night the octopus fritters Â Wanting some more info we asked what it was Â His reply FrittersNonetheless it was goodFlash fried peppers  HORRIBLE Â Limp peppers in what seems like Japanese Mayo Â We all picked at one pepper each and the rest remained untouched Â seafood Paella Negra Â Black SUPER buttery rice with tomato slices and less than 5 seafood sprinkled on top Â And the portions are tiny Â Ive never eaten paella the size of creme brulee before Â No one fought for the remains after couple spoonfulBrussels Sprouts Â GoodCauliflower Excellent Â A bit creamy but it was really good Â Scallop over shortrbis Â Scallops were ok the shortribs were disgustingly salty Â I took a bite of it and literally gaggedSlowcooked Pork Belly Â Very very goodBeef shortrib flatbread Â okThe pitcher of red wine sangria we ordered tasted like watered down cranberry juiceAll in all it was a huge disappointment and a waste of money Â Back to Cafe Iberico I goOh and being harrassed by a toothless homeless man all the way back to my car was the cherry on top of my evening

Author: Mimi D.
Content: Great place Good food drinks and service Definitely try the seasonal sangrias We had these roasted pepper things that were surprisingly delicious  i normally do not like peppers that we had to get a second orderBacon wrapped dates are always a good pic We also had spinach salad wrapped in ham and i think there were figs too Overall a good experience I think theyre supposed to have an outdoor patio for the summerThere are some tourists since they are in the Blackstone Hotel and next to the Hilton Otherwise a good crowd

Author: Diane K.
Content: Great to have tapas in this area Its a very large restaurant with a chic interior design We were seated at a booth in the corner which made for a lovely view of the entire place The rosa sangria was perhaps the best part We also enjoyed the frittatas as our favorite dish and its really hard to mess up bacon wrapped dates While each item we ordered was good there werent many that were terribly memorable Nonetheless wonderful service drinks and merriment was had

Author: An P.
Content: Give credit where credit is due Â I tried to hate Mercat a la Planxa it is downtown in a very touristy part of town and they are so very used to their patrons being pure tourists but even Chicagoans can find great eats and solace in a meal at Mercat a la PlanxaComing from work downtown I conveniently hopped on the Red Line and walked a few blocks over to Mercat located in the Blackstone Hotel Â I ordered a Spanish beer while waiting for friends and it was not overly crowded in the bar area and plenty of people were seated in the dining area enjoying their eatsWe were sat at our table which had enough room for me to put my backpack down since I am always hauling my camera along Â The server had some charm and seemed to like his work and gave us plenty of time to order and brought our drinks quickly Â Looking at the menu I was a little bit overwhelmed since any time I go to tapas I end up wanting to order everything Â We all compromised and went for the Chefs tasting menu for 65 which was a four course meal with 12 dishes with portions for everyone to get a good piece 5 Goose Island Matildas to boot and we were ready to goWhat came next was a deluge of delightful plates showing off mastery of tapas and the tastes and textures were worth the money we spent Â I really thought dinner was over after all of the plates but then they brought out prawn and lamb and I was ready for my napService AFood AAtmosphere AOverall Rating Daaaaaaaaaaaayum

Author: Des D.
Content: My boyfriend and I went here after skating at Millennium Park After reading some of the rave reviews here on yelp I was excited to finally give Mercat a try The space was impressive but as soon as we got seated disappointment sank in The tables were so cramped together that we were literally an inch from the next table with no space to move around and felt no privacy at all for we can obviously hear the conversations on the left and right tables Â Despite that I was still rooting for a great meal that was going to win me over easilyWe ordered a variety of meats vegetable and rice tapas The prices for these were on the high side but we were willing to splurge hoping it was going to be worth it and unfortunately it was not Out of the 7 plates we ordered all but two met my expectations The seafood croquettes and verdona salad was exceptional the rest was abysmal The skirt steak was served rarealmost raw We expected our waiter to give us the option of how we wanted our meats but didnt care to ask The arroz congraje was way too salty and I am a person that normally overseasons my meals but this just tasted like I was shoving salt in my mouth The quail with foie de gras looked better than it actually tasted The patatas bravas was just smokey and bland The specialty drinks was extra sweet that by the time we were to the last few sips it was all sugarThe dessert was even more disappointing I love desserts and practically eat anything with chocolate but the fried chocolates was just too much for me It was way to sweet it tasted like fried sugar We also tried the Helados sorbet and this was okay but not great I probably would have gotten better quality sorbet from the gelataria at the corner of my place Anyway you got the point the food just did not cut itThe service was also pretty bad We went on a Sat night and there were only two waiters that were taking orders for all the tables granted there were a ton of people walking around bringing the plates to the tables but they all had a set task After the waiter took our order we did not see him until almost 2 hours later We wanted to add an additional plate but by the time he came around we just gave up At one point our table was full of empty plates that the people that were bringing the plates didnt care to take them presuming I guess this wasnt their job and just kept on moving them on the table so they can make room for the new plateAt the end of the night we ended up with an exorbitant bill and a stomach ache Although the actual experience at the restaurant was not the worst part Lets just say Mercat also stays with you the next day Well depending on how you see it Lets just say youll be needing some Imodium the day afterOverall this place is pretentious way too overpriced overseasoned food and drinks and horrible service With that said we are never going back Next time I am in the mood for Tapas Ill just stick to Cafe Ibericounpretentious and does not disappoint

Author: Blythe Z.
Content: I visited her for Restaurant Week Â As other reviewers have mentioned my sisterin law and I were also pushed to order for the reg menu  we acknowledged that we came with the intention to dine off the RW menu we were told that the RW menu would not be enough food  so as suggested we ordered 2 additional items  Diver Scallops and the Meatballs Â We had TOO much food Â I should note that we were told if we wanted to order in addition to the RW menu which supposedly wasnt going to be enough food for 2 the kitchen needed the order placed all at once Â I said that it was my experience in the past when ordering tapas  one can usually order as you eat our waiter Dante looked at me like I was insane Â I do think the portions were small we would have been fine not ordering other items it bothers me that I felt we were pressured to do so Â I feel the food was over priced and there are far better tapas places around Â I was happy with the cocktails the service and decor is nice  overall though just a bit salty with the experience Â I live around the corner and do not think Ill be back2 glasses of wine2 cocktails2 ppl dining on Restaurant Week Dinner Menu2 addl tapas  scallops and meatballs  Â 15900 Â in my opinion not worth it

Author: Chitterne B.
Content: Drinks Nice wine list and a few interesting cocktails  the tomato martini and the tamarind cooler were both fantasticFood Quite good  I often find Spanish tapas too greasy and salty for my taste but this wasnt the case here We literally ordered half the menu but some highlights were the padron peppers the razor clams the blood sausage the rice with truffled cauliflower cream and the pink peppercorn sorbet for dessert Service Okay Our waitress mysteriously disappeared after taking our drink orders and it took a while for someone to pick up our table but no other complaints Overall a fantastic lively little tapas place but I would certainly hope so for the price

Author: Rachel N.
Content: So I kind of loved my meal here  which was a massive surprise given that Spanish isnt always my thang Â  onto the noshing which took place in a vast space located within a hotel decor is appropriately trendy industrial  but I digress  the food is quite tastyWent for a late lunch over the weekend and were one of 45 tables filled out of idk 30  the menu looked limited at first  perhaps 7 starters and 7 mains  but everything we had was delicious The turnip soup sans serrano was creamy and soullifting and my avo asparagus and green bean salad was crisp and tasty  each ingredient in every dish served a purpose Oh and the side of catalan spinach w pine nuts and currants was tassssssty Scallops were nice but only 4 per serving A lady with my lust for these creatures needs at least 8 please chef Garces please They have a lunch deal 18 for 2 courses or 35 for 3  I didnt look at the dessert menu so I cant judge the worthiness of that option but for 2 courses of this quality for 18 Id go back any day for a quick lunch Civilized yet in and out within an hour Oh vegetarians be warned not a massive selection though pescatarians will be just dandy Carnivores will not suffer in the least All flavors are more nuanced than expected Win

Author: Ron C.
Content: So I came to Mercat on Friday with a few buddies It was my birthday so we decided to get the whole pig We ordered it 2 days in advance and were really anticipating our visit Unfortuantely I was not impressed by the pig The pig came out looking quite delicious it was carved up and served to us It was soft juicy and tender The skin was crispy but I felt it was way too salty and overall too much of a good thing can be bad The sides were also extremely filling and not particularly amazing white beans potatoes spring onions and spinach And for the price of 45 a head it was defintiely not worth itOn the other hand we had the bacon wrapped dates which were extremely tasty The chefs selection of cheeses was also very delicious I think if you do come here it should definitely be for the tapas Looking around at the other tables the tapas definitely looked more appetizing The decor was great with high ceilings and colorful decorations and the service was perfect Im only upset that our big meal ended up being quite disappointing and therefore 3 stars If I did come here for the tapas 4 stars for sure

Author: Liz L.
Content: Pretty impressed Â My friend and I came on a Friday night with no reservations but we were able to get seats in the bar areaThe portion sizes here are weird Â Some plates like the serrano ham and fig salad are huge and others like the bacon wrapped dates are tinyThe presentation here is excellent Â The food looks scrumptious and for the most part it is Â I would come back although Id probably make a reservation

Author: Lauren D.
Content: Ive been to Mercat twice now and enjoyed both times Â The location is really nice  huge windows overlooking Michigan Avenuethe park  great place to celebrate a birthday or special occasion Â The hostshostesses are incredibly friendlyAs far as food goes Ive tried a lot of different dishes and have a few favorites  the rabbit ravioli the duck the chefs selection of cheeses and the slow roasted pork Â Everything is really really good Â They have a great wine list and some really cool drinks  I tried a vanilla pearinfused vodka martini that was deliciousNext time I want to try the chefs menu which seems like a good idea if youre unsure of what to orderwant a sample of many things

Author: Kimberly L.
Content: Holy Toledo what a great experience First off the atmosphere is fun and the servers actually seem like they are excited about the foodand they want you to be excited too And I was Let me tell youI wasLa Mesa de Josethe tasting menuis such a great value at 65 that it seems downright criminal You just cannot imagine the beautiful treats that just keep on coming out of the kitcheneach one more delicious than the last Plusbonusits not one of those tasting menus where youll probably end up getting something you dont want The waiter will walk through the menu with you and will find out what you like what you hate etc and the chef will tailor your experience Um quite coolTasty charcuteria piemientos de padron lovely Spanish peppers the croquetas cocas flatbreads wagyu beefoh my Â goodnesswhat a lovely spread You will not be disappointed in a single dishOn to the drinkswe started with a sparkling glass of cava and then switched to the recommended bottle of wine verdelhoa winning combo Not exactly an inexpensive experience Two people ordering from the tasting menu and having drinks should expect to spend about 200 plus a tip And youll want to tip generously because the service is top notchWhat are you waiting for

Author: Tracy L.
Content: Yes its owned by one of the Iron Chefs Jose Garces and yes its a big trendy and sexy placeMore importantly the tapas are good I ordered 3 plates for myself for dinner and they were the perfect amountSizzling garlic shrimp Fantastic A mustBaconwrapped dates Not my favorite but interesting and worth a tryButter squash dumplings Nice and fillingSangria Uh how can you not enjoy it with your tapasMy waitress was friendly and overall I had a great time hereRecommended

Author: lisa b.
Content: A thoroughly bad experienceI understand a restaurant having an off night but the dinner experience I shared with two others was horrendous Â Truthfully I dont even remember the food based on how bad the night was Â What happened Â Start with two not one but TWO different dishes served with human hairs in them Â Add a surly waiter Â Add indifferent inattentive poorly timed service Â While the manager Mindy did her best to try to salvage the evening it was a disaster Â Yes they offer us extra food and drink and ultimately comped the entire eveningbut it did not fix the ruined evening

Author: MIke F.
Content: Tried out Mercat this Friday night Â Had 930 reservations and didnt get seated and our pitcher of sangria until 1030 Â I understand theyve been open for less than 2 weeks but an hour waitFOOD Overall pretty good but definitely hit or miss Â The diver scallops Â were the only real stand outs Â Calamari was terrible incredibly rubbery and offsmelling Goat cheese  ham ravioli melted in the mouth but the portion was laughable 3 of the smallest pillows of pasta Ive ever seen Â Seasonal sangria was quite nice and the basil toned down some of the sweetnessSTAFF Â Friendly overall Â They seem to be doing the best they can with an awful setup the tiny bar and restrooms are downstairs while the dining room is upstairs Â Apologetic about the wait but didnt comp anything which was a bit outrageous THE ROOM Â Some cool elements but a bit themey Â Honeycomb spiral staircase was interesting and the tile above the kitchen is fabulous Â Offset by the fact that every window  mirror is covered with decals which sends it into DisneyVegas territory Tables were too close together Â Music was cheesy early90srunwaystyle dance music and too loud why cant they just play some new school bossanova Â The kitchendining room was loud enough without a techno soundtrackOVERALL Â I would probably try it again in a few months when they have time to work the kinks out but wont run back which is unfortunate as i live 2 blocks away Â The bill for 2 of us was 113 and we left with a full belly and a nice buzz so definitely a good value Â Oh yeah those headsets NEED to go

Author: Rhonda G.
Content: I will definitely have to go back for a more thorough experience but for now this is what I haveDecor Fabulous I love the lounge when you first walk in and the open dining area upstairsFood Scallops are insanely delicious setas al horno was great sauteed veggies with goat cheese also greatDrink Cava was bubbly goodnessI will be going back soon

Author: Brad P.
Content: For my Philly folks who are already way familiar with how awesome Garces is  It is Amada in Chicago with a great pork belly dishThe baconwrapped dates are delicious The hamchorizo croquettes did not really impress meThe Holland pork bellyTocino Con Cidra  hot damn this was great I see why it is the signature dish at Mercat This is a tender amazing dish with a crazygood glaze Warning  it is a small dishbut you should be expecting that at a tapas placeProtip If you are visiting from Philly they will not accept your Garces Group card Bummer

Author: Sydney P.
Content: Wonderful Found this place while surfing around on Yelp The dining room is absolutely amazing Great open space with wonderful views of the city Food Food and more Food We had the Strawberry Sangria which was delicious along with many of the fantastic dishes on the menu I honestly can say that out of the 6 or 7 dishes we had everything was wonderful Will defiantly be back again

Author: Viet N.
Content: Went here for Chicago Restaurant week Â AmazingI had their brunch tasting menu which included a 7 course menu a charcuterie buffet with suckling pig and a dessert bar Â For 30 this was an absolute stealHighlights  Roasted suckling pig was hacked apart while still crackling and juicy Â Seriously made me forget all about Purple Pig Â  Their take on Eggs Benedict with truffle oil was incredible Â Fluffy yet decadent Â  Crab topped toasted brioche was also similarly amazing They made a tasty spinach and green apple salad dish that I originally thought was going to be the weak part of the menu but turned out to be an delight Â Very light and fresh and the interplay between coldtart apples and partially sauteed spinach was cleverAll in all highly recommended Â I cant remember the last time I had a meal that good

Author: K W.
Content: My bf and I had Mercats breakfast 3 times during our 5day stay in downtown Chicago Part of this was due to the convenience Mercat is located in the Renaissance Blackstone Hotel where we were staying and part of this was due to the deliciousness of the food here We were able to arrange breakfast deliveries to our hotel room Being woken up by Mercats Blackstone Eggs Benedict was like heaven The meal consisted of tender chorizo and perfectly poached eggs in a savory creamy sauce The toasted brioche soaked up all the deliciousness The crispy breakfast potatoes were fabulous too This was one of the best if not the best eggs benedict dish I have hadFor my 3rd Mercat breakfast this time at the actual beautifullydecorated restaurant I decided to try something different steak and poached eggs s3media4akyelpcdncomâ¦ The steak was definitely tasty though it could have used some sauce or extra flavor to give it some oomph I thought it was weird that they didnt have steak sauce They ran out of biscuits so I had the delicious brioche again The sauce for this dish was again absolutely delicious The eggs were great except there was a bland gross funky tasting extra tiny egg Im not sure why they gave me this extra little egg it made my meal worse Verdict Blackstone Eggs Benedict rocks my world 5 stars for that

Author: Love S.
Content: When I heard Mercat had opened I was excited to try it out Ive been wanting to eat delicious Spanish cuisine ever since I had some of the best meals ever whilst on holiday in my favorite country Spain My first visit came after watching FC Barcelona beat Mexico at Soldier Field What better way to celebrate their win than dining at Mercat It was also the final day of Lollapalooza so plenty of people watchingI was with 3 friends and 2 of them had a long drive back to Michigan so our first visit was kinda rushed and we didnt spend as much time as we would have liked Next time I plan to stay longer over food and drinks and soak in the gorgeous interior The space is beautiful I love how it is reminiscent of Spain in that theyve mixed modern with old world and used an array of colors and patterns throughout I thought the glass wall with the etchings of birds I believe they are birds was quite cool and the open kitchen is also niceThey started us off with some bread that took us on our food journey We each ordered 23 tapas and shared what we could as I dont eat meat just fish I ordered the espincas a la catalana  catalan spinach raisins pine nuts apples It was delish Very tasty a good combination of salty and sweet which I love I had the diver scallops which were cooked to perfection and extremely tasty Of course the patatas bravas had to be ordered because I was craving the ones I had in Malaga Spain a few years back Mercats were pretty damn close to those We had a few varieties of cheese which I cannot recall at the momentThere were a few more things that I ate that I am completely forgetting but I capped it off with a latte and will definitely be making my way back for a longer dinner Definitely a superb place for those visiting Chicago and to those looking for a cool experience in their own city Oh and glad to see that Mercat is within the charming Blackstone Hotel space  So glad they saved the building and renovated

Author: Y L.
Content: I went to Mercat a la Planxa for my wedding anniversary last year We had the tasting menu and it was so much food The wait staff was very attentive and the decor was amazing

Author: Kyung P.
Content: I was not impressed Â I went for lunch on a weekday and we probably ordered 1 of each item off of the menu for our party of 5 Â The portions were disappointingly small and every item was entirely too salty Â After spending 40pp we did walk away full but I dont think Id come back here again Â They do offer a special prefixe for lunch but it still seems way overpriced for the food you get Â I guess some people are willing to pay for the decor but not meService was also very spotty even though we were 1 of 5 tables in the restaurant for lunch

Author: Karen A.
Content: The BEST tapas in Chicago So what if you cant pronounce or get the name right the food here is OUTSTANDINGBacon wrapped dates OH YEASeranno Ham and Fig Salad HeavenlyShort Rib Flatbread OhmScallops shrilp lamb oh yes keep them ALL comingI completely recommend the grand tasting menuyessplurgedo ityou deserve it Your mouth will sing you will have tummy orgasms and your life will seem like it has more meaning you be meaning to return to this excellent restaurant with lovingly prepared Â exquisite foodsYumm Mee

Author: Allison A.
Content: My lord but this place is great Â The dining room is exactly what you want when you go out for a fun night  great view and decor and the right kind of loud vibe you crave when you want to be around people Â And yes the food is absolutely amazing Â It can also be expensive so be prepared Â Heres what I had last night De Los Cort Martini orange and cinnamon 15 w tax tip at the barCadi Urgelia raw cow milk cheese 11Olives 6Croquetas de Mariscos seafood croquettes 12Gambas Con Garbonzos flatbread 14Patatas Bravas potatoes with aioli 5Chocolate Croquetas 10TOTAL 73 Â not including tax and tip on foodNow that was MORE than enough food my friend also ordered a few plates and we shared and it was completely worth it Â You should just know what youre getting into especially if you work at a nonprofit like I doPROS they will make vegetarian accommodations without judging they serve absinthe service is friendly and if you order 72 hours in advance you can get a WHOLE SUCKLING PIG Â I dont even eat meat and I want to see that

Author: Julia H.
Content: This place is excellent Beyond excellent I came here with a party of 17 We hands down received the best service I have ever had in my life And I am a serious service SNOB I waitressed for a long time and I know all the excuses You either know your stuff or are a lazy sack who doesnt deserve a job This place was AMAZING They handled the table extremely well Because there were so many of us we did the chefs selection They began preparing for us when we were in the lounge Initially I was concerned that with such a large group I wouldnt be full after something like that Boy was it the opposite Everything was perfect the service the amazing food their timing We even had a vegan girl with us As soon as we told them there were special vegan dishes coming out left and right It was greatI honestly cant even think of enough good things to say about this place It was excellent I highly recommend it

Author: Dan C.
Content: Really good authentic Spanish food seems almost impossible to come by in the US or at least Chicago Mercat does only one of those adjectives well but its the one that counts Yes neither my months of traveling around Spain nor my Spanish gf had ever heard of fideua or paella served as a tapa but there they are at Mercat tiny but beautiful and delicious Ive been here twice and everything Ive ever gotten or tried has been delicious People talk about the sangria but honestly I think the food is the highlight maybe I just prefer no brandy in my sangria So many options to choose from and flavors to combine Anything with seafood in it is divine Their saucier is amazing Ingredients are consistently topnotch and prepared perfectly Things I particularly enjoyed again everything was delicious were the chipirones a la plancha tough to find chipirones around gambas al ajillo and of course the fideua negra But there is so much that I have not yet had and want to try on my next visitFor two people expect to pay around 100 for a generous meal pitcher of sangria tax and tip A bit pricey but totally worth it culinarily Not to mention the fact that the decor and style definitely set the perfect tone for a special occasion

Author: Shannon H.
Content: I took my husband here for his birthday because he is a huge Iron Chef fan and the head chef is Jose Garces the recently designated Iron Chef The tapas was out of control The flavors were so good Everything had so many flavor layers it was good that they were such small portions because I dont know if I could have finished an entree portion Our server Naomi was excellent knew her stuff and steered us the right way to some amazing choices My favorite part of the meal was the dessert duh We had Im embarassed to say three desserts The Croquettes were insane They were little balls of awesome filled with chocolate and dipped in carameloilstuff Clearly Im not a chef so I couldnt even begin to appropriately describe how good it was We also had a meringue which was refreshing as olive oil cake which had blueberry compote on top and was so good I highly recommend this place

Author: Jen F.
Content: I was very disappointed by Mercat Â My sister Dana F and I came here on our trip to Chicago Â We waited until 10 PM because that was the only reservation available Â We expected the food to be great since the place was so hoppin Â GOTCHAWe got a bunch of tapas Â They came out in phases and one after another I took a bite and was not impressed at all Â I kept figuring that the next tapa would be better but sadly this pattern continued and each tapa was just as disappointing as the one before itSome examples the potatos bravas were just little fried potato thingies Â Way to butcher that one Â Even for a fried potato they were hard and dense just not very good Â Congrats Mercat you fcked up a fried potatoThe ham croquetas were just as disappointing Â One bite and out came oozing tomato sauce and bacon Â SeriouslyThe rest of tapas went something like this maybe not as bad but none stood out as being good Â Not one made me say mMmmMm Â Ive been to many tapas places and this was probably the most disappointing especially since we had high expectationsThe only good things about this place was A they had Estrella one of my favorite beers B the cheese plate Â But its cheese they didnt have to do anything except cut it Â So this barely counts Â and C the bread with tomatoes that they give each table Â This was good Â These three saved Mercat from a one star ratingThe dessert was fair Â The chocolate croquetas didnt do anything for me Â I did enjoy the almond and coconut ice creams though

Author: Sarah K.
Content: Justin wasnt a fan at all Treated us like idiots Didnt he know we were from the best foodie city in the countryWhen presented with a desert menu that contained olive oil cake I said whats that like He said theres olive oil in it When we asked about the olive oil on the sorbet and chocolate croquetts he said theres olive oil on it When asked what our neighboring table had he said third row down the menu We no longer had menus Whatever The food was amazing but Justin needs a revamp

Author: Eric P.
Content: My GF and I checked this place out looking for some casual tapas so we were taken by surprise when the food ended up being gorgeous and delicious Â We ate at the bar as tables would have been a 45 minute wait but we were served promptly and the waiters recommendations were great Â I was happy to see they had Alagash belgian beer so I had about 3 my GF had a drink called shoko which was an interesing mixture of peach vodka sour cucumber and basil leaves Very refreshingFor food I highly recommend the followingBacon wrapped datesArroz with Morel mushroomsShort ribs with scallopsThe chefs mix of cheesesThe ravioli with boar bologneseThe plates are small even for tapas but the food is filling and phenomenal a word I rarely use Â I would go back in a hot minute

Author: Irene C.
Content: Located inside of the Blackstone Hotel NOT your typical hotel restaurant Â During our stay we ate at Mercat twice  for brunch and earlylight dinner Â The ambiance drinks food are very authentic and creative Â Whats goodComplimentary Brioche toast with tomatoe garlic spread served during dinnerServed only during lunch most sandwiches come with Pom Frites read french fries drizzled with a spice saffron aoili sauce  yumEggs Benedict with Truffled Hollandaise Sauce Lunch their chicken sandwich  amazing according to my friendTHE VIEW Windows oversee Grant park  beautifulRed Sangria Â Not so goodServing sizes if tapas are for sharing how can you share a dish with 5 small raviolis in itSnooty attitude at the door and too much attention to how and in what order items should be eatenDo not order the potatoes at dinner or 6 tater tots will come out and tease you the whole night Â Instead try the french fries at lunchCome on an expense account or during lunch

Author: Eric M.
Content: This is one of the only restaurants Ive ever gone to with people where I was actually embarrassed to have taken them there afterwards Â The service was that badIt was me a white American two of my Chinese friends and two of their Polish friends Â We all spoke perfectly understandable EnglishWhen we arrived it was a little late but they were still posted to be open for another hour Â There were plenty of empty tables and yet the hostess looked putupon when I asked for a table as opposed to sitting at the barIm pretty familiar with tapas and Spanish food in general but not an expert by any means Â So we had a few questions about the meal Â The server had a difficult time answering our questions and had to go to the kitchen to get some of the answers  and they werent complicated esoteric questionsThe dishes came out in odd orders and some of them were cold Â I thought the scallops were poor quality  they were flat and tired looking  I actually think they may have been skate not an acceptable substitution at a restaurant that charges this muchWhich brings me to another thing  pricing Â Its a nice enough space but their pricing is overboard Â Flavors were mixed  some plates were awesome others were watery and missed the ball Â Neither food nor service were really up to the level needed at their price pointId like to try it again sometime  but on my own so as not to risk embarrassment again  to see if they really can step up to the task

Author: Debbie H.
Content: So so tasty Â I am a big fan of tapas and had never tried Catalonianinspired tapas  I was definitely inspired myself Â  I met a friend for a drink at the downstairs Â bar where the service was friendly and the Spanish wine options delicious Â I enjoy a temprenillo or granache and they had many varieties and varietals of each Â Even though we got there at 7pm they didnt mind that we just wanted to hang at the bar for a bit past our reservation and kept our table readyThe food  what can I say Â You just cant go wrong with a meat and cheese plate Period Â The jamon serrano and chorizo plates were HUGE probably couldve gone with one or the other and the goat and cow cheese were a delightful pairing Â Ive never seen nutella involved in a cheese plate but I am officially converted Bring on the chocolate AND cheeseWe then shared the squash dumplings with lamb ragout and bacon which was a titch salty but still quite tasty Â The gambas ajilo were nicely sized as sometimes you get the little babylooking tidbit shrimp  these were nice and meaty Â Then the shortrib flatbread which was a heavenly end to the meal Â I couldnt possibly fit any more food or wine in my body by the end so Ill have to go back for dessert

Author: Danita B.
Content: A group of nine of us went on Saturday Jan 16 Many of us have done tapas elsewhere BaBaReeba Barcelona some of us old school in actual Spain etc but we had a couple newbies PROSOur server Deirdre was very polite and attentive and made knowledgeable suggestions Although we did not necessarily go with said suggestions It did at least show she knew what she was about thereWe got two comped items some delicious tomato flatbread and these flashfried chili thingies Food very tasty Things I tasted at various points patatas bravas delicioso the mushroom paella rich somewhat salty to me but good chorizo good salchichon de vic good datiles con almendras excellent diver scallops excellent I was somewhat surprised the place didnt have the standard bread and olive oil offered It would have been nice to have something to go with the extra salchichon for instance Decor is swankThings to consider not necessarily CONS Mercat IMO is one of those for show restaurants Its got the swanky decor the swanky downtown location you should dress appropriately The food is staged and dressed up as well Compared to some of the other tapas places Ive been to they were more expensive for less on the plate and we had a lot of people to go around so we were ordering multiples I guess Ive got it in my mind that tapas should be more fun and relaxed and casual Its not that this place wasnt fun it was but the overwhelming impression I have is its a place for people who are more interested in the looks and social cache of going to such a place And of course you are going to pay for that because hey the place has got to pay that expensive downtown rent Im just not into that If Im going out to eat Im more concerned with service and food qualityOverall I am glad I went for the experience but I probably wont be back Id rather return to my other tapas options in Chicago and Evanston

Author: Mike M.
Content: Had the most amazing time here last night Â Loved the vibe of the room and the latenight dining crowd Â Service was excellent Â Our server Fred  explained the menu really well and let us know when we ordered either too much or not enough Â We opted for doing the wine flight which I strongly suggest so you can take a mini tour of Spanish wines without having to commit to a bottle Â Loved learning about a few new grapes and found some new favorites Now onto the foodstarter Bread rubbed with tomato garlic and herbsOctopus and potatoThen we had these little balls of cheese chorizo deep fried over a roasted pepper sauceI forget what they were called but all I know is they rocked Fig salad bleu cheese wrapped in prosciuttothis was fantasticPrawns a la Planxa suckthejuicefromthe headdeliciousI went somewhere far away while eating those Â YUM Special of the evening homemade lamb sausage and fetablack lentils chickpeas and fetaDessert was a cross between chocolate pot du creme creme brulee and vanilla ice cream with espresso granita on top Â A mixture of all of my favorite things in one bowltoo bad I had to share  Wed definitely return bring some friends and try the suckling pig Â It was a great night expect to pay approx 100pp allin We also heard about their brunch25 5 tapas and unlimited bloodymary bar Sounds like an awesome value and a great time

Author: Kris W.
Content: Ate here a couple years ago and it was decent Ate here a year ago and it was ok Ate here a couple months ago and again last week and it was disappointingThe primary problem was the service  the foods fine if a little random in appearance and portion most are small but some items are really outsizedthe lentil salad was enough for 46 easily But when it takes 15 minutes to have a drink order taken theres no explanation of the menu items and drinks are shoved down between other glassesIm not coming back and paying 50 a person for itThe cocktails are good the foods good The staff seems to be increasing in suckiness with each passing year There are lots of other places to eat in Chicago and Ill stick to trying some of them rather than coming here again Its disappointing because this used to be a great place and Im sure it might still be but my last few visits just havent been up to par

Author: Amanda W.
Content: I was really excited to check this place out but the steep prices and extra tiny tapas left me lukewarm on the place Â Everything we had was good but nothing blew me away enough that Id pick Mercat a la Planxa over a less expensive tapas placeMy boyfriend and I had three plates and a pitcher of sangria and that set us back 80 We realized we couldnt make a full meal out of this place without going broke Â The sangria was supposed to be some seasonal pomegranate flavor but it tasted like standard sangria to me And Ive had baconwrapped dates at almost every tapas place in the city and these were middle of the pack my favorite ones are at Twist At Mercat a la Planxa you only get four baconwrapped dates when youd get at least six or so just as good dates at another place for half the price Â The one bright spot in the costtosize ratio was the cheese we ordered We got two large and yummy pieces of cheese with a great pear dipping sauce The room was beautiful and the service was attentive but I think Ill stick to other less expensive tapas places in the future if I want to have a filling meal without going broke  especially if Im going out with a group

Author: Janis W.
Content: Hmmm the food was good Â Our waiter was nice as were the food runners and hostesses Â Something was up with the bar staff the night we were there maybe they had just gotten yelled at or eaten poison mushrooms because they were moving in slow motion superslowConsequently we didnt get to order as many drinks as we wouldve liked while waiting at the bar for our table and Â once we were seated the wine pairings didnt come when the courses were servedIts a Â very pretty room but I think overall this restaurant falls into the tourist trap category and for the price Id rather go somewhere new next time Im spending 247 for 2 people

Author: traci t.
Content: I came here last week for lunch and I believe that lunch vs dinner at the same restaurant can be completely different experience so I can only base this off of my recent lunch I was torn on the decor  on one hand I liked it but on the other hand it was sort of off since it is in the Blackstone Hotel  a recently restored and historic buildingI realize they arent the same but something didnt fit However I like the high ceilings the windows and the bar area I think it would all look better at night Then again I think about other restaurants that are vibrant and I think Id say the same thing They offer a lunch special  the Catalan Express where you choose from a soup salad or sandwich for 18 Online they listed cured meats and cheeses as an option but I didnt see them on the menu My dining companions arrived before me and I didnt ask our server about the meatscheeses as they had already made up their minds We each ordered salads  they had the serrano ham and fig and I had the ensalada verde The serrano was a surprising big portion and apparently tasted great too  the combination of the saltiness and sweetness with the cabrales worked well I really loved my salad as simple as it was  asparagus fava beans avocado green beans and a spanish cheese It tasted fresh and filling  not like what you normally get in a green lunch salad  usually its a bunch of greens tossed with a cherry tomato or two and a balsamic of some sort For the entrees  one had the scallops which were nice and big and freshly seared and the other had a grilled chicken dish The chicken looked and tasted good not necessarily an interesting dish but I think that for one who isnt adventurous and wants something straightforward it was a good choice Maybe its just me but I find that most of the restaurants around the Loop have these safe dishes on their menu for lunchtime I assume its because they get people who work in the area or are tourists that are scared by anything that has any spice or is different I had steak medallions  small portion over what I think was a potato puree The server advised me that the meat was prepared mediumrare which I thought would be fine It was still a little bit to rare in the middle for me but I was pressed for time and didnt want to send it back The service was fine our server was a little slow in getting our order compared to how not busy the restaurant was  but not a big deal Another server saw us trying to get his attention and came over to help After spending time looking at the dinner menu Id definitely want to come back here  Im curious what its like on the weekends I heard it was packed and wonder if its with hotel guests or people from the neighborhood Id hate to see it turn into a Cafe Ba Ba Reeba

Author: Amelia S.
Content: Went here last visit in Chicago and it was a flawless experience I think we had the best seat in the house second floor right next to the glass over looking the entire restaurant Some of the dishes we ordered included the bacon wrapped dates which were deadly the garlic shrimp wouldnt order that again boring the short ribs and scallops AWEsome cider pork belly I mean its pork belly sooo of course it was amazing and the rabbit pasta We ordered a good amount more but we went to pops for champagne and NoMi before for drinks so my memory isnt the best not to mention we had a thing of sangria at Mercat They also gave some delicious tomato bread while waiting I would definitely come here again next time without drinking so much before hand LOVE IT

Author: Tim H.
Content: Well executed tapas with fresh ingredients great service and trendy atmosphere Â I would say the best tasting tapas in ChicagoIf you dont mind very pricey small dishes with great atmosphere and service try out Mercat a la Planxa Â Note you wont end up full here for less than 40 per person thoughMercat is located in the Blackstone hotel and I am not even sure if there is an entrance to Mercat from inside the hotel itself Â  There is valet parking that is less than 15 on Balboa Â The main entrance to Mercat is on MichiganIf you can get one of the 35 tables on the upper level Â  It is quieter up there and you get to overlook the rest of the dining room Â If you can get seating in the upper level it is a VIP dining experience

Author: pauline c.
Content: Mercat starts with a bang and ends with a whimper Â After urging from the waitress we decided to go with the tasting menu at about 58 per person Â Everyone at the table has to order the tasting menu Â So Â We eatThe first course consisted of a salad cured meat wrapped around a spinach salad tossed in a light vinaigrette complete with walnuts and blue cheese Â This was a hit Â Completely delicious and the flavor was just right Â The cheese plate was also good Â Paired well with slices of apple except I noticed the slices were bruised Â Next came the shrimp boiling in a bowl of sizzling spicy butter Â While the spices complemented the seafood well the shrimps themselves were about mediocre in freshness Â Along with this course came the butternut squash ravioli Â Two Â In a large bowl Â And it was lacking flavor Â And honestly nothing smells more like gimick than the cheesey flavored foam on top Â If Anthony Bourdain complained about this kind of douchy behavior on Top Chef in 2000 and late fast forward to 2009 who still uses this techniqueshat Â Next we were served sliced beef medallionssirloinjerky cut by a kindergartner Â Every piece was jagged uneven and we were served horribly burnt end pieces that were doused in salt Â The prawns were also a definite miss Â Freshness was not on the menu Â The last item we were served was a bowl of baked cabbagebroccoli Â Except that it was thrown into a vat of salt and retrieved to be served on my dinner plate Â Honestly we were off to a great start Â How did it end so so terribly wrong Â Its definitely you not me

Author: Susan M.
Content: Knew nothing about this place coming in other than the concierge at the Hilton recommended it Â I have found my hangout for the week Apparently they serve all three meals  but am planning on popping in for snacks and wine when I need a break from my workshop this week Tonight I had the olives to start  good nothing too unusual but great with the first glass of the white wine flight Main dish was halibut topped with truffle dust served over smashed fava beans and chorizo cubes The halibut was a little overcooked but the flavor helped it along But my favorite dish was the sliced cauliflower with cream and marcona almonds again topped with truffles OMG Service is friendly the music is flamenco fun looks like a nightclub and everyone seemed to be having a good time Cant wait to go back and try more

Author: art s.
Content: Friendly greeting  service that acknowledged our open table reservation requestAppreciate the flexible wine options both variety and serving sizeFood ranged from really good to greatGreatCoca costillas de terneraDatiles con almendrasAlmost greatPatatas bravasWagyu zabutonReally goodTruita de patataA special squash blossom with goat cheeseThe one quibble Id note is  42 the wagyus impact on the tab is much greater than its impact on the meal Â It was the most expensive item by far and it was good but it was probably our third or fourth favorite item of the night Â Nonetheless Mercat has secured a spot on in our rotation of nice places to have dinner and places to take visitors from out of town

Author: Brent W.
Content: Im sticking with my 5star rating love this place Â We actually split the Chefs tasting menu and just added the lobster and another dish i cant recall Â It was more than enough and will definitely be back to experience Jose Garces take on Catalan tapas Â  Side note Grab a drink at the downstairs bar premeal and youll be treated to a few tapas dishes free of charge Â Id also submit that the downstairs bar has some of the coolest bathrooms in Chicagoafter all it is the Blackstone one of the sharpest hotels in the City imo

Author: Tina T.
Content: 45 Stars Â Love this restaurant for its vibrancy decor and atmosphere almost as much as the food Â While its been said that you may get better tapas at Iberico part of the reason one comes to Mercat is for the atmosphere and circuses of the restaurant Â This is definitely a place to celebrate an occasion Â We sat upstairs at the small bar in the restaurant instead of waiting for a table and it was great Â The bartender was quite attentive and friendly and the seating was intimate enough for twoHaving been told that Mercat was pricey I was surprised that our bill was only 115 for 2 people Â We both had two drinks each shared about 5 platters and we were both pleasingly full by the last plate Â Now I am not a huge eater and neither is my husband but we were satiated Â My favorite was the rice with morels a delicious dish full of rich flavorsPerhaps the tapas at Iberico or even Babareeba are almost or just as good but its the whole package along with the unique ingredients served in each tapa that makes Mercat a place to definitely try at least once

Author: Anna P.
Content: Jose Garces you tempt me soThis place was delicious  I am originally from Philadelphia and had heard about his mini takeover from Stephen Starr how did this not cause a celebrity deathmatch so I was super psyched to try his Chicago placeThe specialty sangria was amazing  I love sangria and am pretty picky about it but this was delicious A mix of red and white wines with Stoli white pomegranate Ill take a pitcher thanks What we gotBacon wrapped dates I know everyone writes about these but they merit an additional WOW  best Ive ever hadCatalan spinach  a fairly basic tapas dish actually delicious as always with sliced apples raisins and pine nutsCider glazed pork belly  AMAZING I know pork belly is all the rage now in Chitown and this was particularly delicious and not too heavy Butternut squash dumplings with lamb ragout  YUM esp for the fall Shrimp flatbread  absolutely amazing and a really good 5th dish since it really helped to fill us up otherwise I might have been hungry stillDessert to top it all off milk chocolate croquettes with banana infused marshmallows and rosemary infused caramel These were absolutely amazing  to be honest I didnt know what to expect but when you split open the croquettes the milk chocolate comes spilling out and mixes with the marshmallow and caramel andmmmmmmmtake me backIf your mouth isnt watering by now theres something wrong with your salivary glands

Author: Craig K.
Content: We came down from our room at the black stone for the free wifi a cocktail and a lite snack Â Whiskey cocktails were fantastic along with the salmon croquettes

Author: Anisha A.
Content: Because nothing beats ruminating over a perverted puppet musical while eating tapas we headed here after Avenue QI find most tapas places to be fine at best its the nature of the cuisine Mercat was a little bit better then fine and you cant ask for more To start it provides a splash of dramatic scene rare on this strip of south Michigan jarringly high ceilings cool booths and even a curiously isolated semisuspended table for 2 that Im fascinated by I would like to play chess there This place had me at the wonderfully warm tomato bread it served gratis to start Excellent sangria margaritas and recommended wine pairings Yes we did end up closing the place down in the process of enjoying a full roster of drink The cheese plate paired with jams is a great start especially the nutella one The tuna or was it hamachi cant remember i waited too long to write this was superb as well as the pasta with rabbit They even do an interesting upscale spin on those standard potatoes all tapas places serve You know the ones that usually end up on your table because someone is compelled to order them

Author: Linda M.
Content: Tapas tapas tapas This place has got the goods Â Every plate that our party ordered was absolutely mouth watering Â My only negative review about Mercat is that our party of 8 had to share these small morsels making all of us want more Â We spent a fortune YES expensive tapas joint on this place trying every dish possible on the menu Â What a recommendation TRY EVERYTHINGIThe white and red sangria is pretty good Â The white sangria seemed stronger than the red  both hit the spot though The decor was awesome Â When you first walk in you enter the retro60s mod decoryou think this place looks cool and cozy  but once you are called for your table you are taken up the spiraling stairs to dining dazzling mecca Â Great high ceilings and large windows made my Mercat experience even more extravagant Â You can see the kitchen wherever you sit  its a good thing just in case you think the chef might spit in your lovely mealGood food  Great Service  Casual  Comfortable  A YELP 6 STARsigh I miss Chicagosorta

Author: Jessica T.
Content: I came here Saturday with a group of 10 people for my birthday dinner It was fabulous Every single thing we tried was mouthwatering and delectable The tomato bread they served at the beginning was the best free bread Ive ever had The waiter suggested the tasting menu but we decided to order a bunch of tapas and share those instead Im glad we did I think my favorite part of the meal was the dessert croquettesits just a bite but very satisfying The service was great and the ambiance was hip and luxurious I think that this place would be good for a date or a night out with friends Ill be back

Author: Hoang L.
Content: Yellowfin Tuna with artichoke and almond pine nuts at Mercat in light of restaurant week I could have eaten my entire meal not just entree with one bite Thumbs down See attached pictureAlthough I had an appetizer and dessert they were both smaller than my entree One bite and youre done My meal was 22 plus tax and tip Too much for lunch Do I need to tap into my savings if I want to get full No thanks

Author: Celia S.
Content: Im basing this review solely on my brunch experience Although I would like to give this place a second shot for dinner Anyway came here for brunch with a group of friends The restaurant was pretty emptyit was around 130pm so that could have been the reason Anyway the brunch menu was pretty limited I wasnt crazy for the options so I requested the continental buffet meats cheese pastries etc but for what ever reason they stopped offering it just before we got therewhateva So I ended up ordering the brioche french toast and the rest of my party ordered the steak and eggs Although everything tasted okthe portion were so small that we were all considering going somewhere else to grab a real mealbut then we realized it was just the fat kids in us and opted not to Overall the food was just oknothing to rave about I wont be returning for brunch nor would I recommend it Maybe dinner would be a different story

Author: Amy J.
Content: This place is definitely 5 starworthy A group of us went for a work outing and got the 55 per person tasting menu It was AMAZING Everything we had was wonderful First off the red sangria was really good and I dont even like sangria As for the food I am a firm believer in just letting this chef select my meal We got about 8 appetisers to share and 4 entrees Not one disappointed The cured meat melted in your mouth the spanish omelet octopus meatballsI dont even remember what else but everything was mouthwatering And the entrees were killertender beef and lamb spicy jumbo shrimp and a tasty mushroom and rice dish The service was great The food just kept coming and each server explained in detail what the dishes were The decor is very pretty This is a great place to impress outoftowners I cant wait to go back and get the tasting menu again

Author: Nick S.
Content: A third update seems a little excessive doesnt itI wouldve thought so but theres no way I could have NOT done another update It brings me great pleasure to relinquish Mercat its previous 2star rating and bump it to a 5A very important business principle IMO is Customer Retention Smart businesses operate via returning customers who continuously pour money into profits versus the one customer who pays a big bill but is never to be seen again its common sense You know someone is serious about business if they monitor social outlets such as Yelp for any unsatisfactory reviews Mercat does just that and their loss prevention warrants them a much deserved update I understand everyone has their off days and Â Im certain my last visit was probably one of those But if you dont call attention to these minor slip ups they could very well become a new model of whats to be expected I couldnt bear to allow that to happen to Mercat Things You MUST Try Oxtail Empanadas the dough is very light but flavorful Great texture The filling had a very great flavor profile Basically think of your favorite braised dish stuffed into an empanada shell Oxtail meat is decadent Arroz a la Cazuela Spanish take on Gumbo Nice smoky broth accented by the rich unmistakable taste of saffron Nice accents of spanish chorizo and assorted meats Very satisfying Also served with crouton and rouille Suckling Pig Seriously worth the procedure of calling 3 days in advance etc Table side presentation LOTs of pork If youre a pork lover this is for you I love that they didnt overcomplicate anything The beauteous pig was allowed to shine and it was not in vain I would suggest splitting this among 68 people The accompanying sides are very complementary I used to boast about Chinese Style roasted pork but this has honestly bumped it down a notch on my list At this point Mercats suckling pig reigns If you have the opportunity check this place out Try the dishes I mentioned You will NOT be disappointed

Author: Faith D.
Content: Amuse  focaccia with freshest salsa Small plates  Bacon wrapped dates Â Serrano ham and fig salad Â Scallops Â Braised short rib flatbread with bacon marmalade Â Sizzling skillet of mushrooms garlic shallots and potato Mmm Mmm MmmDessert  Horchata bon bons Â One bite each Â  PerfectGalpal says she has tickets for a play in the south loop and would I please find a restaurant where we only have to park once Â Had heard good things about MALP from several friends Â  Turned out  it was next door to the theater Â  Couldnt have been easierReservations on the early side on a Saturday night as we wanted to have enough time to enjoy dinner before our 730 play Â  I have to say  from start to finish  everything was wonderful Â  We were seated immediately at a table by a window Â Great looking room Â  Totally fantastic vibe  music Â Terrific server Naomi  she had great recommendations and we clicked with her Â Our only complaint if you want to call it that  is the tables are really close together Â We understand squeezing as many guests as possible into the space so  thats our biggest gripe Â And maybe a tad salty because I was very thirsty all evening Â  Half a star off for thatThe Food  Â Delicious flavors Â  Great combinations Â  Beautiful presentations Â  Especially the ham and fig salad Â  There was a WOW factor to everything we tried Â I liked that they split the jumbo scallops down the middle Â I like mine cooked and not jiggly Â  They were grilled to perfection Â Other diners had equally great looking plates and we wished we had a bigger group and therefore would have tried more Â  Â Looking forward to getting back to this unique location and terrific food

Author: Tom C.
