Content: Great food swank decor lousy serviceWe went here as a foursome at 8PM on a Thursday night Â The look of the place is hip and cool Â Lots of activity but not too loud Â The meal was quite good but our waiter nearly ruined it Â Example one Three of us ordered white sangria and one ordered red sangria Â The waiter suggested How about a pitcher of white Â I said Sure but he still wants the red Â So we received a pitcher of white no red Â  Â Maybe we just confused himExample two Many tapas places will cycle in fresh plates I thought this was one of them so when I had a plate a little messy with olive pits and various sauces I requested a new one Â The waiter took my plate and disappeared Â When our next group of tapas arrived I still did not have a plate or utensils Â I tried to say something to the guy who dropped off the food but he appeared to understand absolutely no English Â So I waited Â And waited Â I finally flagged down our server reminded him I needed a plate and watched him leave again Â Several MINUTES later he returned and grabbed a plate from a shelf near the kitchen Â UnacceptableThese are just two of the multitude of problems with the service Â As for the food it was delicious Â The baconwrapped dates were my favorite Â I also liked the meatballs and shrimp Â Very tasty food but very amateur wait staff Â I wont be returning

Author: Hanna K.
Content: I went on the recommendation of a couple of friends that had gone to this place and were they right I loved Mercat I went on a Tuesday night so it wasnt crowded at all We started off with a white sangria mojito and the seasonal sangria The drinks were ok but the food was what really blew me away 1 Serrano ham and fig salad I liked it but it was slightly salty 2 Bacon wrapped dates stuffed with almonds with a creamy cheese sauce I loved the combo of the sweet salty and creamy Ive had the bacon wrapped dates at Twist and Avec and I think Mercat has the best ones hands down although Avecs is pretty rockin because of the chorizo 3 Tocino con cidra pork belly with a cider glaze this was my FAVORITE dish of the night Ive had bbqed pork belly before but the cider glaze at this place was awesome 4 Short ribs  diver scallops the scallops and short ribs were so tender This dish was my dining partners favorite but it was a little salty for me 5 Australian sea bass the fish was super fresh 6 Butternut squash dumplings I thought this dish was ok I didnt like how creamy and running the filling was 7 Arroz con morels this was a pretty good risottostyle dish I didnt think it had quite the texture of risotto because it was a bit too mushy for me but i cant tell whether this was really a risotto 8 Milk chocolate croquettes at first I was hesitant but this dessert won me over I LOVED the soft creamy banana marshmallow This was my second favorite dish of the night I would definitely go back to Mercat to try other dishes

Author: Kara E.
Content: Be prepared to fork over the cash at this place I recently saw this place on an episode of Check Please and desperately wanted to try it out Its a little tricky to actually find the restaurant once youre inside the Blackstone Hotel but I eventually made my way The drink list most def has a variety of unique mixed drinks I started off with the Merengue which was sweet w a kick Then later tried the seasonal sangria which included a kick of vodka Â My girls and I ordered several tapas dishes which we all shared Be aware that these dishes are probably only met for sharing between 2 people The portions are small and pricey The tapas staple of bacon wrapped dates were flavorful and left me wanting more Ironically their spinach dish with pine nuts and apples was awesome Who knew spinach could taste so good My gal pals and I also tried the bacon flatbread spicy potatoes diver scallops an amazing rice almost like a risotto w clams and a shortrib and scallop entree All of the dishes were amazing and had a pretty presentation Desserts were also very good The chocolate croquettes and the butter cake are a MUST try Â The croquettes come with a marshmallow fluff type sauce need I say moreAll in all the food was good small portions and a little pricey but a great ambiance Glad I tried it

Author: Diana H.
Content: We came here for lunch because we were staying at the Blackstone hotel and since it is owned by an Iron Chef we thought that it should be a good choice for our short stay Â However we were disappointed at what we gotFirst of all our waiter didnt seem to listen to us Â We asked for iced tea with a little bit of ice actually I said two ice cubes because I know it might be difficult for people to judge what is little but apparently he was not listening and still gave me a lot of ice in my iced tea Â Then at the end of the meal we asked for a small glass of warm water to take my medicine with something needs to dissolve in water and I got a glass of room temperature water Â I returned the water then when he brought us new hotter water it was in one big mug Â My husband decided that we would just pour water out of a glass and measure the right amount of water that I needed instead of asking him to do itIf the food was great perhaps we could still be happy with the overall experience but they were just OK Â We both ordered the Catalan Express 18 which is a glass of iced tea or soda then two courses Â Both my husbands serrano ham salad and my chicken and shrimp soup could have been good but they were both over salted which killed a lot of flavors Â Then our entrees came Â His was a very small portion of fish fillet I wanted to say maybe the size of my palm pretty thin and mine was two scallop skewers 4 scallops total but you could tell the scallops were sliced in half to create the skewers Â The flavors were fine but neither of us were satisfied Â I would not recommend coming to this restaurant

Author: Kristin S.
Content: I have now eaten here twice once for business and once before a night out to see Spamalot Both times I was still hungry after walking out the doorWhile the food is pretty and generally tastes good spending 60 on a meal just to have my stomach growling during Richard Chamberlains rendition of Always Look At the Bright Side of Life is just wrongand that was without alcohol I can hit up Cafe Iberico or Cafe BaBaReba and walk out full and pleasantly buzzing for less than halfI give it two stars one for interesting food and two for the awesome tomato bread stick things we got at the beginning of the meal

Author: Stephanie K.
Content: I eat out a lot and this place really needs to step up its game Â I went with an old friend on a Saturday night Â Fairly early about 6pmThe atmosphere was hopping but not over crowdedImmediately we could tell our server was clearly too cool for school Â  We explained we had not been to the space before and he rattled off his memorized menu explanation so fast we were left more confused than we startedBeing adventurous we just went with it ordering a salad 2 veggie dishes and 2 traditional tapas Â  Â We ordered all at once but asked our server to please pace our dishes Â Seconds later we were staring down at our main meal before the complimentary breadsticks arrived Â  Â The garlic shrimp was oily and stringy and the crab cake was so small you couldnt really share it Â  Our salad came out 3rd Â  Â Plus the prices are just outrageous for Chicago I understand this is South Michigan Avenue I understand its the Blackstone Hotel Â Still this is not worth the trip Â  If youre going to spend 110 dollars for 5 plates and 2 drinks you are better off going to any number of Chicagos fine restaurants that actually smile when you say thank you Â Our server killed it for the entire team Â  The hostesses  buss people were nice Â I am not sure why everyone raves but I will not be going back

Author: Marcy T.
Content: One word INCREDIBLE I literally cant say enough about how fantastic Mercat is My husband and I had an enjoyable dinner with two friends here a few months ago and were excited to take my inlaws to Mercat during their New Years trip to Chicago I knew it would be good but nothing could have prepared me for what we experiencedWe opted for the tasting menu with wine pairings an amazing choice The courses arent exactly one plate but usually 45 in each course First course amazing appetizers including Mercats signature bacon wrapped dates and more charcuterie type apps There were awesome palette cleansers in between like green peppers Second course was pasta with an amazing rabbit ravioli of sorts Third course  meat meat and more meat The thing I was most impressed about though beyond the amazing food was the service Matteo our server was knowledgeable and so helpful as we planned our dinner The biggest perk came for my sisterinlaw though Shes pregnant and very conscientious of what she can and cannot eat They brought her a separate charcuterie plate so that her meats would be fully cooked and a separate meat course plate as well with well done meat On top of that because she couldnt imbibe the bartender made her a variety of wellpaired kiddie cocktails to keep her eating and drinking just as interesting as the rest of oursDefinitely ranked up there with one of my best meals as a Chicagoan

Author: Melissa W.
Content: Mercat a la Planxa is a great restaurant for a casual evening with a loved one or with a group of friends The variety of tapas is similar to what you may have experienced at other tapas restaurants but with a little upscale touch or twist to themUpon arriving I was a little put off by the fact that some of the seats in the small entryway bar were reserved To my friends and I it was a little strange that there would actually be reserved seats in such a tiny space Mercat a la Planxa has an extensive list of specialty cocktails as well as housemade sangria We all opted for the sangria It was good and multiples were ordered but it was not outstanding Having said that at the time of our reservation we were escorted upstairs to the dining room which was like a breath of fresh air twostory lots of light and fun decorAt first the menu can be a little intimidating even for someone who has had tapas many times before Our waiter explained the menu to us and the layout of it made much more sense The waitstaff was excellent very attentive and more than willing to answer any questions that we had I would describe the food as traditional tapas with a twist An example would be that traditional baconwrapped dates are actually baconwrapped figs stuffed with almonds This was definitely a favorite at our table My table started off with approximately 4 5 plates and kept one of our menus so that we could order more as we felt necessary Our waiters recommended 34 plates per person and their recommendation was quite accurate Please keep in mind that these are small plates Some of them are much smaller than others The pasta dishes are quite smallAll of the food was delicious with a couple exceptions Of course this is all based on individual taste Presentation was excellent for all of the items we ordered as well as the items we saw arriving at other tables One item that stood out as something that may need a little work was the walnut sorbet After tasting it I thought it tasted like something but couldnt put my finger on it My other half had the best description which I thought was incredibly accurate They described the sorbet as tasting like PlaydohMy friends and I cant wait to go back to Mercat a la Planxa and try the many other items on the menu We averaged approximately 60 per person for both food and drinks including tip I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for great tapas and a good time

Author: Manish P.
Content: Came into this place on a rainy day back in late july one thing about this place is that i will NEVER forget the Arroz a la Cazuela this was by far the best soupbroth i have ever had in my life every single bite was amazing and delicious and i wanted it to never end i did that catalan express and also got the gamba y chorizo coca which was pretty damn good itself luckily we came at an off time so no one else was there and we had the whole place to ourselves highly recommend this place will be back for sure

Author: tiffany w.
Content: The rundownHands down the best burger I have ever had It had fig cheese marinated peppers and a decadent sauce Yummy sangria Pretty good service however the server accidently charged us twice Great salads A bit overpriced but overall yumsters

Author: Maria B.
Content: AMAZING Live in Chicago Planning a trip to Chitown Head to Mercat ASAPSome of the best food ive ever had We did the chefs menu at the special lunch price of 35 and you get 6 small courses with some awesome tasting CatalonianSpanish food The restaurant is not pretentious you can stop in for a casual lunch in the big open dining space and watch the chefs prepare the food in their open kitchen Service was excellent and it was the first time i was ever asked if i had any food allergies how thoughtful  attentiveMercat a la Plaxa pronounced Plancha is owned by Iron Chef Jose Garces and lemme tell you the food taste originality plating made me feel like i was one of the judges on Iron Chef being presented with these masterpiecesFirst CourseFlash Fried PadrÃ³n Peppers with a delicous red pepperpinenut dipSecond CourseSpinach salad with serrano ham chorizo and figThird CourseArroz a la Cazuela  Shrimp Chicken soup with a paprika aioli sauce on toasted breadFourth CourseTruita de Patata con Espinacas  potato  parsley with a saffron sauceGrilled Chorizo on skewersHam CroquetaFifth CourseScallops with lime mint and parsleyHanger Steak on top of a potato croquetSixth CourseWarm spinach salad with shredded apple and pinenutsNo complaints each dish was excellent Be sure to check out the pics

Author: Mikey J.
Content: Lovely Tapas Bar right in the heart of Chicago Â The interior is warm and inviting and the service the night I went was very goodThe food is quality as well crispy and flavorful flatbreads tasty olives cured salami and pork chopped right from a roasted pigI highly recommend Â I recommend checking the place out on a Sunday as there will be lots of street parking Â A good way to start the week

Author: Adele n.
Content: If you value your money even a little or if you like being treated with even a little respect do not go here under any circumstances First let me talk about the food There were these flashfried peppers that were flavorful and good there was a goat cheese and vegetables dish that I liked the dessert croquettes were funBut this is without a doubt a onestar experience because the service here was unconscionably bad  not just unhelpful but actually rude pushy insulting and deceitful I went here last night with five friends for restaurant week The special restaurant week menu is what got us in the door But as soon as we sat down our server aggressively pushed us away from the restaurant week menu 33 per person and towards the chefs tasting menu 60 per person We were provided six regular menus and only one restaurant week menu As we began ordering from the restaurant week menu which we had to pass around the table to read our server repeatedly told us that the portion sizes on the restaurant week menu were too small and that we should order from the regular menu Â When some in our party ordered a few extra items off the menu in addition to their 33 per person meals the waitress repeatedly commented only one its really small She even tried to steer us away from the restaurant week menu again by telling us that she wasnt sure that the chef would allow us to add items to our order if we were getting the restaurant week menu I wont call you out by name waitress but you know who you are and you should know that I dont like being made to feel like a piece of shit when I eat out with friends I am polite to servers I was one for six years and I always leave at least a 20 percent tip whether the service was great or not But your tactic of trying to make us feel like cheapskates no matter what we ordered just really rubbed me the wrong way But I guess you dont care because your tip was a guaranteed 19 percent of whatever we purchased Avoid

Author: Rashmi P.
Content: Mercat a la Planx resides in the newly renovated Blackstone hotel the second floor opens to a swanky space filled with beautiful people hustling and bustling with a vibrant bar and a fantastic view of Grant Park Even on a weeknight the restaurant was at maximum capacity Parched due to the unusual heat wave Chicago was hit with we ordered the seasonal sangria with rhubarb The uncommon ingredients married perfectly to create a fresh fragrant and chilled cocktail We simply couldnt get enough of itOur waiter was professional and polite One couldnt help over looking his tardiness as the restaurant was super packed and he didnt even have a minute to breathe Yet he attended to us with a smile Tapas certainly not what you would expect from your local neighborhood joint in Spain Chef Garces has taken Tapas to a gourmand level with intrinsically prepared dishes and addition of fusion flavors The community of Catalonia north eastern Spain favors garlic and one can surely taste that influence on the dishes here at Mercat I for one relish garlic in all formsIn between savoring the rhubarb sangria and catching up with friends we ordered pintxos muranos patata bravas morcilla flatbread tocino con cidra gambas al ajillo cordero lechalel en curry pimientos and cheese selection Aside from the lamb brochettes kitchen ran out of we managed to taste everything else we ordered They even have Roast Pig on the menu which involves advance orderingThe Patata Bravas were presented unlike any of my previous encounters with this classic dish Crispy tater tots like potatoes topped were adequately with spicy paprika aioli we ended up ordering secondsAt times the description of a certain dish tends to evoke fear or disdain in diners morcilla blood sausage falls into that category However I for one love them hence I look forward to the signature touches of the restaurant that are bold enough to offer them Mercat a la Planxa had one of the best I have tasted in my various travels It even won the vote of my friends who hadnt tasted them before With the right amount of sweetness combined with the rice the morcilla melted in my mouth Nicely doneThe Chefs selection of 3 cheeses was a befitting ending to our delicious meal The generous portions of cheese were accompanied with finger licking dipping sauces yet another display of the Kitchens uniqueness Mercat a la Planxa seems to serve minuscule portions with higher prices in comparison to average typical tapas fare however each dish coming out their kitchen is uniquely paired packed with bold flavors presented beautifully and most importantly tasting exquisiteWhat should have been a casual evening out with friends turned into a spectacular dining experience commendable of any epicureans delight Mercat a la Planxa for the fortunate ChiTown residents and travelers is open throughout the day offering breakfast brunch lunch and dinner

Author: Ben H.
Content: I hit up Mercat back in October before Jose Garces won Iron Chef and the restaurant presumably turned into a madhouse Â I love CatalanBarcelonarelated things so Mercat was definitely a huge draw for me Â When I discovered the day before that this was one of Garces restaurants I was definitely in Â The place itself was really quite nice Â The interior was a bit dark with some interesting lighting and dÃ©cor Â It was a stylish goodlooking restaurant  I liked it a lot Â Apparently other people did too  it wasnt busy when we got there but it was packed by the time we left Â Anyway the food  drinkSippin onAltovinum  Spanish Garnacha Â This was pretty good but Id probably opt for something else Â Though Ive never been particularly crazy about any Spanish wines Ive had Â Munchin onPan con tomate  BAM They hit you from the start with this FREE tapa Â This was delicious and perfectly executed Â Great bread lightly toasted for a bit of crunch and a very flavorful mix of tomato garlic olive oil etc Â Bacalao croquetas  These were decent but not amazing and I probably wouldnt get them again Â I didnt really care for the peppers served with them Â Butifarra sausage  This was pretty good Â I mean its pretty basic  just 3 smallish sausages Â The seasoning was interesting Â If I was in the mood Id get this again Â Patatas bravas  Eh honestly Ive had better versions of this common dish Â They werent friedcrunchy enough and the spicy paprika aioli wasnt a welcome addition or spicyTortilla  The omelette had potatoes and spinach in it Â Maybe onion and I think saffron Â It was a pretty typical take on this dish  its good but didnt really amaze me Â Pork belly  Bulls eye Â My favorite dish Â Pork belly with cider tart apples and a truffley turnip puree Â It was a fantastic dish Â All the flavors and textures worked really well Â I was worried about the truffle being too much I might be a little sensitive to the flavor of truffles but it was the perfect amount Â It was one of those dishes you want to keep eating and eating Â  Â Chocolate croquetas  How the hell are some of you hating on these Â I pity the foolThese are ridiculous Â Chocolatey gooey perfectlyfried little nuggets of awesomeness served with a variety of tasty pairings  banana marshmallow  rosemary caramel   and some exotic olive oil Â This dish was excellent in terms of texture and flavor and is certainly one of the more memorable clever and unique desserts Ive come across in a long time Â Can they make them baseballsizedSo while the food overall was very good there were some additional disappointing aspects of the meal aside from a couple of the actual dishes Â Well its probably obvious but the portion sizes were too small for the prices Â The prices were steep and even acknowledging that they surely use highquality ingredients and such I couldnt help but feel a little gypped at some of the tiny portions Â Also the odd number of servings in each dish was really wacky  itd be like 5 croquetas or 7 patatas Â Why is that Â Its kinda annoying to split food like that Â Its a small quibble but seriously it seems pretty basic Anyway Mercat is definitely a quality spot that offers some great tapas Â While the pricesportions arent ideal the food in general is very good Â Id definitely hit up this place again if I was back in town Â 4

Author: Tom P.
Content: Wow All I can say is WowMy wife suggested this restaurant for our mini staycation in downtown Chicago this weekend Â Im not very long winded so heres my summary Some of the best food I have ever eaten We did the Chefs tasting menu my wife got the wine pairing but I didnt  The service was impeccable Our waiter was so nice and helpful He made our whole evening very enjoyable My wife loved her three small glasses of wine She felt that they were perfectly paired with the food She also doesnt like fish so they were kind enough to substitute garlic shrimp Much to my delight it was delicious My favorite was the little cheese plate There was some kind of spread yellow that was combined with a small piece of bread apple slices and a delicious cheese I could have eaten quite a few of those The tastes just burst in my mouth Everything else in the tasting was perfect I would highly recommend this place Im a bit of a picky eater typically but everything they brought out was delicious They do bring the courses pretty quickly so you have to keep up Give it a try I think youll enjoy it

Author: Elvin Y.
Content: So a group of nine of us went here for a bday celebrationIt was a GREAT time Â Great ambiance and great serviceWe didnt feel like making any decisions so we went for the Chefs tasting menu I highly recommend it Â Its 3 courses and you get about 1215 dishes Â Great choice for a group And we got a ton of food it just kept on comingSome of the ones we LOVED Some kind of a pepper wsome dip lamb chomps were incredible pork belly was amazing and I dont love pork belly at all we also loved the strips of steakI personally really liked the brussel sprouts some of my friends didnt care for it Desserts were not included in the tasting menu Â But we got the rice pudding amazing Also ice cream on top of what almost seemed like thick chocolate pudding Great place for a group celebration Â OHthey also have GREAT sangria

Author: Robyn T.
Content: You must come for brunch at Mercat For 25 you can enjoy 4 tapas brunch items like chorizo baked with eggs or favorites like dates wrapped in bacon AND an unlimited alcoholic brunch beverage of your choice sangria mimosas or the divine build your own bloody mary barOur server was super friendly and attentive but problems arose when the tapas arrived at the table Each person ordered for themselves but the food runner said the name of the dish and put it on the table It would be helpful for the item to be placed with the person who ordered them to avoid a vegetarian eating a dish containing meat Just a small change that Im sure would help the busy brunch staff

Author: Jennifer K.
Content: My friend visited me during the third week of March for spring break so I wanted to take her to a restaurant to remind her of Spain she studied abroad in Spain last year Â I found out that Mercat had opened recently so we booked reservations on March 20th Â We were seated promptly in an open colorful setting Â And our server was very attentive from the getgoWe opted for the tapas Â Charcuteria Mixto featured three different kinds of meats with garnishes on the side Â Gambas al ajillo garlic shrimp was served piping hot though the smell of garlic was overpowering it didnt take over the taste Â Espinacas a la Catalana Catalan Spinach was delicious Â Our server suggested it and he was spot on Â The spinach was lightly blanched with toasted pine nuts and crisp apples complementing it Â I wanted to like the patatas bravas but the popular tapas dish was a bit disappointing Â Rodaballo turbot was tender though a bit on the saltyoily side Â The real highlight was tocino con xerez pork belly Â The pork belly slices were meltingly delicious with ciderapple for garnishI forgot what we had for dessert which goes to show how memorable that was Â Though Im pretty sure we enjoyed it Â Hmm Â Anywho the meal dessert and two sangria glasses came up just under 100 for two people less than 50 a person for a filling meal Â Though it seems as though the restaurant is still working out kinks the service was attentive and the price fair

Author: Anna V.
Content: I came to this place before I knew Jose Garces was on Iron Chef and wish I paid more attention now I went here with someone who knew the menu pretty well and another person who didnt We were at the mercy of her choices and she nailed it We picked a bottle of wine at random and didnt do the pairingThis is a highly stylized tapas restaurant  its not like Ba Ba Reeba which I think of as more traditionally tapaslike We did a modified tasting that they changed to accomodate an allergy for me Braised rabbit ravioli cocas patatas bravas mushrooms ahi and some really damn good iberico ham Meat a la planxa is the big finish and it is delicious but the portions are small and theres a lot of sharinginteracting going on Its well presented but nothing too weirdThis is the second of two places I would ever bother taking the train to Harrison for Custom House is the other as Im not a fan of traveling this area these days  hang out for a half hour on the platform underground or on some of the corners after 11pm or so and youll start to see why It is weird that this place is inside of a hotel too I feel like it needs its own spot to really work In a narrow cool tapas bar setting I feel like itd be a major winnerI had a very flirty waiter here who I wish I remembered Oops

Author: Vanessa G.
Content: Visiting Chicago for the first time we had no idea where to eat and decided to check Yelp for some viable options The reviews seemed decent and with reasonable Tapas prices we figured it would be a good place to tryThe place is huge and the food is soso Bacon wrapped dates were absolutely delicious but the other menu items left something to be desired The waiter tried to upsell us the lamb also which happened to be the most expensive menu item even after we said we werent interestedOverall decent experience but probably would not return

Author: Ellie B.
Content: I went here on a date not too long after they opened Â The food was nice atmosphere pleasant and service adequate Â I had heard they were known for their rabbit and sangria Â We tried a number of items including their specialties Â I thought the sangria was good but nothing to write home about Â The rabbit was gamey but its rabbit Â I didnt like it Â We tried the dates as well which didnt compare to Avecs Â Avec stole my heart with their datesWhat I did really enjoy though was the Montana y Mar I think thats what they called it steak and sea scallops Â Very tasty very tender Â Their mushroom risotto was good too Â For dessert I had the four chocolates which were all delicious Â If youre having trouble deciding or you cant read the Catalan ask your server theyre good at explaining and making suggestions

Author: Jennifer B.
Content: Fancy space in a fancy hotel that serves fancy food Â I like it Â Mercat has really good food Â Im a vegetarian and I LOVED that there was more for me to eat on this menu than a cheese plate and a random salad Â Automatic bonus points for any tapas place Â It was crazy crowded on a recent Friday night and we decided to skip the wait and eat in the circular lounge area Â We had attentive service there which is always a concern for a bartype area although the table got immediately crowded between our pitcher of sangria our glasses our personal tiny plate and one dish of foodI highly recommend the seasonal sangria and at 29 for a pitcher that probably contains at least six servings its one of the best deals on the menu Â Although the food here is great its also overpriced Â I dont mind paying a lot for food when its worth it and although the quality of food here is high the portions are so tiny I just couldnt justify it especially when you plan on ordering several plates per person

Author: Lisa L.
Content: We went with the other yelper suggestions and tried out the chefs tasting menu without the pairings Â Overall the food was absolutely delicious and abundant Â I felt that the portion size was just right keeping in mind that it was both tapas and a tasting menu Â I appreciated the more creative spins on tapas classics like the papas bravas and the baconwrapped dates with almonds and goat cheese fondue Â We split a pitcher of the while seasonal sangria which went very nicely with our meal Â Out wait staff throughout the meal were fantastic with a perfect awareness of when they were needed and when was best to not come by Â All our courses came perfectly spaced and were nicely presentedMy husband and I both agreed that the one off part of the night was the fact that dessert was not included in the tasting menu Â I guess we kind of figured that at the price we were paying all courses of the meal would be included Â We decided to try out the desserts regardless and were delighted by what we ordered  he had the rum cake I think and I have some sort of chocolate croquettes which were deliciousAside from the food the space itself was a treat in itself Â Housed in the former ballroom of the adjacent hotel the dining room is highceilinged colorful and comes complete with a wonderful view of the park and probably the lake during the day Â I also really enjoyed the very open layout and modern decor Â I would love to get some of their window decals designed to look like the pavers on las ramblas

Author: Stella Y.
Content: We came here for a bday brunch for a great pal and it was yummy and creative  Def the meal tested your tastebuds25 brunch special items change every weekHam coquettes eggs benedict Merchango Bacon biscuits and gravy spinach omlette wild mushrooms  eggs scrambled duck a la cherry and cod  mashpotatoes whipped dip Bottomless juice  coffee and 8 bottomless mimosas and bloody marysDef a fun atmosphere Id like to check this place out at night

Author: Vaidehi T.
Content: 4 and a half starsMercat a la planxa offers a very sophisticated and intimate dining experience with some great tasting tapas The ambiance is very beautiful and sexy I loved the decor of the place the dim lights and the high ceilings I was also surprised at how big the place wasOn to the food  delicious They have quite a few vegetarian dishesWe started with the complimentary tomato bread  delish Then we had the butternut squash dumplings with mushrooms and truffle oil It was so smooth and decadent We loved itThen came the wild mushrooms with confit potato and onion  this dish was the star of the meal I am a big fan of mushrooms and this was a superb dish The next time my husband and me go here we are going to order one for each of us Cauliflower dish  this was ok good but not great like the previous two dishesPatatas bravas  am not a big fan of potatoes and I dont enjoy smoky flavor My husband ordered this and he absolutely loved itFor dessert we got the hazelnutmascarpone gateau with apricot sorbet and dulce de leche  it was heavenly I love apricots and the dessert was the perfect ending to the meal The service was adequate  no complaints The restaurant is a little too expensive for the tapas dishes but the flavor of the food totally makes it worth it

Author: Ted K.
Content: Amada Lite All in all similar menus but not quite as pleasing as Amada in Philadelphia Open modern decor service was fine Had the Fedeua a noodle paella which tasted just like the one I had at Suquet de lAlmirall in Barcelona Barcelonita neighborhood  unfortunately I didnt like it there either A little too oily and salty for me The pan con tomate was weird too more like a bruschettaThat being said everything from la planxa was very good as were the vegetable tapas espinicas a la Catalana calcots pimientos de padron setas al horno and the jamon iberico was very good somehow was quite a bit better at Amada though perhaps because it was hand cut The patatas bravas were different kind of like tater tots with brava sauce and only 6 per order but they were good if a tad salty

Author: Chris W.
Content: This place is pretty damn good but I cant give it a five star because the servers seemed off their game  a little clueless at times although perfectly friendly Â The sangria here is top notch and I had a few tapas that were awesome  I cant remember what they were now I ate there about three weeks ago Â But the highlight was a whole roasted pig served at the table Â It was really a sight and a taste too cooked perfectly it seemed to me Â The place is a scene very loud but the big windows looking over Michigan Avenue give the room a grand feel Â This is a good fancy date destination and a good fancy large party destinationSpied Harold Ramis here Â Cool dude

Author: Richard S.
Content: Wonderful interpretation of traditional tapas and Catalonian seemed more like Basque to me cuisine Â Every dish was about two notches away from what we expectedin a very positive way Â Patatas bravas for example looked liked a strip of neatlyarranged scallops rather than a dish of lumped orange potatoes Â We thoroughly enjoyed everything we ordered and are excited to try other areas of the menu next timePlease note that this is NOT a Ba Ba Reba or Ibericotype place Â Dont take your party of 30 recent college grads here expecting a table with a jug of cheap sangria in front of every seatService however was notably off Â The server was quite nice but he just never came around much Â We was off folding napkins when we wanted to order more food and another round of drinks Â The bill for four of us was only 200were used to that for two Â This has to be a fluke and the food was more than good enough for us to give them another shot Â Fingers crossed for next time Â If the service is what it should be this will be one of my favorite Â Definitely repeat value hereRemember to get your valet ticket validated for a nice little break

Author: Kent L.
Content: Saturday February 13 2010 reservations for two at 815pmMy girlfriend is from Philadelphia and had been dying to go to this restaurant as it is currently the only Jose Garces restaurant outside of Philly First impression was that this place was much larger than it looked from the outside Attractive interior great location and clearly a hot spot as the place was jam packed when we went for dinnerExcellent food We began our dinner with the Serrano Ham and Fig Salad and a pitcher of white wine sangria I highly recommend this dish to kick off dinner unless you are not a fan of ham as this thing is loaded with it This is not your typical salad We then had the Pelotas de Calabaza Y Cordero which was also very good followed by the Paella Negra she loved it but I am not crazy about seafood or black rice We ended with Croquetas De Xocolata as dessert which was pretty goodNow to the downsides Our waiter made excellent recommendations on the dishes but was not around much We had to ask three times where the bread was it finally came after we finished our second courses Restaurant is relatively loud and seating is arranged very close together taking a bit away from the intimacy Overall the service we had experienced was subpar for the price range but maybe it was a fluke night I would still go back to try some of the other dishes

Author: Eric L.
Content: Outstanding Â Went on a Wednesday night not too crowded great waitress made great recommendationsWe had1 Charcuterie platter2 Queso platter3 Baconwrapped Dates Stuffed with Almonds Datiles con Almendras4 Lamb wrapped in bacon stuffed with a roasted cherry tomato served on a skewer Lamb brochette5 Serrano ham croquettes 6 Colorado rack of lamb 7 Rabbit sausage8 Spicy Potatoes with Spicy Paprika Aioli Patatas Bravas9 Warm Brussels Sprouts Salad with Bacon Coles de Bruselas10 Spanish Octopus Confit Potato Smoked Paprika Pulpo con Patatas11 Wild Mushrooms Confit Potato Shallot  Parsely Setas al Horno12 Porcini  Catalan Sausage Roasted Garlic and Manchego Flatbread Cepes y Butifarra13 Beef Shortrib Horseradish Parmesan  Bacon Flatbread Costillas de TerneraEvery menu item we had was outstanding Â Excellently prepared well balanced bold but not overwhelming flavorsThe least interesting items were the rabbit sausage and the patatas bravasThe rack of lamb was excellently prepared delicious but nothing special Â For items that are unique to Mercat get the croquettes spanish octopus good but small portion for the price beef shortrib flatbread the horseradish kick is quite niceMercat a la Planxa made the list for my top 3 eating experiences in Chicago last night

Author: Emmy B.
Content: This restaurant is absolutely FABULOUSIm vegetarian pescetarian and there were still tons of really amazing optionsWe hadspicy potatoesbread with tomatoessquashscallopshouse red wineand all were so delicious I noticed an inconsistency with some of the portion sizes scallops were tiny spicy potatoes were plentiful but it was fine in the end because we were stuffed It was a little pricey for what you get but since the food tasted so good Ill let it slideThe atmosphere is very warm and welcoming and I must highlight that our server was super attentive and amazing I like that this place has a nice balance of traditional elegance with a bit of a funky modern twistIt was our first night in Chicago we had just gotten in from a 5 hour plane ride we were hungry and a bit cranky but our server was so lovely and totally turned our day around She even gave us one of our tapas on the house and said Welcome to Chitown This ones on us Awww so sweetWill definitely come back here

Author: Phil S.
Content: I have three words for my experience at Mercat OUT STAND ING This place has been on our list since we saw it reviewed on an episode of Check Please We decided to give it a shot for a special New Years Eve dinner This is definitely a special occasion destination We did the special NYE chefs menu and a wine flight each and the tab came to about 250 with tax and tip This is more than we normally spend for anything but our more expensivespecial outings My wife recently commented to a friend that there is a primal conflict between my love of good food and being a complete cheapass she said it nicer But I dont mind paying for quality and this place was worth the price The ingredients were really high end and the service was excellent We also got a lot of really tasty food for our money I was full before the meat course lamb chops and Wagyu beefit goes without saying that I got my second wind after tasting it Major highlights  Great service We ordered the chefs menu but they tailored it to our exact likes and dislikes replacing two items with items that were more palatable for my wife she doesnt eat shellfish The waiter also kept really close tabs on us and the food and wine was brought out with pretty flawless timing  The Serranno Ham and Fig salad was out of this world So simple yet such a perfect balance of flavors  The lamb chops were simply fantastic Served with two sauces that were completely superfluous IMHO since the chop was perfect on its own Minor low lights  The tuna was only ok and not up to the standards of the rest of the meal  The baconwrapped dates which is a classic tapas dish was prepared with an almond inside the date The almond balances out the sweetsavory contrast a bit which to me is the point of this pairing I think I prefer the classic version no almond betterThe whole experience was perfect for a special NYE dinner and Mercat has now officially been added to the PILETTCOTHD listPlaces I Like Even Though They Cost Over Two Hundred Dollars

Author: Lourdes A.
Content: En garde Prepare to spear the shrimp and do so quickly lest you miss it altogether Lets just say that this is not your typical tapas shared food experience The servings are smaller and not the familystyle portions you may have come to expect if you frequent Cafe Iberico and Cafe Ba Ba Reeba What Mercat is though is a sophisticated dining experience in a lovely setting with huge floor to ceiling windows overlooking the southern end of Grant Park The portions may be small but they are exquisitely presented and complemented by the best white wine sangria Ive had in years The service was attentive without being intrusive They won me over with the sublime Braised Goat Ravioli that they made especially for the Cubs Convention Mercats way of keeping it real Chicago style Â  Musthaves Setas al Horno Wild Mushrooms Tocino con Cidra Pork Belly in Cider Glaze and any tapas with goat meat which they prepare to tender perfection

Author: Kristin M.
Content: The staff and the food were amazing Suggest the short rib flatbread bacon dates and the truffle rabbit

Author: Samantha K.
Content: I feel I should give out 5s sparingly but I couldnt click 4 and live with myself The first experience I had here was during restaurant week in which we did a prix fixe menu and got a wine flight The service was good at times a bit slow but again it was restaurant week at dinner time The server was great though in ensuring we got what we wanted the BF doesnt like seafood and they were accommodating to that One wine really stood out and after asking about it he wrote it down so we could get it ourselves as we didon they walk home I was most impressed with the prosciutto ham fig salad wrap and continue to get it every time I go Dont miss itBrunch with the parents was the next time we went and it remains the best brunch out there We have been to NoMi and while its good this stood out as better and at a fraction of the cost to boot It was a rainy Sunday and we sat there for 3 hours enjoying 8 bottomless sangria and the courses just kept coming Each one you get a small portion but if they gave you anymore you wouldnt be able to enjoy all they bring Then theres the roasted suckling pig you can get as you please and they put sea salt on and you will realize you dont care that you are looking into its hallow eyes as you eat it Its that goodWe went for a friends birthday and had another amazing meal but tried the smores dessert I will not even attempt to describe this Just get it

Author: Robin M.
Content: Mercat a la Planxa was next door to my hotel but I wouldve traveled a lot further to try it out because I love Spanish food I didnt have time to sample a whole meal of tapas but I did have the arroz a la cazuela saffron scented chicken broth with lobster rabbit chicken chorizo shaved artichoke salad and piquillo aioli My Argentinian friend complained that it wasnt authentic because it came in a bowl not a cazuela but these American eyes and taste buds were in no way put off It was simply put the most extraordinary thing Ive ever seen happen to chicken soup The colors were so beautiful too it was really a feast for the eyes as much as for the palate It came with fresh focaccia topped with a tomato bruschetta those are Italian terms I know but I dont know the right Spanish ones for them Overall it was a perfect light supper I think my favorite thing about this place is its spectacular cocktails menu I had the sangria flight which was three halfglasses of seasonal sangrias a white with apple and pear a rosÃ© with orange and cranberry best sangria Ive ever had and a red with apple orange and cinnamon All were delicious I came back another evening with a friend and we tried a few of their other house cocktails All were creative and delicious Mercats a bit more expensive than I usually go on a business trip but Im really glad I went It would be a great place for an intimate date Ill definitely go back next time Im in Chicago

Author: Mark N.
Content: Great room terrific food very good serviceand pricey Â Not sure what the story is behind the faux etchings on the big windows overlooking the park but could certainly live without them Â Looked like something out of a cheap Ft Lauderdale motel Otherwise room is fabulous had heard stories that it was so loud you couldnt carry on a conversation but not the case last night Â Service was very attentive in a friendly way  not overdone at all Â And I agree  the headsets have to go Food was outstanding  did a meat and cheese course then flatbread Â ravioli ham ragout was stronger than the pasta is accompanied diver scallops a little beefGREAT garlic shrimp Â Dip your bread in the garlic butter sauceum um good Â  It all comes with a cost however Â OK we didnt really need that extra bottle of wine Â But it sure was good

Author: Robin B.
Content: I went here last night and I am already craving the butternut squash raviollis Â I am throughly convinced that ordering the Chefs selection is the way to go Â It was 58 and quite literally a Â parade of food Â Nothing disappointed Â  The items were brought out three at a time which was a good pace with a total of around 15 menu items Â  Worth notingI do not eat lamb but from the mouths of those who did this is the best piece of meat of have ever had Â The service was excellent and not over bearing

Author: Lauren M.
Content: Im begrudgingly writing this review I had a total Meh shoulder shrug experience here It was a busy Friday night first mistake but it was late almost 1030p  It felt like EVERYONE including the bartenders and hostesses had an attitude and not the good kind of attitude but the hitty Im better than you I dont want to help you that just made me feel like I was bothering them or that I was inconveniencing them It really bothered me and put a sour taste in my mouth Thankfully the wine selection is great but their food  well  it was just Meh As an avid traveler and eaterfoodie it felt like they were trying too hard and missed the mark The serrano ham was delicious but only came with 4 slices of bread not enough The saffron compote that came with our cheese selection was AMAZING The paella negra was so salty it was hard to swallow I felt discouraged when I left I really wanted an amazing experience but it just  wasnt The architecture was beautiful but the next time I am craving tapasSpanishCatalonian Im headed to Cafe Iberico

Author: Ryan L.
Content: Delicious food no doubt Â The white chocolate ice cream aside it is missnamed and should be called Caramel ice cream Â very creamy but not chocolatey Â The reservations and seating process is frustrating and subpar for a restaurant of this potential caliber Â Do not know if it is a staff issue or overbooking due to the longer dining times of a tapas jointOur server on our second visit was not nearly as helpful or attentive as the first Â The cocktails are always good but priceyNext time I crave Tapas i will venture out and try a new place

Author: Doug H.
Content: Prepare to be treated poorly Â A promise of 45 minutes turned into a dismissive nothing is available an hour later Â Keep on driving to the Purple Pig Â If getting treated like crap makes you think its just more exclusive then this is the place for youTo their credit I was contacted within the week my their GM after this posting Â His follow up was credible and prompt Â Im willing to give them another chance if only to be able to make a judgment on the food

Author: Wendy T.
Content: What a surprise Â Ive never had an exceptional tapas experience until Mercat Â Met a friend here for dinner before the Joffrey Ballet last Friday night Â The place was a last minute choice so of course we couldnt get seated for dinner but the cozy bar on the first floor served the full menu so we lucked out Â Everything we had was exceptional the bacon wrapped dates the paella the shrimp flat bread and the mussels Plus just the bread they served as freebie was exceptional with fresh tomato and garlic on a strip of a nice flavorful focaccia type bread Â  Â The place was so good that I brought my husband back there the next night  again couldnt get reservations so we sat in a cozy little boothnook near the upstairs bar Â It wasnt a fluke the second night was as good as the first and we tried several different things including the shortribsscallops and a ravioli that was just exceptional Â We drank the white sangria Â We ordered a pitcher but they were out of the actual vessels so our server just kept filling our glasses throughout the evening and charged us for the pitcher which ended up being a good deal I think because we took our time ordering food and spent nearly two hours enjoying the food and the atmosphere Â Now Im trying to decide who Ill introduce this place to next outoftown guests pals or plan ahead a bit more and get a real reservation for a romantic dinner for two

Author: Shirley L.
Content: Absolutely amazing restaurantgreat vibe either for a date or for groups If you want the most value go for the tasting menu We had the 65 one which comes with 12 courses including lamb chop prawns and steak All were super super amazing A the end we had no stomach for dessert We paired everything with the rose sangriaWill be back here again for sure

Author: Jennie T.
Content: Ive been to more than a couple of tapas places and Mercat places itself near the bottom of my list I was so excited to visit the restaurant when I was staying at the Hilton across the street but sadly the restaurant disappointed meIt was crowded and we were seated at the tall sofa area was this the waiting area I couldnt tell We ordered drinks and our waitress completely tipped her tray broke the glass and spilled our drinks all over We didnt mind this too much because we could tell that she was new The drinks we ordered were pretty good my friend had something with strawberries in it and I had something with peach I know it wasnt sangrias thoughWe ordered some food and the little tables in front of us couldnt hold all of the food so you eventually moved us to a high table But I actually liked the atmosphere where we were originally seated Upon the waitresss recommendation we ordered the bacon covered dates I dont know about my friend but I didnt really like this plate It was too sweet for me We also ordered the octopus but I liked Cafe Ibericos way better The plate was too bland We also got some kind of flatbread I think it had sausage in it but I dont really remember but I didnt enjoy that either The flavor did not jive with my palate at all Â We ordered a plate of the duck and that was just mediocre I dont remember what else we ordered but whatever it was it wasnt very memorable Although we didnt get to meet the iron chef I was not impressed at all Cafe Iberico will still remain my favorite restaurant for Spanish tapas

Author: Justin B.
Content: Simply the best restaurant Ive been to in years Â I arrived with a large party and was a bit hesitant due to the hypebut Mercat did not disappoint Â We were slightly overwhelmed by the menu  so many options so little time Â Besides we were there to engage in good conversation thats what its about right Â We all decided to go with the chefs choice which varies on a daily basis Â its a three course smorgasbord of culinary delight Â I cant even remember every item we had but some of the highlights were the salad wrapped in prosciutto bacon wrapped dates the rack of lamb and beef tenderloin Â Simply amazingWe were a bit worried by tapas yet we left more than full Â Our server was more than friendly and accommodated our every need alternate choices for a nonseafood eating friend Â The bartender was really nice and actually stopped by our table during dinner just to see how we were doing Â Who does that Â I was quite impressed with the ambiance as well Â The Renaissance owned by Marriott did a fantastic job restoring the hotel as they do with almost every property they own Â The energy was high and the staff remained pretty calm Â It was crowded but we managed to feel like we had our own area and the rest of the dining room didnt bother us Â As mentioned the chefs choice was a prix fixe deal at 65 per person or just around there Â Sangria was flowing as well Â Overall it ended up being just over 100 per person tip included  not too bad for the myriad of flavors and tasty dishes served throughout the evening Â Im bringing outoftowners here every chance I get

Author: Boon K.
Content: This place has become my favorite tapas in Chicago Â I have been there twice since but the second experience was just perfect with Eddie serving us We did not get the fixed menu this time because we might be too full so Eddie got a sense of what we might like He choose a selection of red for our flight and ended loving all three that we needed the names of each The next day we ended up at Binnys buying several bottlesIm almost done trying most of the menu and these are these are my favorites Tocino bacon dates Mushroon Arroz and Padron PeppersThe best part of the meal was the ending Eddie suggested this wonderful fresh cherry puree drink and it was just perfect

Author: Taylor M.
Content: This restaurant and bar was awesome The only reason I gave it four stars instead of five stars was because the hostess said our table was not ready and she would come get us at the bar when it was I told her we would be downstairs and she said she would find us 45 minutes later we realized the hostess never came to get use The bartender went to inquire about our table and the hostess said she could not find us I was not upset because that gave us the chance to enjoy some margaritas I had the last two margaritas on the menu The Fresco was my favorite but both were excellent They were served on the rocks I also had the seasonal sangria which was white wine with apple infused vodka and grilled apples it was fantastic Speaking of fantastic our server was amazing he really knew the menu front and back He gave us great recommendations He told us people typically order 3 dishes a piece My date and I ordered 6 dishes total and were not able to finish My favorite was Conill and Chestnut a really yummy pasta with brandy cherries I also really enjoyed the paella negra and a flat bread with shrimp The food and drinks were fantastic A great place to go on a date

Author: Seema A.
Content: Tapas are tricky as although I love the idea I rarely find dished that jump out at me This place was great Nice ambiancehidden because its upstairs Amazing food and service Nothing we tried was badButternut squash ravioli and the lamb that doesnt come in sauce was amazing The desserts are not your typical Latin flare with flan or fried ice cream I had the hazelnut sliver which was YUM Im not too familiar with Spanish wines so of course I stuck the syrahs and they were great

Author: Nicholas T.
Content: We wanted to like to this place but walking home my wife and I had trouble figuring out a highlight of the entire dining experience Â We were torn between the server he really was trying hard or the apple slices on the cheese plate Â Yes it was that disappointing Â Where to startWhen responding to my question is there a place to check my coat the appropriate response is usually NOT no but I can bunch it up and put it behind the hostess stand Â Seriously Â Is this Chicago Â Are the temps cold in the winter Â Is this restaurant in one of the nicer hotels on Michigan Ave Â There was no chance I wanted our coats bunched up like that so I opted to keep them a decision I would soon regret Â  Good grief could you be sitting any closer to the table next to you Â How many people are you trying to cram in the restaurant Â It was virtually impossible for anyone to enter the booth areas without completely disrupting the dining experience of the adjacent tables Â The waiter had to stand behind the table and shout across to the people in the booths because there was no room Â Oh and those jackets that everyone had with them because they could not check them where do you think they ended up Â On the floor on the dinners next to them under butts like a booster seat Â We went to this restaurant because they advertise Iron Chef Mondays on the website Â Its still listed there as a type this This special offers the tasting menu for 35 Â Well according to our waiter we havent done that in a while while laughing Â Well then take it off your website I cant imagine we were the only people there interested in thatThe waiter was selling us on the tasting menus so we obliged and got the wine pairing for each 1 basic and 1 premium tasting menu Â Unfortunately the chef wont mix the normal and premium tasting menus at the same table Â Not sure why Â If I was dining alone could I still order a single tasting menu Â If the answer is yes you can mix and match the two tasting menus at a table with multiple people Â Are all the single diners in the restaurant on the night we were there not permitted to order off the tasting menu Â There were the same amount of courses on each tasting so its a bit perplexing Â The quality of the food was at best average Â While appealing to the eye the taste was just not there Â Many of the initial tapas dishes were loaded up with way too much bread and lacked any remarkable flavor Â It wasnt by any means disgusting it just wasnt very good Â The two better items on the menu were the short rib flatbread and the garlic shrimp Â Hindsight Id probably get those as my meal if I went backOverall for nearly 250 two basic tastings basic wine pairing tax and tip it was not worth it Â There are many other tapas places in town that are just as a good if not better for a fraction of the price Â Hindsight I should have used the 199 Sangria special after checking in on FourSqaure unless they havent done that in a while

Author: Emma D.
Content: Went for a delicious lunch date We both ordered the Catalan Express cheese plate with two mildnutty hard cheeses really well paired with a sweet sauce and a chutney green apple slices and bread a super hearty saffron rice stew with chicken sausage and shrimp diver scallops which were super buttery and perfectly cooked black angus hangar steak  amazinggg with a crunchy sear on the outside and tender and moist on the insideWe also got a side order of wild mushrooms which were drenched in garlic and butter and reminded me of escargot Given our menu choices we really didnt need the mushrooms  we were stuffed And thus no dessert eitherThe ambience was wonderful huge windows with lots of light and views out to Grant Park an open kitchen in the back but no unwanted aromas of cooking colorful modern decor and attentive service I was impressed that they didnt feel the need to play up Iron Chef linkage at all the food spoke for itself

Author: Cristina T.
Content: Like a few other reviewers we also came here with the Gilt City certificate At around 730 on a Thursday night the restaurant was crawling with businessmen and their clients While we waited to be seated we ordered drinks at the bar If you check in on foursquare there is a 199 sangria dealWhen we were seated we received the pan con tomate which really reminded me of when I lived in Spain Just a simple piece of garlic toast with tomato Delicious We then received a beautiful bowl of Spanish olives some Spanish salami and a cheese plate The salami portion was huge and the flavor was insanely good My favorite part was the cheese selection with apples and a burnt caramel sauce of sorts The meal was off to a great startWe continued with our 2nd course which was a selection of tapas My favorites were the bacon wrapped dates stuffed with almonds They were richalmost could have been a dessert The ravioli stuffed with butternut squash and lamb were also very tastyThe gambas al ajillo were done very well as they were a dish I would often order while living in SpainMoving to the 3rd course I really liked the jumbo prawns with their heads still on There were only 2 of them to share but their flavor was incredible The rib eye was a little tough for my liking and my boyfriends pieces were full of gritty fat The spinach with currants was also decent but was missing something Seeing as I was already pretty full I was ok not loving our 3rd course as much as the 1st and 2ndDessert were small chocolate croquetas that were served with a rosemary caramel and banana marshmallow I thought these were the perfect mini dessert They werent too sweet and the portion was great after such a large meal I enjoyed my time at Mercat The decor is great and the dishes come out at a reasonable pace I just really like to see chefs who are very involved with their restaurants and I doubt Jose Garces will be moving to Chicago anytime soon

Author: Jennifer B.
Content: Situated at the Blackstone Hotel Mercats patio had the perfect overlook of Michigan Ave and Grant Park Â We had snacks on said patio in the afternoon just before we had to catch our plane but I also took a look inside Â Recently remodeled the upstairs restaurant was vibrant with color mirrors and unexpected decorative touches Â I can imagine a really fun birthday dinner up there or something of the sortWe ordered beer wine cheese and olives Â Pretty standard stuff I didnt intend on reviewing but the cheese plate was something to behold Â The pungeant raw cows milk cheese a bit too much on its own was pefectly tamed by some truffled lavender apple jelly seriously thats what they called it Â Incredible combination  never had anything like it Â The olives were pretty standard as were the beer and wine

Author: Jonathan C.
Content: FABULOUS Â We had the Premium tasting menu and it was phenomenal We had a good 18 course as evident by my copious amounts of pictures I may have missed one as my phone died half way through and I had borrow a coworkers to take the rest Â It was quite an experience as food just kept coming out Â The wait staff was great Â They told us if we come back we can just tell them when we came if we wanted to get a similar menu or taste items different from what we tried that time I also dont eat meat and they had no issue with making some comparable vegetable and seafood dishes and accommodating for another coworkers lactose intolerance Some highlights includePATATAS BRAVAS httpwwwyelpcombizphotoso4NcUfco7Â­JxOcyfKFWyAhgselectx4AMKOjwlke6nj3aiCI7RASpicy Potatoes with Spicy Paprika Ailoi ok this in very akin to tator tots and not a super stunning dish but for some reason I cant get the Spicy Paprika out of my mind Â Its been months and I can almost still taste itLLENTIES I CIGORONS  yelpcombizphotoso4Ncâ¦This lentil salad was quite good Â Very creamy and went well with the crisp endivineSEARED TUNA  yelpcombizphotoso4Ncâ¦Seared Just on the bottom and topped with a light oil this was VERY good Â Ive eaten my share of tuna and this we well preparedSTRUBE RANCH WAGYU  yelpcombizphotoso4Ncâ¦I didnt have this but I understand it was a table favoriteOverall a great experience as to be expected of the winner of Food Networks The Next Iron Chef Â The location shares an entrance with the Blackstone Hotel Â Just take the stairs to the right into the restaurantWould definitely love to come back

Author: J R.
Content: Really really expensive for which I dont deduct a star because that should be obvious from reading reviewsmenus Ive eaten here twice Once was a prix fixe menu for Valentines day which was very fun and well worth the 90person that was without wine mind you However some of the things we saw come out of the kitchen looked very good and we had a little bit of buyers remorse not ordering a la carte in the first place Everything tasted fantastic though and we were worried there wouldnt be enough food but we left completely stuffed The second time was more recently and we did a la carte in a group and that worked much better The portions are small as expected but everything was cooked perfectly  especially the seafood Also the rabbit dish was excellent They bring small palate cleansersintermezzos complementary sometimes which was a nice touchOverall this is definitely a SOMETIMES kind of restaurant unless you have the deep pockets for it The decor is interesting and it can get pretty loud because of the open space Perfect for an anniversary nice date or celebration dinner

Author: Carlos B.
Content: We picked Mercat a la Planxa because weve had pretty good luck with other Iron Chefowned restaurants Â The reviews were generally good etc etc Â We were visiting Chicago for a few days and wanted to plan for a couple of highend dinnersIn general though we thought that the tapas delivered by Mercats DegustaciÃ³n de lujo were mostly flat safe andor ordinary and the price was ridiculously high especially with the wine paring Â We chose the chefs menu because of all the rave reviews we had seen online Â Honestly we didnt even look at the rest of the menu Â Ill come back to this laterService was attentive if a little overthetop with the description of the wines little hint of dried peach and chrysanthemum honey really until 23 of the way throughabout the time we ran out of winewhen it turned rather rude When we were done with the last course the waiter whooshed by and plopped the desert menus on our table without saying a wordOK if you dont want details go down to the the wrapupThe first course consisted of five dishes introduced by the waiter as strong flavored tapas all paired with a white wine1 Tortillas with saffron sauce Â Good taste could have been stronger on the saffron but the fact that it was lukewarm was a letdown you expect food that should be hot to be hot2 Cheese with fruit spread and apples Â The cheese was rather ordinary cabra al vino similar to a Manchego and the fruit spread was a pretty good pairing Â Overalleh3 Pan con tomate bread with tomatoes Â Honestly This one tasted like the chef poured a can of diced tomatoes on a piece of bread and served it4 JamÃ³n IbÃ©rico Â This is supposed to be the very best dried ham in Spain similar to an Italian prosciutto only drier and more flavorful and it was good but Im not sure I honestly dont think it was real IbÃ©rico I think they got away with serving regular Serrano ham5 Dates wrapped in bacon Â These were pretty goodThe white wine that was served with this dish was good Â Light slightly acidic smart pairing Â But I was thoroughly disappointed at this point Â I thought wed see more unique daring choicesThe second course was the best credit where credit is due and was served with a fantastic Pinot Noir6 Grilled chilies Â Yum7 Lamb meatballs Â Doubleyum nice and hot8 Rabbit ravioli with truffle sauce Â Very very good9 Minipizza with mushrooms Â Given the rest of the dishes in this course this one was a letdown Â It was just a minipizzaThe last course started promising but then woefully fell apart Â It came paired with a pretty averagetasting red wine dont recall the exact type10 Brussels sprouts Â Delicious11 Risotto with truffle Â Probably the best risotto Ive ever had Â So far so good but then12 Spinach Â Ordinary13 Colorado Lamb chops Â Ok14 Half of a small grilled lobster Â Looked nice but was horror of horrorsovercookedThe wine was ok but the courses took so long we ran out of it before the spinach came out Â So we had to drink water or purchase more wine for the rest of the meal Â My sense is that if tapas come paired with wine there should be enough wine to last the entire courseTapas means tops or covers and it originated in Spain when they would bring out your beer with plates covering the mugs with little bitesized munchies Â For me the thrill of tapas is in a huge way measured by how creatively a chef can serve pretty simple dishes flashfried anchovies braised pig ear cut in slivers stuffed minioctopi shrimp etc Â Many of the dishes on this chefs menu simply didnt fit the tapas conceptThen I decided to take another look at the menu online remember that we didnt look at it carefully at the start of our meal Â WHAT Â Turns out they do have exciting adventurous tapas selections but none of them made it to the chefs menu Â My suspicion is that most people dont order that stuff so thats why the chefs menu is made up exclusively of the blandpalate selections Â What gets me is that the waiter asked us whether we had any special requests food allergies or phobias etc and I told him no no phobias of any sort in fact the more adventurous the better and Im willing to bet we got exactly what everyone else got Â So why askI dont like to compare restaurants too many variables but in this case Ill say this fellowIronChef Mario Batalis Casa Mono in New York City is a FAAAAAAR better place to eat tapas Â Go there and spend your heart out Â You wont be sorryIll wrap it up by saying that when the bill arrived I was pretty bummed Â The whole thing cost 340 no extras except for a Â 12 of a pour my wife had of the white wine during the first course and a tip Â I expected to pay that much Â But I also expected a LOT more quality variety courage to serve offthewall selection andespecially with the winequantity

Author: Varsha G.
Content: This is a classy elegant wine bar that I would definitely revisit Â When it comes to price it is a little on the pricier side but it is worth the experience Â We did a lot of small plates and thanks to the yelp reviews I tried the bacon wrapped dates and I am a huge fan It is an absolute must try Â Service was pretty good our waiter did a great job answering any questions we had and was friendly

Author: Rich W.
Content: Ive tried both the chefs tasting menu and ordering a la carte Â Food is good  flavorful and beautifully presented Â No complaints about that Â However the portion is smaller than other tapas places and the price more expensive Â While I was happy with the food I still felt that it was grossly overpriced Â The whole point of eating tapas is sampling many small dishes  but the a la carte prices are prohibitively high Â Youd have to break the bank to have a true tapas experience Â To add insult to injury the service was not very good Â My waiter in my most recent visit was forgetful and a bit rude when talking to us Â He would have been better suited for places like TGI Friday Â  Seriously so many of these trendy highend places will do so much better in service if they fire their waiters and promote their busboys to be waiters  they are so much more attentive Â Just sayin Â  For now Id still go to Cafe Iberico or Avec

Author: Brady H.
Content: Just posted some photos The food there is gorgeousJust want to say that if the food is supposed to be shared the portions should be large enough to easliy share

Author: Jelly C.
Content: First of all the place is gorgeous I am in love with their tables and chairs If they could tell me how I could get my hands on them Id totally splurge It was a weeknight and it was more busy that I thought it could be The atmosphere is nice and casual with a hint of sophistication here and there Too bad their food didnt live up to the decorWe had 7 people in our party It was mommys bday so I thought it would be nice to try something new BIG mistake I dont remember everything we ordered but we spent upwards 500 so Im sure there wasnt too much on the menu we didnt orderWe gave the flatbreads a try the paella short ribs dates mushrooms baby squid ink pasta fish lobster steak sangria potatoes scallops shrimp etc Almost everything was either underseasoned or oversalted I think the best dish was the grilled rib eye we ordered which is sad because I can make a hell of a grilled steak at home The flat breads came in second to the steak The Sangria was SO boring much different from the way they described it in the menu but daddy managed to finish off the pitcher Our waiter was mucho attentive knowledgeable and nice but I wish he wouldve recommended me to get the chefs selection thing for 55 person because I didnt like the fact that 2 tinyyy dishes came out at a time to be shared amongst 7 people I tried to have our waitor wait for things to come out before he started serving but he said the kitchen was scared that it would be too much on our table As if too much food was a bad thing

Author: Mike S.
Content: We tried Mercat during Restaurant Week this year it was one of the worst Restaurant Week experiences weve ever hadThe server immediately tried to steer us away from the RW menu and pushed their higherpriced tasting menu on us We had to specifically ask to see the RW menu and he begrudgingly brought one claiming that the portions were significantly smaller and that we would need to supplement other courses from the regular menu or we would leave hungry We went ahead with the RW menu anyways its why we came after all and added a few side dishes The couple next to us was persuaded to order completely a la carte and chose several of the same dishes that were included on the RW menuWhen the food came out the portions were identical Waiters brought out the same food for both tables and there was absolutely no difference With the extra courses that we ordered at the insistence of our waiter we ended up with way too much food We felt totally ripped off in the end Combined with the inflated drink prices it was way more than we intended to spend and we couldnt even finish our food I dont understand why Mercat participates in Restaurant Week if they arent willing to embrace the basic principle of itAdditionally the service suffered throughout dinner service Empty drinks and water glasses littered our table for most of the meal Getting fresh plates was like pulling teeth And the bill showed up before we were done eating a huge pet peeve of mineHonestly most of the food was wonderful But with the service we received we will never be back Avoid this place

Author: Ya K.
Content: one of my favorite restaurants during my trip to chicagowe were surprised there were not many peoplehowever it was a rainy holiday the dining area is on the second floor which was a little puzzling when we entered first floor is the bar the very high ceiling and overall decor are very pleasantwe ordered 65 tasting menu and it turns out unforgettable our wait staff definitely downplayed how much food there are in the tasting menueach categorycourse we have 2 to 3 different small dishes for you to share but the food just kept coming and covered our entire tables we had in total tastedcharcuteria cured meatsla peral  cows milkapricotcider mustardtruita de patata spanish omelette with spinach potatoes  saffron aiolidÃ¡tiles con almendras baconwrapped dates stuffed with almondscepesy butifarrawild mushrooms catalan sausage roasted garlic and manchegopelotas de calabaza y cordero butternut squash dumplings lamb ragout beech mushroom escabeche black trufflepulpo con patatas spanish octopus confit potato smoked paprikapatatas bravas spicy potatoes with spicy paprika aioliespinacas a la catalana catalan spinach currants pine nuts  applesand finally the main dishes yes after all thosegambas al ajillo garlic shrimpsteak very meaty and deliciouslamb chopsboth steak and lamb chops came with three different dipping sauces i only remembered one is harissa it was a satisfying feast no doubt many dishes are a first for us all delicious a variety of tastes delicate and beautiful the menu is big with a lot of things so i would recommend trying the tasting menu if you do not have a firm idea on what to order

Author: Karen J.
Content: This place is tucked into the lobby of the Blackstone Hotel which worked for me as I was staying here for 6 weeks straight for work Â I found the food to be very good but not cheap A couple of things that really stood out included the flat bread sauteed shrimp and marinated anchovies Â Yes anchovies Â I never would have believed it either but it was amazing Â I really cant say a bad thing about the food but only a few things stood out given the number of tapas we had Â The wine selection was good and I found the wait staff to be attentive Â The atmosphere was okay but nothing that would knock you over Plus it is the lobby of a hotel I would go again but would have trouble explaining the bill on my expense account Â Did I mention it wasnt cheap

Author: Lisa L.
Content: I thought Amada in Philly had ruined me for all other tapas  but flying to the city of brotherly love every time I wanted Spanish food was really starting to become unrealistic  luckily Mercat right here in my own home town openedThe menu is wonderful and on both of my visits we had amazing service and even better food Â The chef here trained at Amada James Beard awarding winning restaurant  and he is doing to same great things with small plates here that Jose Garces is doing thereThe sangria is wonderful really really wonderful but they also have a fantastic grilled pineapple mojito that rocked my world Â If the menu looks overwhelming do yourself a favor and just order the tasting menu you will end up with tons of food and the best stuff the kitchen is doing that dayI am in love with the goat cheese and balsamic strawberries off the cheese menu as well as anything a la planxa style Â Beware though portions are not huge and prices are relatively high which is part of the reason I think the tasting is such a great value but the food is really well done and I dont think you could fine better tasting tapas in the city

Author: Adrienne C.
