Content: I really liked this place on account of a number of factors1  I like the decor Â It offers a modern atmosphere with out being pretentious Â Its pretty laid back2  All of the menu items have an eclectic mix of ingredients that exceed expectations3  When I struggled in deciding between two desserts the waitress surprised us with our second choice for free while we were eating our first Â And it was even better than what we decided onI tried Cana de cabra queso  very good  next time Â I want to try something a bit more adventurous but it was good Baconwrapped lamb and cherry tomatoes cant remember name but it was under the traditional tapas Patatas Bravas Mussels from the traditional tapas portion of the menu  this way by far one of my favorites Â It was served with charred toast which actually accentuated the flavoring of the mussels Â They were fantastic Toci no con ci dra SlowCooked Pork Belly Cider Glaze Green Apples  Truffle  definitely my other favoriteThe dessert I loved was the Croquetas de Xocolata Â This featured milk Chocolate Croquettes Banana marshmallow ROSEMARY CARAMEL and Arbequina Olive Oil Â I am obsessed with this Rosemary Caramel Â BrilliantI will return soon

Author: Christiana S.
Content: I had a very special dinner here with about 30 people for my partners birthday I never would have thought of doing this and he planned it all out himself Clever guy I knew there was a reason to keep him aroundWe had a special prixfixe menu with multiple courses that was incredibly reasonable at less than 50 each with alcohol up to our own choosing They also allowed us to bring in some of our own wine which was very kind We more than made up the difference in cocktails and a generous gratuity which should be standard for those who BYOB in an establishment with a good wine list Remember that people its only fair to the staffI should mention first that the space itself is gorgeous Great energy high HIGH ceilings and Spanish music that was at the appropriate volume Small bar area which is unfortunate for those without reservations or waiting on their latecomers And now the star of the show the food Oh the foodThe tapas were delicious and filling We ordered ala carte a cheese course before our menu began and feasted all evening The cheeses were wonderful and well appointed with pairings of jams and savory tapenades Plenty of bread Our first course consisted of pan con tomate truita de patata con espinacas and ensalada verdosa Translated for your reading pleasure that means we started with bruschetta a clever potatospinach omelette that was delicious and hard to describe and a green salad Plenty to go around Second course was gambas al ajillo costillas de ternera and datiles con almendras Essentially it was shrimp in a bubbling garlic oil beef shortribs tapasstyle and baconwrapped dates stuffed with almonds OH EM GEE Those dates and shortribs haunt my dreamsFrankly by the time we got to our third course which was chicken and chiorizo paella paella valenciana we were stuffed and it was actually anticlimactic I nevertheless ate my share what can I say Im a trooper and was very thankful that the kitchen was willing to take care of our nonmeat eaters in the group by preparing alternatives to the paella and bringing extra nonmeat tapas throughout the first two courses Thats just a major sign of classOur server who was the BEST patiently took photos of our entire group and did an allaround outstanding job And then they brought us the croquetas de xocolata which have this marshmallowy banana in them as well as the chocolate with candles for my birthday boy Of course we all sang for him and embarrassed him thoroughly Its only fairAn outstanding evening all told and one I look forward to repeating again soon

Author: Jims L.
Content: Great food Really awful service see picture postedWent for lunch Lunch is supposed to be quick I was there for over 15 hours Nothing was as it should be No utensils between courses No water No drink refills Unfortunate

Author: Lauren K.
Content: I visited Chicago recently for work and we decided to go somewhere fun and exciting for dinner one night That led us to Mercat a la Planxa The food was amazing but the experience of dining for hours and trying copious amounts of delicious small plates made the night really special The roasted apple seasonal sangria was amazing and from there the waiter was knowledgeable and recommended some great wines to pair with our food Between the four of us we tried 12 small plates and three desserts and left satisfied and boggled as to how EVERYTHING was delicious I hear about the ham and fig salad and how amazing it is but with all the great dishes I have to say this and the scallop and shrimp meatballs were our tables least favorites The standouts in a sea of delicious were easy to pick out The bacon wrapped dates were phenomenal So flavorful and amazing The short rib and horseradish flatbread was unique spicy and memorable Lastly the butternut squash and lamb ragout dumplings were a dish we talked about all evening There were so many high notes that its hard to call out specifics but if you are ever in Chicago even for a few hours make Mercat a la Planxa a MUST on your to do list You wont regret it

Author: Anthony Z.
Content: Met a friend from out of town and decided to go ahead and order the nonluxury tasting menu Â It was very good everything had great flavor although portion size was borderline small Â Thing is its tapas Â And for 135 pp with a couple of drinks and dessert not included in the tasting menu it was a laughably steep price Â This did include tax and tipNot running back except maybe for brunch which I understand is far more reasonable

Author: A W.
Content: The atmosphere is intolerable and an inyourface reminder of how unlike Chicago this place is Â The food is terribly salty the seating is pretty crammed and it doesnt have a mediterranean feel in its menu options or otherwiseI did like the mushroom soup and their flat breads are good Â My fiance thoroughly enjoyed the squid in its own ink on pasta Â They also make great drinksDo these make up for how overstimulated I was by something that shouldve been relaxing and enjoyable Â No and I hope we can go back to this restaurant as few times as possible

Author: Megumi T.
Content: Really delicious place and  server is amazingI Â Drink is good too Only one complain is too close to the next table but great place

Author: Ross R.
Content: This is a good place to celebrate something special Its unique and the food is interesting Youll end up dropping some cash and you might not be able to hear any conversation but hey youre looking goodTry to get a window seat otherwise youre kind of crowded in and overwhelmed by the crazy high ceilings

Author: Alaina F.
Content: This was one of the best dining experiences I have had in a while Â We were looking for late dining on a Saturday night and decided on Mercat Â We couldnt have made a better decision Â The restaurant was lively but not obnoxious the service was great and the food was absolutely fantasticA few recommendations although I dont think you can go wrong with anything herecheese cana de cabra  goat cheese with strawberry balsamic tapas pimientos de padron bacon wrapped dates spanish octopus flatbread short rib sounds strange tastes unbelievableWe are fairly picky eaters one of us very and we did not have a single complaint during this meal Not one Nothing but great things at Mercat Â I cant wait to go back

Author: Alice L.
Content: My boyfriend and I came to Mercat a la Planxa as a form of distraction from school Catalan tapas sound pretty good when you realize midquarter that classes are much harder than you expected them to be Mercat is on the corner of Balbo and Michigan and conveniently accessible by a ton of buses The entrance to the restaurant is slightly difficult to find though You have to go in The Blackstone and if you enter on Michigan pass through the bar and ascend a flight of stairs to the main dining area The dining room is spacious with tall ceilings and an odd beehive theme We got there a bit earlier than our reservation but were seated promptly in what I consider the best twoperson table in the house at least for a date We each got the Chefs Tasting Menu and he got the pairings as well The meal is broken up into three courses with a couple of dishes eachThe first course came out all at once On the house were a big bowl of olives and a plate of light airy bruschetta Three different servers brought our dishes a plate of cured meats accompanied by crisp bread and various pickles goats milk cheese with crisp Granny Smith apple slices and a mango chutney a spinach and potato omelette It was a good portion of food to start off the meal and because the rest of the dishes are brought out more leisurely you get full at a slow happy pace The second course began with the baconwrapped figs which are just as divine as everyone says they are They came out with a plate of butternut squash dumplings accompanied by lamb ragout beech mushrooms and truffle which was also wonderful These are both dishes that I will definitely order a la carte when I go back probably in multiple portions We were then served a dish of tender perfectly cooked shrimp swimming in a garlicky butter sauce Last was a flatbread of beef shortribs in a sweet barbecuelike sauce with baron parmesan and fresh sprigs of arugula Intentionally or not a decent period of time separated our second and third courses This was probably a good thing as I was starting to get stuffed after the generally portioned flatbread Our last course began with two vegetable dishes patatas bravas ie spicy potatoes resembling tater tots with a rich aioli and Catalan spinich sauteed in vinegar with a salad of thinly shaved apple threads on top I wasnt crazy about either I thought the aioli was a bit too mayonnaiselike and excessive The Spinach dish seemed to have a weird aftertaste but I usually dont like Spinach all that much anyway The meal then concluded on a plate of mediumrare steak accompanied by two sauces The steak was cooked well with a crisp edge but there were some pieces of gristle that I wasnt too fond of We ordered the Croquetas de Xocolata for dessert and wolfed them down immediately The banana marshmallows tasted like dollops of heavy whipped cream Overall we left quite happy and full One of the reasons I decided to come here actually was that most reviews seemed to agree that the Chefs tasting menu was a good amount of food I think its a good place to start but I will definitely order a la carte next time I go especially since the tasting menu doesnt seem to vary much I am really not a big fan of Iron Chef America the Japanese version was overdone in a hilarious way but theres something about the sanitized and glossy production values of the stateside equivalent that lacks the originals kooky charm Still Mercat a la Planxa was pleasant and satisfying My hats off to Iron Chef Garces

Author: Roger W.
Content: I dont think there is any city in the US that can compare with Chicago on the concentration of tapasstyle restaurant Â  Mercat a la Planxa is one of the last Chicago restaurants I visited before relocating out of the midwest Â I made the mistake of reading the dinner menu before heading out there for lunch so I was a little disappointed with the offerings Â However the chef was kind enough to let us order a few items off the dinner menu Â The waiter was also very patient Â He went back to the kitchen a few times to check with the chef on our special requests Â They deserve extra points on the service frontThe dishes we ordered off the dinner menu are Jamon iberico and bacon wrapped dates Â The Jamon iberico didnt quite measure up against my experience at De Rosa in Paris but it certainly had the hint of fruitiness Â The bacon was overcooked and slightly burnt on the dates Â There seems to be a debate on whether the bacon wrapped dates here are better or worse than the chorizo stuffed dates from AVEC Â For me the AVEC version is still the winner hands down Â I wouldnt mind coming back for dinner but the lunch items we ordered werent too impressive Â Well the black angus hanger steak wasnt too bad

Author: Nilda L.
Content: I dont understand why Mercat has such great reviews I saw it Mercat on Check Please so when my husband and I went to Millennium Park we decided to check it outWe arrived without reservations Opps but not a prob We sat outside and it was a gorgeous evening and we had Dancing At the Park across the street Great setting While waiting at the hostess stand this very nice woman obviously a tourist recommend the dates She was so sweet and excited to be there It was cuteThe lounge area was filled with tourists doesnt really bother me just throwing it in here cause I know some people prefer to stay away from touristy areas and this was The service was excellent The hostess the servers everyone was great However the food wasnt We ordered1 Gambas con garbanzo which is a flat bread with shrimp chorizo and garbanzo bean puree Reminded us of a pepperoni pizza with shrimp My husband said it was like a fancy Pepperidge Farm pizza 2 Paella Negra Very salty3 Peolotas de Calabaza y Cordero butternut quash dumplings were ok Not very exciting 4Butifarra Con Judias house made pork and apple sausage Kind of sweet I would prefer to use the sausage for breakfast or brunch with some pancakes and without the truffled white beansThe best item of the night was compliments of the chef the Baconwrapped dates I would have been happy just eating this alone We also had the Ajo y Tomate Flatbread Its like a bruschetta only I prefer brushetta when its warm and crispyDesserts were good Had the Croquettes my husband loved it Chocolate balls with banana and marshmallow crisp on the outside Not badThe ambiance it great service wonderful foodjust eat the dates

Author: Jeanus T.
Content: This is the second time Ive been to Mercat The first time was a couple years ago and was there for a prix fixe It was Ok but it wasnt spectacularThe second time thoughit was last Sat We just ordered from the menu and food was gooooddd Thought was tapas so we ordered 56 dishes to share between two people and turned out to be way too much food and had to pack some home Ambiance was nice too The place is solid

Author: Liliana H.
Content: OVERALLWe bought a Gilt Deal for this place 100 for 2 people and we were really excited to eat here as its only a couple of blocks from our apartment Â We were so disappointed Next time Ill skip Mercat and make the trek to Lincoln Park to go to Ba Ba ReeBa or take a cab down the street to Tapas Valencia Its not even about paying more because we can afford it its about this food not even being worth what they are chargingI dont know what the big deal about this place is Â I found the restaurants ambiance to be lacking and full of old people and probably mostly tourists We went on a Saturday night at 730pm so its not like it was the first service of the night Â I swear the average age of people there was 60 Â It was not a place that I would want to start my night out at like other tapas placesOut of the 10 plates we tried I would only order 4 of those again FAILSERVICEFor a Saturday night Im surprised at the poor planning on Mercats part Â Our server told us right off the bat that he was the bartender and they asked him to fill in for the day so he apologized for his performance in advance and that he may not know all that was on the menu Â GreatCould have been because he was the bartender but even so it does not excuse the fact that we had to have a busboy hunt him down several times to get refills on our drinksFOODFirst CourseChefs selection of charcuterie cheese and olivesnice spread of meats and breadsSecond courseShort ribs with horseradish parmesan and baconthese were like little pizzas with the shredded short rib and bacon on top and parmesanhorseradish as the base Â The horseradish was overwhelming Â We picked out the beef and left everything elseBaconwrapped dates stuffed with almondabsolutely delicious Â By far one of the best dishes we tasted throughout the nightButternut squash dumplings with lamb ragout beech mushrooms escabeche and black trufflesMust try Im not a fan of lamb as it tastes quite gamey but this was excellent Â Great mix of flavors and the dumplings were creamy with a touch of sweetnessSpanish octopus confit potato smoked paprikaoctopus was greasy and chewy Â Also very fishy tasting Â We each ate a piece and left the restThird courseblack angus ribeyevery fatty pieces Â Not worth the pricejumbo prawns with lemon and garlicDisappointed that at a restaurant of this caliber the prawns werent even cleaned properly Â I cut the head off and with it came prawn poop Â GrossCatalan spinach currants pine nuts and applesthis was really good spinach was not overcooked and sautÃ©ed nicelySpicy potatoes with spicy paprika aiolipretty hard to mess up this dish at any tapas place nothing excitingDessertMilk chocolate croquettes with banana marshmallow rosemary caramel and arbequina olive oilby far one of the best parts of the dinnerDrinksWe checked in on foursquare and got a glass of sangria for 199 We opted for the white sangria pear peach and rosemary and liked it so much we got a full pitcherdefinitely could taste the peach schnapps Â And the rosemary was not overpowering Just a hintalso had their charred pineapple mojito charred pineapple infused rum mint lime juice soda Â it was delicious but very limey so if you dont like lime this is not a drink for you

Author: Anne L.
Content: Food was excellent Â Ordered the bacon wrapped dates and the butternut squashTook away a star as the food was overpriced for the servicg size you receive Â You will leave hungryI did not care for the sangriaTook away another star for the service was told that in order to eat outside I would have to order dinner not just drinks and appetizers Â This was at 800 on a Tuesday nightwith tables open Â How pretentious do you have to be

Author: Peter F.
Content: Mercat a la Planxa is the new bar and restaurant addition to the beautifully refurbished Blackstone Hotel on South Michigan Avenue With a relative paucity of stylish bars and restaurants nearby Mercat has the potential to be a star attraction in the area Entry to the restaurant on the second floor is through a curiously small bar which with seats for about ten and a large screen TV seems incongruous for the whole vibe the Mercat is trying to achieve The restaurant itself appears to be a very expensive refit of a large two storey space with a high ceiling gorgeous arched windows naked bulbs and mirrored walls Â  The food is fine but to me it was overworked in presentation and just okay for taste There are no real stand out dishes save perhaps the diver scallops the current seafood belle of the ball and the spinach and prosciutto salad The flatbreads are expensive as are the salads and rice dishes Â We shared the sorbets all three of which were unfortunately a disaster the apple was very fake in taste and colour the lumpy blackcurrant tasted of raisins and was actually inedible the third a very weird cherry oak which made us wonder where the oak flavour came from We didnt finish themThe drinks list is fine with to me what seems a silly choice of 6 or 9oz wine glass serving sizes whats the point and bottles The wine list runs predictably heavy on Spanish wines the verdelho and the syrah I had were fine There are several run of the mill other wines available Mondavi etc Cocktails sangrias and after dinner drinks are also available but I am VERY suspicious of Â a restaurant that includes a STARBUCKS socalled liqueur For fear of encountering further Starbucks products we didnt try the coffee or teaThere seemed to be a ridiculous number of wait staff for what was untimely service When drinks take longer to appear than food you know there is something wrong especially when at one point there were 5 staff behind the bar Odd too was the penchant for two waiters appearing at once one the big silent type who said nothing until contradicting the other his partner a really annoying younger person who asked 57 times if we were enjoying ourselvesHaving spent several hundred dollars on dinner for three I expect a far better standard of food wine and service Maybe I struck it on a bad night  and I hope for Mercats sake this was the case Until I hear otherwise it will be a while before I return

Author: Charla W.
Content: I tried this place out with some girlfriends for drinks and appetizers before we went out dancing on a weekend night I was not a fan of this place and I am a big fan of tapas I have had better elsewhere at many other tapas restaurants in Chicago at least 3 or 4 tapas restaurants come to mind right awayThe place was very overpriced also I would recommend going elsewhere for tapas and for drinks The place even had a stuffy feel to me and was not laid back at all

Author: Tony B.
Content: Had a great experience here last night for a birthday celebration Â Service food atmosphere excellent  what a treat the way the designer set up the space a curving whimsical colorful vertical open space Â Daring contrast to the Classic Blackstone hotel but coexists well with it Â Great menu everything we had was superb I dont remember all the names but 6 tapas dishes for 3 people plus 1 dessert and a pitcher of Sangria left everyone totally satisfied Â Bacon wrapped dates 2 veggie tapas that were the highlights sliced pork olives octopus all greatIT IS EXPENSIVE  if you are a bargain hunter you will not be happy The portions are NOT LARGE for the price Â I feel the quality and friendly but extremely professional service is worth it be all might not agree

Author: Chris H.
Content: Went 2 weeks ago and was looking for a great place to take my girlfriend with atmosphere and good food not that finding either of those is a problem in this town  I left very happy and this is why  My Wallet Wasnt Heavy Anymore just kidding Â  Â love the way that the place just opens up when you climb the spiral stairs to the restaurant The massive windows looking out at the park are impressive but i agree the etching thing is a bit off The service was fantastic polite and attentive  Â  Â We went with the Chefs Choice and You better be hungry because for Tapas it fills you up  choose to go with our servers choice on wine instead of the pairings and was he spot on It was Lent so for my date we asked for a more seafood laden choice and were told Â not a problem we would be glad to do it Â Everything was perfect and the final dish was lobster for two Â WOW Â we were stuffed  Dessert was excellent Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  There are 2 down sides  Only bathroom requires you going thru the dining area back downstairs to the tiny lounge area so what right  and if you are not comfortable meeting new people your in trouble because this place is Packed Tight  try getting up from the booth area without moving entire tableConsidering the pedigree of the Executive ChefStaff Â it should be what it is A place I will go to again and again

Author: amber p.
Content: I give this place 35 stars It wouldve been 455 had the service been better Im not a very picky person when it comes to service but for what it costs to dine here it is somewhat expected to get decent service I may have had 3 different servers which is fine if things flowed right but they seemed pretty confused Also the time between apps and entree was like 45 mins yo thats way to long Anyways on to the positivethe food was pretty awesome I had the dates wrapped with bacon yum the scallops the sea bass very good and a few other things The decor is nice as well I will definitely be returning to give this place another shot with the service because I sure did enjoy the food and ambiance

Author: Elizabeth L.
Content: My hometown favorite La Tasca will be knocked down a peg on the Zagat Spanish  Tapas listWeve been here twice once just the two of us and once with friends from Toronto Â The food is very good and the tapas concept is great for dinner with friends Â The four stars are because we had bad hostess experiences both times and even though we made reservations and showed up a little early we had to wait 15 minutes past our reservation both times Â This is not a HUGE deal but the bar  waiting area downstairs is not huge and crowds up quickly Â Additionally although the food quality and taste is very high the price tag is equally high if not a little higher for some of the grilled meats I think so on value for money this one is about even if not a trifle on the negative side in my bookAll that being said I think this is a fantastic place in a great location Â The decor is hip and fun Â The first time we were there we went alacarte and the 2nd time we did the tasting menu Â The tasting menu is probably better value for money then DIY ordering and is highly recommended  they bring out a great sample of what the menu has to offer

Author: Ash A.
Content: Arrived at the Hilton late Saturday evening and the concierge recommended the conveniently located Mercat for a late night bite Â So glad we went Â The place though unwelcoming on the outside was a delight to the senses once you get to the upper floor Â It was busy but the hostess was very helpful in guiding us to an open table in the sunken bar area Â Had an OUTSTANDING waitress  wish I had got her name The immense windows looking out on to Grant Park gave an open sophisticated feel to the place Great lighting comfy seatingFood  the lobster with vanilla foam from the larger plate section was amazing Â The lobster portion was generous and all the other varied components of the dish made it an exciting and special taste treat Papatas bravas were crisp and came with a delicious aioli Â The creme brulee dessert was superb Â All dishes were artistically presented and the service was efficient and knowledgeable Â Too bad I dont live in Chicago

Author: Chris S.
Content: Go for LUNCH I can totally understand how per some reviews the food seems overpriced and poorly executed Â Our main courses seared scallops and seared ahi tuna were definitely poorly cooked and somewhat sloppily executed Â Likewise the first courses were sort of thrown together a tasty stew of chorizo shrimp artichoke etc and a green salad with asparagus and avocado etc without any creative presentation to speak ofThat said the ingredients and flavors were all wonderful Â The stew was delicious and the celery root and eggplant purees on our main courses were so creamy and wonderful Â So its kind of what youd expect from the forgotten side project of an iron chef Â IronChef caliber flavors and ingredients with line cook executionNow if you were going for dinner and ordered 80 worth of different individual plates which all fell short the abovedescribed compromise might not be a comfort to you Â But at lunch its definitely worth it Â Get the Catalan Express lunch deal Â A soda any first course and any second course in combinations that would normally cost as much as 27 all for 18 Â A great deal worthy of 4 stars despite the compromise in quality

Author: Stacie B.
Content: Ive given this joint 2 tries Â I loved the food the first time dinner tasting menu Â The dates are AMAZING and everyone at the table really liked or loved everything we had Â Second time around same 2 people with me we really liked the food as well  the dishes are perfectly cooked and seasoned and are interestingThe thing that made all of us resolve to never go back is the service Â We easily waited 45 minutes to even get things started at dinner on our first visit and easily waited 30 minutes today for lunch Â In both of these instances the restaurant was half full at bestAdd on top of that the issues weve had with advertised specials Â On our first trip my friend checked in with foursquare and was told that a sangria special for 199 was available Â She ordered that but got nothing but attitude from the bartender Â The same thing happened today Â Dont advertise an offer only to have your staff impose a number of conditions that are not specified anywhere in the offer Similarly on our first visit there was a special menu of which our server and apparently the chef knew nothing Â That menu was also advertised as available online Â We ended up having a really good meal but not until we sat there and waited and waited and waited for the server to figure things outThe service is seriously subpar here and on neither occasion have our servers had any excuse for being as inattentive and uninformed as they have been Â Chicago is full of so many great restaurants where both the food and the service meet expectations Â The three of us will not be back to Mercat which is a serious shame because the food deserves better

Author: Kenneth C.
Content: This months dining excursion coincided with the arrival of some friends Mercat a la Planxa which features an Iron Chef is a Cataloniabased Spanish Tapas place We all went with the prixfixe menu which featured an amazing array of foodOur service throughout was exemplary which is not something I have come to expect from Chicago eateries The decor was rather overthetop and somewhat 70s feeling with a sunken dining room making the bar and kitchen look elevated The Chef Jose Garces was walking around talking to the various tables throughout the night which was very niceCourse 1 We started with a Bruschettaesque entree on thick toasted bread It literally hit all five tastes and was of a sufficient enough portion that one slice was enough for several bites worth of this I actually liked it a lot better than bruschetta because it had an excellent array of spices on it Additionally they served very thinly sliced Chorizo sausage along with a light mustard sliced yellow peppers and gerkins The chorizo was flavorful but not overpowering and sliced so thinly that it didnt end up being fillingAlso they served us little dumplingsized bits of a Spanish Omelette with Spinach Potatoes  Saffron Aioli  this was just amazing and even one of our friends who truly hates spinach ate this It didnt actually taste very spinachy but it was incredibly savory and while not particularly omelettey you could taste the eggs and potatoes very well The aioli was a small dollop but enough to be deliciousThey also served us Manchego cheese along with a sherrybacon powder sauce that I personally didnt like but everyone else adoredFinally they brought out fried pimientos de padrom with salbixada and sea salt  small green peppers with a very very light mustard sauce Im pretty sure I ate half the allotted amountCourse 2 Â We were served dates wrapped in bacon stuffed with crushed almonds and then for the final decadence a cheese fondue sauce was poured over the top They then brought out Patatas Bravas  spicy potatoes with spicy paprika aioli Seriously these were one of the best items of the night  tiny little bundles of mmmmm They served us Arroz con morels  morel mushroom bomba rice fava beans green asparagus  lemon oil An odd consistency but seriously deliciousThen they brought out Gambas al Ajillo  simply garlic in browned butter served BOILING The shrimp was hella hot but sooo good in the simple butter I used the toast the served it with to sop up the sauce and would have poured it into my mouth directly if I could have done it and not looked like a TOTAL idiotThey served us a flatbread Costillas de ternera  beef shortribs horseradish parmeson and bacon As one of our friends said in surprise Hey this has a bit of a bite  it was an incredibly complex bit of food in terms of taste with a bit of spicy a bit of tart a bit of everything SO GOODAdditionally they served us Conill amb chesnut  braised rabbit agnolotti Rosemary TruffleChestnut Puree and brandied cherries This was very raviolii with a very interesting foam on top the puree that had a lot more flavor than youd expectCourse 3 For the main course which doesnt have the awesome descriptions that the above head but does not take away the amazing quality of the food we had Colorado rack of lamb which I am pretty sure everyone at the table pronounced as the best lamb theyd ever had Some sort of beefrelated product we cant figure out if it was skirt steak short ribs or what we are pretty sure though that it was the short ribs and prawns which were served with heads and tails attached though I pulled em off cause yeahAnd then there was dessertCourse 4We had SIX types of sorbet approximately 2 teaspoons of each Turkish Fig Dulce de Leche Chocolate Peppermint Milk Stout Apricot and CoconutChocolate croquettes with creme anglais AMAZINGA chocolate mousse goopy thing with vanilla ice cream on a waferAn orange creme with some sort of citrus compote that orange creme was something specialRice pudding with another sort of creme and a citrus compoteFinally at the very very end in a just one more little mint Sir its waferthin they gave us a pomegranate chocolate cookie thing that was about the size of my pinkie and it was a wonderful end

Author: Jackie K.
Content: The service here was amazing My husband and I went to Spain on our honeymoon so we like to think of a nice tapas dinner a special reminder of that special time The cocktails took awhile but clearly because they were mini works of art The three small plates we ordered were actually enough to fill us up which was generous  the jamon plate was incredible for 9 I definitely recommend this little gem on Michigan Ave

Author: Murphy Z.
Content: The food was very impressive My husband and I chose the prefix taste morning for our Sunday morning visit The six course dishes are way too much for two people And the Bloody Mary bar was also excellent

Author: karma g.
Content: My family stopped in for a late lunch on a Saturdaygreat service and the shorter lunch menu was fine for us Â We ended up ordering a few plates off both the first and second course options and were charged for the lunch special instead of Â a la cartea great dealThe food was delicious and the service was great there was no hovering while we hung out afterwards to talkbut they didnt ignore us completely either refilling drinks and whatnot Â The red wine flight was a great choice highly recommendedWell be returning sometime for dinner the full Â menu looks excellent

Author: Maria M.
Content: Loved it Everything we ordered was delicious and the atmosphere is cozy

Author: Roxy A.
Content: Went here for the first time w a group for brunch yesterday it was my first time dining at mercat but it was a pretty enjoyable experience The ambience of the restaurant is very cute  mod the food  decor are both very colorfulWe had the brunch special where u choose 4 tapas plus one botomless specialty cocktail bloody mary mimosas redwhite sangria for 25 There was a wide variety of choices for the tapas however the menu was a bit confusing at first because it says choose 5 tapas  a signature cocktail however if you order a cocktail w the special then you only get to choose 4 tapas For the bloody mary they had a bar where u can mix in all the ingredientsthe yellow gazpacho was very tastyWe also ordered the paella negra which was large enough to serve our group of 6 It had lobster octopus calamari  shrimpit was very flavorful and if youve never had paella dont let the black squid ink scare you away because you wont want to miss out on this dish Also the manchego bacon biscuits are really good too For the tapas I recommend the gambas garlic shrimp the crab omelette skirt steak sandwich shrimp  gritstheres plenty of choices to satisfy your tastebuds

Author: Dana F.
Content: Was this really Catalan and not some Balearic foam party The blaring techno and cougars made me feel like I was in Ibiza Â Not only was the atmosphere weird and the loud music made it difficult to carry on a conversation Â Iron Chef Jose Garces interpretation of tapas really disappointed me Â At least they have Estrella Damm even though its like 8 a bottle when you can get this in Spain for 2 eurosHeres the rundownChefs selection of three cheeses  Good selection of cheese and nice fruit compote pairingsSerrano ham and fig salad  Good they definitely dont skimp on the jamonTortilla  Nice and fluffy but a little overkill with the onionsCroquetas  We ordered the serrano ham ones and EW Â The inside tasted like cheap supermarket tomato sauce and was all oozyCoca de cepes  Consistency of the flatbread wasnt rightEspinicas  Dont plan on kissing anyone for a few days Â I smelled the garlic in this dish before it was on our tablePatas bravas  I thought this was going to be the traditional comfort food but it was a pretentious version of tater tots overloaded with the paprika sauce Â EwOne of the specials was the tuna wrapped in serrano ham and this was goodDessertChocolate croquetas  Much better than their dinner counterpartsAlmond ice cream  MmmmmPretty sure Iberico is a better spot for tapas in the neighborhood

Author: Donny J.
Content: I was intrigued by Iron Chef JosÃ© Garces place and decided to check it outservice was okay but the menu was left to his discretionTrust me on this one let them choose sit back and enjoy

Author: Sonia D.
Content: Food scene in Chicago never disappoints and this place is one of the many reasons Â I was in town this past weekend for the Chicaho half marathon and stayed at the Hilton Â After the race we decided to come here because we had a friend that had dinner the night before Â It was amazing Â We made reservations for 3 at 2pm but there wasnt a wait and we were sat upstairs right when we go there Â Our server Antonio greeted us as we were being sat Â He was very friendly and made us feel very welcomed and at homeWe started off with the sangria flight which was only 13 and came with a white rose and red sangria Â All 3 were flavorful and delicious Â We were starving since we just finished 131 miles so we ordered pretty quick Â 2 of us ordered the Arroz Â A La Cazuela and 1 got the Ensalada Verde Â The Arroz was amazingit was perfect in every way Â It had a fair amount of chorizo shrimp and chicken and the saffron scented broth was dynamite Â I wish I got 2 more bowls of it Â I didnt try the salad but it looked great Â There was an abundance of avocado which is my favorite and makes everything yummy Â We then ordered our entree and 2 of us got the Vieres I Alberginia and 1 got the Baix Amb Pesol y escabeche Â OMG the grilled scallops were amazing Â and the eggplant puree was a perfect touch along with the artichoke confit Â We also ordered a side of fried with spicy paprika aioli BOMB Â and espinacas ala catalana Â They were pretty tasty and Â perfect touch to the mealAntonio was a pleasure to have as our server Â He was knowledgable and friendly and make our dining experience that much betterIf you are looking for some Spanish tapas and are in the area definitely check out Iron Checf Jose Garcess restaurant you will not be disappointed

Author: Miranda B.
Content: With a hot spot on south Michigan Avenue and dramatic interior design you wish you could feel as though you were transported to Barcelona Â But too many dishes were either bland or basic for this spot to be a real hit for meThe selection on the menu is impressive and the dishes all SOUND appealing Â We appreciated being able to split Mercats gazpacho interpretation made with golden tomatoes and enriched with a bit of crab and caviar Â The briny flavor of the crab was lost a bit in the tomato base though the contrast in textures was appealingGrilled jumbo prawns arrived with their heads on  supposedly an indication of freshness  but several tasted heavily of iodine and one was so bad I had to discretely dispose of it in my napkin  too horrid to swallow Grilled octopus was better nicely charred and flavorful if nothing special Â The best dish of the evening was the cauliflower with the pairing of currants and cauliflower complementing both Â Flashfried piquillo peppers with an almond dip sounded good but the dip was a boring brown with no discernible almond flavor and the piquillos had no heat just a vague herbaceous flavor tinged with oilTasting plate of 3 ice creams looked pretty but none of the ice creams packed a punch even on a hot late summer night Â Service was fine if a bit bossy but none of the individual dishes stood out enough to make me want a repeat Â There are lots of other great restaurants in Chicago so I doubt Id come back here again Â It was just  boring and bland

Author: Yasmeen A.
Content: Im dying to give Mercat 5 stars but Ill have to settle for 35 It has all the makings for the perfect tapas restaurant  a gorgeous array of cured meats cheeses vegetarian rice steak and seafood specialties  but it has fallen just short both times I have been With some simple fixes Mercat can live up to itselfThe high points1  The cured meats plate especially the jamon iberico is delicious I consumed my own weight in this stuff in the Basque country several weeks ago and this was a lovely culinary trip back there2  The 8oz filet mignon was perfectly mediumrare I didnt care much for either of the sauces on the side but the steak itself was todiefor3  Simple but the patatas bravas at Mercat are delicious too Theyre always piping hot a little spicy and decoratively plated4  The cheese plate also has some very interesting accompaniments like olive caramel Unexpectedly peculiarly delicious with the sharp sheeps cheeses5  Prawns a la planxa Perfectly grilled and garlicky They leave the heads on so you can enjoy the best part in the empty cavityThe disappointments1  The pulpo It was chewy The smoky paprika was lovely but I had to pick around the plate to find the softest pieces for my boyfriend so he could taste what it should really taste like2  The paella both times was far too salty and burned on top Its great conceptually loaded with seafood and chorizo but we had to request an additional bottle of water after finishing half the small plate I also didnt care for the overcooked crust on topIts important to mention that the service is wonderful  very attentive courteous and helpful Decor is also a major plus The space is innovative modern and comfortable Although there are a few too many tables and it can get noisy its so visually appealing that I didnt mind The menus  dinner and dessert alike  are memorable for their mix of classic Spanish fare and very unique flavor blends present in many of the sauces Overall a very pleasant dining experience in a beautifully decorated space with a delicious menu Its pricey but I will be back sadly leaving the pulpo and paella behind

Author: Haley T.
Content: Based off the experience of eating lunch here I would come backOur waiter was very accommodating to my veganism Though the menu was not necessarily created with vegetarians in mind I had a lovely meal well worth the price

Author: Steven H.
Content: Had dinner here on a Friday night with my teenaged daughter while visiting Chicago Â We loved it Â What Â a fun place imaginatively designed and with a wonderful and welcoming staff whose menu recommendations were spot onAmong the highlights of our meal were a wonderful cheese plate including one accompanied by a roasted garlic dulce de leche sauce  yum a spectacular serrano ham and date salad perfectly cooked garlic shrimp lobster and squid a la planxa and a wonderful lemon cake for dessert Â A lovely experience and thanks to my friend who recommended it

Author: Meredith K.
Content: The service is always great here Â Very attentive Â They also make some unique cocktails Â I think the food is fresh and unique as well Â This is the goat cheese and tomato sauce kind of tapas Â I was here the other night and got the chefs tasting Â They will accommodate you if youre like me and only eat seafood Â I could list out all of the stuff that we eat but theres not enough room Â Cheese salads lobster shrimp bread potatoes olives Â It never endedWhat I really like about this place is that its open and nice inside without being stuffy too trendy or too loud Â You can come Â here with a big group and have fun or on a date and feel romantic

Author: Courtney S.
Content: Great Spanish cuisine Try the Arroz a la Cazuela with the Ham and Fig SaladAte there twice in 2 days it was so good

Author: Theresa T.
Content: Our party of 5 had the tasting menu that comes in 3 courses with each course comes about 45 dishes Throughout the courses we got to try a variety of things always a plus for the indecisive ones like myself ranging from olives meat  cheese seafood flatbreads risotto grilled veggies lamb and steak Everything was flavorful delicious and came in generous portions We also had the rose sangria that was light refreshing and perfectly complemented the dishes with its interesting twist use of fruits such as fresh cranberry and limes instead of the typical apples oranges and etc I was stuffed by the time the last two meat dishes came around but did manage to save room for the horchata bon bon and dark chocolate sorbette which put a sweet and light finish to the meal The restaurant is inside the Renaissance Blackstone Hotel which has that vintage jazzy Chicago charm of its own

Author: Stephanie W.
Content: Thoroughly solid space for a business dinner even if we couldnt quite figure out how to get in the door at firstOur waiter recommended we order 34 dishes per person so we picked a few that we really wanted and let him round out the rest of our selections We wound up with 10 dishes for four people 3 girls 1 guy and it was still way too much but most of it was thoroughly delicious Here are the standout items 1 Red wine sangria We ordered a pitcher and it was delicious 2 Serrano ham and fig salad It completely wasnt what we expected all wrapped up in the thinly sliced ham but it was delicious nonetheless 3 Seared scallops They were oh my god good with just the perfect amount of olive oil and crispiness at the edges 4 A mushroom flatbread that just floored usMy one complaint is that the items all definitely contained more strong ingredients than were listed on the menu including big chunks of smoky bacon in the salad and shiso which I really dont like and picked off on the flatbread Other than that completely legitimate experience

Author: Gabrielle S.
Content: WowAmazingFabulousI was SO impressed Â Had dinner here with the Bf and his parents and did the tasting menuPLENTY of food for 55 a person Â A pitcher of the seasonal sangria with pommegranite a couple fun drinks loved it allMy favspulpo con palatas Spanish octopuspeltotas de calabrazo y cardo butternut squash dumplings lamb ragout trufflecebollas rellenas garrotxa stuffed cipollini onionsand some croquets dessertPHENOMONALAnd the service was amazing Â I cannot wait to go backAlsothe server warned us it would all have garlic but it was subtle enough that I still really tasted and enjoyed my food

Author: Katy O.
Content: I came here with a girlfriend after hearing rave reviews from friends about this place Â I was not disappointed Â The atmosphere is fun if a bit clubby but you can still hold a conversation without having to raise your voice Â This would be a fun place to go before a big night out Â Our waiter was great and very helpful with making choices off the menu Â My friend is a celiac and cant eat gluten but was able to find several options on the extensive menu Â I triedgrilled octopus delicoustortilla espanola different in that there is spinach in it loved ita hard goats milk cheese with garlic dulce de leche delicious although I would have liked more cheese on the platepork belly SO deliciouscroquetas THE BEST IVE EVER HAD Â The croquetas are so light and fluffy and when you bite into them it is like a bacon explosion in your mouth Â HEAVENcauliflower side dish even the CAULIFLOWER was awesomeSangria delicious and not overly fruity or sweetCant wait to go back

Author: L G.
Content: It was last Saturday night Â Clueless of where to go Â We were staying at the Blackstone Hotel so we just made reservations convenient since it was in the same building Â I have to say the place surprised me Â Cool atmosphere excellent service great food and yummy drinks My boyfriend and I have never eaten at a Â tapas place Â We couldnt decide what to order so our waiter suggested the chefs special which was 55pp Â It included 89 dishes that the chef picks Â Honestly when our waiter said that we would be satisfied and full with the meal I kinda didnt believe him Â Tapas are small plates I didnt think 8 would fill me up but I was wrong Â By the time the steak slices came at the end my boyfriend and I were pretty full Â The dishes were presented very nicely and they were all tasty Â  Fantastic variety Â I would definitely go here again

Author: Jenna S.
Content: First let me say I love the decortotally my style They have two tables on a loft style level which were closed when we came but would have been off the chain to sit and watch from above Maybe next time Service started out awesomeand dwindled down to subpar as the place picked up and got busy Almond stuff dates rocked my world and most of the plates we were ordered were very tasty The server mentioned that they would automatically course and pace our dinner which again started out off to a great start when the place was about half fullbut then all of a sudden SLAM We had 6 plates for 2 people sitting on our table getting cold Just to warn youif youre on a romantic date tables are very close together and it might make you feel claustrophobic and as if youre on a double date with the couple sitting next to you I also noticed how there were several parties happening on a Friday evening which got a little out of control and the staff didnt seem to notice or say anything about the level of volume and drinks being spilled everywhere Overall it was an OK experience for which the quality and taste of the food made up for Might not be a regular dining experience as it tends to be a little more pricey than the average fare of the South Loop but good for a nice evening

Author: robert s.
Content: When you Yelp it poursSo my mom is up from Indianapolis to meet me in Chicago Â The purpose of the trip is shopping for clothes a chair and a couple excellent mealsAs always the help from fellow Yelpians was invaluable Â As they helped me figure out where to take my mom shopping Â Which was especially helpful since I only posted my question the night beforeyelpcomtopicchicagosâ¦So were staying at the The Standard Club smack in the middle of downtown and after a day of shopping its gotta be close for my momTime for a game of Yelp Roulette Â I decide Tapas would be a nice treat Â Less than a mile Â And Pow Â Faster than the government can spend a dollar theres Mercat a la Planxca Â Highest rated place and less than 5 blocks Â Open Table a res for the next night and back to watching hotel TVWe had an early 6 30 res which I think is good because you can enjoy the place as it fills up Â The waitress was friendly smart and attentiveWe had the gratin special of the day which I think should be sent up from the minors to the main menu  looks like it was Â gratin de coliflor garlic shrimp asiasi Â arroz del morels excellent and the spanish omelette big and good Â The decor is lively Â The music just a pinch too loud Â And the food was amazing Â The chef stopped by to say hello Â A nice touchFor dessert we had this incredible chocolate puddingtorte with a tasty sweet shell on top with ice cream inside Â So Ive heard if youre leaving Chicago on the Indiana Toll road they stop you at the toll booth and ask if youve been to Mercat a la Planxa if you say no they scold you and double the toll Â Fortunately we were covered

Author: Brett K.
Content: Cant believe I neglected to review for our previous dinner trip sorry Mercat Â Dinner as spectacular on my first visit wine flights were right on with the food Great attention to detail and tradition but yet ingenuity in every dish Â The restaurant is a great atmosphere in the historic Blackstone hotel a very nice touch Drinks service and pace right on Now onto the brunch Â The russian roulotte peppers are deliciously flash fried and one in about ten will send you reaching for your drink fun for everyone the redpepper almond garlic sauce was the high point there Â The most flavorful read gloriously buttery dish by far was the chorizo redpepper brioche eggs benedict just wow  avocado crab on crustini suckling pig salmon whipped egg yolk and potatoes cheese fruit and cured meats truffle eggs the list goes onDeserts were amazing blackberry cobbler bars and banana carrot cakes were just insaneEverything here plus juice and coffee or bottomless sangriabloody marys 8 is 25ea yepEverything Ive ad Mercat has been great but if you can only go once go for the brunch

Author: Lala S.
Content: The last time I reviewed Mercat I had dropped them down from a 5 star to a 2 star I was sad to have to drop their stellar reviews but Mercat has more than redeemed itself based on the sincerity of the staff and their quick response to issues we had mentioned Needless to say Mercat will remain a 5 star restaurant especially after tonight Im glad to say that I will continue to return to Mercat for their high quality food and their great customer serviceI was promptly contacted by the Chef de Cuisine and we were invited back This time service was stellar and we had a wonderful time there Our server Fred is probably one of the best servers I have encountered in a long time He was very personable and friendly In addition all of the issues that i had noted from my last dining experience there have been corrected and service was even better than beforeWe started out with the appetizer special which was an Oxtail Empanada The dough was nice and light and wasnt greasy at all The oxtail was delicious and tenderWe also enjoyed the Pulpo Con Patatas which was tender and had a nice smoky taste In addition we ordered the Arroz ala Cazuela which was just divine It was super flavorful and all the flavors were married really well I would definitely order this again Now the show stopper The half SUCKLING PIG was amazing It was perfectly seasoned and had tons of umamiThe skin was perfectly crisped The table side presentation was also awesome The chef neatly separated the parts of the pig while giving us an explanation and even discussed the process of cooking the pig with us which was really nice We are the adventurous type so we took advantage of the head and tried the jowl brain and ears The brain was prepared with a cherry gastritis and it was magnificent If you can try the suckling pig do soThe pig was accompanied by wilted spinach w apples fingerling potatoes and rosemary white beans all of which were delicious as well Im so glad we went back Mercat a la Planxa you have won my heart once again

Author: stacy d.
Content: This is one of my favorite restaurants in the cityIve been multiple times and thought it was about time that I write a reviewTry the chefs menu You will get three courses with about 15ish small plateseach little taste they bring is absolutely delicious The lamb chops are the absolute best I have ever eatenunfreakinbelievable The wine pairings are fantastic too I have yet to be disappointed The staff is always super friendly tooOne of my favorite things to drink here is the absinthe The whole process is festive from the absinthe fountain to the flamingsugar dripping into the drink Love it they will even bring you some soda to water down the hardcore flavor of the liquor if you want

Author: Sherie P.
Content: This is my first Yelp review so please bear with me Â I met up with a girlfriend at Mercat a la Planxa after finding out she was in town on short notice and it was right by her hotel Â I am so glad we wentFirst we didnt have a reservation and they were gracious enough to seat us on the patio Â It started to rain and we were sat right away inside Â We had a wonderful waiter who was very patient since we had never been before and were trying to catch up after 4 years of not seeing each other Â We ordered a bottle of wine and then the fun beganThey started us off with this very tasty tomato bread Â Yum Â We just ordered a few dishes to share Â First was some grilled prawns Â YUM Â They were simply made and very good Â We had the ESPINACAS A LA CATALANA which was this wonderful spinach with apples and nuts and raisins Â It was my girlfriends favorite thing Â we had the TRUITA DE PATATA Â because I cannot resist a Spanish omelet at a tapas place Â It was good but very small Â And we had the Mar i Muntanya i which was this amazing veal sausage Â It came with some potatos and some octopus that I really didnt care for but the sausage was delicious Â Now dessert Â OMG Â We got these little banana chocolate croquette things with caramel toasted marshmallow and some rosemary infused olive oil Â I though it sounded weird but they were sooooo good Â I would go back just for those Â If you go youve got to try themThe waiter recomend we get 3 to 4 dishes per person to share but that was enough for us Â I would say that had I taken my boyfriend more dishes would have been ordered Â I really liked it and would definitely go back Â Next time I will try the chefs tasting menu and still order my desert

Author: N S.
Content: We visited this lovely little spot for a special occasion with a group of 10 The service was near perfect as was the meal We chose the option of having the chef select our courses for us At 35 per person we had double to triple the amount of food that we had expected especially for a Saturday lunch Items ranged from spicy sausage buttery pesto scallops rare grilled beef to wild mushrooms flavorful fresh spinach and apples fruits vegetables meats and cheeses All the perfect sized portions for everyone in the group to nibble to satisfaction My stand out favorites are the Spanish roasted peppers and a seafood sausage and rice soup with a fried crostini and smoked paprika aioli Dont for get to sample a cocktail or glass of house sangria if you are so inclined We enjoyed a grilled pineapple mojito that really hit the spot on a hot summer afternoon

Author: Drew B.
Content: This place was brilliant Â I havent had a chance to go to some higher end places in Chicago yet so when an opportunity to go here came along I jumped at it Â Service was great even though we were there close to closing Â We managed to get our orders in before the kitchen closed and they were all brought out in quick succession and were well prepared Â The bacon wrapped dates were wonderful Â And it was kind of scary how flavorful the bruschetta was Â We had great squid paella Â Everything we ordered was delicious basically

Author: Palak D.
Content: We went to this restaurant last october on my birthday The ambience music  people were lively  rocking Though we are vegetarian we had lotta options herWe started off with the 3 cheese platter Mixto which was deliciously satiating  feast for the gastric senses  a visual treat for the eyes we then had the patatas bravas which were spicy potato with spicy paprika Aioli You can keep on eating them without a pause we ordered one more plate towards the end we then ordered the Arroz con morels bomba rice with aspharagus lemon  morel mushrooms The restaurant is a bit expensive considering the small plates but as they say good things come in small packages  Lovely food Lovely music Lovely experience  a perfect place to celebrate the perfect day

Author: Libby P.
Content: Well our meal was tasty though I would have to say that some of the dishes were a little off The decor is beautiful but there is pulsing loud music the whole time If you dont like eating to a beat you better not go in this restaurant We had paella negra which was very tasty and seafoody but much too salty However when I bit into a big chunk of octopus I felt like I was hanging out in a tide pool in the sun It was a most delicious feeling though I got only two big chunks of octopus We also had some goats milk cheese with green apple slices and garlic dulce de leche I know garlic Dulce de leche It was so good that I didnt understand why no one else was putting garlic in their dulce de leche We also had rabbit in homemade pasta Mike had to convince me because you know rabbits but this was my favorite dish It came out with foam I love that Mike doesnt with brandied cherries under I was worried theyd be too sweet but they were not and brown butter sauce and pureed chestnuts all over It was delish It was so delish that I sat there and ate the sauce with my fork while my boyfriend sat there and judged me The only issue was that the rabbit was a little tough though I understand thats the name of the game with game For desert I had chocolate mouse with some sort of crackly hazelnut and sugar shell espresso hanging out in the shell and sweet cream gelato on top It was good but unlike all the other dishes it was too big to finishSo a good meal but I would have been happier paying about half as much for it as it had issues Mike and I each had a pretty small and unremarkable glass of sangria we had three dishes dessert and an afterdinner cocktail for Mike It came to around 80 without tipBy the way the service was really stellar But dont get indigestion or drink too much water because the bathroom is all the way downstairs

Author: Akira O.
Content: I was staying at Renaissance and Mercat was a convenient choice for a late dinner on the day of arrival The food was pretty solid I liked the boquerones but nothing else particularly stood out Other than the word planxa I wasnt sure what was basque about the restaurant Having lived in Spain I always struggle tapas joints that charge 23 times more than what youd pay in Spain for not so great tapas

Author: Mike G.
Content: Consistent quality and exceptional service Â Hard for a restaurant to keep its edge but Mercat does

Author: Jessica K.
Content: Really a 35 Â In summary the food was great didnt have one thing I didnt like and with 6 different people with varying taste buds and a tapas assortment of 20 different plates  that is really impressive Â The atmosphere was beautiful fun location over Michigan ave with high ceilings and open kitchen Â The bad was the service Im not really sure who are waitress was or what she was doing and this made the experience a really awkward 35 hour ordeal when it could have been a nice leisurely 2 and then I would have said 4 stars no problem Â But yup no such luck so I have to give it a 3 Â Now to the goodSangria yum delicious just the right amount of sweet fruity and brandyall the food was delicious my faves in particular tended to be the vegetarian dishes Â I cant recall particulars but they were goodThe dessert really was great we had some time of one bite ball that when it hit your mouth warm chocolaty goodness came out and whoa one bite of wow Â very memorable Â All in all a good meal good atmosphere just the service was so slow I cant go any higher Â And Im not talking about the nice even pace when the tapas came out Mercat had that down to a science and that was great Â But that didnt rely on our super slow waitress who I honestly dont even know if she was still working during that Â It was the awkward OK I would like some coffee now that Ive been done eating for 30 min awkward slow that really made the situation bad Â It was the awkwardness of not having drinks offered or my glass full of water Â Oh well that little ball of chocolate goodness will likely still bring me back

Author: Isaac V.
Content: The food was really good I especially enjoyed the bacon wrapped dates with blue cheese sauce Heres a warning for you We made the mistake of ordering 2 paella plates for two of us and discovered a short time later that one paella plate feeds like 4 people My only complaint is the wine is marked up several hundred percent I look forward to calling ahead for a special occasion and placing an order for the suckling pig

Author: Jeffrey M.
Content: I order the luxury tasting menu and it finishes with a mushroom dish and Im then asked if Id like to see a dessert menu This is a fucking joke right What kind of a tasting menu doesnt include a couple dessert dishes after your savory courses How do you finish the savory portion with a mushroom dish after I already had some pretty amazing lamb chops The savory portion should conclude with something grand What a fucking train wreck That being said there were a couple solid dishes in there but overall nothing too exciting

Author: Melissa F.
Content: After coming here my tastebuds were more grateful than a horde of preteens at a One Direction meet and greet LAWD this place is delicious I met my cousin and his gf there for a 530 dinner They had already ordered red sangria so I had some Far from the cloying hot mess that sangria is with generic fruit bits and cheap brandy throughout this truly tasted like red wine So far so goodAlmost everything you can order here is tasty  at least everything we ordered was I like how this restaurant has so many options too The ONE negative thing is that the portions are tiny and the prices are skyhigh That much makes the restaurant very much a NOT everyday sort of place Still I think the flavors are so good that its worth it every so often Helpfully the service is relaxed and friendly Our waiter and my cousin had a nice time chatting about scotchThe presentation itself is fantastic but even the presentation doesnt match the sheer quality and taste of the ingredients themselves Perhaps the best example is the side of mushrooms  we ordered two in total My cousins gf and I thought These look and smell good I bet we will enjoy them Then we ate them The intense flavor of the woodroasted garlicky but not overly so mushrooms  with bits of eggplant and potato chunks  were beyond our expectations Our cousin wondered if they could be that good Then he ate them and you could tell that he agreed The sizzling gambas al ajilo were perfectly executed and Im still drooling thinking about the oil and garlic in which they were cookedThe potatoes are a tiny portion well plated to boot Their smokiness is almost overwhelmingly intense The pork belly was also great  not too fatty with a nice light sauce that balanced the dish The croquetas were smoky and intensely flavorful tooI am forgetting what other dishes we had but they were outstanding Ive had good tapas before But the flavorful dishes of Mercat a la Planxa make it one of the most delicious restaurants in Chicago Period

Author: Peter L.
Content: Not cheap but solid creative food in a town full of good options for tapas Went there with a large group and ended up doing the tasting menu and while 58 per person might sound a bit high we definitely got our moneys worth The courses went something like this  chorizo and chaucuterie  goat cheese with apple slices and a balsamic vinegar and strawberry mixture  pulpo con patatas octopus and potato  peltotas de calabrazo y cardo butternut squash dumplings with a lamb ragout  grilled scallops on a skewer  Lima beans with serrano ham  rice with morels more like a risotto  flat bread with braised short rib  meatballs  rack of lamb with an aioli and romesco sauce  grilled ribeye with the same aioli and romesco sauce All of the dishes were good and there wasnt a bad one in the bunch 11 dishes But the standouts were the scallops and the flat bread The scallops were perfectly cooked and could not have been any fresher while the braised beef was incredibly flavorful We also ordered a few desserts to share but they were largely forgetful Overall Mercat was an unexpected surprise in an area void of decent dining choices

Author: Joyce H.
Content: I came here for the lunch pre fixe with my brother and dad while visiting Chicago Overall I enjoyed myself here Fun atmosphere and I was very satisfied with the service Our server gave great recommendations tooNotes on the pre fixeI loved the ARROZ A LA CAZUELA chicken chorizo tiger shrimp soup It was full of flavor not too heavy and just the right amount The diver scallops 2nd course were deliciousSerrano ham  fig salad  tasty but didnt blow me out of the water Enjoyed the way the shellfish croquettes were plated The terragon emulsion is what made the dish

Author: Greshka P.
Content: 830pm Sunday after a whole day of meetings and walking the Housewares Show my coworkers and I are ready to sit relax and eat To be honest I wanted to try a new restaurant but the others were too tired and since one of them was staying at the Blackstone Hotel we decided to eat at Mercat again Have to say Im really happy we did Starting with service  bartender waitress servers  theyre all friendly helpful and have a great attitude This time I had the Sangriatini which is basically a red sangria but they add cava sparkling wine which makes it even better and refreshing As appetizer we ordered the Olives Wish they sold these in a jar or something they would be great for a cocktail night with friends delicious As entree I had the Tocino con Cidra slowcooked pork belly cider glaze green apples  truffle and Setas Al Horno wild mushrooms confit potato shallot  parsley The Pork Belly melted in my mouth perfectly cooked Thought Mercat couldnt impress me more until I had dessert We ordered two for the table One was a chocolate coffee mousse with a sort of caramelized hazelnut sugar cup with ice cream  amazing  but the best one in my opinion and I would totally mention this in The Best Thing I Ever Ate  if I was in the Food Network Â is the Croquetas De Xocolata milk chocolate croquettes banana marshmallow rose mary caramel arbequina olive oil You have to try this If youre ever in Chicago try your best to go to Mercat a la Planxa Chef Garces Chef Fiorello and the rest of the staff have created amazing dishes and a wonderful environment for us to enjoy

Author: Kaitlin M.
Content: I must say I am a tapas snob The beauty of tapas is that you get a taste of many different dishes That however is the downfall of tapas at the same time Since they are smaller portions the dish has to be made perfectly there are only a couple bites that determine whether the dish is good or not With that in mind Mercat is the best Spanish style tapas that I have had in the city All the dishes we ordered were very good not bland or cold or over cooked all of which are easy to do with tapas I must make two specific recommendations on the behalf of my date and I we LOVED the scallops and he is typically a meat guy A La Planxa and the Chocolate Croquettes for desert If you go try both you will not be disappointed By the way I typically do not go for pitcher of Sangria when eating tapas because it is typically too sweet and made with too little alcohol Mercat however has some very good sangria let me know what you think

Author: Jessica N.
Content: Ive been a here a few times to do the tasting and once during Restaurant Week and it has never disappointed If you are here with a group I highly recommend the tasting Its very affordable for a tasting everything is served family style and you get to try almost the entire menuSome of my favsFried Peppers  Really unique Ive never had anything quite like it Arroz de Casuela  A mix between Paella and CioppinoGambas  perfectly cookedAll the meats are cooked perfectly with amazing steaks You wont go wrongDessert  Theres one with fresh marshmallows thats to die forFun for groups great for entertaining

Author: John T.
Content: I wouldnt call this restaurant an authentic Spanish Tapas restaurant rather they serve Spanish inspired Tapas with a creative twistand they do come up with some interesting and delicious twistsListen to your server when they recommend the tasting menu it is the best value and you get to try some incredible dishes that you would never try otherwise Â They offer tasting menus with or without wine pairings and you cannot go wrong with either Â If you dont care for wine then try their SangriaAt first we were bit worried as the table are close together Â But soon we struck up a conversation with our neighbors and spent the evening talking about all the great dishes we triedAnd when you leave take a walk through the beautiful lobby of the attached Hotel Blackstone

Author: Carrie S.
Content: Some of the best sangria I have had in the US Â Made me miss SpainIf you are a Foursquare person when you check in you can nab a sangria for 199 Â Totally worth itWonderful tapas style menueach taste I had with a large group was well presented and flavorful Â It was easy for me to dine here with my gluten allergy although it took a little navigation Â Usually I am not a huge fan of hotel restaurants but this place was absolutely fantastic Â You should definitely dine here if you stay at the Blackstone or stop by after a long walk through Millennium and Grant Park Â It will be worth your time Â Eat outside and enjoy the view

Author: Anita S.
Content: Oh my Â One of the best dining experiences Ive ever had in ChicagoKiller Sangrias Â Killer bitestapas Â Flavors were incredible Â Spices were perfect and presentation was as elegant as can be Â Our waiter was wonderful Â And this is his job while he is going to law school Â I wish we had career wait staff in Denver even 13 as good as this guy Â Fabulous and wonderful Â Cant say enough about this place

Author: Ben S.
Content: 540 reviews thus far so there is not much more I can add Â Wife and I had a phenomenal meal there last night and thought the tapas were as well crafted as most that we ate during a twoweek trip to Spain earlier this summerOf note  the pan con tomat is delicious and very reminiscent of the flavor of what we ate in Barcelona if not the same construction Â Still it brought back memoriesAt the end of the meal we both agreed that the baconwrapped lamb was our favorite dish

Author: Dax R.
Content: The food is very good Â Almost everything you order is delicious Â Also I like that they have a rewards card for their frequent diners Â As I entertain here quite often I take advantage of the rewards from spending 5001500 per meal Â My only gripe is that they cant get the Â Gambas a la Plaxa right Â When I order this 2 or 3 of the shrimp always taste like it was dead for too long Â I love sucking on the heads and that is the first thing I do Â It kind of spoils your appetite when you get a bad one Â I do sometimes order this just to see if one day they get it right

Author: Jerrold S.
Content: The best tapas Ive ever had Â It was the 3rd tapas place Ive eaten at in 3 weeks and clearly the reigning champion of all tapas Â The bright deep complex of all the dishes really stood out Â Bold great pleasing flavorsFavorite dishes of the night chocolate bon bon dessert was amazing Â maybe the best bite Ive had all year scallop on the planks succulent perfectly cooked and tasty as hell pork belly was so tiny but amazing Â lacquered and crispy skin Â Delicious bacon wrapped dates kick AOCs ass to the curb croquettes melted in your mouth either the best or 2nd best along with the Bazaar garlic shrimp was garlicky goodness they didnt skimp on the garlicThey have a beer here than Ferrian Adria from el Bulli made a limited addition of Â It was a big 750ml bottle Â You should order it Â It has an unbelievable bouquet for a beer and the flavor profile was something that you wouldnt expect for a beer Â Wonderful accompanying beverage to our meal Â A really nice surpriseEvery dish we had with the exception of a tuna dish was memorable Big bold Spanish flair Â The best restaurant Ive been to in Chicago Â Probably doesnt mean all that much since I havent been to Alinea or Girl  the Goat Â Highly recommend

Author: Frank W.
Content: Okay I admit it Im a fan of the Food Network despite the evilness of Brooke Johnson that Tony Bordain has so eloquently documented and Jose Garces really seems like a likable fellow Â But the best part Â He runs a great restaurant Â This is our third visit to Mercat a la Planxa its become a part of our ritual when visiting Chicago Â Cant think of a single tapa that we have had that wasnt good here Â Some suggestions The pulpo con patatas octopus with potatoes is one of the best renditions we have ever experienced the octopus succulent and tender almost melts in your mouth The pimentos de padron are lovely grilled just a tad and dressed with some olive oil and coarse salt You simply cant have tapas in my book without jamon iberico de bellotas the REALLY good stuff and the plate here is very generously covered with those ethereal little slices of piggie goodness  25 may seem like a lot but when you consider what this stuff costs retail even in Spain its actually good value for your money The dates with almonds are a very nice version of this dish with the unusual twist of a silky cheese sauce drizzled over the top Make sure to ask for some of the tomato bread not the classic pan tumuca but an interesting variation using bread similar to foccociaThere is also a very good wine selection with some excellent and not frequently seen selections from a wide variety of Spanish wine regions and a reasonably intriguing list of cocktails and specialty drinksWeve never made it past the tapas menu so cant comment on the main menu dishes but if they are anything like the quality and brilliance of the tapas this is a real winner

Author: Michelle M.
Content: I came here to celebrate a special occasion We had reservations and werent seated until 30min That is a walk out for me but since my boyfriend wanted to try this place we stayed Maybe the fact that we had to wait so long left a bitter taste in my mouth This place is so stiff that I didnt feel comfortable being there The food is just ok Drinks were great and this place is so amazingly beautiful

Author: Alison B.
Content: The food is good fresh and fun but I am giving it 2 stars because I paid for but wasnt able to eat the paella I have an allergy intolerance to onions and therefore called ahead to order paella the day before We began with tapas and the flights of sangria The flights sampler of sangria was totally worth the 13 The cheese and meat platters meh The meat sampler has a good quantity but the slices of cheese were small The sauces they come with are fun but nothing to rave over Heirloom tomato salad with feta was yummy good for sharingThen comes the paella The nice thing is that they give you a time it will come out so you can pace your tapas eating accordingly However it had onion Ugh The waitress told us so sorry I got the message about the paella but there was no mention of onion Hmm ok She said she would check in the kitchen for an alternative and said that this never ever ever happens but they will make an exception and make me a small paella She promised it would be quick so I agreed Here comes the baby paella super it looks DELICIOUS I dived in with a big woo hoo sausage crispy rice fresh tomatoes a crapload of parsley wtf and ONION Seriously She confirmed with the kitchen The chef cleared it but the message didnt get to the cook How big is this kitchen They said theyd make another My friends were already done with their food and my meter was about up I was embarrassed that this had to turn into an ordeal I said I didnt need anything else and I just needed to leave The manager came over to apologize and brought lamb ravioli That was nice since I didnt order it But I didnt like it mooshy gravystewlike sauce but great pasta and again was just embarrassed that this was holding up our check They also brought out comped dessert 4 pieces of chocolate covered cinnamon ice cream over a rice krispie They were good but awkward to eat too big to be bite sized but not easy to bite into Luckily the check came afterward so no one was looking at eachother
