eat we were busy bulking at the checkI am REALLY REALLY sad that I couldnt eat the paella And I spent 50 walking away hungry Luckily I didnt get sick from the onion it can get pretty bad Im used to orders getting screwed up but I expect more of place like MercatAlong the lines of other reviews the decor is good service is decent its hard to find the door to get in its up on the 2nd floor Its a nice date place but dont expect much for special requests

Author: John M.
Content: I travel for work a bit Â When I travel I almost always travel alone so thus I eat alone etc Keep that in mind with pretty much all my reviews unless the review is in Dallas Â I stopped in for dinner one night Â I was staying across the street at the Hilton Â The entrance to the restaurant was through the Blackstone however they do have a street entrance it just was not open on this night The place was pretty busy maybe 80 full Â I asked for a seat in the bar my favorite place in a restaurant to eat when traveling read first note about traveling alone Â and got seated at a bistro table that overlooked the whole restaurant Â The restaurant looked relatively small or at least smaller then i expected Â they had a decent selection of beers Â The only wheat beer big fan they had was blue moon I like blue moon but its on the not that list so I decided on my typical standby Amstel light Usually when there is a tasting menu that is what I choose but I was not that hungry and for some reason was a little reluctant to do that while alone which never stopped me beforeSo I ordered the mixto of cheeses and meats Â this is 2 different dishes Â They have a mixto of meats and a mixto of cheeses Â I thought it odd that they didnt have one of both Â each one came with 3 of the chefs selections I would imagine you could request a particular one or more but I did not Â I do not know which meats I had sorry I guess I was not listening to what the server was telling me but they were all great Â They were cut very thin which for some is ok but on the salami I would have preferred it cut a little thicker Â  It came with some pickles some country mustard and some great little sliced peppersthe mixto of cheeses I got was the cana de cabra the aragons and ombra Â They all were very good Â The can de cabra surprised me the most Â I am not a big fan of brie this one by its self had that nutty taste that brie has Â but when accompanied with the balsamic strawberries it was awesome Â They all were greatI also was brought a complimentary order of tomato bread Â I dont know if they do that for everyone or if it was because I am ridiculously good looking but it was out of this world Â I looked at their menu online and could not find what it is called but I swore that is what they said when they set it downThe service was good Â My waitress was timely and helpful Â My only small complaint is that i wish they would have suggested parings for the meat and accompaniments Â By the time I had gone through several variations and found the one I wanted I only had like one piece left Â Also I was dissappointed to see when I got back to my room that it is restaurant week in Chicago No one mentioned this at the restaurant Â so they lose points for thatOverall very good Â one last thing Dear Restaurant Webmaster remove the music from your site Â I had the site up while typing this review and it almost cost you a star Â You are lucky there are no Yelp half stars Â one more last thing Â Mercat a sounds a lot like Merkin which makes me giggle

Author: Lauren S.
Content: Loved this place The restaurant is beautiful The sangria flights are a must We couldnt decide which paella to eat so we ordered both First off the bacon wrapped dates for an appetizer were amazing We had the chickensausage paella and the all seafood paella with black rice Both were awesome but if I could take the chickensausage paella and add shrimp or calamari it would be the perfect dish The mussels in the seafood paella felt dirty a bit too gritty for my tasteOverall loved this restaurant and would go back in a heartbeat

Author: Frank A.
Content: I truly loved this place and Im super excited to go back soon The entire ambiance is amazing however I stress the importance of reservations Mercat a la Planxa is located in the Blackstone Hotel on Michigan Ave and is an upscale tapas restaurant and it gets busy I was so happy I had reservations because it was a Friday night and it was crowded I had dinner with my BF and we opted for the Chefs tasting menu for 55 a person At first we were scared that it wouldnt be filling but they brought out so many dishes we left happy and stuffed I actually cant remember all the dishes but the best ones do stand out still The tiger shrimps wow they were huge papas bravas pulpo con papas octopus and potatoes the skirt steak with three different sauces and the flat bread with aged asiago cheese just to name a few dishes OH dont forget the dessert croquettes pure heaven Chocolate and Carmel fried with ice cream The staff was extremely nice however our waiter was on some sort of controlled substance He still was very attentive but his eyes were so far gone it was actually funny Drinks Know thats the reason I didnt give the place 5 stars We ordered a glass a wine each and wow were we shocked when we got the bill 24glass The hostess recommended the wine but it was our mistake not asking the price Ouch For our second drink we order the house sangria and it was good but Ive had much better However the food was excellent so that made us forget about our drinks Price The restaurant is very pricey but its a nice treat once in awhile I highly recommend it for a romantic date wink wink

Author: Heather G.
Content: Im still fantasizing about the two times Ive been to Mercat Â For tapas lovers in Chicago this place is FAR ABOVE any of the other usual suspects ie Babareeba Iberico Emilios Â Itll hurt your wallet quite a bit more than those places but youll soon forget it as this place everything about it is AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING Walking in youll think youve walked into a small barlounge Â Continue around the corner of the bar and up the winding staircase however and youll enter a venue that from an ambiance standpoint rivals the hottest restaurants in Vegas Â Always packed this is a place where reservations even on weeknights are a must Â Take some time to clean yourself up as folks here are clearly out to impressTake in the gorgeous artwork enjoy the music and get ready for a pure Catalan dining experience that will leave you wondering why you waited so long to visitCocktails wines and sangrias are all wonderful Â Really valued that my server was knowledgeable about Spanish wines in particular had a simply divine cocktail made with fresh fruit and love the seasonal spin on sangriaHighly recommend the chefs plates of meats and cheeses as a starter Â The meats are sliced paperthin and the cheeses all have perfect pairings of fruit nuts etc Â Baconwrapped dates  I might seriously go back just for those Â  Love the butternut squash dumplings with lamb ragout and black truffles Â The Ribeye is a solid bet  mmmm Â A scallop freak I couldnt get enough of chef Garces combination of flavors Â The shrimp chorizo  garbanzo flatbread had delicious written all over it and did not fall shortI love dessert Â Save room for it here Â The chocolate croquettes are not only tasty but one of the more unique interpretations of chocolate dishes that Ive seen in a long timeHad a phenomenal server the first time but not as memorable server the second Â Across the board however this is a place you can expect to offer stellar service and attention to detailAside from ambiance that leaves other tapas places in its shadows what really differentiates Mercat from all the others is its menu Â Theres just something here that screams authentic pure true to Catalunyayou just wont find it anywhere else absent a trip to BarcelonaMy advice go and go soon knowing youre going to spend and just splurge for as much as your tummy can hold Â  Youll love everything and shortly after much like myself will find yourself dying to go back

Author: carolyn h.
Content: My Boyfriend and I went here and we had a fantastic date night Â We were staying at the Hilton 1 block south of the restaurant and chose this place on a whim because it was close by Â We were making a reservation and they only had a table open for 715 or 1000 Â We werent that hungry but we didnt want to wait till 1000 so we took the 715 Â Our waiter was really great and let us enjoy our cokctails at our table for a while so we could build up an appetite Â The food was great Â Lots of flavors tons of attention to details on each place Â I loved the pork chops Â We got the small two pork chops on the plate and I could have just had the entire plate as my meal I loved it Â The cocktails were also fantastic Â We had a pitcher of the pineapple flavored mojiito and it was awesome Â I wish I could remember the name of it

Author: Kim N.
Content: What a meal Disclaimer  I was here June 2010We had an awesome server who definitely looked out for us One of our pitchers of margaritas which was half full was inadvertently taken away and he comped us a new pitcherWe got the tasting menu and every dish was tasty well seasoned and delicious It was by no means cheap but the quality of the food the ambiance lived up to my expectations of an Iron Chef

Author: Sean H.
Content: Well Garcess Chicago outpost is also the only one that I dont absolutely love Dont get me wrong the food and service were both great but I found it to be a bit too similar to Amada for my liking I guess living in Philly has ruined me as I rather think of Mercat as a slightly watereddown combination of elements of his other seven restaurants A Chicagoan would probably never notice Despite everything I said above the restaurant is actually quite good on the whole just a bit lackluster when compared to the other jewels in the Garces crown It was the best meal I had in Chicago Except for the drunk Dominos delivery That was killer

Author: Jordan K.
Content: We had the chefs tasting menu which was a good choice considering the chef Jose Garces was actually inrestaurant that night Its not often an Iron Chef cooks you dinner so its best to jump on an opportunity like this when you can The fact that we had no idea hed be there this night is neither here nor thereAnyway we had the deluxe tasting menu which included such gems as baconwrapped dates baconwrapped lamb serranowrapped yellowfin tuna and braised rabbit agnolotti Its a lot of work eating all 12 plates and youll be exhausted and ready to burst at the end but its a great dining experienceAlso dont miss out on the sangria Its highend stuff with unique flavor combinations and youll catch a nice buzz Whats not to like

Author: Jinho P.
Content: This brunch spot was one of my most delicious experiences in the world of brunches It was all accidental getting here too So my wife missed my graduation ceremony in UrbanaChampaign her flight was cancelled so I had to pick her up in Ohare We decided to stay at the hotel and during our stay the wife took some glamour shots of me in my cap and gown at the near by park It got pretty cold and rainy so we started to head back to the hotel and came across this restaurant We then yelped the place to fix our curiosity if it was a legit place to eat The reviews were solid so we thought lets goI do recommend the brunch course The tapas are filling small portions but rich in flavor Also they had these hot peppers that were like deep fried and sauteed or something and it completely knocked my socks off My wife was a huge fan of them too We spent most of our time trying to figure out how the hell they made the peppers because it was so good There is also the brunch bar where its all you can eat but the course was so delicious we were too consumed by the presentation of our meal that we didnt venture out to the bar If you are near by maybe taking photos in your cap and gown because your family missed your graduation come eat here Everything will make up for it at this place during brunch

Author: Jay H.
Content: We had an overall diappointing experience here recently Â I reserved on opentable for 815pm on a TH arrived on time and was told we would have to wait 20 minutes Â We were seated at 900pm at a bar table only after I asked whether we should leave Â There were a lot of irritated to angry patrons piled up at the bar Â Apparently this restaurant like some other fashionable spots does not take the concept of a reservation seriously The service was very good  enthusiastic and reasonably attentive given how busy it was Â The room is a spectacle  huge and highly designed Â The food was very creative and used the freshest and highest quality ingredients Â And the presentation was very professional and attractive Â However some dishes were knockouts and others disappointed Â At this price point nearly every dish should be very good to excellentOverall a big tab for a mixed dining experience at an obnoxiously managed establishment Â For the same price I would rather eat five meals at more casual tapas places run by nicer people

Author: Aspasia S.
Content: So that evening we were in Chicago well that was three of usTwo of us decided to meet in the lobby to work and prep for tomorrow after harrowing into slides and technical shikes we succumbed into cocktailsShe said crush was to follow Â Well crush was already UNcrushed in my books she did not know Â Yet he dissed  he showed up in gym clothes and said Oh room service for me tonightGood thing is what my brain told me Â After all Im bored with these really unCULTURED Americans Â I mean really enough already of my fighting against being a diplomats daughter  to put up with a bluecollar that has been socalled selfmadeAwww as Â the cynics would say Cry me a RiverMy Sales Rep and I ate like a pig at this restaurant  a Barcelona with a Catalunia twist inspired tapas wine and cocktails and after bar squid ink pasta lots of grilled scallops prosciutto wrapped with steamed spinach AND LOTS OF WINE waiters were GREATWe made our meeting and I learnedI NEED A EURO VACATIONI should have lived in the Feudalistic past  I like them betterOh well

Author: Jon D.
Content: The Meh Ive experienced better rating sums up my experience for Mercat to a T Â I went for the Sunday Brunch this morning 25 gets you 4 items off of the tapas menu and bottomless cocktails or 5 items and no booze Â Im not one for 11am alcohol so I went for the 5 although I tried a few of the cocktails others had at the tableI found the food to be overly oily and greasy The bread used on the sandwich entrees seemed to be bussed in or bought at costco it wasnt anything to write home about Â Ive had shrimp and grits down in the gulf region and loved it I know theres butter in grits I know thats what you have to do to make them palatable This place apparently felt the need to throw two or three sticks of the stuff in The chorizo hash was heavily overdone Â The garlic shrimp seemed to be a bit underdone Â I tried to like this place I really didThe Â cocktails I tried seemed to follow the old adage how much sugar can I put int this before they notice theres not discernible tasteI skipped the deserts although for 4 for unlimited trips up there it probably was the best value Â  I bring this up for this reason and this reason alone I was charged 4 for about 8oz of weak iced coffee 4 It didnt taste like anything special for all I know it couldve been folgers or store bought ground starbucks I dont know why I was so blown away by thisAs for the ambiance of the place nice location although it seemed that four or five different interior designers had fought over the space and few things seemed to go hand in hand in a nonironic way The service was incredibly slow and unorganized I just wasnt impressed at all

Author: Jennifer W.
Content: I was staying at the Blackstone side note HOLY NICE HOTELOK onto the food I decided to pop downstairs for breakfast and happened to be fortunate enough to get the brunch menuSince I dont eat that much I LOVE TAPAS I had the baked egg in spicy tomato sauce and the tomatoes on bread dish blanking on the fancy name It was delish and inexpensive Also the coffee was fantastic so smooth Once it hits your lipsits so goodwere going streakingSo final thoughts I wish I could live in this hotel and have them cook me breakfast every morning

Author: Mary I.
Content: This review is for dinner Â Its very dark romantic trendy spanish tapas joint Â We had the bacon wrapped dates proscuitto wrapped arugala salad shrimp meh and some type of rice w garganzo beans We also had the flatbread scallops Everything was pretty tasty except the shrimp They tasted frozen and could not even compare to Cafe Ibericos Â Otherwise everything else was pretty good I would come back and NOT order the shrimp Btw I came here for lunch one day and was NOT impressed Only do the dinnerYoull thank me for it Â Price was 50pp including taxtipand sangria

Author: Joanne C.
Content: I really wanted to give 4 stars But both times we went the service was strange Dont get me wrong The food is great If they did a buffet style spread where I could serve myself get my own drinks refill my own water bus my own table and ring myself up that would kick ass But that would defeat the purpose of dining outso I dont have to do any of those things First time we went it was 3 of us me my sister and her bf We were sitting at a table me in the middle with them on either side of me Why does this matter Youll see Â Our server seemed really preoccupied while she was talking to us She kept glancing away at other tables and seemed in a hurry to be done with us We ordered and sat back waiting for our food to arrive it was restaurant week so we just did the fixed menuOur server didnt come to our table to do the customary check up to see if everything was ok did we need anything etc until AFTER our meal was done Really lady There are no plates in front of us anymore and now youre concerned about what we might have needed At one point of our meal I looked in the general direction of the bar area Our server was walking down the steps with a glass of red wine for one of the tables I watched in disgust as she PUTS HER WHOLE NOSE AND MOUTH into the wine glass to sniff the wine Wtf Is that normal before you serve someone wine to put your face into that persons glass and smell it I dont mean a general hover above the glass it was a fullblown chin lips and nose inside the glassThe second time I went for brunch with my sister Again service was meh at best Â I ordered a coffee and didnt get it I asked again and still didnt get it So I just resorted to drinking water since it was obvious I wasnt going to get anyone to give me any coffee So yeah at this point Im probably not going to go back there anytime soon Sad since I really liked the food

Author: Bryan K.
Content: We got the tasting menu and it did not disappoint We had roughly in order sliced cured ham olives chorizo monte enebro cheese Â blood sausage butternut squash dumplings Â mushroom flatbread jumbo prawns Catalan spinach spicy potatoes lamb and rib eye The portions were sizeable especially the cured ham which we were still poking at halfway through the meal The chorizo and blood sausage were superb slightly crispy salty but not too greasy The spicy potatoes were molded like tater tots with a spicy dollop of sauce on top They tasted like they were fried in bacon fat and were excellent The spinach was surprisingly good and very flavorful The lamb was transcendent and melted in your mouth We got there early 530 on a Friday night and the service was excellent By the time we left two hours later the place was packedOverall the quality of the food we had was very good though the prices were steep They do have more than a few unique dishes on the menu that do not seem to be typically offered at other tapas restaurants Im not sure if the difference in quality while noticeably better than most other tapas restaurants is proportional to the higher prices but in the end I can readily endorse this place for special occasions

Author: Terri M.
Content: The BF and I had a lovely leisurely meal here the other night Â The dining room is beautiful and really set the stage for a pleasant and romantic evening Â We were also fortunate enough to get a table by the window and a friendly knowledgeable serverThe meal was delicious and memorable Â We started with the salad with frisee tuna olives and eggs Â It was subtle and delicious Â Admittedly the portions were small but we enjoy smallplates style dining because it allows us to sample more things Â The next items were among the tastiest things we sampled the Spanish octopus with potatoes and smoked paprikaso incredibly tender and delicious we could have eaten ten more servings the potatoes with spicy aoli were almost addictivecrisp on the outside with a dallop of the paprika mayonnaise making it the perfect mouthful the Barramndi Australian Bass with celery root puree was outstanding with crispy skin and tender fleshjust out of this world and the anchovies had the perfect salty tart acidic kickWe ended with a cheese platethree cheeses chosen by the chef Â We felt like the chef did not let us down with the dishes we chose for our meal so he could do no wrong choosing the cheeses Â It was well worth getting the thee cheese selection Â The accompaniments that came with the cheeses were all delicious adding to the pleasure of eating the cheesesIn addition to the cheese plate we also shared a dessert a sheeps cheese torta which was more like a warm cross between a souffle and a cheesecake Â Heavenly Â I highly recommend this restaurant Â The food is inventive and very high quality Â The atmosphere is chic but not too trendy Â I love the cavernous dining room and the beautiful murals and was grateful that it was not at all loud or overcrowded Maybe because it was a Monday night Â I had one of the best meals Ive had in recent memory Â Id definitely recommend it to others and of course eat there again myself

Author: Summer P.
Content: 35 stars  the sangria couldve been a bit tastier and it is on the pricey sideWe were here for a group celebration and had a really nice time Â Overall ambiance was nice and our service was consistent and joyful Â We sat at a table near the window  it looked right over Michigan Avenue Â Since we were in a large group we just ordered a bunch of small plates I was really pleased to see a large selection of vegetarianfish options Â In addition to the deliciousness I thought the dishes were quite imaginative Â Would definitely recommend for those that like this type of food

Author: Tyler A.
Content: I thought I was a foodie but maybe Im notSure being a foodie is about the food Â But its also about the culture its about the restaurants its about the locales and its about the Chefs and the restauranteurs  Essentially too much obsessive info for my ADD brainEnter Jose Garces this guy is huge in the food world Classically trained latinglobal cuisine perspectives 4 successful restaurants in philly Â IronChef winner and has a restaurant 4 blocks away from me SweetSo without even tasting the food I root for this guy already Â Just had brunch but was very pleased Â I opted for yet another eggs benedict variation Such a sucker for these  Tuffle hollandaise list truffle as an ingredient and Im a sucker for that too over poached eggs chorizo and a perfect rectangle of chiabatta toast  Simple sophisticated twist great balance and delicious Â The sea bass tapa was very delicate and compex  intentionally unsubstanial and the french toast i sampled was made unique by a fresh berry compote and cheeseSome things you should note when you go here that the portions are small and the prices are up there tapas or entrees Â This is the kinda place where I want to sample a lot so unfortunately I must save up to eat here again Â The locale  its well in the middle of nowhere Â It is by me after all Â Ok if Im being honest its on the south part of michigan right next to grant park a few blocks away from the lake a few blocks south of the art museum millennium park and the rest of commerical michigan ave as we know it Â Its a good food stop for the sophisticated day planner andor touristSo now i just gotta get my food  wine subscription mailed keep watching more bravofoot networktravel channel until I inevitably get bored and refocus on the pure simplicity of just getting food into my belly south siiide

Author: Frankie J.
Content: TAPAS DE UPSCALEEOA little history on tapas  originating in Spain it was really its meant to be inexpensive locally sourced bar food Â It was to keep people from getting too drunk and too sick Â Luckily tapas was born out of Spain and the food there consisted of most things being cooked in garlic and olive oil and only the freshest local ingredients Â So any of you Twilight vampirers or New Mooners or other wise you cant eat the garlic tapas more for usBack to the present Spain is now the world center of new cuisine and Barcelona is their growing jewel Â Being just there a month ago I ate as many forms of tapas as I could EVERY DAY for two weeks Â Even in the pricey places its not that expensive 810 Euro depending on the place and the plates are a sharable size with no more than 3 plates needed to make a very complete meal Â Meats cheeses vegetables seafood whatever was closest was servedAt Mercat a la Planxa I will say the food tastes GREAT Â The only thing is due to the location and the overhead you will only get to TASTE the food Â Some portions are small some are translucent meat plate Â Dont expect enough to share a tapas portion with anyone but aspiring models 4 models to a plate which means you will need to order a lot more food to avoid that midnight after dinner Whopper if you came in hungry earlier Â It is not a local style restaurant  it is a big name one and with the big overhead comes an artisan tasting gallery ie small samples of very tasty food possibly leaving you hungry for more  LITERALLY Â So be warned Chicago appetites Â If you are a skinny European then this place is PERFECTAs for understanding the food the staff had little knowledge outside of reciting the ingredients Â For instance the first dish which was complementary was pan con tomate  a simple piece of toasted bread rubbed with garlic and crushed tomato drizzled with olive oil Â I asked the bartenders where this dish came from or its origins Â The only spanish person working mentioned a story of how it was made but really it is a Catalan dish  meant to make something special out of dayold bread Â Here the interpretation was much more advanced even for a piece of breadThe restCharcuterie Mixta  3 kinds of meat served with bread and condiments Â The slices were ultra thin and the size of a silver dollarNice flavor but that was our protein for the night Â Setas a la planxa  Nice mix of 3 different mushrooms perfectly cooked and seasoned Â This was the best main dish of the nightPaella Negra  Squid ink rice with squid very good and rich Â Nice dish but just enough for 2 to share for one to finish Â Protein here tooCroquetas de Chocolate  little fried chocolate balls with marshmallow pillows and caramel Â Tasty  6 bites was enough Â The croquetas were hot and the execution perfectDatiles con bacon  not much you can do with a date wrapped in bacon but they put a little frise salad with a light blue cheese dressing almost a play on a buffalo wing presentation Â If they had added a bit of heat to the date it would have been over the topSo to summarize expect a great flavor great food but make sure youre on a diet cause you will be wanting a bit more

Author: Brenna M.
Content: A lot of loooong reviews for this restaurantIll spare you the heavy reading then1 Beautiful interior youll feel very classay2 Clientele is mixed tourists hotel guests and dressy thirtysomethings3 Food was very tastey but expect to get about 2 small bites per item if youre sharing with one other person4 Very expensive We paid 13 for three tiny butternut squash dumplings While they were deliciousthey werent 433each Â delicious5 Sangria  EXCELLENTE We had the seasonal which incorporated red wine and peppercorn without being heavy at all YumGo for the interior stay for the sangria Pass on the food unless youre ready to spend some bank oh or already ate a full meal

Author: Nikki L.
Content: Phenomenal It was my first time for dinner and decided to bring my parents for their first time Ive told them how much I enjoyed the lunch menu and have been dying to check out there dinner spread for a while We had a feast I think we ordered 1 of almost everything on the menu or so it seemed You know how you go out to eat sometimes and there are a few items that youre not crazy about but your over all meal is to die Well this was honestly the first dinner Ive had where everything that hit the table was devoured within 2 or 3 bites I must say if I could change one thing I wish the portions were a little larger For 17 you get about four bites and its so delicious that its not enough From appetizers to entrees and even desserts I loved everythingThe one thing that I was extremely disappointed with is the service TERRIBLE My server was not playful barely cracked a smile and anytime I asked for something he made it seem like I was asking for something outrageous Im the queen of service so I dont care how good your food is if the service is not fantastic you WILL lose a star and I will make sure you never wait on me again As demanding as I am I am also very rewarding when that check hits the table so GET ON ITOverall the food is out of this world delicious A few things you must tryNegra PaellaRack of LambBraised short ribsWild Mushroom with Confit Potatoesand whatever you get ask for a side of their smoked paprika aioliI could drink it its that good

Author: Raana A.
Content: The one time I went to Mercat we ordered the chefs tasting menu I had a dietary restriction  I do not eat pork  and as my two friends did I didnt want my restriction to affect them The chef did an great job by tailoring our selections so there were only a couple of small plate items I couldnt eat The restaurant was bustling when I went so I really have to commend the chef for being able to be so flexible and keep everything straight without a hitch I barely reviewed the menu before deciding on going with the chefs selection Unfortunately cannot recall the names of the dishes I ate as they provided several small plates within several courses Just about everything was delicious  I left with a very happy tummy Beautiful ambiance attentive service phenomenal food equated to an excellent meal I would come back

Author: Tiffany K.
Content: This review is for a dinner date back in 2009I know Im many months too late but I just started yelpingMercat a la Planxa had a chefs tasting special for NYE All I can say is WOW I believe we had about 12 dishes and all of them were small portions very tasty and filling Our dinner lasted about a little less than 2 hours because of the multiple dishes served It was well worth it Service food ambiance were all equally great I would love to come back here again hint hint

Author: Kris L.
Content: My wife and I Â have been going to Mercat since it opened in 2008 and we have introduced friends and family to its Catalan Spanish delicacies since the beginning The small plates format is more than a little overplayed at this point but Mercat came in at the beginning of that phase and with its chef winning Iron Chef the restaurant which is also beautiful and well located in the Blackstone Hotel was off to the races While you can certainly order off of any of the menus different segments we have have loved their tasting menu which is a real value at 55 because they bring selections from each of their menu segments and you get their best It is a lot of food though but the variety is incredibleHighlights for starters are the tomato bread the aged spanish hams croquetas and the fantastic white anchovies For flatbreads try the beef short rib  horseradish for vegetables must haves are the wild mushroom with confit potato and the amazing stuffed cipollini onions From the planxa grill try the amazingly marinated ribeye and the Colorado rack of lambI have always wanted to call ahead and order the whole suckling pig for four or more people but never had the takers Summary Mercat a la Planxa is and has been one of the best new restaurants in the past few years its a beautiful room overlooking Grant Park in the Blackstone Hotel and offers food served like tapas but made of the finest Spanish and American ingredients you will find

Author: L K.
Content: Great fusion twist to traditional tapas Â Eating here brings back such pleasant memories of our meals in Valencia and Madrid Â A visiting friend also said the food was very reminiscent of her particular region and always tries to eat here when shes in townWeve been both to the little round bar area and the dining room and the space is so well appointed with detailed attention paid even to the smallest of decor Â Ignore the snotty hostesses minus halfstar once we got past them the waitstaff was very friendly and attentiveThe food desserts wine and cocktails are all excellent Â Weve had the flatbreads gambas al ajillo patatas bravas paella negra lamb and several other things I cant remember now but I DO remember it all tasted great Â The mushroom soup was so heavenly I could have drunk a gallon of it Â Both red and white sangrias were yummy and the Dark and Stormy gaaaahhh

Author: Sadat A.
Content: I had so much fun today at Mercat We were a part of a group of ten We made plans for this day a month in advance The bottomless Sangrias Mimosa and Bloody Mary bar had a big smile on my face All of the food we tried was fantastic Â The service was slow at first but picked up after the first hour of our time there but again it was super busy when we got there The staff was very very friendly which made me feel comfortable The food the suckling pig was delicious but I was sad when it ran out It was towards the end of of brunch service so it was understandable The biscuits and gravy were delectable and I dont really care for biscuits and gravy most of the time The Eggs Benedict were off the chain I cant wait to make plans to go back next month Its a great atmosphere and great for birthdays and special occasions

Author: Esther Y.
Content: So if you read my reviews you know that I LOVE food and am super impressed when servers are great at their jobsBen D is one of THE best out there Â From the minute we were seated in Bens section we knew it was going to be a fun meal Â He is GREAT Really great Hes friendly SUPER knowledgeable about everything on the menu really easy to talk to and is not afraid to stand firm in his suggestions Â I like that in a server Â Some of the best meals Ive had out were guided by server suggestions and I always leave stuffed happy and my wallet significantly lighterAnyway Ben was chatting with us about the menu while pouring our wine and our glasses were always topped off before we even needed to reach for the bottle which just shows how easy the whole meal felt Â He made amazing suggestions Â We had the three cheese plate with the manchango bacon wrapped dates fried peppers chorizo a flatbread dessertI mean I feel like if I list everything we ate youll judge me so Ill stop here Â Honestly once we were able to give Ben a sense of what we liked he was spot on in recommending even more things for us to try Â I loved thatOne thing that sets great servers apart from others is their ability to anticipate your need as a diner Â Ben D did thatand more Â This was one of my favorite meals in the CityThe meal was spectacular the service phenomenal and I cant wait to plan my next trip to Mercat

Author: Diana M.
Content: Delicious Thats about all I can say Okaytwist my armIll say a little bit moreWe decided early on that we were going to do the 12 course premium chefs tasting and man are we glad we did Plate after plate after plate of some of THE best food Ive ever eaten kept arriving at our table The standouts were the lamb chops  Â falling off the bone perfectly seasoned and grilled hunks of juicy meat that just melted in my mouth The mussels were divine The beef shortribs and horseradish flatbread was amazing The risotto creamy and flavorful The pinxtos superb  as good nay better than what weve had in Barcelona The chocolate croquets we had for dinner were the cherry topper on an already exquisite mealThe cheese plate the Iberico ham the grilled hot peppers the olives etcThere was so much food coming at us that I cant quite remember everything we atebut NOTHING was bad I even ate some of the lobster tail and I dont like lobster It was good But not god enough for me to eat more than a bite I just dont like lobsterIt was expensive but how often do we really eat like gluttonous kings Never So it was absolutely worth it We could have done a restaurant week tasting for a LOT cheaper but we wouldnt have gotten all the great food that we did I highly recommend this to large groups or romantics Business meals or tourists You wont be disappointed

Author: Joan C.
Content: One of my absolute favorite places The decor is modern sleek and swanky and what is also really nice is that you get a glimpse of whats going on in the kitchen since it is on display Â The food is fantastic Â Never have I been to place where each taste you are tasting is painstakingly calculated and intentional Â I had the perfectly cooked Australian Sea Bass that melted on my tongue Â The portions arent that huge but I almost feel that it is on purpose so that you savor every rationed bite Â I was satisfied with just thatbut then the desert menu came Once upon a time there was a wonderful dish called SMores Â Smores have always consistently delivered Â Then one day Smores cousin came into town who happened to be a better looking better tasting a more sophisticated supermodel of smores Â Thats what the croquettes are at Mercat Â These delicious supermodels had a crunch and that chocolate oozing out of the middle sitting in a puddle of aioli Â I couldve had 50 of them Â Overall my experience at Mercat was one of the most pleasant Ive ever had It is also nestled in the Blackstone Hotel which is gorgeous Â Another added bonus to this beautiful restaurant is the wonderful staff Â I politely asked them if we could shoot our engagement photos there while the restaurant was closed and they were more than happy to accommodate this unusual request

Author: Shenelle B.
Content: What can I sayhumm let me thinkTHIS PLACE IS AMAZING It was a total surprise to me that the food was sooo tasty My friend took to Mercat for my birthday It is a place that I passed everyday on my way to class but never thought to stop and eat She told me that the food there was good but I didntt know that it would be THAT goodThe dishes that we ordered consisted of Costillas De Terner which is a beef shortribs with horseradish parmesan and Bacon All of those yummy topping were served on a warm flatbread The shortribs were tender the parmesan was gooey the horseradish gave the dish a kick without being over powering and the baconwell who Â doesnt like baconGambas Al Ajillo which is garlic shrimp They serve the shrimp sizzling in butter If is the freshest shrimp I ever tasted It was so good that I didnt mind if my breath smelled like garlicDatiles Con Almendras Baconwrapped Dates stuffed almonds Now this was a dish that I was very skeptical about but my friend told me I would love it and I was pleasantly surprised with this dish I not a big fan of dates but when mixed with the almonds bacon and spinach it was amazing I couldnt put my fork downSangrias are crisp and refreshing We had the one served with cranberriesLast but not least was the dessert I dont remember that name of it and it is not on the current menu but it was a olive oil cake with almond ice cream I was the perfect portion and the cake was served warm They also put this crunchy wafer on top of the ice cream I would never think that olive oil cake would Â taste as good as it did They perfected that dishIf you want good food go here

Author: B.D. K.
Content: Seems like there is a trend in these reviews For the most part the food is good to great and occasionally the service is horrendous howeverI had a reservation for my fiancÃ©s birthday a few weeks ago We showed up 15 minutes late and were taken upstairs to the best table in the house overlooking the entire restaurant Very nice private dining area by candlelight That really set a great tone for the night so thank you Mercat we will come back again I would give you a 45 overallThe food was all great no complaints except for dessert  but most places are terrible at dessert unless they have a real pastry kitchen and staff Id say this is a great place to go if youre from out of town and want to have a nice meal without breaking the wallet Well two people six tapas dessert and two drinks comes out to about 100 And had we been on the main floor with everyone else I wonder if I would have enjoyed it as much Dunno but the ambiance is nice The service isnt stellar but nothing particularly bad either  just skip dessert and order another drink is my only recommendation

Author: Delia C.
Content: Best tapas in the city Hands down Fabulous wine listGet the tasting menu with the wine pairingUnlike the other tapas places in Chicago the plates here are sophisticated wellcrafted and tasty No greasy chorizo cheese or blah oily shrimp yuckinessBabareeba and Iberico might as well shut downAnd the best thing No screeching bachelorettes guzzling bad sangria by the bucketfulsSpendy Yes But so worth it

Author: J R.
Content: Ive been to a couple of Tapas restaurants now and this one was the best so far Â The welcome dish was excellent to put it simply it was a lot like bruchsetta Â So a friend and I went here together Â We each had the white and red sangria  both very good but not quite enough fruit in it like People loungeThe dishes were all very good Â The dessert was amazing as well Â I hope to go again and try everything

Author: Zarina K.
Content: I really liked this place Â We actually came here with a group for my birthday reservations made weeks in advance Â Tapas are one of my favoritesI really like trying a little bit of everything and this is the best way to try a variety of items We ordered about 23 tapas per person and we were all fine  just ful enough Â We got dessert for free bday treat and didnt bother with after dinner drinksI feel like you cant go wrong with anything they have on the menu Â Everyone raves about pretty much the same stuff so just go and order whatever soundslooks good to you The service was good and its fun to people watch as well

Author: Sandy N.
Content: This was a good place for a small crowd since its bustling right off of Michigan Ave and consists of small plates where cost gets diluted if you have larger numbers We had a party of 5 Unfortunately since we made a reservation at 815 on a Saturday night we had to wait a bit for our tableThe house bread was a delicious parmesan bruschetta which whetted our appetites before the food cameOur selectionsQueso mixto  came with a blue cheese a raw cow cheese and a sheeps milk cheese I think and each one had its own sauceaccompaniment The cheeses were good though the amount of bread was pretty minimalTocino con cidra Pork Belly  Granny Smith AppleBlack Truffle Slaw  very good decadent The acidic apple was a nice contrast to the earthy truffleMar i Muntanya II SerranoWrapped Yellow Fin Tuna Potato Croquette Pickled Red Pearl Onions  also delicious especially the onions contrasting with the creamy Â potato croquettePaella Valenciana Chicken  Chorizo Paella Artichoke  Tomato Salad with Saffron Aioli  this was a little disappointing while the flavor of the paella itself was good i was hoping for more substance seafood meat whatever also olives were included which i hate that threw off the flavor of the dish and you could taste it all over the bites that touched an olivePelotas de calabaza y cordero Butternut Squash Dumplings Lamb Ragout Beech Mushroom Escabeche Black Truffle  this was really delicious creamy rich earthy unfortunately the order only came with 3 so we had to order 2 more but i definitely recommend it All in all the order came to about 33 per person which isnt bad for all of us being full and having a good amount of paella left For the price and location its also a good deal The portion sizes are pretty small though but the variety is nice 4 starsPS Ive been here for restaurant week lunch its excellent

Author: Alejandro L.
Content: Phenomenal tapas that will make you want more and more and morePrices are as spectacular as their extensive wine list but its a good place to escape and celebrate in a different wayTry Patatas Bravas and the DATES OMG The Dates are to die for

Author: Angela M.
Content: I went here last week with a few friends and we had a great time When we first went inside I was worried as it seemed the place was a bit nicer than my chucks and jeans outfit could offer but others were dressed casual as well and a good time seemed to be had by all that were there As far as food and drinksthey were spot on I deferred to my friend to ordering the wine and tapas as shes an expert on both We all split the bacon wrap dates my friend likes them so much she was seconds away from licking the plate when the waiter came back the Serrano Ham and Fig salad which was so good I almost licked the plate the garlic shrimp the albondigas de catalana Spanish meatballs and the mixto which is a cheese plate with three of the chefs choice I cant remember what three we had thanks to the two bottles of wine we had but you really cant go wrong with cheese The pairings sounded weird at first but trust them on itthey were delicious We washed it all down with these tasty little chocolate croquettes for dessert We determined that following dessert we could all die happy Well done Mercat All in all I had a fantastic time and would recommend it to anyone looking for a fun and expensive night out

Author: Seth P.
Content: Lucky me my girl took me to a fancy place Â First of all the service was positively kind Â The first time we showed up was on a busy Friday night and we tried to weasel our way into an outdoor seat Â They were really nice about it and did their best to accommodate us Â When we told them we couldnt wait 45 minutes they they told us in a sincere manner that they hoped wed come back another timeSo we did this time with a reservation Â Service was immediate friendly and unobtrusive Â When it started to rain and we apologetically asked if we could move from our table for two to a table with an umbrella  even though the umbrellatable seated four  they cheerfully told us that we could do it no problem Â When it came time to explain the menu the waitress was highly knowledgeable  without a trace of condescension or pretension Â This was important for me as I know next to nothing about wine in general or Spanish food in particularWhen the waitress asked what I would like to drink I started with lemonade which turned out to be a good choice as the light lemonade she brought out went really well with the food Â I asked her to choose my wine and told her that all I know about wine is that I like Sangiovese Â She brought me a perfect Tempranillo Â When I told her how much I liked it she was genuinely overjoyed  and wrote down the name of the bottle for me Â  I also should point out that the food came out McDonaldsquick Thats a complimentWe started with escalivada which is plate of different cooked vegetables Â While all of it was good the onion was scrumptious Â I really would have liked a whole plate of onions like that Â Then came the rabbit ravioli which I wasnt that excited about because I dont know about eating foam Â But my girlfriend really liked itWe then had the morel mushroom rice which was like a mushroomasparagus risotto Â It was OUT OF THIS WORLD Â They used some kind of topquality Spanish olive oil that created an extra layer of flavor between the vegetables Â My girlfriend said it was so good that she could eat another plate of it  more on that laterThe next dish was the only one that neither of us liked  the patatas bravas which are nongreasy tater tots with some kind of aioli that coats your tongueAs our next dish came out they brought us another plate of the delicious morelasparagus rice Â When we pointed out that we had already had ours and that it probably belonged to someone else the guy said Uh okay shrugged and said its a compliment Â My sweetie got her wish  more of her favorite dishThe last two dishes were OFF THE CHAIN they were so good  tender sweet lobster in creamed corn andA hearty nontapaslike bowl of fava beans lima beans and serrano ham with some kind of Spanish cheese that made it pop Â I could eat this hamandbeans dish every day Â It seems like something youd eat every morning before going out to work the fields in a Catalan winter

Author: Sophia A.
Content: This still keeps the dazzling first impression I had of the place a year ago Â We did the chefs tasting last year and enjoyed every bit of it Â This year since the family travels to Spain at least once every year we were yearning for the comfort tapas and ordered those a la carte Â My review will be based on comparing the ones Im familiar with in SpainJamon Iberico Not sure whats their source but its not as dark as Im used to Â However its shaved thinly and less fatty than most Jamon Ibericos so I personally enjoyed the flavor sans that fat Â Melts in your mouthOctopus with Potatoes  Paprika I know this more as Pulpo a la Gallega and its pretty spot on Â More garlicky than normal slightly less meat than one would normally serve and a tad overcooked than its usual preparation but still delicious and the closest Ive had to the real thing this side of the AtlanticPatatas Bravas Much more cutesy and less messy than the traditional presentation Â You get 7 slices in a row with a bit of the salsa brava on top of each Â But its perfect Â I judge tapas restos on this dish and the fancy plating doesnt mask anything  the flavors are dead onCroquetas de Bacalao These are little babies compared to their cousins in Andalucia Â I couldnt get the bacalao flavor I was hoping for in this one so this is probably the most disappointing Â I wouldnt get it again SadnessPork Belly They definitely know how to win a tocinolovers heartSangria Fabulous Probably even better that the hangoverinducing ones youd get in Spanish bodegas The seasonal ones are magical amalgamations of deliciosoMercat has become the new goto tapas resto over Cafe Iberico just because the dishes are slightly more reminiscent of the Spain we love and visit every year Â Authenticity is still there despite the fancy ambiance and plating Â Id give this a fifth star if I could actually afford to eat everything I want on my own but Im on the whim of the padres Spanish cravings

Author: Amanda S.
Content: I just wrote a tepid review for Avec and couldnt help but reminisce about my great experiences at Mercat Â Mercat ALSO has a beautiful open kitchen delicious bacon wrapped dates great atmosphere and good service Â I dont even think Mercat is more expensive although the portions might be a bit smallerI went to Mercat once for dinner with about a month ago and then came back for the Restaurant Week luck recently Â Both times I had no trouble getting reservations the day of and we were seated right away Â  Â For dinner we had the dates mushrooms Paella De Mariscos the spanish octopus and some buttery chocolately thing for dessert that was amazing Â Also had a great wine list lots of fun Spanish bottles to tryFor lunch I had the Arroza a la Cazuela another seafood paella style dish Tuna with pine nuts and basil and croquestas de xocolata fried chocolate things with marshmallows Â Also got to try the fried peppers scallop and hanger steak which were all great Â My coworker also got a glass of the sangria and seemed very very happy with it Â Ill definitely be back for another romantic dinner soon or for a good break to the work day

Author: Annie S.
Content: I came here last night for a friends birthday and had a great time We had a table for 12 and were seated upstairs in a semiprivate area The actual restaurant is in a hotel and the dining area is pretty large But since we had a large group we had to go upstairs to another area which was great Since we had a large group we asked the waiter to place orders for us and he did a great job He explained every dish to us and brought dishes in groups eg breadscheeses meats seafood etc The bread they bring in the beginning was awesome Its like just bruschetta sp and crunchy I dont remember the names of any of the tapas we ordered but you wont be disappointed They had this green pepper wcheese dip which was awesome We ordered sangria and I liked it even though its sweet The service was great and our waiter was topnotch He was always checking in on us and asked us for permission to keep ordering more food Oh if you want to bring a cake for a birthday they charge 2person Thats annoying but its ok Overall we had a great time and will return

Author: Cristina D.
Content: LOVED this place we got the chefs choice for 35 3 courses with 3 plates per course it was amazing we also got dessert chocolate croquettes that were beautifully plated with banana marshmallow rosemary infused caramel and olive oil IT WAS SOOO GOOD I think you have to try this place I would eat here AT LEAST on a monthly basis Too bad I live in San Francisco CAAlso if you are concerned about eating sustainable seafood  DONT BE They comply with Monterey Bay Aquariums seafood guide and use seafood ingredients that are sustainable and support the oceans ecosystem

Author: Tim Y.
Content: I really enjoyed the food here I didnt go during restaurant week  I actually went here about a year ago Ive been lazy in writing reviews life callsYoull definitely need to come here looking to eat a lot and dont underestimate the filling nature of the small plates Its not cheap but tapasstyle dining rarely is unless youre eating junk

Author: Patrick S.
Content: Tapas They were goodNothing that made me say WOWI would have given a 4 star because the staff was efficient and the food a touch above average but300 for two peopleWe did the tasting menu and three drinks total not eachIf I am going to pay 300 for a dinner it should really wow me I dont just want a series of plates dropped in front of me of less that exciting composition For 300 I want it to be spectacularGo if you have to see it Be excited if you have never had tapas but dont expect something special if you are familiar with this type of dinner

Author: Irina G.
Content: Restaurant week is the way to go with this place Definitely pretty expensive but worth every penny if you are trying to impress someone with an advanced palate The decor is reminiscent of a big NYC restaurant mixed with the honeycomb patterns and colors you would find right in the heart of BarthelonaI think we accidentally got 10 tapas instead of the standard 8 that wouldve gone into our Restaurant week menu but every single dish was off the chain Ham and cheese croquettes spanish omellete with a sprig of saffron chocolate croquettes on a bed of roasted marshmallows for dessert Are you kiddingLittle tip if you foursquare here you can get a glass of the sangria for 199 We got a pitcher of the white sangria  some of the best Ive ever had  and I definitely got drunk off of it but then again im a total lightweightGo enjoy and bon appetit

Author: Vida Vina D.
Content: try as much as you can The place will not disappoint

Author: Kelly B.
Content: First I have to say thank you to the executive chef Â I LOVE foie gras and while they had two dishes with SOME foie gras we wanted the foie to be the main component in the dish so Chef Cory Morris made us our own special dish that was AMAZING Â All other dishes were also amazing especially the pork belly octopus and chorizo Â Agree with other reviews that it is definitely a pricy meal but well be back Â Wine menu was okay  some good selections but also on the pricier end Â Service was also great and they did a good job at coursing out the meal so we werent overwhelmed at any point with too many or not enough dishes Â Such a great restaurant Â Just wish Chef Garces was there  would love to meet him

Author: Casey C.
Content: I went back and boy was my experience different from my last Â Our server was like a preprogrammed robot He really didnt have a good grasp of the wine list Â We had the chefs tasting menu again Last time it was wonderful this time not so much The courses came out too close together Â Tapas should be spaced out and the meal should be an experience I felt rushed and left way too full I probably wont be back for food The sangria was spot on though Yum

Author: Jenn S.
Content: Did I miss something 3 stars doesnt seem quite fitting so I would venture to say that this place was more like 35 stars 375 if I want to get picky The ambiance is wonderful I love the high ceilings and the light bulb light fixtures The hostesses were friendly Not even remotely pretentious as they tend to be along Michigan Ave Their specialty drinks are delicious For someone like me who likes a nice girly drink my Merengue hit the spot I tried their red sangria as well Its good But nothing special On to the food For starters this is not your traditional tapas place I think thats what I just didnt like about it Mentally I set myself up for just tapas However when the friendly waiter came over and started explaining the menu he threw me a curve ball when he said generally people order 24 plates to share and then an entree I asked him so youre saying that everything BUT the entree is tapas style He said yes So whats the point Dont call it tapas Call it an appetizer We came for tapas so we ordered like it was all tapas For our first course we had Garrotxa yummy goats milk cheese with roasted garlicdulce de leche DLISH The garlicdulche de leche is so wonderful Datlies bacon wrapped dates stuffed with almonds WARNINGif there are more than 2 of you at the table get two orders of these Trust me You only get 4 dates per order Gambas al Ajillo garlic shrimp Really good The garlic was not overpowering at all Second course we had Arroz con Morels morel mushroom bomba rice with asparagus Wonderful Would have been unbelievable if it came out hot temperature wise Butifarra con Judias pork  apple sausage Ok this is actually an entree However when we got the plate with 3 little jimmy dean looking sausages I was severely disappointed It tasted great dont get me wrong But I would have been quite angry if I ordered this as an actual entree Patatas Bravas Spicy potatoes with spicy paprika aioli Terrible Just terrible The seasoning was just too much I couldnt even tell that it was a potato I may have just ordered the wrong food that night I didnt read Dennis S review until afterwards His selections looked much better So alas we will try it again and next time not be disappointed by the nosotapas menu

Author: Johnny A.
Content: This place was delicious Â  Â  I went with a part of 7 and we decided to order the CHEF CHOICE menu Â  Basically throughout the 2 hours we were there delicious tapas plates kept coming out Â   Â  I liked Â  Â  Â  Â   there was a vegetarian option that was more than just salads Â  Â  Â  Â   the decor Â  I didnt like Â  Â  Â  Â  Â the price  Â  Â  Â  Â  food runners throwing food down on the table and either not explaining what it was we were about to eat or talking way too fast or quietly about what it was Â   Â  Â  I recommend getting the chefs menu if you can dish out 58 per person

Author: Stefan L.
Content: My new favorite restaurant in Chicago Â The seasonal sangria was fantastic Â Ordered roughly 8 tapas for two people and we left sufficiently full Â Small portions but best flavor of any restaurant in I have been to in the world Â Only complaint was with our veggie dish mushrooms came out really really salty FYIif you plan on joining their frequent diner program do so well in advance of your visit or else you wont get credit Â It takes some time for them to get you into the system

Author: Josie F.
Content: Mercat is the best Â I have been here twice and each time the food just blows me away Â I can not decide on what to order ever so I always go for the chefs tasting menu and then some Â By the end of the meal we realized we had about six different animals for dinner Â Lamb pork rabbit duck  Â  Â  Â  Â  Great value for the price Â Service also is fantastic Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â The only thing I would say is wrong is like so many other restaurants they remind you that the kitchen is closing soon or do not want to take a late night reservation Â  Â People who like to go out may like a fancy meal once in a wild before hand Â I will be back many times Â This is a Chicago must dine spot

Author: Rebecca B.
Content: I expected a lot from this place as I love tapas AND Iron Chef but was sadly disappointed Â First the atmosphere It was a suprisingly unimpressive restaurant Â It was SO LOUD that at a table of six we had to yell across the table to communicate Â And only the two people closest to the waiter could hear him and would have to repeat everything telephone style so the rest of us knew what we were eating Â The music was up too high for the acoustics the room bounces around  it was ridiculousThe staff our waiter seemed to whisper a bunch seriously Â we could barely hear him Â Tables were far too close together as staff kept knocking into my fiance  without apology  and he was sitting in a nontraffic lane Â Our waiter also spilled my moms sangria on her as well as dumping another into the purse of a lady behind us and blamed the glass stating it had a small bottomThe food I cringe as I type it but Ive had better tapas from the tourist trap BaBaReeBa Â Or Iberico or People or any number of tapas places Ive been to Â For an Iron Chef the menu was singularly uninspired and boring Â It all looked and sounded interesting but the taste was often flatThe get 2 stars where they should have 1 because we did the chefs selection and they made sure I had a substitute for every seafood dish they brought out which was a really nice gesture on their part because I dont eat seafood

Author: Derek L.
Content: I really wanted to love this place and it came really close but just didnt quite do it for meFirst of all went there for the 25 dollar brunch special with a couple of friends and Id like to start by saying that even without this awesome special that allowed me to load up on sangrias more on that later their food prices appeared very reasonable for their brunch items Â Most plates were five or fewer dollars normally Â Now these are tapas plates but Im used to spending a lot more for a tapas plate at most places of this caliberThe food was good but not life changing like I had hoped for from a iron chef Jose Garces restaurant Â Some dishes were on the very good but again not life changing side such as the bacon wrapped dates the eggs with truffle butter covered bread and the two open face type sandwich dishes I had had the suckling pig and the short ribs the short ribs being the better of the two by a slim margin Â Others were downright bad we had some sort of fish dish which had the consistency similar to mashed potatoes which was so salty it was kind of disgusting also the pimentos left a lot to be desired Â On food alone this might have been a 3 star experience though I think I would still be willing to check it out for dinner as I suspect that possibly their brunch menu isnt their Agame Â Luckily however I went with the white sangria which was hands down the best sangria Ive ever had Â It was perfectly sweet and didnt really suffer from the dry wine mouthfeel you often get with sangria Â You could easily go to brunch and make the 25 dollars worth it in just sangria if you wanted to Â I liked the ambiance of the place it was modern and well lit which was great for brunch Â My friends and I all came pretty casual and didnt feel the slightest bit out of place the bussers were running around in tshirts so definitely not stuffy in there Â The music was spanish inspired and interesting not overly loud Â Tables seemed a bit close together not sure if it would have felt a little crowded had the place been full we went at 2pm so things were dying down Â Service was ok I expected our server to be a little more forthcoming with suggestions and I went a while with an empty glass at one point in the meal but it wasnt bad and when asked the server was knowledgeable about the menu and made sure I got a last glass of sangria when he brought the check so I was happy with the service by the end of the mealOverall it was a good experience and I am looking forward to trying their dinner menu at some point in the future

Author: Shayan R.
Content: The food is the star here The bacon wrapped dates and almonds was amazing The croquettes fantastic A wonderful selection of cheeses accompanied by condiments like caramelized bacon sauce The flat breads were great especially the short ribsThe bad was the service We were seated upstairs where apparently your server forgets about you The drinks were watered down The sangria totally watered down The only redeeming drink was the caliente specialty drink with a dried chili in the drinkmmm If the service were better probably a solid 4 stars

Author: Mel K.
Content: Mercat is a special place If you have the money to spare go for the Jamon Iberico  made from pigs fed on acorns that makes the meat sweet and nutty The rabbit agnolotti is probably one of the best dishes Ive had in Chicago It just melts in your mouth Its a more upscale tapas place than your Cafe Iberico or Babareeba but the quality of the dishes sets it apart

Author: fritz L.
Content: Good food solid service Â A trifle loudThe only weak link was the dessert and cafe con lecheMonte Enebro cheese is very good and a nice sized portionFlash fried padron peppers were salty and hot but not too much of eitherPulpo con patatas is tender and sweetPork stuffed roasted rabbit leg was excellentThe crema Catalan was uninterestingI had a glass of GineGine a very good choice

Author: Garrett T.
Content: Very good food and fun atmosphere Â We have ordered the tasters menu a couple of times and always a wonderful combination of foods Â The wine paring highly recommended if you like parings Â If not the sangria will work just fine Â My only complaint is I usually leave less than full and have spent a bunch of money but the wife loves it so there you go

Author: Sara L.
Content: I came into this place with a friend for lunch on a Saturday Â It wasnt that busy when we first got there 1130 so service was really good until it got busy around 1230 Â It took us forever to get refills and our check Â but other than thatthe food is amazing I love this place Â The decor is very nice and simply because the food was so enjoyable I did not deduct a star due to service Â We got the Catalan Express lunch special which comes with a drink and 2 courses Â Price is fairly cheap for what youre getting 18For the first course I got the Arroz a la Cazuela soup Its very rich in flavorI highly recommend it Â I also really enjoyed the Yellowfin Tuna although it wasnt what I expected Â Its two small cuts of seared yellowfin so if you dont like youre fish raw this is definitely not for you with celery root and basil emulsion Â The Black Angus Hanger steak was also really goodIt has a potato croquette laid out on the bottom and then is topped with braised short ribs Â The thing about the food here is that everything is bursting with flavor Â They put unique sauces on the plate that dont overwhelm the food but enhance it Â We also ended up getting dessert Croquetas De Xocolata YUMI uploaded pictures so you can get a visual of what youre getting

Author: K C.
Content: Another great restaurant in Chicago Â This is located in the Blackstone Hotel next to the Hilton Conrad on South Michigan Â Small plates with fantastic flavorsgreat seafood offering with other offerings like Tocino Con Cidra Hard to find in the cityThe cheese selection is nicethe Cadi Urgelia is amazingYou will love it

Author: Chef X.
Content: I could eat here everyday Server was A knew the menu inside  out and was happy to chat about it Â Took care of us like we were the only table in the room and it was a very busy Friday nightKudos Mercat

Author: Sarah C.
Content: Came here on our trip to Chicago for Fathers Day brunch and it was awesome I was a little hesitant to go to a Mexican type cuisine for brunch but it was very tasty and you get a TON of food for the valueYou get a 3 course tasting menu 2 items per course AND a whole buffet to choose from The buffet includes fresh fruit muffins breads pastries a WHOLE pig smoked salmon spicy spanish chorizo and cheeses among other things The buffet is tasty fresh and awesomeThe tasting menu was also delicious Bacon wrapped dates stuffed with almond and blue cheese truffle hollandaise eggs benidict on brioche shrimp and grits with short ribs etcALSO bottomless bloody mary bar is amazing All the spices are set up for you to add big prawns veggies different types of tomato juice mix salsa gazpacho And they use Svedka which is well above well vodka If you are a bloody mary fan this part makes it worth it just to check the place outIf you are not into bloodys you can do bottomless mimosas sangria white or red or mimosasI highly reccomend this spot and the service is great The waitress seemed very patient and helpful despite having alot on her plate

Author: Mirini K.
Content: Im a pretty picky eater I really enjoyed the meal I had here I didnt have high expectations because I felt like an upscale tapas was going to just be overpriced and mediocre I WAS WRONGThe food was so good  The cheeses are paired with really yummy sauces The Cadi Urgelia cheese with the sherrybacon caramel sauce was my favorite The Arroz a la Cazuela soup was pretty good too The Wagyu Zabuton steak was absolutely delicious The Conill Amb Castanyes braised rabbit was very good It wasnt gamey at all and very flavorful I was so full by the end of the meal I would definitely return for another meal

Author: DeeMarie W.
Content: I thought the food at Mercat was so good that I cannot stop thinking about some of the dishes that I hadMy absolute faves were First the bacon wrapped dates were the bomb Â I cannot tell you how delicious they were Â We also had the fig salad array of cheeses and the butternut squash raviolis which are OMG good Â Apparently a woman comes in to make them and it is her only job Â I wish I can have her phone number The meats are delectable Â The lamb what can I sayliterally melts in your mouth Â Cannot stop thinking about the lamb Â The best lamb I have ever eaten Â Everything we tasted was recommended by our waiter and he brought us a few other great tasting dishes as wellThe only two items that we ordered that I would not order again are the Spanish squid I like squid but didnt think this was the bomb and the garlic shrimp which you can really order anywhere Â I thought both were a little tough tooDrinks well they were very expensive Â Holy cow expensive Â I had the charred pineapple mojito which was served in a rocks glass for 1300 Â I had a few and didnt catch a buzz Â  Â I would think for the price of some of the drinks they would be a little potent and deliciousAtmosphere was great Â Dark and modern very relaxing Â Open kitchen Â You can see the cooks prepareI thought the waiter and the other servers who filled our water and cleared away plates were very attentive Â We never had an empty water glass or messy tableI would agree that the food prices are One note Â Today I went to my hair salon and my stylist told me about the really great restaurant in the city that is a must try Â It was the Mercat a la Planxa Â What a coincidence I ate there on Friday and he on Saturday Â We were discussing the dishes that we loved The dishes in common that we had we both agreed were fantastic Â Which was the bacon wrapped dates and the lamb Â He had other dishes that we did not because he and his guests ordered the tasting menu Â But by the descriptions I must go back

Author: Linsey C.
Content: This place is amazing Â Strolled in on Friday night around 720 with my cousin in from out of town and this place was hoppin Â We ended up snagging the only spots left at the bar downstairs but before our first delicious bites arrived we had managed to grab a table that had been recently vacated The foodincredible Â We started with the chef choice cheese sampler which comes with 3 cheeseseach with an amazing sauceI could have eaten just that all night Â But no Â Next were the bacon wrapped dates which were also amazingand I dont even like datesguess I do now Â Third was the paprika potatoes which simply stole the show Â Finally the glazed pork belly Â Words cannot describeFor dessertthe pear hibiscus pound cake and the chocolate marshmallow bites of heavenNeither of us drank but the sangria looked amazingnext time for sureIm not a super huge southloop fan but I might have just turned a pivotal cornerIll certainly be back to this placenext time though Ill make reservations for the full experience upstairs in the dinning room

Author: Shelby A.
Content: Okay first off I do not know how this place doesnt have five stars People saying the portions were too small its TAPAS Know your food And the price was well worth it for the flavors okay now to my reviewYesterday my boyfriend and I stumbled upon this place because we needed something to eat while we waited for someone in the JPMorgan Chase Corporate Challenge to be done We were trying to choose between tapas and sushi and boy am I so glad we chose tapas When we entered after walking up the stairs we were astounded with the interior of the restaurant With its high ceilings unique lighting and modern decor I was already happy with our choiceAs for what we ordered the only thing I wasnt 100 happy with was the Red Sangria mainly because I figured it would be sweet like it usually is but Ive noticed that city drinks are just stronger I later tried the and yes Im just copy and pasting the names from the menu online CHARRED PINEAPPLE MOJITO which was fantastic It was almost like a pineapple version of a Mikes Hard haha But it satisfied my sweet cravingFor food we orderedTRUITA DE PATATA which was just what I had been craving I would definitely order this again The flavors were fantasticPULPO CON PATATAS which was great I had never had octopus before so I have nothing to compare it to but flavor was very unique and the meat was very tender GUATLA ANEC UVAS Y POLENTA which was quite delicious The roasted grape glaze on the quail was to die for But my favorite thing on this plate had to be the goat cheese polenta croquettes That cheese was to die for I definitely want to sample their cheeses next time TOCINO CON CIDRA which was the best thing out of the entire meal It was to die for Â If youre looking for something fantastic get this Combining all the ingredients on the plate has got to be one of the best flavors Ive ever experiencedFor dessert we orderedCREMACATALANA which has the be one of the best desserts Ive ever had That sweet potato ice cream is amazing And the combination with the bavarois YUMPASTISSOSDAVELLANA which I didnt care too much for but thats because I didnt want it in the first place My boyfriend really enjoyed it though if thats your cup of tea cAnd to top it off our server was amazing She was very knowledgeable of everything on the menu and she was of great help when it came to deciding on what we wanted and selling us more fooddrinks I wish I remembered her name though Overall this meal service and ambiance was fantastic Never you mind the long walk to the bathroom its well worth it I definitely would like to come back here again soon and try new things

Author: Bambi M.
Content: So cutemusic greatgreat servicelights a lil 2 bright 4 my taste but still very cute The food tastyesp the bacon wrapped dates But go for the Sangria flight It was soooo good Love that its in the SLwalking distance from my flatcan you say summer hang lol Mos def would return  planning on it

Author: Karen C.
Content: Good but not stellar Â For what you are getting its good but nothing really wows you Â Ill go back next time I am in town if the opportunity comes up but not somewhere I feel is a must return to

Author: Susan M.
Content: There was a lot going on here Â We ordered the Sunday Brunch tasting menu you get about 6 plates all enough to share Â 2500person Â 5 dollar Mimosas and a good Bloody Mary bar included Â Everything we had was delicious Â The service was good Â They also have a small breadcheesepastry table that you can help yourself to included in the Brunch price Â I also really like this Hotel

Author: Charlotte Y.
Content: Great room decent service and strong cocktails Â Thats the low down in a couple of seconds Â I was here Friday night with a friend and overall our experience was nice enough Â I must say that there wasnt a thing bad about our experience it just wasnt anything we hadnt experienced before Â Instead of opting to wait 45 minutes for a table clearly we should have thought about this prior to traversing out on a weekend night we decided to sit upstairs main dining room in a sunken in lounge like area that could seat about 46 parties Â Our server was attentive albeit very very young much like the rest of the staff here and brought us our drink order swiftly Â Damn my drink was strong  some red concoction with anise in it Â As we werent starving and were only looking to graze that evening we ordered the tortilla not the name on the menu but its a lot like the tortilla served at Cafe Iberico a flat bread with mushrooms and manchego and a couple of grilled a la planxa items namely the calamari and tuna Â We loved the tortilla and flatbread but the calamari and tuna left us lukewarm Â Id definitely give it another shot but with a bill for over 8000 for 4 tapas dishes and 2 cocktails I may wait a little bit before making it a destination Â Oh the room is splendid high ceilings sunken in dining area with a theater style kitchen in the rear

Author: Carl A.
Content: Great looking place Â Airy and open feeling Â Pretty good views of Grant Park Â I would say it is a good date placeMenu is is pretty enticing forwardthinking as well as traditional Â It was also a little pricy and average Â However the cheese board is very impressiveThe service is very attentive Â Great touristlocationI probably will not make a trip back here unless I am with outoftowners and were hungry and on South Michigan Avenue

Author: Amy R.
Content: I went here with a group for a friends going away party Â We didnt want to spend time arguing about what to order but we had one friend who doesnt eat pork or beef and the rest of love red meat so we hesitated getting the chefs choice Â The waiter assured us that the chef would accomadate and indeed for every red meat dish that they brought out they brought my friend his own fish or vegetarian dishWhile it was more than we typically spend we got so much food that we all felt that it was an excellent deal and soooo delicious Â The space was fun and fancy but not formal Â The sangria was unique and tasty Definately worth a repeat visit

Author: Heather L.
