Content: For great tapas this place really cant be beat Everything about our experience was wonderful  the staff was friendly and knowledgeable The food was divine The only thing that could have been improved was that our tasting of cheese was probably around one ounce Thats a bit steep if you ask me  several dollars for three little thin points of some cheese But the accompaniments were delicious The creme Catalan was too good to be true

Author: Jessica B.
Content: I went here last night and it was AWESOME The red sangria was lovely but I much preferred the Merengue drink which was fruity but not overly tart from the grapefruit inside Yes thats the girl in meFoodwise you cant really go wrong but portion sizes are DEFINITELY small even smaller than I anticipatedI recommend Mixto of meat and cheese garlic shrimp bacon wrapped dates short ribs with fois gras and my absolute favorite the pork belly with green apples That was cooked to perfectionThe restaurant is smaller than I thought but the big openair dining area upstairs and the patio seating are very comfortable Great place

Author: Dyan F.
Content: Delicious Delicious DeliciousIve been there twice done the chefs menu each time and have been absolutely wowed by the food Â Bacon and other cured meats play a pretty major role in the cuisine and as a selfproclaimed bacon expert this stuff was some of the best Ive had Â All of the dishes had the perfect marriages of flavor from more traditional tapa combinations like baconwrapped figs to unique combinations like a brusselsproutgarbanzo beancitrus fruit dishService was attentive and after expressing a fondness for one of the desserts one of the chefs even came out with the recipeMercat I hope to see you again soon

Author: Angie F.
Content: One of my favorite restaurants in Chicago and I am a Native foodie Â Every single dish Ive had is like a dream Â And Ive had EVERY ONE POSSIBLE for a vegetarian Â Ive sent friends there Â Ive had many business lunches there and every single person has thanked me for the referral Â I could go onandon but I would just ramble the same point over and over It is fabulous

Author: Denise H.
Content: I absolutely love Restaurant Week in Chicago Â I went to Mercat with a few friends on 22310 and was taken by surprise as I walked in because of the cute little loungebar area Â The hostess was very pleasant and greeted me with a smile Â The coat check is in a very awkward location out the exit door and in the lobby of the Blackstone Hotel but I understand since the first level isnt really all that bigWe had sooooo much food Â Im not a huge red meat or pork eater but I found myself digging in the tapas plates of my friends because everything looked and smelled so darn good Â And wow did it taste good Â There was not one thing at Mercat I did not enjoy Â The waitress was so pleasant and smiled every time she came to the table Â The one thing to be very cautious of are the stairsmaneuvering them can be a little tricky if youve had one too many pitchers of sangria

Author: Sarah M.
Content: The food is delicious The drinks are lovely The space is breathtaking But maybe its because Im such a Midwesterner but I find the portion sizes absurdly small in relation to the pricing With a ton of tapas places in town I wouldnt go here if I was really hungryOn a weekend call for reservations if you want dinner anytime before 10pm

Author: Eduardo V.
Content: We found this great restaurant while staying at the Blackstone Reinassance in Chicago Â They recommended it during checkin at the hotelEven though we were still early for lunch they accommodated us and showed us the Lunch menuThe service was great Â The decor was impressive and the food was deliciousGreat tapas and varied selection Â Portions where kind of small but then again they were tapasCroquetas de Bacalo were superb Â I ordered the scallops with eggplant and they were fabulousNext morning we had breakfast hereThe BEST Eggs Benedict Ive ever hadCongratulations to the ChefAt night it has a great crowd with two available barsA must

Author: r. m.
Content: Always reliablebut how do I get to this statementFirst let me state that I am not a big fan of Spanish Tapas because in general tend to not be vegetarian friendly very meat reliant dishes nor tasty spices are not incorporated into dishes wellAlso I am bias in favor for this place because a good friend Patty bartender works there and hooked me to this spot But I have taken my mother there for her birthday first dates business associates and even had a small gathering of friends for an early birthday dining outingBut the service is also knowledgeable attentive cooperative if you are a vegetarian just tell them an idea for an alternative to a menu selection and prompt But it is what they serve that always is dependablewell seasoned food that is full of flavor Who knew spanish tapas could be so full of life and colorThe Spanish omelette is a must as are the jalapeno peppers The cheese selections are always incredible with their separate dipping sauce The chocolate croquettes with marshmallows is unbelievable Â My guest typically are drawn to the large prawns octopus or the chef selection of meats The sangria is something special as wellAlthough the restaurant is large it tends to not get too loud in there unless you go downstairs to the lounge on a Friday night Highly recommendedOne

Author: Chris L.
Content: Maybe I am lucky and my first visit to restaurants end up wildly successful Â Apparently it happened again Â The wife and I decided to celebrate our first anniversary by trying out Mercat Â We werent sure what we were going to do so we just threw caution to the wind and did the Chefs tasting menu with wine pairings Â At 85 per person its not cheap but this was a special occasion so we went for it Â Holy jeez Â This was the steal of a lifetime Â 12 bountiful courses with 3 different wines Â We honestly expected 12 amusebouche courses Â Instead the portions were large and delicious Â But let me take a step backWhen making the reservations I mentioned that it was our anniversary Â Our waitress who was beyond awesome brought us complimentary cava and what could be described as Spanish bruschetta Â Both were absolutely perfect Â The flavors matched perfectly Â Ill preface the description of the meal by saying that I dont recall the names of the wines that were paired Â What I can say is that they matched perfectly with the food melding one course with another Â As for the food we had the following dishes Â cadi urgelia serrano ham  fig salad some sort of Gazpacho with salmon roe and pork belly truita de patata con espinacas croquetas de bacalao datiles con almendras gambas al ajillo costillas de ternera conill amb chestnut coles de bruselas with lentils I think imperial wagyu short ribs and diver scallops Â Again everything was well sized and delicious Â By the end of the meal I asked the waitress if we were finally done since my stomach didnt have any additional room Â This must be a common question because she brought out soda water with bitters and said that it would make us feel much better and less full Â Guess whatIt worked Â Im putting that down as a trick from now on Â Honestly the whole experience we had was above and beyond Â Its not a cheap date but I think we got every pennys worth Â I would absolutely recommend Mercat to others

Author: N. Q.
Content: Stayed at the Blackstone back in February and decided to try the hotel restaurant Â I have to say this is the first time Ive had a fantastic dinner at a hotel Â Cool hip place with good food Â Great vibe and ambiance Waitress was knowledgeable friendly and attentive Loved the Serrano ham and fig salad I loved the sangria The potato and rice dishes sorry forgot the names were delicious too Â Everything looked so good Come here with a group so you can sample more dishes Since Im from LA I didnt think the prices were too high especially since the portions were a decent size

Author: Alison Z.
Content: One of my top 3 restaurants in Chicago The food is incredible and has elements of two of my favorite cuisines Spanish and French Its Catalan food so dont expect the same menu as a Spanish tapas restaurant We ordered the Mixto Charcuteria Cepes y Butifarra Flatbread Serano Ham  Fig Salad olives bread w crushed tomato and a couple other items that I cant remember but everything we ate was full of flavor and beautifully presented Also very good sangria with some interesting fruit and herb combinations Fun place for dates girls nights group dinners celebrations etc Great location Michigan  Balbo overlooking Grant Park Bring your visitors here for dinner and then walk over to Buddy Guys for entertainmentfun night out in Chicago

Author: Jonathan C.
Content: The place is great for lunch 18 for the Catalan Express includes a fountain drinkiced tea an appetizer and an entree The place was a bit confusing to get to we went to two doors one in the front and one inside apparently you need to go to the lobby then walk up one stair I ordered the Mixto Croquetas it was good then scallop for entree The scallop tasted just ok it was very fresh but it did come with six pieces medium size Overall the quality of the food was decent Nothing exceptional but the amount of food you get for the price is unbeatable Recommend anyone who wants to grab a quick bite during lunch hour If you want quality food this might be an ideal place

Author: Zach M.
Content: Perfection My mission was to find a place close to the Loop for a group of old friends to meet and catch up after years apart So I was looking for delicious food that could be shared Tapas at a round table in a comfortable place conducive to lively conversation Â This place was exactly that And it really overdeliveredThere were 5 of us and we had the chefs choice menu 65person their PDF menu online says 55personapparently the price has gone up and the website hasnt been updated And it was SO MUCH DELICIOUS FOOD We were full half way through the courses and thought it was over and they just kept bringing more dishes Excellent friendly helpful attentive staff at every level from the greeter to the waiter to the busser to the floor manager They gave us just the right amount of information without at all ever being intrusive to our conversation and enjoyment They made us feel VERY comfortable The atmosphere of the place was perfect lively comfortable casual elegant In the end we wanted to have them split the bill equally across 5 credit cards and they didnt bat an eyeJust put it all in the hands of the chefs tasting menu and youll have a great delicious time

Author: Elaine A.
Content: Not quite sure what happened Â I had high such high expections however it is pretty questionable when youre able to get a table on Valentines Day literally 20 minutes before arriving Â The space is beautiful Â I enjoyed the ambiance but the service was subpar Â Kinda almost felt like I was talking to a used car salesman while choosing different items Â The food was overpriced and not as delicious as I had imagined Â Some items we ordered included patatas bravas I was expecting more than 6 tots costillas de ternera pollo a la planxa which was overdone and rubbery and tocino con cidra Â However their complimentary tomato flatbread was delicious and I shouldve filled up Â After about 25 minutes of waiting for our next set of tapas we decided to cancel the rest of the items Â The wait in between was kinda ridicDefinitely a let down for me but at least the drinks were delicious

Author: Bridget K.
Content: Ill keep this short and sweet Mercat a la Planxa Market on the Grill was hands down the best dinner Ive ever had Â Not only was the location convenient for a 6 PM reservation in the loop near the touristy spots I hadnt seen yet but the ambiance was warm and welcoming too Â My dining companion loves food just as much as me so when he chose this spot I knew my taste buds would be pleased Â The restaurant is run by world reknown chef Michael Fiorello  so my expectations were plenty high Â All of which were exceeded with their famous baconwrapped dates and creamed spinach dish with delicious currants Â The marbling of the meat selection was ideal and tasted exceptional with the saffron coated goat cheese tray Â  All the seasonal tasting plates made sense and had a unique flavor that lingered until the next mind blowing item hit my paletteThe service was incredible and the red sangria was refreshing after a long day of work Â I look forward to a return visit and highly recommend your next meal be here

Author: Jim R.
Content: I didnt know what to expect and so it easily exceeded my expectations The food was delicious We did the Premium tasting menu and the only course that was less than great was the lobster preparation Everything else was incredible The service was spot on This was our first visit and will definitely not be the last Its a little noisy in the dining room but not so noisy that it becomes uncomfortableI forgot to try the Sangria which is supposed to be the best around so I have a great excuse to do this again That and I know my foodie daughter and her husband will go mental here The sooner the betterThank you Mercat a la Planxaloved it

Author: Victoria B.
Content: Pros ambiance presentation bruschetta croquetas de xocolateCons slow service super salty food small portions overpriced 150 meal but left completely unsatisfied Next time we want tapas we will stick to the best Babareebas or Ibericoeven Peoples in Bucktown

Author: C W.
Content: One of the best meals I have ever eaten Â For sure get the bacon wrapped dates and the fried milk chocolate for dessertThe Sage Smash is also a must have but exercise caution it is addictive

Author: TopCat W.
Content: We had the Chefs Luxury tasting menu and everything was simply delicious Â Including the free crispy bread topped with a heavenly tomato salsa Â I really had to stop myself from eating it to save room for the tasting menu Â Next time I want to try the Iron Chef Mondays tasting menuThe food was more than plentiful and very well priced Â The service was good Â This restaurant was very noisy even on a weeknight Â So dont go there for business or romantic mealsChef Jose Garces rocks

Author: Carol K.
Content: I understand why people would like this place I do But for me it was too rich and salty The richness of the food is obviously Mercats tapas style lots of bold flavors lots of butter lots of oil lots of cheese lots of saturated fat Its fairly creative slightly above average execution and technique however nothing earth shattering My gripe is that they dress the food up so much you cant actually taste the food you mostly taste sauces my tongue was saturated with salt Okay enough about the salt if youre into heavier richer flavors with small plates youll probably enjoy it Plus the libations were great the mixologist behind the bar was an aceI thought it was good enough I probably wont go back

Author: Becky C.
Content: So this is what expensive tapas taste likeand it was so worth it Â Im so glad to have chosen Mercat for Restaurant Week Â The ambiance and decor of the place was trendy and romantic Â The lighting was just right to set the mood for a nice dinner out with lover and friends Â The food was amazing Â Since there were 4 of us we decided to have everything Mercat offered on its Restaurant Week menu and shared Â Sharing is caring and loving every bite was what we did Â In the order of deliciousness with detailed descriptions of my favesPatatas a la Riojana It was all about the sauce I dont know what else they could have done other than weaving magic into this dish Â The pairing of heirloom baby potatoes and cider braised chorizo was out of this world Â The potatoes were soft and soaked up the sauce really well while the smokiness of the chorizo complemented them perfectly Â But the manchego espuma sauce was bowllicking good Â DroolingSerrano Ham and Fig Salad Fresh with just the right amount salty and nutty The sherryshallot vinaigrette laced everything so that every forkful was tasty and tangy but not overwhelming The serrano ham and fig added character to the dish while the nuts gave it some crunch Â Pelotas de Calabaza y Cordero Each item by itself would have made this dish ordinary but together they could conquer even the pickiest eaters tastebuds Â The delicate flavor of the butternut squash dumplings matched with the lamb ragout in the most interesting way Somehow the squash diluted the gaminess of the lamb and made it into some sort of awesome Â The beech mushroom escabeche  black truffle rounded out the dish Trutia de Patata Playful square packages of yumliciousness Â These spanish style omelette with spinach potatoes and saffron aioli would kick any other square packages and gigantic halfmoon shaped omelettes butts Â The pastalike skin on the outside was al dente while the inside was mashed potato heaven Its hard to describe the overall flavor profile of this dish Â You just have to try it for yourself Â Too bad it was only one or two bites worth Â Everything else the flash fried peppers the serrano ham  chorizo croquettes the shrimp asiagoesque flatbread and the goat cheese  grilled sourdough were excellent as well Â We ended a great meal with Croquetas de Xocolat  small fried balls of milk chocolate on top of sticky marshmallow caramel and premium olive oil

Author: Kristen P.
Content: This was my second visit to Mercat and I think my first was a bit betterThe first time I had gone I think my experience was better because I had a bigger budget to play with My fiance and I were able to try ANYTHING we wanted the second time I went with a gal pal and we didnt have as much to spend so we picked quite a few of the traditional tapas that were a little less expensive and fancy and unfortunately they tasted that wayThe best things about BOTH meals the bacon wrapped dates must be had the complimentary brushetta super moist and the platter of 3 meats all very goodFor the rest of the small plates I didnt find the portions matching up to the price I will pay good money for good food but most of the entrees were just maybe a 7 out of 10 and probably 35 more per plate than I considered fair for the plates I will say that if you do have the ability to spend the extra money the fancier plates definitely give you a better bang for your buck taste wise Props to our server unfortunately I cant remember her name but I was expecting service to be more snotty to go with the ambiance and she was greatIll be looking for a new tapas place

Author: Andrea T.
Content: I bought the Gilt Deal 100 for 2 people We were very excited to eat at Â Mercat because were big Iron Chef fans go Jose We were NOT disappointed If there was a 45 option thats what I would give vs the 4 or 5star reviewAmbiance Id give an 8 out of 10 Â I was cold temperature in the restaurant sitting by the window but I really liked all of the rustic touches and warm colors I deducted a point for the bathrooms  not superclean and not that great compared to the rest of the restaurantService Id give an 9 They were attentive but the descriptions of what we were eating were delivered a little too quickly Would have liked to hear a little more about what we were eatingFood was amazing  8 out of 10 First CourseChefs selection of charcuterie cheese and olives Very straightforward very goodSecond courseShort ribs with horseradish parmesan and bacon flatbread This was todiefor I would go back just for this dish Unlike the other reviewer I found there to be a hint of horseradish  it was not at all overwhelming It was a great complement to the savory short ribs Rich and deliciousBaconwrapped dates stuffed with almond This just proves that everything is better with cheese The best baconwrapped dates Ive ever had My boyfriend said he didnt like baconwrapped dates and quickly changed his tuneButternut squash dumplings with lamb ragout beech mushrooms escabeche and black truffles Nice mix of flavors but you have to love butternut squash Not a fave but worth tryingGambas al Ajillo  Garlic shrimp Good but expected and too much salt Third courseblack angus ribeye Good but Its ribeye Perfectly cooked but could have trimmed the fat I liked the sauces in the order they were served  chili sauce was great green sauce was good mayobased sauce was forgettablejumbo prawns with lemon and garlic A little fishy salty and not cleaned properly Â AverageCatalan spinach currants pine nuts and apples Fantastic A highlightSpicy potatoes with spicy paprika aioli Not my favorite The middle was scalding hot The sauce was just soso Needs more heatDessertMilk chocolate croquettes with banana marshmallow rosemary caramel and arbequina olive oil This is a must try Seriously I thought the banana marshmallow sounded gross but it was sooooooooo good YumDrinksWe had the seasonal sangria It was light and refreshing Not a drop left

Author: Daniel M.
Content: Finally went here after hearing good things and I am very glad I did We got the La Mesa de Jose tasting menu It was awesome The tomato bread they start you out with is very good The tasting menu included bacon wrapped dates shrimp octopus and cured meat among other things There was a romesco sauce that was very tasty as a garnish for a few of the meatsWe also had the seasonal sangria which was delicious The restaurant has a nice set up and great location I would recommend this place for anyone who likes Spanish food

Author: cari m.
Content: Have been here 3x  enjoyed each visit However the last visit Sat Aug 31 my party there were 3 of us was a bit disappointed wthe shrimp dish  we returned the dish as the shrimp was a little off The waiter apologized  gave us a free dessert  which none of us liked but at least it was an acknowledgment of our complaint LOLIf youre looking for intimacy  this isnt the spot Its very very loudBTW  much prefer their sangria especially the flight over their wine selection Maybe Im not a fan of Spanish wines

Author: Tom Z.
Content: late review Had the tasting menu almost half a year ago and it was amazing There was such variety and as a hater of olives I even enjoyed the olives dish The octopus was the highlight for me will definitely go back there when I am craving tapas again

Author: Aneta S.
Content: We stumbled upon this by place accident was close to the hotel and had great reviews Although it was a very busy night we were so lucky to get a table Â The atmosphere is fun and hip and not stuffy at all Â Now to the best part  the food Â I think this would be the first time I fell in love with Spanish food Â We drooled over the little potatoes and the lamb chops are a must try  they melt in your mouth Â The tapas style is fun because you get to try different things Â This is a fun romantic hip place and the Iron Chef was so nice and downtoearth Â Thank you for a fabulous meal

Author: Tom S.
Content: My friends took me to Mercat for my birthday It worked out that a Wednesday night would be the best for us so my friend made a reservation requesting a window seat divulging that we are foodies not some out of town conventioneers and foodies who would be reviewing their visit Not only that we were there to celebrate a birthday and wouldnt it be nice if they could stick a few candles in whatever dessert we would end up orderingI arrived first or so I thought and took a seat at the bar in the Bodega just inside the front door I ordered a specialty cocktail called the Matador a Hendricks Gin based cocktail with among other things beets and fresh thyme The drink I received had neither beets or thyme because the bartender said he was out of them Nevermind A few moments later one of the other two friends arrived She poured over the menu and ordered a whitefoam topped cocktail that had again among other things white wine and basilAs our reservation approached ee made our way upstairs to the dining room and checked in The hostess assured us that she had reserved the requested table at the main window until she realized someone else had been seated there She did note that another window seat was about the empty and that we could have it but it wasnt really the table my host requested The other person at the front desk offered us each a glass of Cava while we waited for our friend and our table in the small and tight holding pen a few steps below the hostess standThe space is punctuated by a view of the kitchen lots of tile a 70s inspired honeycomb that stretches from the Bodega downstairs to within a few feet of the ceiling from which hangs modern barebulb pendant lights Mirrored walls with caricatures of Iron Chef Garces and his staff working the Bodega and restaurant seemed to expand the space while the warmer tones keep the space exactly thatWhen the table was ready we were seated and our waiter was quick to approach and walked me through the menu as I was the newbieWe were encouraged to order 3 to 4 things per person and I was assured the portions were big enough to share which hasnt been my experience in other tapas restaurants But my fears were soon quelled We each ordered 3 things and before we knew it the food was flying out of the kitchen before slowing down towards the end of the meal The 2nd flat bread we had ordered was one of the last things to come out It was considerably more done than the first which was recommended to me a beef short rib bread with bacon jam and caramelized onion topped with a copious amount of Parmesan cheese that didnt bring nearly the salt the dish needed The 2nd flat bread had mushrooms and  allegedly  sausage but the sausage was sliced paper thin and only noticed by one in our party who peeled it away from the bread I still wasnt entirely sure it was sausage as it was overpowered by truffle oil that intensified the taste of the mushrooms In fact the running theme of the evening was truffle oilFried dough balls were the most disappointing including the ham and cheese croquettes that had no ham flavor whatsoever and the what turned out to be free dessert of milk chocolate croquettes that simply tasted of fried dough overpowering the weak milk chocolate That they were free in honor of my birthday was a poorly veiled insult Salmon was overcooked and lacked flavor beyond the crispy skin and I almost forgot the unimaginative salad we picked through and let the waiter clear when it was just over half eatenStand outs included the rabbit in pasta rillettes with more bread the plantain and spinach empanadas mostly thanks to a very flavorful relish that contained red bell peppers that were beautifully marinated and the foie gras The only grilled item apparently their specialty was the garlic shrimp  with the heads still attached I was excited about sucking the head but they were empty What is the point of serving a shrimp with the head if the brains have been removed  and by whom The shrimp were nice and large beautifully cooked meaty white and redolent with garlic and sauceThere were questions about the quality of the vodka served over the vodka ordered  and lo and behold the 2 more Matadors I had both contained beets a mash in the bottom of the glass that lent a very faint earthiness to the drink and a soft sprig of fresh thymeFreebies included the garlickytomato bread and fresh mild green flashfried chilies with a Romesco sauce  and the milk chocolate croquettes thanks to my making it through another birthdayWhile this review feels a bit harsh we did enjoy our time and most of the food I think when I go back Im going to play it differently and order a bottle of Spanish wine and eat my way through their grilled tapas

Author: Susan F.
Content: The atmosphere of the restaurant is very nice Â It feels intimate yet was full and loud in a good way when I was there Â We ordered the chefs tasting and were able to accommodate me as the only person in the group who did not eat red meat Â It is definitely pricey but I felt very satisfied at the end and they were definitely not skimping on the wine Â I thought it was strange that dessert was not one of the courses for the chefs tasting I think they should clarify that ahead of time because I think one would expect it Â Also a number of the dishes were exceptionally salty Â It may have been particularly bad on some of the seafood I got but it was also noted by my friends who had red meat Â Also a little too intimate in terms of table size because we were having a hard time getting everything to fit on the table Â The snide comment about how we were positioning our plates by one of the servers was a little rude and unnecessary Â Not sure I would go back Â I agree with what others have said there are definitely less expensive tapas places in the city Â However this one seemed elevated they just need to work a bit on seasoning and maybe service

Author: Rob C.
Content: came for lunch Â sampled thearroz a la cazuela with saffron scented broth shrimp chicken chorizo artichoke confit and piquillo aioli flavorful little saltypimientos de padron with salbitxada and sea salt like shishitosmixto croquetas bite size with serrano ham and chorizo romesco  super mini bites could use better texture since was too softsetas al horno with wild mushrooms confit potato shallot and parsley  goodand patatas fritas with house cut fries and spicy paprika aioliplace is very fusion

Author: kirstjen l.
Content: my new favorite neighborhood place Â When I moved to South Loop there was not a single decent restaurant Â About 2 yrs ago I said that I would be satisfied if we could get a tapas joint Â Well we got more than a tapas joint in Mercat de la Planxa Â This is a hot spot Â The food is tasty beautifully presented Â I have had to fight my urge to lick my plate on more than one occasion Â Desserts are a MUSTA pitcher of sangria goes a lot further than youd expect hereThe restaurant is pretty  you have a great view of one of the prettier parts of Grant ParkThe only drawback is that on occasion my waitresses have been less than stellar

Author: angela n.
Content: I am a total food snob and I give it 5 starsYum wish I lived in Chicago

Author: Jean S.
Content: Lively atmosphere Â Friendly helpful sincere service Â Food was ALL hot fresh and excellently presented Â Lets face it with tapas there are lots of opportunities to goof up but Mercat didnt Â The boys enjoyed the beer selection lamb and tomato bread best Â  Consider reservations if your party is over 2 people Â It was really busy at 700 on a Monday

Author: Sean C.
Content: We had a Saturday evening dinner with friends in celebration for a birthday Â Words cannot describe the overall experience we enjoyedWe started the evening with a photo and short conversation with Iron Chef Jose Garces Â What a delightful and downtoearth guy Â He was in town to premier his 1st Iron Chef Battle tomorrowI was eager to experience this Catalan restaurant after living in Madrid traveling to Andalucia eating at Emilios and Cafe Iberico Â This by far topped every American tapas restaurant Ive been too and brought back great memories of SpainEach of us chose 3 entrees for a total of 12 dishes rather than the chefs list for more variety for a little less costThe pitcher of Red Sangria was sweet and nearly perfectWe began with a tapas assortment of olives garlic shrimp and marinated anchovies with pine nuts and green olives Â The anchovies had a nice smoky fish flavor combined with the saltiness of the olive and contrasted the soft anchovie and the firmness of the olive for a surprisingly tasty dish Â The garlic shrimp were outstanding Â The bacon wrapped dates with almonds were a table favoriteWe had a mixed platter of jamon serrano chorizo and jamon de pato duckall greatNext came the patatas bravas or some lightly friedcrunchy potatoes with a paprika aioli which were fantastic Â Along with this came the Braised Rabbit Agnolotti with a trufflechestnut puree and cherries Â Hands down the BEST DISH we had all evening Â Essential to pair the cherry and the pasta in the same bite Â This dish gave me a glimpse of what it must be like to be in kitchen stadium Â Absolutely incredible and a must for anyone goingOur main dishes were the pork belly with cider glaze apples and a parnsip puree outstanding short ribs and diver scallops Muscovy duck breast with a duck confitfoie gras crepe dont know why they ever outlawed the stuff its divine and serrano wrapped tuna on a potato croquette were cooked perfectlyWe ended with a dessert of chocolate croquettes banana marshmallow rosemary carmel and olive oil Â I never imagined olive oil chocolate and caramel all together but the pairing of olive oil and caramel and the little marshmallow were absolutely heavenlySamuel was our server and was outstanding meeting our every need Â  Â The atmosphere was hip and modern so says my artist wife mood was good Â We all agreed this was one of our best dining experiences 15 hours as the servers gradually introduce each courseWe will definitely be back and will savor this for a long time Â The best dining experience weve had in Chicago

Author: Derrek C.
Content: 45 really Â I ate here a few weeks back and I can still remember the big bold flavors of my meal Â I had the 2 course lunch here and I chose the Arroz a la Cazuela a type of Chilean soup the Butifarra con Judias house made sausages with truffled white beans with the fries as a side and my friend and I split the chocolate croquettes as a desertThe Arroz a la Cazuela was a solid dish Â The saffron added a great aroma to the broth and the flavor was subtle but not hidden Â I didnt care too much for the artichoke confitthe shrimp chicken and chorizo when eaten with the aioli blew that away Â My second dish was essentially house made sausage with with truffled white beans Â The white beans knocked my socks off Â They were the best beans I had ever had Â The accompanying fries were well cooked the but the aioli wasnt too memorableFor desert a friend and I split the chocolate croquettes with banana marshmallow Â My friend loved the croquettesshe devoured hers so fast but I didnt enjoy them as much as I did the marshmallows with caramel Â Silky smooth with rich banana flavor Â    highly recommended Â Dont let the olive oil turn you off of this desertit adds a nice contrasting flavor to this dish I will definitely visit Mercat when Im in Chicago again    I cant seem about to forget those delicious truffled white beans    Oh and I also had the seasonal sangria Â If Im not mistaken it was 7 and well worth the price Â Youd never think of putting basil in an alcoholic beverage but damn was it great

Author: Elizabeth A.
Content: Visited Chicago in October this place was recommended by a coworker Â Seriously the only glimmer of a complaint I have is that its a little hard to see from the street Â We took a cab it was POURING and he didnt know where it was and the sign is virtually impossible to read from Michigan Â Once we were inside I was amazed Â We arrived earlier than our reservation so we sat at the downstairs bars for a couple beers Â Great atmosphere friendly bartender Â The hostess seated us in a cozy little half booth by the window Â We knew what we were going to order before we got therethe chefs selection Â So the first thing we got was a little charcuterie plate that had CARAMEL BACON SAUCE Â yes you read that right Â caramel  bacon in a sauce with bread and cheese Â I was in love at first bite literally Â From there we had an amazing array of tapas that ended with a steak that was cooked to absolute mediumrare perfection I have been raving about this place to everyone and anyone that will listen since I am now back in Colorado and hope to visit Mercat a la Planxa every time Im in the windy city

Author: Alejandra F.
Content: Our waitress Sally was fabulousWe ordered the seasonal sangria with the strawberries and time and thought it was deliciousOur favorite courses were the tocino con cidra phenomenal and the pintxos muranos The setas and espinacas were wonderful as well Our review for the mixto croquetas and the patatas bravas are that theyre good but our least favorite of the 6 tapas we had Also the focacia bread they bring out at the beginning is awesome and Im not a fan of tomatoesI had the chocolate y avellana for dessert Awesome for a chocolatehazelnut lover and a perfect size to share My boyfriend liked his dessert had the orangecarrot jam  sorry cant remember the name but he didnt love it as muchOverall pleasant first time experience and hope to go back soon

Author: Barbara T.
Content: I really liked the food and the decor but I have to agree with the people who complained about coming in for the restaurant Â week special menu and were pushed to order from the regular menu The server emphasized how small the portions were Well my friend and I DID order from the restaurant week menu and there was plenty of food for 2 women In fact we didnt finish the last couple of dishes Â With the 2 of us and the way the deal works we had everything on the special menu So its a very good deal that they are trying to steer you away from So why be part of Restaurant Week if you dont want people to actually take advantage of it RW gives people a chance to try a new place and if they like it theyll be back So they might lose money in the short run but will gain new customers in the long run Â I dont know if this practice is coming from the servers or management but they should really rethink itSo I would like to come back with my husband to try some the regular menu because I liked the food but no pun intended it left a bad taste in my mouth

Author: James W.
Content: Fantastic mealFirst the lay out of the restaurant and atmosphere are very unique Â When you walk in you go immediately upstairs on a small winding staircase which opens up into an expansive restaurant with a 2530 foot ceiling Â The restaurant is one giant room with an open kitchen but somehow its still feels intimate and closeI was there with five people and we choose to get the chefs tasting menu which allows you to try many dishes from all the different categories on the menu Â The majority of the courses were excellent only a few I did not love Â I highly recommend the bacon wrapped dates lamb chops and rabbit ravioli Â Also the sangria was deliciousI see other people were complaining about the service but I did not find this to be much of an issue although I was there on a Wednesday night Â We were seated right away waiter was attentive and very knowledgeable Â The only complaints i would have about the service was that the food was slow to come out of the kitchen and the waiter was a little too much of a salesmanOverall highly recommended

Author: William R.
Content: Had an amazing night here Â We had this Gilt City deal which was a four course dinner for two Â The food served tapas style never seemed to stop comingThe waitress was a bit uptight but in a way that you would like your waitress to be uptight Â I loved the ambiance and the tiles above the kitchen that did nothing but remind me of the Mercat Santa Caterina in BarcelonaI would go into detail but I ate here two months ago and could not do it justice Â Unfortunately eating here often is not within my means but hopefully I will be back soon

Author: Larry B.
Content: Who doesnt love dates wrapped in bacon This Spanish tapas place on the second floor of the Blackstone hotel was a fun place to reconnect with my old college roommate My only complaint the noise level is deafening My friend and I were 18 inches apart and had to lean close to hear each other Not much fun when youre trying to talkThe service was great and it was packed on a Tuesday night at 7 pm I recommend you order the meat or flatbread dishes because the veggie options were boring Catalan spinach and some cauliflower tapas were mehAnything with chorizo  spicy sausage  was great Flatbread with shrimp and chorizo and flatbread spare ribs with chorizo were delish Dont skip dessert We got some kind of chocolate mouse with ice cream that was so good we ordered a second dessert  milk chocolate croquettes Without alcohol but including tip it came to 100

Author: Sneha P.
Content: Came in here on a Monday The La Mora is top notch from the mint to black pepper to the black currants We also tried some tapas the baconcovered dates patatas bravas a goat meat dish and some olives Delicious The La Mora was the highlight The Olmeca Martini looked really interesting too The server Mateo or Matt was nice and attentive but a little rehearsed

Author: Seema K.
Content: I really liked this tapas place It had a large selection of Spanish wines The house bruschetta bread was so tasty Also loved the arroz coliflor the truffle cream lemon and manchengo cheese made it fantastic tasted like a risotto The brussel sprouts with feta cheese cranberry and walnut was so delish and unlike any sprouts I have ever eaten Didnt care too much for the patatas bravas they were a bit too fried We did like the goat cheese pear compote but you could only eat so much of it They had tons of vegetarian options which I loved My hubby really enjoyed the garlic shrimp but found bacon wrapped lamb dish to be just ok Â The ambiance is nice and service was really gooddefinitely worth checking out

Author: Anna M.
Content: Wonder food great atmosphere Went with some friends from out of town They liked it too Just was disappointed that the waiters mixed our orders and some of us didnt get what we ordered but what someone else ordered and they got stuck having to order something else

Author: Piper W.
Content: Had breakfast there as well as lunch on another day Lunch was definitely better

Author: Jen S.
Content: I always loved Iron Chef Jose Garces for being so humble and talented in what he does I was really excited to be visiting in Chicago and was about to dine at his restaurantGuess what I love this guy even more The food was amazing Thank you Iron Chef Jose Garces for a wonderful meal My girlfriends and I enjoyed the evening with drinks

Author: Sunny I.
Content: The chefs are geniuses Each dish is a work of art and tastes as good as it looks

Author: Kristin B.
Content: After all the hype with the Blackstone Hotel and in speaking to people who worked at the hotel I figured I would get some friends together and try it out The views from this massive room were amazing We had a spot in the back by the elevator which was a great spot for people watching There were six in our party and we went through multiple pitchers of the very tasty Sangrias The menu had so many different selections that it was actually fun to make selections from Our favorites included the Cheeses Ham  Fig Salad Spanish Omlet Ham Croquettes Spicy Potatoes and items from the Grill While this isnt your typical tapas place you are in for a tasty adventure Definitely a great place to take someone you want to impress Its a great date setting romantic atmosphere not too loud and 5 star service

Author: Niraj P.
Content: We went there the other night with a fairly large group 8 people and had a blast The atmosphere was fun and lively The drinks were good and strong and most of the food was very very yummy My favorites the meatballs flatbread with shortribs grilled steak and the chocolate croquettasDidnt like the baconwrapped dateshave had better at other tapas restaurants and the service was somewhat slowOverall it was a bit overpriced for the portions but everyone seemed to walk away with a full belly and a smile on their face

Author: Miles H.
Content: Im just now trying to put into words my astonishing experience at this place Simply as an often pickyass person who loveshates restos like SushiSamba Tru Topo NoMi Francesca Danko SF Mr Chow LA etc I had one of the most satisfying explosive and complete dinners of my dining life PeriodDont read below just goMercatuh oh Absolutely phenomenal experience in appreciation of sesnual robust bright flavorsalmost brought tears to my eyes Im stillstruggling to put it into words Also amazingly after only a few months in operation the place is spinning like a top with the kitchen servers Sam all working throbbing in perfect harmony doing saying delivering at the right time in just the right wayMercat does not thankfully aspire to the new haute vanguard of Spanish cuisine but takes the best of Spanish sensibilities combinations passions together with elements of French and Euro rustic whole suckling pig to hit a glorious and perfectly priced sweetspot for pleasure seekers

Author: Kevin M.
Content: We visited Mercat a la Planxa for a nice indulgent Valentines Day dinner and we were blown away by the mixture of flavorsWe looked at the menu and realized that we would never be able to decide what we should try so we put ourselves into the hands of chef Jose Garces with the prix fixe menu This was absolutely the right choice I tried 5 kinds of food that I never had before and probably wouldnt have chosen off the menuIts been mentioned on many other reviews but the Serrano Ham and Fig salad is truly amazing The Conill Amb Chestnut Braised rabbit agnolotti with rosemary a trufflechestnut puree and brandied cherries was delicate and delicious The Lobster and Waygu short rib a la planxa were prime examples of the restaurants signature grilling styleWe were also impressed by the bartenders at Mercat We enjoyed the Martini de la boqueria bombay sapphire pomegranate liqueur fresh sour and fresh mint and the Spanishattan Bourbon with a vanillasoaked raspberry and vermouth which were tasty twists on traditional favoritesWe were already big fans of Cafe BaBaReeba for Tapas on the North Side but Mercat a la Planxa was a great discovery for us

Author: Kailin L.
Content: I came here with a party of 6 for dinner Â Some of us were staying at the Blackstone hotel and we decided to check out Mercat a la Planxa Â The food delicious but the service was unfortunately far from the quality one would expecthence the 2 stars Â Our waiter pushed the 58 78 with wine pairing chefs tasting menu at least twice if not three times each time with more pressure at one point saying things like its REEAAALLY YUUUMMMMYY Â And when we told him we would prefer to pick our own dishes he was very visibly miffed and less attentive to us for the rest of the night Â When we did place our orders he forgot 2 of the itemsThe food here is great but the service is at best careless at worst pushy and rude Â Get your tapas fix elsewhere

Author: Jessica R.
Content: We had a mediocre experience at Mercat a la Planxa for lunch during Chicago Restaurant Week Service is what really killed this experience Our server was not knowledgeable about the food or wine having to field all our questions to another although he wasnt new He was not attentive and our drinks went without refill for quite awhile He never smiled It did seem he had five tables to take care of but with a prix fixe menu it shouldnt be that difficultThe atmosphere wasnt intimate and unfortunately still felt like we were in a hotel yes I know it is a hotel restaurant but the restaurant should feel like a separate dining experience when you enter in my opinion The food was decent The Serrano ham and fig salad was really good but I thought the extra smoked bacon was unnecessary and overpowered the other flavors The scallops were the best part of my meal with the roasted eggplant puree and wisp of basil sauce very delicious and melding together I couldnt eat any of the dessert options so they were kind to substitute cheese instead which were good My husband however enjoyed the milk chocolate croquettes with banana marshmallow to no end and suggested I take a bite and suffer through a few hours of pain from my allergy because it would be worth it for how amazing they are I did not but his final course did determine that this review was at least 3 stars Recommendation Just go for dessert

Author: Hilary J.
Content: This place rocks Great cocktails great food great service I went there for the first time on Saturday with a friend and was pleasantly surprisedThe portions are small but as expected in a tapas restaurant But the dishes are insanely good Great flavor combinations and innovative itemsTry the mojito tootasty little cocktail

Author: Susan N.
Content: Very pretty decor professional and efficient service great cozy bar downstairs Food is delicious every bite Chef Garces is gaining popularity for good reason Try the short rib flat bread it was yummy However I cannot overlook how TINY the portions are Tineeee I know tapas are not supposed to resemble gyro plates or supersized value meals but these portions were extra tiny Ive eaten at 5 or 6 other tapas places and I felt that this one served the smallest portions at the highest prices I also felt that the cocktails were weak which did not help the cause Sorry kids Ill likely skip it the next time

Author: Andrew T.
Content: When in doubt come here Â You wont be disappointed Â I am telling you Â I have probably been here 5 or 6 times so more than most but certainly not a enoughMercat is a tapas spot and though a bit pricey they do a great job Â I have ordered multiple options from their menu experienced Â a grandiose chefs tasting menu and even engaged in morning beverages and brunch with their all you can drink special Â Choose from make your own bloody mary delicious Sangria options or if you are feeling bubbly their mimosasAlong with brunch comes a selection of tapas treats  and even some paella Â The only other complaint  potential issue I can think of would be the proximity to a hotel which on a weekend for brunch can leave you with a large group of loud tourists blabbing away Â The food and drinks help you get over it

Author: Dawn D.
Content: Wow Â What a disaster Â This was my second visit to Mercat and it was like night and day Â The first time was two or three years ago and we had a great time Â Last night howeverwow Â We were there to celebrate our friends 40th birthday and the service was just awfulWe had a reservation for 13 at 930 Â When we arrived which admittedly was about 10 minutes late two of our group had already checked in with the hostess upstairs who told them that they were ready for us Â So 10 minutes late we went upstairs and said we were only going to be 10 people and they told us that it would be about 10 more minutes  um what Â Okaaaaayso we went to the upstairs bar and ordered drinks Â About 30 minutes later they had our table ready Â Just a ridiculous delay considering the time and that we had a reservationWe ordered pitchers of margaritas and a LOT of tapas Â Personally I ordered 3 dishes Â 45 minutes later I had received one of them Â The tapas that came out for the table was badly timed  some people didnt get anything they ordered for 30 minutes Â So after 45 minutes when the waiter came back and asked how things were going I told him that I had only received 1 of my 3 dishes  the seafood meatballs yum Â I didnt get the patatas bravas or the croquettes Â He went away to put in the order and 10 minutes later came back to say they had just run out of the patatasand then blamed me for having just ordered them Â  I said well actually I ORDERED them 45 minutes ago Â He suggested another lentil dish which I agreed to try and which never showed up Â The croquettes came out and were quite tastyOur server should have checked in with us earlier about our food Â He did try to salvage some tip by getting us free desserts and then of course added 19 tip for himself since we were a large party Â We didnt argue the tip but certainly didnt contribute any more than that which we would have done if the service and food delivery had been better Â The food that DID make it to our table was very good hence the two stars Â The classic margaritas were excellent Â Too expensive for my taste on a normal basis and based on this experience they cant handle big parties so no real reason for me to go back again

Author: Marisa S.
Content: Service was some of the worst I have ever experienced He took over 20 minutes for our waiter to come to our table once seated and he then ignored our table and surrounding tables the rest of the afternoonWe went for the Sunday brunch special  25 and the drink special  8 The deal sounds awesome until you realize that you will only get 2 or 3 drinks within 2 hours because the service is so awful Once complaining to the manager they comped one of our meals which was much appreciated but not enough to warrant another visit I give this place 2 stars because the food was good and that is their only saving grace

Author: Maggie P.
Content: A couple years ago I would have rated this my absolute favorite restaurant in Chicago Yet its popularity grew and it has slightly changed to cater to its growing numbers Not necessarily a bad thing but theyve taken out some of the best dishes that were offered on the menuThat said the final product really is spectacular Its highly inflated the ingredients are of normal quality but Chef Garces uses them in the most unique combinations and has developed some of the most outstanding dishes in the Chicago areaDont skip on the sangria its too good Overall 4 stars Fun atmosphere and experience I love tapas but very expensive

Author: Rebecca O.
Content: Mercat was a totally unexpected surprise on our visit to Chicago Â The pimento were so good we ordered another and the mushrooms were amazing If you like garlic pepper and Spanish tapas you will be really glad you gave this place a try Â I hope you dont come in large numbers as we will be back before we leave ChicagoSotwo days later Â Even better Â A special of squid tomatoes black beans Â A wonderfully loud and friendly space with so many people talking and enjoying Â A different tempranilloI hope you enjoy as much as we and all these other people have

Author: J B K.
Content: Im not normally a fan of tapas only because I tend to favor places that give you larger portions for lesser prices However Having had such positive experiences at 2 other tapas restaurants in Chicago why not go for 3 for 3I was set up to come here to meet a guest I left the burbs an hour and some change early got there 20 minutes late anyway Word of warning for those who are coming from the burbseither plan ahead orplan ahead Thats all there is to it Traffic in downtown Chicago is brutal to say the least and coming during dinnertime is a verifiable nightmareAnyway enough about my travels lets get to the grubThe table bread is amazing I think it was some kind of bruschetta but it was absolutely delicious I could have gorged myself on just those aloneMy dinner companion and I elected to go with the Chefs Selection which is cornucopia of food Be warned however it because it IS the Chefs selection you are going to PAY for the chefs selections Very impressed with the types of flatbread cheese and spread plate As well I loved their dumplings I think thats what they were About an hour into our meal we still hadnt finished anything and the waiter brought out steak knives At that point we were both stuffedbut we managed to get some more food down anyway I think it was more than 7 different types in total but my memory is somewhat hazyWe also elected to go with a pitcher of the white sangria However since they were out of pitchers our waiter instead promised us 3 glasses of sangria apiece Since this was an option we decided to try all three types out and we were very happy that we did The white was very weak emphasis on VERY the red had a very strong wine flavor that didnt overpower and yet still left you with a pleasant tingle and the seasonal was nothing to write home about Can you guess which sangria we liked bestCheck time came and I realized why we had gotten so much food I remembered rather suddenly why I dont eat out very often Im not complaining thoughwe had an exemplary meal being served by a toprate waitstaff While Id love to come back often its the price tag that makes me realize that perhaps often is a little much Save up a little and make an occasion of this tripIts also important to note that it can get a little crowded making navigation to the bathrooms a little difficult That and some of the prices Â were the only things that knocked off a star Hey have you SEEN gas prices How does one afford to eat AND drive these daysEnd result Parking is available through valet food is pretty pricey but with good company its a great dining experience Highly recommended for the more casual dating scene as its not overly pretentious I thought and the staff is very friendly and helpful Great times

Author: Samir R.
Content: MMMMMbaconAfter eating at Mercat you can see why Jose Garces is an Iron ChefWe had the chefs tasting menu and everything was wonderful Â There was not a single dish that I did not enjoy The wine pairing was excellent as well Â Service was good and the ambiance was nice as well Â Mercat is one of the top dining experiences I have had and anyone in Chicago or visiting must do

Author: kai m.
Content: Great ambience  trendy and nice without making me feel awkward for wearing sneakers Every bite of food I had was delectable the chocolate croquettes with banana marshmallows was incredible the sangria was strong and not too sweet and the black lentils with garbanzo beans and feta cheese is as filling as a meal Baconwrapped lamb Yes pleaseAlso if you can try to get seated in Carloss section He was a great waiter Friendly attentive without being smothering and he made me laugh so hard at one point that I was doubled over covering my face

Author: Selin D.
Content: By far the best infused food Spanish with all the ingredients in this planet Love love loved it  excellent service  price worthy amazing atmosphere Must try their pineapple mojito They make their own pineapple rum

Author: Fernanda N.
Content: One word WOWThe food is absolutely AMAZING I ate soooo muchService is just OK but worthy the shot for the food

Author: Beth R.
Content: Chefs Tasting Menu Need I say moreHonestly this was my first experience with a tasting menu and it was amazing I am somewhat of a control freak and the thought of having someone else bring dishes to me on their whim could have put me into panic attack mode but fortunately I had already had about 2 glasses of the amazing Summer Sangria so I went with itThe experience was literally something I will remember for the rest of my life so fun so unexpected so delicious and so worth the price I recommend the tasting menu at Mercat a la Planxa hands down So many surprises along the way I wont go into detail just do it It will change your life

Author: Leah E.
Content: This review boils down to a couple of low points that unfortunately took away from what could have been a really nice dinner out Â 1 Hostess and Seating We were a party of two with a reservation and yet had to wait a half an hour for our table Â Once it was time to seat us the hostess came out to the pool table in the Blackstone that was nice and said our table was readybut then it wasnt again a very oops just kidding moment followed by some sortofawkward standing around in front of the hostess booth time Â In a nice restaurantas suggested by the prices the celeb chef and the buzz hostesses once upon a time I used to be one should seat people who have reservations promptly or quote an appropriate time that they will have to wait do all of this while being accommodating and actually HAVE a table when they retrieve the guests Â Also If you sit by the window in Mercat a la Planxa it is freezing Â Like putyourjacketbackon freezing2 Waitstaff There are so many of you Â But they breezed past our table with 12 second mumblings about what they were serving This is foodie stuff Â And as the selections came off of a tasting menu I was curious about the dishes Â That extra moment it takes to describebriefly I know youre busy what Im eating makes the experience much more rich and enjoyable Â Besides I want to know if youve given me horseradish cream or a butter sauce theres a huge difference in flavor3 Food Â It was nice some of it outstanding and delivered at varying temperatures some of it much too cold Â I wondered if I can see the kitchen from here why are my shrimps cold Â The spinach dish is unbelievable Â I could have eaten a pound of itEverything else was niceAlas those low points sure were lame Â The Gilt City deal made it a nice experience albeit one that I am unlikely to repeat

Author: N U.
Content: The food was great The restaurant week menu did a great job of highlighting their tapas The lamb and dates were my favorites I was not a fan of the potato topped with sweet potato puree but the croquettes for dessert more than made up for that The white sangria was not flavorful but i dont think Ive ever had a flavorful white sangria My one dislike was that they didnt clear the plates from previous courses until we asked

Author: Audrey S.
Content: I came here for a 25 brunch and was extremely impressed I got to sample the meat cheese and dessert station located in the center of the dining room The cheese I think it was gouda was alright  pretty standard They had chocolatecovered strawberries and super cute tiny raspberry tarts Our first course consisted of sweet potatoalmond milk buckwheat pancakes topped with sliced strawberries cardamom whipped cream and syrup on the side These were most excellent And then came the bacon wrapped dates They were amazing and couldnt be any better Our second course was a salmon benedict and peppers The beautifullyplated benedict was made of seared skuna bay salmon a poached egg a sherry compressed tomato and maltese sauce atop a potato croquette The padron peppers green and shaped like chili peppers were served with a yummy salbitaxada sauce By the time our third course arrived I was feeling pretty full but didnt want to miss out on the revuelto de conejo and cochinillo asado The first was soft scrambled eggs braised rabbit brussels sprouts leaves glazed carrots and truffle chestnut toast The cochinillo asado was a roasted suckling pig with grilled onions and romensco sauce I didnt care for this dish so much but then I probably wouldnt like it no matter who made it The bloody mary bar had three choices of mixes  a traditional and then two lighter mixes  one a pale green which was really mild the other pink which I didnt try I went for the traditional and added chili powder paprika a pepper shaped like a tiny pickle and a celery stick They had one kind of fun addition which was a jalapeno pepper stuffed with sausage and a watermelon ball on either side stuck on a skewerThe staff was very friendly and accommodating One of the people in my group is a vegetarian and the cook actually prepared separate dishes for her which I thought was really thoughtful For each course the chef came out to tell us all about what he had madeAll in all this is a fantastic choice for brunch and I would definitely come back You can read more about my experience on my blog at audreyschroderblogspotâ¦

Author: Haley S.
Content: Went here for restaurant week last night Â They set it up as a tasting menu which my friend and I appreciated since there wasnt so much food that we felt sick by the end Â I always love bacon wrapped dates so that was goodthe salad with bacon serrano ham and toasted almonds was great Â I liked the free pan con tomate that they gave as well Â The best thing all night was the sausage manchego and mushroom flatbread Â So delicious Â There were two slightly similar shrimp dishes which were good but similar Â I also loved the lamb chops Â Dessert was little chocolate fritters Â One warning even with restaurant weekthe bill was 70 dollars a piecewe had a glass of sangria and a glass of wine Â So the verdict Â Excellent but expensive

Author: Erin S.
Content: My boyfriend and I stopped here after a show at the Auditorium Theatre The restaurant did not open until 5 and we were a bit early so we had the opportunity to sit at the bar for a few drinks The bartender was very nice and obliged us with some suggestions for dinner because we inquired having never been before When we say down we decided to go for it We went with the chefs tasting and the dishes promptly started coming We had the opportunity to sample sooo many dishes It was an adventure Lol I think we over did it a bit  we had no idea how many dishes we were in for at the outset  Luckily we hadnt eaten anything and were pretty famished It was a very neat experience The setting is very nice as well For my first Tapas experience I think the bar is set very high

Author: Band E.
Content: Overall dinner was elegantly prepared decently portioned and delicious Service was professional if not slightly robotic Much of the menu was a little too clunky heavy for us but there were enough selections to make the trip worthwhile

Author: Jim H.
Content: I never post reviews but since Mercat gets so many 4 and 5 star reviews planted I need to post Â Not many posts mention the exorbitant cost that accompanies leaving hungry with mediocre service Â My partner and I returned for a second time to Mercat Â One year ago we went enjoyed the great ambiance and views of Michigan Ave but felt a bit jipped spending lots of money and leaving hungry Â Well the same happened again last night but this time the service was very mediocre Â We spent 250 total and left hungry again Â I understand the whole tapas sharing idea and small plate  no entree rage that is going on in restaurants but when they are just shy of 20 for each and the taste is fine but you need to spend another 100 to fill your tummy not worth itAlso we ordered first two apps and the first came after 20 minutes we ate it quickly because we were starving after another 20 minutes the server came over and barked he barked regularly ANY QUESTIONS  um yeah where is our next appetizer Â half hearted apology and another 15 minutes the next app comes out Â 6 apps later 250 out the door we were still hungry and went to Atwood Cafe for a couple appetizers that filled us up with outstanding service Â The service at Mercat seemed forced like they were told to ACT like they care flashing fraudulent smiles while contempt dripped off their saber tooths Really like we should feel lucky to be there Â I dont mind paying big bucks for an outstanding meal with outstanding service and ambience but Mercat failed at all three and now for the second time we left still hungry and very disappointed Â The cabbie was cracking up while driving us home as well complained of being raped by MercatI give it two stars because some of the food was tasty but way over priced too small portions and the service sucked twat

Author: Louise D.
Content: Everything about this meal was stunning Great service and ambiance Absolutely an incredible find This was one of the best meals Ive ever had

Author: Hesham S.
Content: Perfect My daughter booked it when I was visiting her Nothing like it in Silicon valley The wine pairing menu was fantastic Only four stars because the first corse set the bar high and the third was also great  the second was so so clearly a filler

Author: River J.
Content: I went to Mercat a la Planxa on a Sunday evening Â We got a great table inside Â Overall Im very positive on this place Â A few major points are as follows Â Food was excellent  everything we ordered was great Â Dont miss the bacon wrapped dates Â Service was very good friendly and helpful Â  Â The space ie the dining room sets a great mood Â Its large open and warm and still fairly dramatic with high ceilings and big windows looking onto Michigan Avenue and the park Â The only negative Â Its a bit pricey Â There were four of us and we paid about 68 per person which included tax and tip Â This is not something I want to pay for every weekend but definitely worth going from time to time

Author: Melissa W.
Content: One of the best fine dining experiences Ive had in a whileThe waitstaff was attentive Although the runner did deliver his summery of each dish when served with very little enthusiasm and less confidence Â Our server was fantastic taking the time to familiarize us with the menu give recommendations reexplain things a few times as I stopped listening to enjoy the space gorgeous space by the way Â The portions were perfect for tapas Â Each dish was wall thought out with inspiring flavor profiles and well executed Â My only complaint about the entire meal was that the short ribs were way over salted Â However our waitress notices that I wasnt scarfing down every last morsel of it as i had down w all other dishes and took the time to ask what was wrong and then proceeded to have the chef remake the dish to my liking Â Fantastic Â I cant wait to go back for the suckling pig

Author: Henna N.
Content: I really want to give this place a higher rating The food was better than places Ive given 5 stars tobut the serviceI cant rewardTry the Spinach Serrano Ham and Fig Salad Fantastic Really YumMaybe the night my husband and I went was just an off night We actually came for our first anniversary dinner I LOVE Catalan food Ive lived in Gava Mar el Masnou and Barcelona and Im just a big fan of Catalan cuisine Ive been wanting to try Mercat for awhileMy husband made a reservation for our special occasion Really lame that we were seated with no privacy squished next to another couple If a guest makes a point of making a reservation just give them a table There were tables available We asked to move after a few minutes because it was so uncomfortable Still not the best location but at least we had a window on one side and werent stuffed between two partiesWhatever its about the food The wine was good We ordered a lovely bottle of Rioja The short ribs and scallops that I ordered were pretty good Half of the short ribs were way too salty though We ordered about 5 more dishes but I dont remember anymore In general very good Creative plating That serrano spinach salad stood out though If I come back thatll be part of the reason It was a nice night overall because it was a special night for us and we were determined to make it so If I had been with other company though I think I would have had less patience The service was horrible Our waiter was friendly but honestly we never saw him He took foreverrrrr to take our orders and never came back after that We had to literally flag him down if we needed something SUCH slow service We were done eating for awhile and just talking thinking our waiter would show up with a dessert menubut after awhile again realized wed have to flag him down Fine did it Literally takes him 10 minutes to reappear with the dessert menus Yes about the same time line to take our orderWell I really wanted to love this place Like I said I love Catalan foodit has a special place in my heart I wanted this to be a great first anniversary dinner Id say we had a great nightbut not particularly due to Mercat They did a decent job pulling their weight with the foodbut the service really needs to step up Too bad Ive been telling everyone about this placeand puffing up amazing Catalan cuisinebut eh not sure whether Ill bother to spend my money here again Maybe my calcots craving will kick in when spring arrives Well see

Author: Julia C.
Content: Incredible food Â Great for a small group Â We went before a concert at Soldier Field perfectly located for thatOur server was GREAT very attentive and knowledgable about the menu Â He seemed to have tried everything and had some excellent suggestions Â We tried a little bit of everything on the menu and everythign was excellent Â We especially liked the simple grilled items we tried grilled baby octopus Â The traditional tapas items you find at other restaurants were done here in a modern playful and extremely tasty manner especially the potatas bravasBe warned it is pricier then your standard Chicago tapas restaurant for dinner Â But the food is worth every penny and the portions are enough to fill you up if your order the amount recommended by the server Â The sangrias are different and very good as well Â The atmosphere is very clubby but has different areas to choose from Â We were at a table upstairs that was a bit weird to get to but then gave us more privacy and quiet Â They also have outdoor seating if you desire

Author: Bryan C.
Content: Had a chance to dine at Mercat this past weekend Â Dinner was great would definitely return Â We ordered calamari barramundi mushroom soup salad croquettes spicy potatoes Â Everything was amazing along with the drinksI would definitely recommend this place and cant wait to go again Â Nice looking space as well

Author: Adria F.
Content: Based on the number of reviews I dont need to say much Â Awesome albeit expensive tapas Â Portion size is generous for tapas so even though its pricey you leave feeling you got your moneys worthFavorites bacon wrapped dates of course arroz a la cazuela could have licked the bowl costillas de ternera beef shortrib flatbread with horseradish parmesan  bacontruly amazing and I would go back for this one dish aloneGreat place to grab drinks tooawesome sangria and great setting in the unique Blackstone Hotel

Author: Clare M.
Content: Thank you Mercat forexcellent servicewonderful wine listbeautiful datesLuscious Iberico HamJuicy SteakOne small request Â An authentic Paella Vallencia Â I have tried Paella at many places in chicagoNOT A SINGLE one has met my expectations or reminded me of the paellas I have had in Spain Â I have utter confidence that Mercat would easily achieve the authentic flavor and take it to a whole new level Â I dream of the day that they make one Â Paella Party Â call me Mercat

Author: Katie Z.
Content: Got our reso through OpenTable and were running about 15 minutes late Â We called on the way and they said it was no problem and it wasnt so that was appreciated Â We didnt have a waiter greet us for longer than Im used to and when we did he didnt introduce himself Â We did the chefs tasting menu with the wine pairings for 85 and got an insane amount of food Â The wine pairings were also tasty and the white that came with the first course was an amazing blend of what I called if Pinot Grigio and Riesling had a baby Â The service left a lot to be desired as a different person delivered each course and they did not introduce each item unless we asked for it I want to eat this every day for the rest of my lifeBacon Wrapped DatesShortrib flatbreadBread with tomato jam it was the starter and literally exploded with flavorGrilled ribeye with what I can only describe as avocado chimichurri cream on the side Ill pass next time to save roomButternut squash dumplings kind of gummy not very well seasonedJumbo prawns served a la planxa my prawn was grainy like almst sandy feeling grainyId come back for sure

Author: Steph H.
Content: I cant tell you how many times Ive come here and being a huge tapas fansnob thats saying a lot for this place While it may not be my absolute favorite Catalonian spot in the city I wouldnt hesitate to recommend it to anyone in the loop or south loop area Â When my mother visits she often stays at the Blackstone the hotel which Mercat is attached to so the restaurant is an easy jaunt from her room after checking in Â I can say Ive had most everything on the menu and you really cant go wrong with any dish you choose but I would highly recommend the scallops and the quail Seriously delicious Â The sangria is good but Im an after dinner drink kind of girl and love that they serve absinthe in the correct fashion Â Every now and then they have brunch for 35 per person for a three course pre fixe menu which I think is a pretty great deal Add an additional 8 and you get bottomless mimosas and bloody marys  which you can make yourself if youd like at the bloody mary bar which has allllllll the fixins you could possibly imagine Â All in all this really is a great place and a wonderful choice is your looking for authentic Spanish cuisine

Author: Ben A.
Content: Went here on the Saturday over Memorial Day weekend and I was very very impressed Â I have been to a few of the tapas places in the city including Cafe Iberico Cafe Babareeba and Emilios Â This place beats them all hands down Â First of all I thought the decor and atmosphere were a cut above Â Mercat is a more highend scene kind of place than the others Â I mean that as a compliment too Â The beautiful people were milling around at the tables and the restaurant bar where I had a chance to sample a couple of drinks  Spanish Fly and the pineapple mojitos Â Not a mixed drink kind of guy by any means but these were outstanding Â Once we sat down things got even better Â We had the serrano ham and fig salad which was basically a spinach salad with the ham wrapped around the outside instead of mixed in Â From there was one great dish after another  the setas al horno wild mushrooms the patatas bravas the baconwrapped dates these were Â ridiculously good Â And dinner topped off with the costillas de ternera which was beef shortribs horseradish parmesan and bacon on top of flatbread Â Amazing Â When I didnt think things could get any better we finished off a dessert of chocolate croquettes Â Service was outstanding  efficient yet relaxed Â I got what I needed quickly yet never felt hurried to make a decision or to eat and get out Â When I got up to leave after a couple of hours I was satisfied yet not disgustingly full Â I was also sure that I had to come here again as this is one of the best restaurant experiences of any kind Ive had here in Chicago

Author: Joe S.
Content: I had pretty big expectations going inbut sadly I was let down Look the food was good but something was off I almost felt like they were riding on their chefs success as the iron chef or whatever The bar tender brought it up and the serverIs it really that big of a deal Maybe but you dont hear michelin star restaurants flaunting it because the food speaks for itself Anyway the dates were great the shrimp was really tasty baby octopus was out of this world The scallops were a little tough and I love it when they melt in your mouth but that they did not Sangria was nice and our server was very nice easy on the eyes too Thats all I got wish it was better

Author: Janice T.
Content: After reading great reviews about this place  me and my boyfriend came here for our last night in Chicago together for their brunch We walked in and the place was pretty empty The decor was gorgeous we loved the concept of the open kitchen We were excited to come here because we were both huge Iron Chef fans All in all we were pretty disappointed The concept of the Tapas are great and they are indeed very filling The plates were a hit and miss Some were delicious and we would eat them all in a matter of seconds and some were just okay Took a bite and pushed it to the side I expected the meats  cheese stations to have a little bit more selection than the one meat to choose from and the two cheeses The girl that was our server was very sweet but she seem to not know the dishes that well and would forget all the ingredients in the dish when she brought it over But I am not holding her against that  she was attentive and did a good job making sure we were doing well The other thing I didnt like was the fact it was a tasting menu yet we used the same set of plates and utensils throughout the whole meal I understand if it was busy but it was quite dead so I didnt understand why it wasnt changed at least onceI do want to come again to try to dinner since there are a lot of great reviews about it It may have been an off day  who knows I will be giving this place another shot when I am back in Chitown

Author: Shari S.
