Content: The food at this place is fantastic Â Each dish had its own creative twist which was quite enjoyable Â They were accommodating with modifying dishes to make them vegetarianpescatarian friendly The scallop dish was great but when are scallops ever bad Â I loved the pelotas de calabaza y cordero minus the lamb ragout the patatas bravas and the setas al horno Â  Great wine list Â The big negative for me was the bathroom Â The bathroom was disgusting worst then a 4AM bar Â I almost gave them 3 stars for this Â The restaurant was so nice I was not expecting the bathroom to be so gross Â Did anybody else notice this

Author: Tamara F.
Content: How did I not know about this very cute place Â Not even a peep Â Love the high ceilings and dark colors Â We had the prix fixe deluxe dinner selection and they were gems about making sure there were no beef or scallops in any of the 12 dishes Â Our waiter was attentive and very knowledgeable without being overbearning and he gave us tips and trivia about our dishes and how the food was raised and or prepared Â I also enjoyed the wine he helped select for our dinner Â This may not be a girls night out destination but for a more subdued dinner it is perfect

Author: Mike S.
Content: Great lunch Â Great atmosphere

Author: Matt L.
Content: Jose Garces is an Iron Chef now Have fun getting resos Spoiler alert

Author: Brad C.
Content: Chicago owns Mercat about as much as it owns say Rick Bayless or Boul Michthat is not at all Its inevitable I suppose that a whole microverse is necessary to serve the convention and tourist crowds but its also unfortunate that the citys best Spanish restaurant belongs and wants to belong squarely in the realm of the outoftowners rather than in the cold and overweight embrace of area foodies You gets no loveAh air quotesnatures pretense But work with me here this is largely not a Spanish restaurant Sure Mercat advertises itself as Catalonian but its serving tapas uh Madrid with lots of nonnative elements see eggplant pureedefinitely not Catalan Thats bourgeois American conceptualization of Spanish food folks and that is pretty fascinating to observesort of like watching old people run frantically to catch a Blue Line Train that has in fact been stalled in the station for the last five minutes Okay kidding watching old people run is much fascinating But isnt it amazing that what we perceive as contemporary Italian or Spanish is really American rid of regional dogmas and nationalist preoccupations Lets have a little more faith peopleWell It had been a year since my last visit they did finally change the opening menuwhich Â must have been in place for a yearbut took off the one knockout dish a squid ink pasta with aioli that was among the better things I ate in 2008 Jose Garces for what its worth is one of the most consistent wholemenu visionaries Ive come acrossthere isnt a single thing on the menu I wouldnt want to eatbut rare is the truly memorable truly unforgettable dish Thats by design surely you come here max out your per diem enjoy your meal and poop it out a day later EphemeraBut plenty of pop though With tomatoes in season the introductory pan de tomato Catalan singsso much so that Im not sure why Garces serves this the rest of the year The cheese plates are nice bowing to tradition with a little contemporary flair we had a hard goat cheese that came with a garlic dulce de leche allowing us to make nice little sandwiches of cheese granny smith apple and the caramel Pasta remains a strong point the squash dumplings were beautifully creamy a glimpse of fall I found the lamb ragu and lamb bacon superfluous however Of the two surfandturf dishes skip the scallopshort rib dishoversalted and the additional parts eggplant puree artichoke salad while tasty did not cohereand go for the serranowrapped tuna which is a fun textural experiment thanks to the accompanying foie gras and croquette Because my father doesnt eat pork we also ordered a couple of classicstortilla Espanola gambas al ajillothat were entirely inoffensive but were presumably far below what we could have gotten if the well 85 of the menu was more amenableTo the part where I get to being an old maid the pricing is getting obnoxious This place was never cheap but the 1020 perdish increase over the past year is especially gnawing in light of the steadfastly small portion size On a perbite basis only Spiaggia has more expensive pastas were talking three small dumplings smaller than Urban Belly for 14 Really Some of the vegetable sides were also 14 We had the Escalivida a plate of marinated vegetables that literally had one small pepper three grape tomatoes a cippolini onion a small mound of eggplant puree and some figgedout breadit was great it was 11 Again really We had to prompt our server to get the once customary petit fours In other news Ive now officially become my motherLast year I would not have hesitated to bestow a fourstarer on this place but naturals not in it no longer The cooking is generally great but it is not true It is in spite of the talent behind it and the consistency within depressingly corporate I never thought Id say thisand apologies for doing sobut this place has no soul

Author: Amanda A.
Content: Great chefs choice menu We tried some food that I wouldve never ordered plus got my favorite the bacon wrapped dates Â Yumm

Author: Tara D.
Content: Mercat a la Planxa was probably the top three most memorable meals of my life Granted my family and I were celebrating and having a grand old time but the food was absolutely to die for We went for dinner and stuffed ourselves full with the complete Tasting Menu I think 85 per person I feel that if you are trying to eat Tapas as a meal you cant be frugal  tapas are SMALL PORTIONS Tapas in Spain are meant to be eaten with just alcohol as an appetizer Anyway the food was fresh and incredible The layout of the restaurant is very interesting and open Service was incredible Will absolutely recommend and go back for a very special expensive meal GET THE TASTING MENU

Author: Keely J.
Content: Underwhelming I wa expecting a lot more for some reason The food was okay but nothing to write home about Not a lot of vegetarian options and the space was a little too much for me

Author: Jen G.
Content: Good griefdid it really take me TWO YEARS and some three months to reach 100 reviews I think Ive reached the age where Im OK with the fact that I dont always visit the hot spot right after all the hot reviews perhaps this is why it took so long to get to 100I digress For more than a year Ive been meaning to visit Mercat only to have something change at the last minuteWith a visiting foodie in town though I vowed to finally make it this time and invited Jenny S along for the rideWe arrived on time for our 715 reservation and the hostess was nice when she told us wed have a short wait This proved to be accurate as we were seated in about 15 minutes but in the interim the downstairs host stand is next to the bar and we lucked into three empty seats and kicked off the evening with a round of drinks I went for the Two Brothers draft but the others opted for the merenguewhich smelled deliciousand the mojitoBoth bartenders provided excellent service while juggling the rather boisterous lounge patrons at the timeUpstairs once seated three of us immediately dove into the menu each choosing two tapascourses to share The best of the best Butternut squash dumplings with lamb ragout The grilled shrimp were the most traditional thing we tried but that shouldnt count against it Excellent presentation and nice flavor The La Peral cows cheese almost made me weep if only because I was too stuffed to eat or order more of itThe good Dates wrapped in bacon and stuffed with almonds an always dependable dish but am I being high maintenance wanting more than 4 per order Seafood paellagenerous servings of fish but a bit lacking in flavor Still a solid dish The fennel and white bean salad arrived late in the meal and as a result we didnt finish it but it was flavorful and had a nice portioningThe meh Mango sorbet started out sweet and nearly destroyed my throat at the end Say what Theres red pepper in there Put it on the menu pleaseWhile the service overall was solid its a bit annoying when you have to ask twice to see the wine list Also our waiter never stayed put for long and I had to ask him for more water Not a huge issue but guests should never have to ask for water Id visit again for sure I agree with some others that its a bit pricey

Author: Andrew T.
Content: First and last time here Â So not impressed despite the otherwise good reviewsPrices for drinks Â Sorry it maybe Michigan Avenue  but its SOUTH Michigan Avenue  not Gold Coast Â The cranberry mojito was decent but a bit watery and very light on the rum Â The seasonal sangria tasted watery againThe food was not that impressive Â Ill give them props for presentation Â 6 for a small bowl of jar olives Â Really Â  The complimentary bruschetta was the most appetizing thing we hadThe patatas bravas were inedible Â Put it up to your mouth and they smell of burning newspaper Â Unless you cut one in two and let it rest for a moment it tastes like youve just eaten burning newspaper Â DisgustingThe beef shortribs flatbread was okay Â Just okay Â I can tell the chef likes smoky things because the shortribs had an oddly similar smokiness that was far too similar to the patatas bravas  only the shortribs are edibleThe garlic shrimp was a joke Â Tiny frozen from the bag shrimp in a garlic sauce that was neither original nor very present in the dish in which it was servedI echo the sentiments on the generally snooty service Â Please folks Â You arent waiting tables for celebrities at some of the finer establishments in the city Â Stop acting like you do and just be friendly and pleasant Â I could go to the Elephant  Castle and get better service at the bar Â Lastly listen to your guests when they order a drink Â When I ordered a martini made WITH Lillet Blanc I did not order a GLASS of Lillet Blanc  and nothing elseSorry to sound like a hater but this place was awful Â Not worth a second visit

Author: Donald D.
Content: The food was fesh and appealing Â Certainly worth the trip

Author: Elaine H.
Content: Im going to risk the wrath of the Mercat fans by saying this place was just not that great Â The food was ok worthy of 3 stars but the bad service a sneaky upsell incident and overpricing knock it down to a 2star experience for meThe dishes are very pricey across the board and given the overall quality of the food we definitely came away feeling like we had spent much more than the dinner was worth As far as tapas go these are some of the fancier ones Ive had though not among the best Â The basics and classics such as bacon wrapped dates were disappointing you can get better at a less chichi place like Ba Ba Reeba Â Fair enough though this place is geared towards the exotic tapas and some of them were quite good like the spinach with green apple and the short rib with diver scallop Â Others like the butternut squash pelotes were weak Â More on the topic of this dish in a minute thoughService was really the big downside of the experience though Â Our waiter was weird and irritating suckyuppy and constantly doing the notsosubtle upsell Â An occasional excellent choice after I place my order doesnt bother me but its tapas Â We ordered six or seven dishes and really dont need to be patted on the head for our food selecting savvy after each choice Â Thats my personal favorite Oh those are delicious Yep thanks Â The more obvious upselling What delicious cocktails can I get for you Which dessert would you like instead of Would you like to order something to drink was annoying but it was the covert sneaky upsell that really bothered us Â We ordered the butternut squash pelotes 14 and the waiter said and that dish usually comes with 3 pelotes but I can do it with 4 for you Â It was close to closing time and there were two of us so we assumed he was doing us a favor and said thanks Â The dish turned out to be essentially four teeny squash tortellini Â overpriced for what it was but it turned out that they had also charged us an extra 5 for the 4th one bringing the cost to 19 for 4 little squash lumps Â And if you do the math youll also notice that the bonus one was more expensive than the three that came with the original dish Â Overpriced already not very tasty terrible pricing for the addon and truly awful and sneaky upsellingWhen I brought it up with the manager he seemed shocked that the waiter had not informed us that there would be a charge and also said he was surprised that they would have charged 5 for the extra squash tortellini thing and said hed talk to the waiter about it Â But no offer of a refund or anything like that just said he hoped wed still consider coming back at some point Â All things considered probably not Â Even if it had been cheaper and the service less sketchy there are better places for tapas in the city

Author: Christa R.
Content: This place is absolutely fantastic The tiger shrimp and chorizo soup is probably the best soup I have ever had in my life Service is fantastic and the ambiance is completely distracting Its beautiful Youll have to see for yourself Definitely try the white sangria Its refreshing a little pricey but worth it

Author: Laila C.
Content: I have found the HOLY GRAIL of Chicago brunch This place is ridiculously amazing and a great deal for 25 you get 7 tapas style food items and a charcutterie bar that includes delicious cheeses and salami proscuitto and AMAZING roast suckling pig The chef actually cuts up pieces of roast pork adds very good olive oil salt and herbs to it to make it even more delicious I could have just ate that and be delighted On top of that you can add 8 and get unlimited drinks You get your choice of mimosa 3 types of sangria and a crazy build your own bloody mary bar that has giant prawns the size of my face Also not only do they have the standard bloody mary mix but they also have Â green gazpacho and tomatillo mixes both make inhouse Also they have a bar of desserts and pastries I didnt try them but they looked pretty goodAMAZING Seriously words cannot describe how in love I am with the brunch right now I dont understand why everyone and their moms are not eating there every Sunday morning Basically for 50 you could spend the entire day drinking and eating and eating and drinking OMG I will be baaaaaaaack ps the only thing that sucked was charging 5 for tea

Author: Robyn P.
Content: I ate here in August 2008 and LOVED it when I returned to Chicago last month I didnt go back and now Im kicking myself for it every detail of that dinner a year ago is still engrained in my memory the magic began in the bar downstairs The Merengue is the very reason that Absolut Grapefruit has become my vodka of choice its blended with fresh strawberries and a mango and lime puree Yeah a girly drink but so what Turns out it was the best cocktail Ive ever had Then we headed upstairs and had a variety of tapas and cocas patatas bravas espinacas a la Catalana almejas y tocino costillas de ternera and lucky for us one of Jose Garces ironchefwinning dishes was on the menu that night sliced iberico and cantaloupe terrine The patatas bravas were like grownup tater tots they didnt have that hashbrown texture but were more refined and served with a paprika aioli Delicious The almejastocino and costillas cocas were excellent Spanishstyle pizzas a little on the salty side tho the former combined bacon clams and brandade which is a like a salt lick all by itself and the latter consisted of shredded beef shortribs horseradish parmesan cheese and more bacon Pairing these with salads instead of tapas would have been a better choice Next timeThe terrine was the best thing I had that night It was simple but had a stunning presentation with layers of thinly sliced serrano ham and cantaloupe that classic porkfruit combination doesnt get any better than thisMercat is pricey but well worth it in my opinion Aside from the mindblowing food the atmosphere was lively the music was fun and the vibe was vibrant Ill be back next year

Author: Richie D.
Content: Take a jaunt away from Barcelonas Gothic Quarter and Las Ramblas into Mercat Santa Caterina A Catalonian market possessing a myriad of colors flavors and aromas Â After experiencing the real thing in the homeland of Espana your heart will be calling for Chicagos South Loop Mercat a la Planxa located in the gorgeous Blackstone Hotel Â I finally had the opportunity to bite into their contemporary take of traditional and modern Spanish planxa grilled and madetoorder tapas Â Now normally tapas are bar bites in Spain so Mercat was a ways off when it came to priceunless I was unknowingly paying for the currency equivalent price in Euros Â Otherwise everything was Spain bumped up a notch involving chic decor with Gaudiinspired mosaics and octagonal shapes Â Mercat even offers a Whole Roasted Suckling Pig Cochinillo asado Â Note Must be ordered 72 hours in advance I took all my fellow Yelpers advice and ordered the Premium Mesa de Joses Tasting Menu Â Our fabulous waitress covered all bases by checking if anyone had allergies or dislikes explaining the difference between the Premium Tasting and ordinary tasting the premium basically includes the more expensive menu items ej lobster versus shrimp and was super friendly and courteous to the point of giving me a menu marking down which items were including in the tasting Â Accompanied by my wino friend we purchased a bottle of GarnachaTempranillo mix to accompany our food versus paying the overpriced wine pairing Â This was after sipping on a cocktail each of El Bolero and Merengue both nothing to call home aboutOn to the TastingI will say that our favorite dishes note that none were disliked were the following I included the menus Catalan names for referenceBaconwrapped Dates Stuffed with Almonds Datiles con almendras Best I had EVER had which says a lot since they seem to have become popular at many restaurants across the cityBraised Rabbit Agnolotti Conill amb chestnut One of my top dishes that was similar to a rabbit ravioli with a delectable trufflechestnut puree and sweet brandied cherriesColorado Rack of Lamb Easily the best lamb I had ever eaten with a delicious jus poured over the top with tons of flavorColorado Lamb Loin Brochettes wrapped in Bacon with Lamb Jus Pintxos muranos Ultra tender with tons of natural juices and tasty baconSerrano Ham  Fig Salad I have been to the Museos de Jamon Ham Museums throughout Spain and wherever Mercat gets their serrano ham from is outstanding plus this salad his huge with large tasty figs hidden withinMorel Mushroom Bomba Rice Arrox con morels Ultra fluffy rice dish with tons of truffle oil Whats not to love about thatGreen Bean Salad with Serrano Ham Judias verdes con jamon Im not a fan of vegetables but if this is what my mom prepared as a kid I would have quickly eaten my daily portion of greensAlso included in the tasting were the following Mixto cheeses and marmalades Spanish Omelet Truita de patata Mussels Mejillones a la rousillon Porcini and Catalan Sausage Coca Coca de cepes y butifarra and half LobsterI finished off my meal with the Croquetas de Xocolata which is not to be missed Â Theyre little fried balls of dough croquettes injected with milk chocolate which are to be dipped in the accompanying bananamarshmallow foamcreme and rosemary caramel Â The display alone is gorgeous being served on a deviled egg platter but once you pop into one of those little fried gushers the display is easily forgotten aboutMy one easily fixed complaint is that the dishes came out quickly in the beginning and then became spaced out by 20 minutes or so towards the end Â My other would be the close proximity of the tables but thats just how it goes Â Otherwise Mercat is the perfect spot for a special occasion like an anniversary and the Chef Tasting Menu is extraordinary with a good variety of dishes and plenty of food Â So make that Open Table reservation ASAP

Author: Phill C.
Content: Came last night for the first Iron Chef Monday which was featuring Mexican chocolate Â We got the Iron Chef tasting menu for two but also ordered additional items since those portions were smaller Â Tooootally didnt have to do that since I was struggling half way through the meal or maybe that was because I had huge burger for lunch Â The Mexican chocolate tasting menu included 3 courses and a dessert each course having 2 menu items and 1 Mexican chocolate dish Â I now realize some of our chocolate dishes were substituted with regular menu items Â The kobe beef tartare never came out and we never got the waffle with chocolate sauce Â Instead we got a chocolate funnel cake which was more like chocolate covered rice krispies with a papaya sorbet Â I was just so full I couldnt think straight Â But it all makes sense now since the table next to us was told they had run out of the Iron Chef menu portions Â Out of the the special dishes I tried both were okay Â The smoked duck over the chocolate linguine was perfectly cook Â The chocolate mole pork loin couldve been a bit more moist but the chocolate tamale was delicious Â Out of the other dishes from the tasting menu the only one that I really enjoyed was the serrano ham  fig salad Â The salad was wrapped by serrano ham into a salad meat log Â Filled with figs and large crispy chunks of pork belly Â Also the baconwrapped dates were delicious Â Crispy bacon stuffed with almonds with hot blue cheese poured over Â Other then that the rest of the dishes were just okayService started out great with our server informatively describing some of his wine recommendations Â But as the night went on the service got much slower and it took a very long time to get our check Â Im glad I tried the Iron Chef Mexican chocolate menu but nothing I would come back for Â Maybe just some of those baconwrapped dates at the bar

Author: Mandy B.
Content: We came for my mothers 60th birthday We got the chefs special and i highly recommend it They asked if anyone had any dietary restrictions and i explained i was a pescatarian For every dish with meat they brought me a seperate bite with vegetables or fish It was so considerate I also recommend the sangria flight a good deal to try 3 of their sangrias We mentioned on the phone that it was a birthday celebration and they claimed to have written it down on the reservation however nothing special was done Was a lil disappointed

Author: Carl B.
Content: Where have I been Â Im only the 1000th person to review this place Â Im sorry it took me so long to get here Â A tapas place with some nice surprises Â Loved the Blue Fin tuna and you cant go wrong with bacon wrapped anything  I had dates and lamb wrapped in itthe fruit date not my real date darn it Â I will be back

Author: Neha S.
Content: I love the food here especially the grill items which are their specialty Its a little pricey but well worth it for a special occasion The more traditional tapas were very good but I would concentrate on sticking with the items a la planxa They are delicious

Author: Kiks A.
Content: The little I know about Catalan is that Catalan likes differentiating themselves from rest of Spain though I dont know enough about either to be able to tell the difference between one tapas vs another Â Cafe amb llet anyoneFirst story bar is very dark and cozy kind of Wesque but when you go upstairs the ceilings are high huge mirrored walls and the place just seems huge Â They have this weird parenthases shaped seating right by the stairs that they filled with couples  my friends and i sat in the regular area cute chairs btw Â  Â All the drinks look really enticing  tried two spiced sangria and muddled fruitvodka concoction and they were yum Â The food reminds me of the American Express commercial where the service was great the food was  small elf food Â Definitely smaller daintier portions than any of the other tapas places Ive been Â The batatas bravas came out tiny and in a little row Â All the food was very good though Â The 4 chocolate dessert hit the spot too  white hot chocolate real sweet a chocolate mousse that was less sweet a chocolate cake with a tart sour powder on top and a walnut milk ice cream which was surprisingly good Â I plan to go back

Author: Mary P.
Content: Must try the Branzino and Bacon wrapped dates Delish

Author: Sarah S.
Content: What a disappointing birthday dinner I came here on Monday for my special Iron Chef birthday dinner and it was just so underwhelming and failed to meet any of my expectationsLet me start with the goodWe got lucky with our street parking spot Our waiter was so well informed about the foods and also the wines I didnt know which wine to get and he brought me a couple of wines to try He was just like a sommelier with his vast knowledge of the liquids However I should have known he would bring me two of the most expensive wines on the menu to try 16 for my glass of South American vinoNot on the Iron Chef Monday menu we had the Cadi Urgelia which was quite good Its a cow milk cheese platter but honestly nothing is cooked so if this was somehow messed up that would be a big shameThe Serrano Ham  Fig Salad on the Iron Chef  the regular menu This had such a creative presentation and was so tasty I dont usually like salad but this was encased in the thinly cut ham with just the right amount of sherry vinaigrette plus tasty spiced almonds to boot Perhaps my favorite dish of the nightThe bacon wrapped stuffed dates Datiles Con Almendras only on the regular menu we ordered  paid for these separately like the cheese plate All tapas places seem to have these but the presentation and being topped with the sauce make them top notch hereMediocre which should probably be under bad but I cant say they were horrible PTruita De Patata Con Espinacas Spanish omelette with potato spinach  saffron Not much I can on this except it was just okayEspinacas A La CatalanaOkay spinach but nothing too appealingGambas Al Ajillo garlic spciy shrimp UnderwhelmingNow the badDun Dun Dun Dunsome people had their own nice tables but if youre a party of two expect to be smooshed next to a bunch of other parties of two Lame to not have the proper personal space while diningNowhere did they say you need to be very specific in saying you wanted the Iron Chef menu The table next to us went to try the Iron Chef Monday menu and the waiter informed them that was not going to happen they only had 20 portions Really For your special opening night of this you made enough for 20 people Errrrr That really sucks The guy at that table was quite annoyed because he called and asked about it the menu when he made their reservation and nothing was mentioned about having to secure the menu Thankfully we did note we wanted the Iron Chef menu in our Open Table reservation so we were granted the privileged The worst partthey substituted menu items and no one ever told us this was going to happen Umsince when can you just change someones dishes Especially one of the special Mexican chocolate items What in the world This was just such a poorly executed special menu for Mercat We never got the Kobe beef tartare or the Canela waffle with chocolate sauce Ridiculous when that was the whole point of this menu ArghCostillas De Ternera beef shortribs horseradish parmesan  bacon Flatbreadwe each had one piece of this and didnt finish the restdidnt even take it home The flatbread itself was good but the toppings werent greatMexican chocolate tamale and Mexican chocolate Iberian pork loin Yay I thought Something from the special menu The Pork was good the tamale was notMexican chocolate linguine with smoked duck The duck was good and I realize duck is greasy but the dish overall was extreeeemely greasy and extreeeeemely salty Not a fanAlthough our server started out nice it got extremely slow He told us the kitchen was backed up and Im understanding of thatbut at this point we were just waiting on our dessertDessert Well this wasnt the dessert we were supposed to get AND we just waited 30 minutes for it to come out30 minutes for some cocoa puff things and a bowl of sorbet ArghSo after we finished our dessert we waited another 30 minutes for him to ask us if we needed anything else Then another 10 minutes for our check We put our CC right in for him to take so we could leave but it was another 5 minutes before he came back to us All in all we spent two and a half hours there when it should have been about 90 minutesThey were also supposed to have Mexican chocolate atole with doughnuts as a dessert but that wasnt on their menu in the restaurant Check the sites chicagoeatercomarchivâ¦ it was supposed to be 5 courses but it was actually four  2 of the dishes listed were not offered It was tasting sized portions of the middle three dishes mixed with some of their regular menu itemsIm sorry Mercat a la Planxa but you did not make me a happy birthday camper and you truly failed on the Iron Chef Menu premiere night Im truly just so disappointed  I feel bad for my buddy who ended up shelling out 140 for a bad dinner for my birthday

Author: Alya A.
Content: final rating of 3 stars is an average of the scores of our overall experience1 star wait  party of 3 wa 745p reservation on a wednesday night was made to wait 45 minutes for a table with no real apology or explanation 2 stars pretension  our silly euroaccented cheese presenter actually had no idea which cheese was which whether cow or goat etc etc3 stars service food recommendations drinks  all up to par4 stars the food itself  traditional tapas but more interesting flavorful exciting would go back to reorder and try new things5 stars decor  stunning

Author: Cameron C.
Content: Absintheyes they do have absinthe here Â I know it may not be excting to many and I know it isnt nearly as potent as what you would get in Amsterdambut hey I got a bit perky Â They did it right too with the communal ice contraption dripping over a sugar cube Â The space is drop dead gorgeous with high ceilings and grant park as a backdrop Â Love the location and the funky colors and paterns throughout Â The food was right on esp the churizzo flatbread thingyparty in your mouth Â I walked out the door onto Mich Ave with a smile on my facehmmm did the absinthe have anything to do with this

Author: Shane B.
Content: This is tough because the food was fine the atmosphere was fine and our service was fine Â The thing that got to me was the price Â While in Chicago for a long weekend over the Holiday we ate at both Girl  The Goat and Publican and were amazed at the food Â But not at Mercat and the bill was almost twice as much Â I knew what the bill was going to be but I expected the food to be at a higher level Â Im not sure I would recommend this to anyone Â There are much better places to spend your money

Author: Jo M.
Content: We are currently in Chicago where we are thinking about as a permanent move Since we love Spanish food we felt the hotel we are in would be perfect as Mercat is part of the place Super stay super food I think notWe first went for lunch and were really hungry The menu was good and had nice choices He went with the ham and fig salad and I had another salad with cheese and veggies Nice Good sangria too Then it took forever to get the next dishes like about 45 minutes And we were hungry so it seemed longer and the other tables were being served and they were leaving Finally the manager came with the food to apologize Nice touch good hanger steak and spinach for me We thought wed give it another try for dinner That was the worst idea yet The service was horrendous and we didnt even get served We went to the bar at 6 and were told we couldnt get an actual table for dinner until 815 So we sit at the bar They told us we could eat at a bar table then We know what those are like tiny with little dollchairs that are so uncomfortable We passed Wed waitWe returned at 815 promptly itll be a few minutes we were told At 830 we are offered the same bar table from 2 hours before The exact same table I told the woman this so she said we could have another tiny table but with a banquette for seating Okay a little better Then she said she was sorry and would bring us a glass of wine to make it up Next thing we have a hostess staring down at us telling us that we are lying about waiting two hours and it was ten minutes and we were relaxing in our rooms I asked are you lecturing me and she actually said yes sort of Wow Then a male manager comes and gets in our faces and says that we are so lucky that they fit us in and we should have taken the first table at the bar because they take reservations for those tables too I guess the bar stools are reserved hereI will never come here again even if I move to Chicago and will tell everyone what horrid service this place has There is really bad karma here for some reason Avoid at all costs

Author: Dana A.
Content: I liked this restaurant Â The ambience was fantastic 5stars Â My only complaint is that the tables are really close together think French bistro close Â Therefore do not plan on having an intimate conversation here instead plan on making friends with the people sitting next to you Â The food is good didnt blow my mind though Â The portions are small typical tapas bar restaurant Â Each dish is about 3 bites for 2 people Â My favorite dish was the SALPICON DE MARICOS Razor Clams Piquillo Pepper Sofrito Saffron Aiolo Grilled Focaccia Â For desert I had the CROQUETES DE XOCOLATA 38 Cacao Barry Milk Chocolate Croquettes Banana Marshmallow Rosemary Infused Caramel Arbequina Olive Oil and it was the most delicious dish I had all night Â The customer service is good Â I had a problem with receiving water for 30 minutes and I ended up getting up and tracking someone down Â The staff made up for it by giving me the desert on the house a complete surprise and made the absence of water worth it Â I ordered the sangria sampler and the white sangria which happened to be pear and ginger when I went was the best Â All of the sangrias seemed to lack wineand flavor which was very disappointing they could have been lemonade for all I know Â I then ordered the NV Aria Brut RosÃ© Pinot Noir  Cava which is a sparkling Pinot Noir Â I expected it to be redder and more flavorful but it was still good Â Expect it in a small champagne glass though not a wine glass

Author: Michael W.
Content: Let us begin by admitting I am an avid Iron Chef fanyesstarting back with the original in Japan even before the American version came outqueue the poor dub over in a sing songy voiceooooohhhit tastes like bubbles dancing on my tongue Â So with Mercats chef Jose Garces having actually WON the most recent Iron Chef America my expectations are high Â This guy can cook and this place should be something well north of specialThe decor is very nice and hip Â As you flow up the circular staircase you come into a room where the curved theme pleasantly continues Â Tables walls walkways all having some curved elements Â  High ceilings give the space a nice open feel Â Bright colors and varying textures abound Â You know immediately you are in a lively cool space Â Just what one might expect from the restaurant of an Iron Chef Â The only questionable concept is the abundance of mirror walls Â YupI did flash back a couple times to childhood memories of late 70searly 80s at my friends house where the mirror wall was rockin it out Â They make it work here at Mercat somehowOn to servicemehwhat can I say Â For the prices I would expect pretty stellar service Â Its not that our server wasnt attentive but just a little off Â ieupon having just been sat down our server hands us a menu and asks us if we want a drink Â YesIm being way too anal herebut how in the world would we know what we want to drink when you literally just handed us this expansive drink menu Â The other glitch on the service front was that we ordered the chefs selection so we didnt have prior knowledge to what was coming to us Â Differing servers would come by and deliver dishes to us Â But they seemed to be so rushed and talked so fast I literally will not be able to tell you exactly what we ate Â It was kinda like some kinda of food delivery ninjas would sneak in stun us with a lightning quick bitch slap smackdown of a dish and disappear off into the night before we realized what just happened Â I think Remo Williams moved on to open up a culinary service college and they must have a job placement program with Mercat Â Google that sht you youngins that have no idea who Remo is Â So lets cut to the food Â This was clearly Mercats strongest point Â As I said I cant tell you what we ate exactly as I couldnt seeunderstand the grasshopper U valedictorian that took the pebble and threw it in my eye but with the chef selection we received a huge variety of dishes and all were very tasty Â They were inventive fun creative and always balanced nicely in flavor Â The drinks were also really delicious with some sharp and interesting flavors Â Overall experiencemaybe a little pricey but the food is strong and we had an enjoyable dinner 3 for service 4 for food and decor so well round em up to 4 Â Now if I can only figure out how to hire someone from Remo U to clean my loft

Author: Lily L.
Content: Located inside the Blackstone hotel Mercat a la Planxa is a Jose Garces tapas restaurant Â The restaurant is located on the second level with soaring ceilings and a view of the Lakeshore Drive no water Â Service Service was pretty standard for what youd expect at a restaurant of this caliber Â People were friendly Â When our server was taking my order I told him that I had a couple of dietary restrictions Â He noted them but the kitchen must have forgotten about it Â As a result I was brought out an entree or second course of a dish that I wouldnt have eaten Â As we were about to pay for our dinner our server brought out another dish and apologized for the oversight Â I thought that was really nice Food Â I think the food is why the restaurant deserves a solid 3 to 35 stars Â The food was okay Â Nothing spectacular Â Id say good but not mind blowing Â We ordered the 35 chefs choice la mesa de Jose and the 18 express meal Â The chefs choice came with an assortment of food based on obviously the chefs choice Â The 18 express meal allowed us to pick one first course and one second course along with a soda Â We chose the Spanish omelette and the burger Â TRUITA DE PATATA CON ESPINACAS The omelette was what youd find at any other restaurant except they have this ginormous hunk of cheesy aioli on top Â It tasted fine Â THE MERCAT BURGER This burger had some sweetness to it Â Comes with PATATAS FRITAS basically fries with a bunch of seasoning to it La Mesa De Jose Dishes I must admit I wasnt expecting hefty portions Â And I dont know what the normal portion size for a lot of dishes are Â However we were given 14 of a slice of the Truita de patata Â I dont know if everything else was just 14 of the normal portion size but just FYI Â But I think we had quite a few dishes so I guess its a pretty reasonable thing to doARROZ A LA CAZUELA The soup was good Â I especially like the broth Â You get a shrimp sliced in half in this meal along with chorizoSERRANO HAM  FIG SALAD The salad was pretty decent Â I liked the dried figs where the sweetness contrasts with the saltiness of the ham Â Its a hard dish to mess up and it was alrightPIMIENTOS DE PADRÃN These peppers were fried but not too greasy Â Came with more aioli than we could eat but thats fineMIXTO CROQUETAS This was decent Â But again portion size was tiny Â I think it was 2 croquetas that were the size of the thumb of a childVIEIRES I ALBERGÃNIA This was one of our second courses Â It was a single scallop that had been pan seared on top and bottom Â Then they sliced the said scallop in two and put the two halves on a skewer Â Felt a little cheap honestlyESPINACAS A LA CATALANA Â This was my veggie dish Â It was good Â The apples were supposed to be sliced into tiny matchstick slices but some werent sliced all the way through so you had hunks of apples Â But I didnt mind too muchSHRIMP not seen on menu I got this shrimp dish way later Â It was well cooked Â I think overall the food was decent Â Nothing was bad Â It was all good but just not super delicious or great Â Maybe my expectations were a bit too high for this place

Author: Suzanne E.
Content: Nothing new to reportthe place is still lively and still a great use of the beautiful old space that used to be a dive bar with poorly maintained tropical fishbut I have to share this Â I bought a friendly tourist a drink here last week and in telling her friends by cell phone where to come and meet her she said she was at Meerkat a la Planxa Â Ive been having images of mongooses frolicking in the surf ever since

Author: P W.
Content: Yes its a beautiful space The food was good but there are more delicious and priceappropriate tapas to be had here in Chicago There were four of us and the waiter really pushed us to order 3 plates each The result was that we had way more food than any of us could finish It was ridiculously over the top in amount and came out spradically so you would alternately be inundated with plates or sitting and waiting for the next item We asked several times for bread and never got it Our waiter disappeared at one point and we all sat there drinkless for what seemed an eternity then were inundated with 4 plates from the servers thats one way to really irritate leave me sitting dry The two stars here are for the service Ill stick to Las Ramblas in Andersonville or Azucar in Logan Square Better food and more fabulously attentive staff and service

Author: Shaun K.
Content: Step into Catalunya Â Parles catala Â Well thats alright youll still enjoy the lively Gaudi inspired decor and flavorful cuisine Â The chair backs are encased in fabric that looks to be Custo influenced and the back wall around and above the bar is a grand colorful mosaic Â Bulbs hang from the ceiling which is painted to contrast with the bright airy walls Â The arched windows from the top floor view Grant Park Â My sangria blanca included grapes pears and rosemary to give it a more earthy and dry taste  far better than a fruity concoction Â The Barri Gotic bocadillo was plated on a rectangular white plate cut into 2 isosceles Â pieces and served with a bowl of herbed fries Â The skirt steak was excellent with carmelized onions blue cheese and oregano a lil sweet a lil salty and very tender Â Great spot Ill have to return for more Â Els catalans ho fan millor

Author: Lori M.
Content: I was hoping for amazing Â What we got was soso Â  The restaurant is cool has a great energetic vibe and the promise of catalan tapas prepared in the style of Chef Jose Garces is all delicious sounding Sadly their waitstaff ours named Wesley isnt particularly well versed in Catalan sophistication Â Instead theres more of a South Western Avenue Used Car Salesman approach Â Pushing the chefs selections and boring sangrias before even bothering to get to know their customers I for one am a vegetarian and had he taken 2 seconds to ask a few questions he wouldnt have had to run through all the suckling pig options Â  What was worse however was having an unfinished 13 cocktail snatched up before it was finished and being told that their coffee machine was broken and they didnt really do spanish coffees anyway and the manager went to Starbucks to get us coffee Â  Had they given us the choice we would not have ordered Starbucks coffee at Mercat for 5cup Â  I like that they are so business savvy that they made a profit from that coffee sale but annoyed so much so that I was in too big of a hurry to get to the symphony on time that I didnt want to further deal with Wesley Â  His continual response to each tables requests within our earshot No problem seemed more like he thought he was doing everyone favors for waiting on themus Â Not a memorable experience but one that did in fact detract from our overall rating of our dinner Â  Whatever your pleasure request a server who knows hisher Catalan soul and not one that is more interested in cranking out  of customers per minute

Author: Jedd J.
Content: My first experience here was 5 star second visit was 3 star

Author: Sandra V.
Content: The rabbit ravioli with brown butter foam and brandied cherries was one of the best things I have eaten in my ENTIRE life The first bite I took elicited an actual physical reaction and a holy shit thats good to come from my mouth I also loved the little goat cheese tarts with the super thin slices of beets on topa very good not too sweet dessert I would return to Chicago just to eat here again

Author: Laura S.
Content: Dinner at Mercat a la Planxa was one of the things I was most looking forward to on my most recent visit to Chicago My last meal there still stands as one of the best meals Ive had in my life I was looking forward to being able to resample some of the dishes I loved last time espinacas a la Catalana how I love you and trying some new ones While the experience was not as stellar as the last we visited on a Friday evening at 715 so the restaurant was much busier and service understandably less impeccable the restaurant maintains its status as my favorite in Chicago  and gives Amada a run for its money as my favorite JG spot This was my first meal after making it to the city so I arrived hungry and ready to do damage to the tapas menu Luckily my friends can eat so we were able to try everything I was looking forward to The menu is expansive and youre not going to want to choose Come hungry bring friends and leave the picky eaters at home although vegetarians will be perfectly happy  67 of our table did not eat meat or fish with me being the notable exception We started with the cheese mixto which is very well put together I have forgotten two of the cheeses but one was a very good rich garroxta The highlight of the cheese plate is definitely the accompaniments though The vegetarians were in ecstacy over the garlic dulce de leche one is coming to visit me in Philadelphia soon and is thrilled to know that she can actually purchase it at Garces Trading Company What they dont know is that if they ate meat they could have had the sherrybacon caramel which puts absolutely everything else we ate that evening to shame I literally licked the bowl That good Although the menu is very meatheavy there were plenty of dishes to keep my vegetarian friends happy We ordered one of the specials which was reminiscent of scrambled eggs  with truffles and truffle oil It had incredible flavor and depth The special was intended to include shrimp as well but was absolutely great without them We also ordered the bomba rice I skipped this dish youll see why by the time I get to the end I can only fit so much at one meal but the vegetarians enjoyed it including the one who is not a particularly big fan of rice All of us loved the truita de patata which is a traditional Spanish tortilla and essentially the same thing as the tortilla Espanola at Amada The espinacas a la Catalana was just as delicious as I remembered leaving me wishing that Amada or Tinto would add it to the menu Â To round out our vegetarian selections we had the patatas bravas calcots a la planxa and llientes i cigrons The potatoes and green onions were very good and prepared perfectly although not particularly innovative The table was split on the lentil and garbanzo bean dish It arrived at the end of the evening though so those of us who did not love it may simply have been too full to appreciate it It was definitely innovative though  the texture and flavors were new to meI was the only one at the table who ate either of the two meat dishes so you will have to trust my word on them Dont worry I have vast meateating experience on this vacation alone I managed to eat 9 different animals so you can totally trust my opinion The first dish was the cordero lechal en curry  roasted suckling lamb with chickpeas broccolini and served with flatbread When I first tasted the dish I didnt love it  I just had the lamb with some sauce on the flatbread and didnt think the flavors were great Â Then I got smart and tried a bit of everything on a fork Oh my That made all the difference The flatbread turned out to be absolutely unnecessary we used the rest to eat the llientes i cigrons My last dish was the conil amb castanyes  braised rabbit agnolotti It was absolutely delicious When I described it to a friend she was suspcious  rabbit in pasta The answer is yes Rabbit in pasta Thumbs up Along with the incredible meal we enjoyed some of the seasonal sangria It was very refreshing my only complaint is that with the addition of Absolut raspberry its dangerously delicious By the end of dinner I was definitely feeling my drinks We shared the chocolate croquettes and crema Catalana for dessert although we just nibbled the flavors were great One friend reported that the chocolate croquette made her feel like a chocolateeating vampire Mercat a la Planxa did not disappoint It is definitely always going to make it onto my list of places to eat when I visit the Windy City With absolutely delicious food great service even when the restaurant is slammed and innovative flavors its everything I expect from my favorite Iron Chef

Author: Kirstin P.
Content: Bacon covered dates are wonderful surprises of fantasticness

Author: Angie C.
Content: A new favorite tapas place Mercat is conveniently located on South Michigan ave at the Blackstone HotelI love the atmosphere  dark chic modernreminded me of a NYC bar I agree with other Yelpers that the menu was a bit overwhelming you want everything but we had a fantastic server who explained the menu and gave some recommendations We loved all 6 tapas we tried I loved that they were true tapas portions and the flavors were heavenly I had wished they played Spanish music instead of weird technoand would have preferred to sit away from the kitchen but overall a great experience Great for date night and Ill definitely go back

Author: Cristabel R.
Content: Very high expectations for this place considering it is from Iron Chef JosÃ© Garces We got the luxury tasting menu which pretty much means you will get JamÃ³n Iberico de Bellota on your charcuterie plate which is inherently incredibly delicious and lobster in your seafood course this was a grand dissapointment as the lobster was clearly frozen prior to cook and very dry and flavorless The highlight of the meal were the baconwrapped almond stuffed dates really the best Ive had in any tapas restaurant Overall the food was delicious great atmosphere very knowledgeable servers and fabulous drinks I would definitely come back

Author: Vince T.
Content: Great atmosphere Â Went late on a Saturday night Â The food was good but the floor was messy Â Maybe it was a busy nite

Author: Jamie M.
Content: This is a great restaurant with a wonderful atmosphere Â We went for our work teams holiday dinner with a group of seven and everyone was happy and had something to eat even the vegetarians Â They recomended the olive margarita to me and although I was skeptical it was deliciousious Â Trendy and you pay for it but its worth it

Author: Shanti N.
Content: Having been here twice I can safely say that this is a stalwart winetapas bar that is out of the fray of Michigan Avenue but still close to the action On both of my visits the wine list has been right on very reasonably priced for the offerings and location The decor is very soothing and gives you the option to sit at the bar at tables in the lounge or walk upstairs to the dining area for a more formal experience The flatbreads are tasty and imminently shareable Unfortunately I missed out on the summer dining season but look forward to sitting outside and enjoying a glass of wine once the weather warms up

Author: Paul K.
Content: Good tapas bar but for the price I found it rather overrated I had the hibiscus sangria for a beverage subpar the potato omelette excellent the croquettas worst part of the meal bacon wrapped dates average and a meat dish Bill was almost 100 for one would much rather hit Cafe BaBaReeba in Lincoln Park Not a bad option though if youre staying at the Marriott theres not too much else in the immediate vicinity

Author: Stacy K.
Content: Meh Wasnt impressed Â The decor and service was great but the food was mediocre Â The presentation was nice but the flavor was notmy cousin had a fixedmenu for our group his family and wedding partyat least 25 people so we got to try a bunch of different things My sister found plastic in her saladthe manager  not sure what he was apologized and brought it to the attention to everyone in the kitchen to make sure it didnt happen again but for the type of restaurant that it presents itself as it shouldnt have happened in the first place Â Oh well mistakes happen and luckily my sister didnt swallow it Â Maybe the items chosen for the fixed menu were just not to my liking but again I wasnt impressed so I am not likely to return Â The food is pretentious and sounds fancy but didnt live up to my expectations if you want amazing baconwrapped dates go to Avec instead

Author: John C.
Content: Okay this place has to fix their damn service Â This place is very close to us and we went there before the U2 concert and a few days ago for my wifes birthday Â I really like the tapas here but something has to be done about the service Â Please fix it Â Fix itnowVisit 1  Made a reservation through opentable and was promptly seated Â We ordered a few drinks and six tapas Â Everything was going great until our last two tapas took 2030 minutes to come out Â Our waiter stopped by and basically asked us if we were done Â My wife said we were done ordering but we were still waiting for our last two dishes Â He pretended like he knew what we were talking about but the look on his face told us otherwise Â He said there must be a hold up but I knew that he didnt even remember that we were waiting for two dishes Â The dishes finally come out and they were very good it was just annoying to have to wait and then have some pretend that they didnt screw up Â Visit 2  I called for the reservation since we had six people Â They told me that if I wanted eight people that we would have to be seated at 530 or 6 which was too early Â So I didnt invite my other friends Â We get there promptly at 830 and the people at our table have paid their check and we are waiting for them to get up and go Â Im not blaming Mercat for having to wait 20 minutes to get seated but Im annoyed that the table we are waiting for has eight people Â Ugh Â Luckily the hostess had hot shoes and she was very nice and it was entertaining to look at her shoes Â Anyway we wait to order our drinks after we get seated Â Drinks take 10 to 15 minutes to get to our table Â Seriously Â I asked the waiter if I could order my next beer right away cause if it takes that long I should just order right now Â I dont think he appreciated that Â The bar was backed up and each drink took way too long to get Â The food service was actually pretty good other than the fact that I was moving dishes off to the side all night long because nobody was clearing our tableSo three starsI think the food was excellent Â But Im dinging them for the service Â Read on for food commentsIf you are hungry get the chefs selection for 58 Â You cant go wrong and you can swap dishes out that you dont want Â Youll be stuffed at the end of the nightHam  Fig Saladwow delicious Â Looked like a burrito wrapped in ham but the inside was salad Â Bacon Wrapped Datessweet delicious crunch with an almond inside Â everyone raved about theseFlatbreadsin my mind these are just okayButternut Squash Dumplingsyum yum give me dim sumLambchopsoh so goodCarnes Y Aves section of the menu is all good Â Cheese that we had was very good Â Shrimp dishes were just okay and the cauliflower tapa was no goodMy wife said her mojito was fantastic

Author: Rebecca H.
Content: Great date place Great food Great atmosphere

Author: Rich K.
Content: One of the best eating experiences of my young life

Author: Laine K.
Content: Picture it Â Taking my boyfriend to the auto show for Valentines Day as ever the good girlfriend Â But good girlfriend had ulterior motives Â Imagine me with my hands steepled mumbling excellent a la Mr Burns possibly with a cat on my lap Â I made it a stipulation that I would suffer through auto uninterestingness if he would let me pick the eatery for early dinner Â So I finally got to go to one of the many places that has been on my gotta try in Chicago list Â And this baby lives up to the excitement Â Delicious food amazing service cozy atmosphere and fab drinks Â We were there quite by accident during Restaurant Week so we did the whole tasting menu Â Awesome Â I cant wait to go back Â The plates were so beautiful too

Author: Kat R.
Content: Came here with friends before going to the symphony The dates are amazing and their ice cream may be some if the best Ive had The only thing that was off putting was that all the tapas were made for even numbers of groups our table had 3 and our waiter didnt offer to portion our food appropriately

Author: Fuffie G.
Content: I had heard great things about this place and was very excited to finally try it Â The Blackstone Hotel is an old gem that has been restored to its old charm and warmth Â The restaurant was much more modern and rather loud Â I was pleasantly surprised to see it as crowded as it was for a Monday night Â Our waiter while very sweet was rather inept Â He never asked for our drink order and did stop by for a second to tell us that some complimentary thing would be coming out Â I couldnt hear what it was and it never arrived so I still dont know what it was supposed to be Â We ordered a few different things and one of my friends who has food allergies ordered one dish of diver scallops which the waiter knew was going to be the only thing she was going to eat puts that order in first and was our first dish to arrive Â she ate by herself and then basically sat and ate bread and butter while we ate our foodThroughout the 1st portion of our meal the waitstaffservers kept knocking into my friends chair and then one of them accidentally dropped something on her Â The liquid went everywhere Â The 2nd tier managersome snooty french guy acted as though she was an inconvenience to whatever it was he was doing and told her she should get her coat cleaned and that she would have to come back to bring him the cleaning bill Â What Â The food Â WONDERFUL DELICIOUS FLAVORFUL Â The morel mushroom risotto was one of the best things I have ever tasted and would have licked the bowl if I was in private Â  The pork belly with some potato puree and the short rib was just delicious Â The chef really put some thought into his dishesSo would I go back Â The food was so good that yes I probably wouldthe staff probably knows this which is why they behave like they doone more thingmake sure you have a fat walletits pricey5 star food1 star serviceattitude3 star average

Author: Linda C.
Content: Arroz soup and truita de patata are extremely salty How can you make a salty truita which is a Spanish omelette Not traditional and authentic Ive had real ones in Spain To make matters worstthe cured meat like salami and prosciutto were not salty in comparison That is scary and unbelievable

Author: John A.
Content: Cocktail  Sage Smash Â premium wine flight never disappoints share your plates  expand your experience Push your culinary boundaries romantic for 2 but a party for 6 best tapas outside of Spain Â Love this place Want to do the pig

Author: Jessica M.
Content: As a business owner in the wedding industry I have to give this place 5 stars Get over there and try the mushrooms Wow I ordered a second they were so good I usually make it over twice a year The chicago summer dance serious is across Â the street and we usually take abig group This would make a nice rehearsal dinner spot They bring complimentary brochettea which is amazing They also have interesting drinks and great service As the founder of windycityweddingdancecom I will be recommending this place to my clients

Author: Brenda V.
Content: AWESOME Â Yes the portions are small but they pack a punch of supreme flavor thank you yelpers for the reviews I ordered the pork belly tocino and the brusselsprouts that were probably the best thing I ever ate service was on point esp Â the wonderful server who patiently described every dish as he presented it Plan on 34 tapas per person for a full meal Decor is contemporary but comfortable Valet is off the Blackstone Hotel entrance FYI average dinner for 2 no drinks 80give or take dessert etc

Author: Katie D.
Content: Loved this place great atmosphere Â We came here because 1 Purple Pig had 145hr wait times at 530pm on Friday What and they dont take reservations 2 because this place was three blocks away from the CSO and we had tickets for the concert that started at 8pm Â Needless to say we wanted classy and yummy dinner Â Mercat a la Planxa was just the ticket We loved the intimate bar located on the ground floor so much that we decided to just sit there at one of the funky tables that reminded me of my grandmas sewing machine with a butcher top block instead of where the actual sewing machine should be Â There was an impressive wine selection with several Catalunyan wine options plus decent choice of Scotches Whiskeys and other top shelf stuff Â We had white Anchovy dish with pine nuts to die for if you like anchovies a Manchego cheese plate with absolutely delicious lavender and quince jam and an apple a mushroom tapas probably the best among all of the other stuff that we ordered and Spanish omelet forgettable dont order its tiny to the point where its almost seems that its mockingly grinning at you from the large round plate on which it is served Â The bartender also brought us some fresh baguette to scoop up all the olive oil from the anchovy dish Â She took our order and when I told her that I was a vegetarian she kindly asked the kitchen to sub chorizo for mushrooms on my flatbread Â The prices here are a bit on a high side flatbread for example was 10 for approximately 45 small slices enough for two people to share if you are ordering other stuff Â But considering how great the service was we did not mind paying more Â Also we were able to have a great quick and delicious quiet dinner without loud music or high noise level that is omnipresent in more popular spots Definitely will be back

Author: Philip R.
Content: Had a very good burger here only reason that I give it 4 stars instead of 5 is that Im more of a meat and potatoes guy and its a little foodie for me though the foodies Im sure would argue that its not Â Id definitely go back again

Author: K B.
Content: I read a bunch of reviews so I was mentally prepared for nonexistent service nonstop delivery of dishes so that you have to scarf down everything and how to find the restaurant Found spiral staircase check Water glass consistently kept full  Dishes are delivered in courses so multiple do come out at once but I promise they wait until you finish the course before the next is delivered so no rush  We ordered the tasting menu which comes with 3 courses and Ill admit when our table was suddenly packed to the edge with appetizer tapas I got a little anxious but no worries All delicious but the absolute favorites bacon wrapped dates with almonds the olives steak with 3 dipping sauces butternut squash dumplings charcuteria especially the one with cheeseapplejamAlso had wild mushroom flatbread spinachpotato omelette spinachapplecurrants grilled octopus and potato spicy potatoesAlso get the sangria Well be going back

Author: Lee D.
Content: Id give it 5 stars for the food and decor and 2 stars for the service and room temperature FREEZING both times Ive been so in my book thats a 3 overall because I HATE being cold and waiting 10 minutes to see the server for the first time Â And I specifically requested a warm spot in my opentable reservation booking

Author: Cynthia A.
Content: This was truly one of the most exciting meals Ive had in many years Â Four of us made a Saturday night reservation and were seated right on time Â Beautiful space wonderful drinks Â  The menu is a little daunting upon first look so we decided that each of us would order 3 items and then wed go from there Â We tried to order something from every typecold hot veggy meat smoked or cured fresh Â We got a wonderful mix of things and they were served in exactly the right order nothing that we stated they just knew how we should experience the meal Â I love to cook and I know ingredients Â What I loved about this restaurant is that the dishes were quite complex and many times we were just flummoxed as to what ingredients were used Â Complex does not have to mean elaborate or overdone Â Nothing was Â It just means that the mixtures of components complemented each other so well that the flavor marriages were amazingly successfulThe smoked meats and cheese the risotto the lamb the crabseriously everything was great Â And waiting and wondering what the next dish would be made for a lot of excitement Â Each dish is enough for four to taste Â We were afraid wed be hungry at the end of the meal but we really werent Â We ordered the large portion of lamb for the four of us and it was generousIf you want a beautiful place with delicious food and drinks with a lot of circus and food entertainment for the evening you cannot go wrong Â But bring your wallet Â It was a splurge place for us

Author: Jeff L.
Content: Not thrilled Empanadas were greasy Location is nice for outdoor seating And people watching And it is very pricey for what you get 4 bacon wrapped dates for about 10 Small glass of sangria was 9

Author: Matthew D.
Content: My wife and I and our parents came here for Thanksgiving dinner They had several options we chose to do the prix fixe family style This option included 3 courses an appetizer and dessert although each course was itself 3ish small plates so it translated into 14 actual items Everything but the main course was traditionalish Spanish tapas and the main course was itself a Thanksgiving Dinner that included turkey prepared four ways and most of the traditional American sides in various disguised forms We had two wine pairings which had some great wines and some weaker onesI dont feel like the Thanksgiving set menu was a normal experience at this restaurant so I cant write a full review but we enjoyed our time and Id recommend this to other diners or visitors to Chicago looking to go out on Thanksgiving

Author: Saira K.
Content: Having lived in Spain I was terribly disappointed with my meal here Advertised as taste of Catalonia Not what I experienced in Barcelona and the surroundings Glad I didnt go for the tasting menu Sexy ambiance though

Author: David K.
Content: We went there for brunch excited to try the Bloody Mary bar and tapas Â The Bloody Mary bar was the highlight Â Service was disconnected and really slow Â Staff was nice but not engaged We had to ask for different plates and clean utensils between each course Â It was the tasting menu for goodness sake dont you want us to taste each course without the remnants of the sweet or savory from last course Â It ended being a 25 hour brunch which is way too long Â It was not busy Â There were 3 couples and often we had to figure out how to divvy up the portions which was awkward Â Overall some of flavors were interesting but not worth the poor service

Author: Henry S.
Content: Ive only recently went for breakfast at Mercat on a weekday morning but Ive also had dinner here numerous times since it opened Â So this write up will be for bothOk so breakfast first Â There were only 3 tables in the entire place including us Â Mornings are definitely a very different vibe here Â The whole place is very quiet and really gives you a chance to soak in the gorgeous room and the gorgeous view outside Â We had the Two Eggs scrambled with rosemaryapple sausage and the Eggs Benedict Â The eggs were light and fluffy Â The sausages were 2 glistening vermillion patties Â I almost thought it was chorizo Â Very flavorful but mild although I was expecting spicy seeing the way it looks Â The Eggs Benedict eggs chorizo toasted brioche truffled hollandaise was one of the most decadent Benedicts Ive ever tasted Â The hollandaise was such a concentrated blend of yolk and dairy and hints of truffle kept lingering Â Both dishes came with a breakfast potato that was very creative Â It was basically a shredded potato cake Â Think latkes or hash brown but in cake form Â Bits of rosemary assault the taste buds Â My only one grip is with coffee which was called Royal Cup Â It was pretty bland and boring Â Give me Intelligentsia or MetropolisAt dinner time Mercat takes on a very sexy and fun vibe Â If you enter from the street you will probably hang out at the tiny lounge downstairs first Â Excellent cocktails try the seasonal sangria if you are so inclined Â When your table is ready walk up the spiral staircase to the wonderful dining room Â High high ceiling mirrored and stenciled walls the semi circular set up reminds one of a supper club and then the large windows looking outside to great views of Grant ParkThey have various tapas size dishes as well as larger plates Â Some alltime favorites include Â Pimientos de padron flash fried peppers in a Catalan sauce Â Reminds me of Japanese shishito peppers Â Croquetas de bacalao pillowy soft salt cod fritters in a piquant sauce Â Datiles con almendras Â At this point for me nobody can beat the dates at Avec Â These ones at Mercat is a close second Â The cabrales sauce drizzled on top is very creative Â Pulpo con patatas Â Nothing like the garden variety octopus dish you get at any other Spanish restaurant Â Tender confit of octopus and potato Â Paella Negra Â A little teeny tiny skillet of squid ink tinted rice with all the goodness from the sea Â The cauliflower gratin Â Thin shaved slices of cauliflower crunchy almonds in a sea of cream and trufflesCocas or flatbreads are another signature dish Â A relatively small platform housing rich and decadent flavors Â My favorites are the short ribs and the clam and bacon Â The Ala Planxa items are always good Â Simple well seasoned tasty Â A few standouts are the chipirones baby calamari barramundi hamachi and lamb chops Â Service is ok Â Not too cheerfully annoying although it could border on perfunctory at times especially when they are packed Â Why 4 stars Â Mercat is definitely a nightout place Â Sexy vibe gorgeous room fun atmosphere beautiful clientele Â I think many people have the misconception that this is a tapas restaurant therefore comparing Mercat to CafÃ© Iberico or Meson Sabika Â Wrong people Â Apples and oranges Â For me Mercat is a modern Spanish restaurant serving creative Catalan food Â Yes the portions could be small and prices are high for the portion size Â But factor in the creative tasty food and great ambience you will have a fun evening

Author: Howard B.
Content: Had 2 breakfasts and a lunch Everything was great For 18 you get a two course lunch thats a great satisfier The green salad and chicken hit the spot the white beans on the side were not to be put down Breakfasts were perfectly prepared with a nice view of the park Good service too

Author: Barbara S.
Content: A foodie friend drove me from the southern suburbs to experience one of the most creative brunches in Chicagoland Â She was spotonLocated in the Blackstone Hotel Mercat has an everchanging three course tasting menu that also includes unlimited trips to the cheese manchego and meat chorizo  some of the best and dessert stations Â At 25 bucks this is a bargain in quality and quantityThe servers understand the elegance of allowing conversations to continue while timing the presentation of the next course Â Directly before our trip to the cheesemeat bar we passed by a drink station that offered either virgin or alcoholic versions of Catalaninspired bloody Marys which one could dress with an inspirational number of ingredients lined along the bar Â  Cornichons with the Mary Â How could I resist As we slowly completed our manchego app the server was attentive but not hovering Â Our plates cleared the bacon wrapped dates stuffed with almonds and finished with a special sauce had my eyes rolling to the back of my head Â Am I in heaven I wondered Â The second half of the first course consisted of minipancakes with nutella toasted banana marshmallow and rosemary caramel Â The addition of the rosemary to the caramel gave me pause so I had to try the strange combo Â It worked this coming from someone with no discernable sweet toothNext the Mercat Eggs Benedict arrived with a perfectly poached egg complemented by a perfect truffled hollandaise and brioche Â Was I in France Spain or ChicagoThe second half of the second course consisted of flash fried peppers with an almond x sauce Â Those things nearly drove me home to grill some on my own  but I do not know what kind of peppers they were Â They must have been imported because I have not known the delicate yet lingering taste before Â  GIVE ME MORE was my thought Â I am glad I had room for the final two third coursesSuckling pig melted in my mouth Is there nothing in life my porcine friends cannot fix Â  To end with seared brussel sprouts wcranberry walnut and French feta could be mundane if not executed with such care Â The dessert bar was the only disappointment Â This selection was mundane and the nibbles were not worth the caloriesSpeciality drinks were offered for a mere 5 and appeared to be generously poured Â We left sated but not stuffed Â It is a wonder to experience an excellent tasting menu that did not have me wondering where the nearest fast food chain was so I could actually have food instead of snotty snacks Â  BravoWhen I return I may opt for the ala carte menu as Scottish smoked salmon on a toasted bagel with the mandatory East Coast accoutrements appeals to my senses

Author: Diana C.
Content: Tapas are okay not the best Ive had but definitely not the worst Â Definitely lost points or a star I guess for noise level Â Decor is pretty

Author: David N.
Content: Breakfast review the eggs with chirizo was really salty Â Potatoes were dandy However service was decent

Author: Mae S.
Content: Do the Chefs special Â You cant go wrong

Author: Wayne R.
Content: How did we not know about this place sooner It is a beautiful room overlooking Michigan Ave The menu is extensive and comprehensive Â Service was excellent And the food was superb Of course baconwrapped dates as good as weve ever had the Piementos de Padron were outstandingnot hot at all and the accompanying slaw was very delicious The patatas Bravas what we called Tapas Tots were amazing Also the Costillas de Ternera shredded short ribs on flatbread was divine All were beautifully presented Â  And the bon bon dessert was the perfect ending though we wished we had room for more food The price for 3 people was 100 perhaps a little high for tapas but well worth it

Author: Julia T.
Content: This is by far the best tapas place in the city Â Their plates are absolutely delicious Â The flavors are so bold and the food just melts in your mouth Im not a fan of tater tots but they have a tater tot dish with a glaze of spicy sauce on top and it is to die for Â The service here is superb and the staff is super friendly and always give you great wine recommendations Â Its hard to get a reservation here so I would advise to set up a reservation a few days ahead of time

Author: Kate K.
Content: I was entirely underwhelmed by Mercat After having been to great tapas restaurants in Chicago Vegas New York etc I was expecting to be floored  not so much Â First it serves some of the smallest tapas I have ever seen And thats saying something Â My bf and I have found that when food arrives at our table and our first thought is  wtf that tiny thing is 40  were probably not going to like it Wish we could have known that prior to goingWe ordered the bacon wrapped dates mine had a pit it in it the house bread a overly citrusy version of bruschetta the patatas bravas not spicy AT ALL some fish on the grill I forget and the lamb in curry which was passable Â We tried the dish that the chef apparently made when he was on Iron Chef  he won the 20092010 season  which was a beef flatbread Â All I can say is that he must have been in the bottom three that nightI recommend CafÃ© BaBaReba northside CafÃ© Iberico or Tapas de Valencia south loopTwo stars for great service and a beautiful atmosphere If you go  go later around 730 or 8

Author: Kristin M.
Content: Sorry peeps but this place was an utterly expensive disappointment Â From the service to the food and even the drinks Â Lets start with the important part the foodCheese We started off with three varieties of cheese only one which was memorableit was the goat Â They all were served with these sweet dessert like dipping sauces Â Now had we ordered cheese for dessert or if it was on the dessert menu Id get it Â But this was a starter and the sauces were a turnoff Peppers Â These little fried chilis were quite salty tasty and delicious Â But they were literally just fried peppers in oil and thus not a reason to returnLamb meatballs At first I thought these were quite tasty but then they quickly turned gross Â There were hard little fat pieces in them that I swear could withstand a nuclear explosion Â My fiance was SPITTING them out on the floor because we could not chew them Â So embarrassing but the thought of that dish makes my stomach turnRabbit Ravioli Â Very little rabbit inside the pasta and the cherries in the dish were too sweet Â Just not very goodQual Â This was by far the best thing on the menu and who knew I even liked qual Â Portion was super small but the qual was perfectly smoked and deliciously seasonedHorrachata bon bons Â These were pretty good for a dessert Â Fried chocolate balls in some sort of cinnamon sweet sauceNow had all this came under 100I may cut them some slack Â But this was one of the most expensive and just not very good food Ive had in Chicago Â Worst partwe left hungry Â I am not even going to go there on the service but that also sucked Â Impossible to get a drink our plates were never cleared once another dish was brought so we just had stacks of dirty dishes sitting in front of usOh wait I went there Â Not sure why there are so many good reviews other than maybe for ambiance Â Though I am not big on tapas places either so I can chalk this up as just another tapas restaurant Id wish I never wasted money on

Author: Partha A.
Content: The paella was to die for As was the bacon wrapped dates The dessert was great too Our server gracefully reminded us that we had ordered too much food

Author: Alexis A.
Content: Fantastic space with lots of light and cool decor Soso food I got the chefs tasting menu last night The food was plentiful and some things were tasty However everything was covered in olive oil and I found the taste of the oil obscured other flavors The serano ham which Ive never had served with oil was drenched in it as were the scallops spinach salad and the chocolate served at the end of the meal I understand that olive oil is used to add flavor but the chef here overdid it

Author: Nicole N.
