Content: Very surprisingly good I didnt have huge expectations but I was very happily surprised with both the food and service I went during lunch which was not crowded at all All three of us choose to go with their Catalan Express twocourse 18 menu that comes with an ice tea or soda I choose the splitpea soup with truffle oil delicious and generous portion as well as the hangar steak sandwich with caramelized onions and a balsamic reduction The sandwich was perfectly European and having been to Barcelona twice was a very Spanish portionand perfect It tasted delicious and I would recommend both dishes I hope to make it back for dinner and see if that menu will be equally as satisfying

Author: Andrea A.
Content: Whenever I have guests from outside of Chicago I always want to take them here Â It is beautiful inside high ceilings lots of mirrors and dimmed lighting Â The food is AMAZING and they even gave us a complimentary drink for having to wait just 10 minutes past a reservation time

Author: ami l.
Content: Overpriced and overrated The food wasnt amazing and I LOVE Tapas It was decent but not for the prices Do yourself a favor and find another spot

Author: Diana H.
Content: Excellent food and service Â Our party opted to trust the chef and ordered the chefs choice menu Â We received three courses each with at least four different tapas Â All dishes were not only prepared to perfection but beautifully plated and served in a timely fashion Â Our server Doc was extremely knowledgeable about the menu and attentive to our partys preferences Â We will definitely dine here again in the future

Author: Olivia D.
Content: I have trouble giving just 1 star Â Especially to a restaurant I know COULD be good Â Ive been here twice Â Once for dinner when my experience was pretty good Â I enjoyed the food and the service was alrightThe second time was for brunch Â The experience was enough for me to never go back unless dragged kicking and screamingAfter surveying my coworkers friends and foodie acquaintances alike weve decided that Mercat cant do large parties Â Youd think they could being a tapas place whose menu is designed for sharingOn to the brunch Â We were a group of ten Â We all did the 25 pick five tapas and each of us chose a beverage bottomless Bloody Mary bar the only awesome thing about my experience as one of our dishes Â The idea with this is that each person orders his own dishes which of course we were anticipating sharing but which we expected to be delivered to each person individuallyNot the case Â The server I wish I remembered his nameBob Â Ill call him Bob although it could have been Matt or Mark or I dunno told us that he would just bring everything out family style Â Um ok Bob sure just do whatever you want huh Â So my boyfriend and I sitting at the end of the table were the only ones who had ordered the brandade Â They delivered one to each end of the table and no one at the other end even knew what it was to let us know that it was down there Â When we finally discovered it hiding at the other end it was all good because the brandade tasted like crap anyway Â Possible the worst most tasteless brandade Ive ever had Â So this was the case with all dishes causing us to yell out to the food runners when they brought the dishes over OH Â I have the pork bellyover hereWe tried almost everythingLoved the benedict it was actually delicious Â The bacon wrapped dates as in my first experience and as promised by everyone and their mother were AWESOMEEverything else especially the shortrib and the hash boring Â Uninspired Â I could make much better at homeAt one point our server Bob got into an argument with the chefs in the open kitchen Â I noticed Â Most diners wouldnt but I work in a restaurant so I did Â You have to be careful about these things with an open kitchen Â Other notes about Bob includeHUGE rip in his pants Â Just below his butt on the inside of his thigh I mean 34 Â I dont want to stare at my servers hairy inner thigh while eating thank youWhen the hash came out for one of our guests my boyfriend who cooks professionally asked if the egg was supposed to be poached or fried or hard or what it was sitting on top poached but over Â A hard rubbery mass Â Bob replies Uh I dunno you wanna new one Â The replacement the egg was fried Â UhDidnt ask us if we wanted any coffees or anything left us sitting for 20 minutes with no food or anything Â I got up and asked the chefs assuming they would love a reason to make Bob feel badWhen the girls at the other end asked what was available on the dessert buffet he responded theres some rolls and fruit Im not sure exactly what theyve got todayyou can go lookInformed us that normally he brings the vodka for the bottomless bloody marys but we should probably just head to the bar its easierAll in all the restaurant seemed unprepared for our 10 top food was disorganized and left us waiting at awkward moments some with food in front of them some not the carving and cheese station was a mess the managerhost seemed to not give a flying eff about what was happening on the floor she never came near our table of course the food seemed like it sat warming for extended periods of time the service was god awful definitely Bobs fault Â The only employee who seemed like he cared about his job was the bartenderThank Jeebus for AUTOGRAT huh BobWith a smaller group Mercat A La Planxa is a good value with a few really tasty treats Â Is it worth the risk of a TERRIBLE experience Â I dont think so Â Head to Emilios or Cafe Ba Ba Reba which are more consistent delicious and less pricey

Author: Zaven K.
Content: When my mom saw this place on Check Please she decided that this would be the place we would celebrate her birthday The room and circuses are quite nice I like the open kitchen and vast open space outfitted with swank modern furnishings The food was unfortunately a bit disappointing We opted for the Chefs choice prixfixe menu To my palate the seasonings were all wrong and there was far too much bread used to fill you up One outstanding piece of Wagyu beef does stand out in my memory as does the wine flight we had to go with our meal But when everything was said and done the itch I had developed for a good tapas meal left me scratching And the bill left me wishing Id have gone to Cafe Iberico The final nail in the coffin was when neither my mom nor I could remember where we had gone for her birthday last year until a week later

Author: Caitlin C.
Content: This place is actually the reason I decided to finally cave in and make a Yelp account Â Let me start off by saying Ive worked in the service industry for over ten years and cannot believe that a place like this has such AWFUL service I have never ever complained about a server or bartender but I actually really wanted to last night Â I dined at the bar last evening and was underwhelmed by my whole experience The only reason I am even giving this two stars is because of the free flatbread 5 stars that preceded my meal which was fantastic Â I ordered the patatas bravas NOTHING like Las Bravas in Madrid which has the worlds finest and the slow cooked pork belly which was good but super tiny and nothing to write home about Upon contemplating ordering another small dish or dessert I asked the bartender who didnt smile once in the almost two hours I was at the bar oh or ask how anything was if there was anything that really stood out on the dessert menu that I should consider Her response Wait for it I dont really like dessert so I dont know Jose Garces Iron Chef winner I think you need to give your staff a lesson on customer service Not only was the bartender uneducated on service you couldve made something up and I wouldve never known but your hostess stand and service area were continually complaining about tables they even were talking about asking a table to actually get up because they sat them in the wrong area Unreal Needless to say I wont be back EVER And I wont try any of your affiliated restaurants in the Philadelphia area which I frequent often

Author: Marissa B.
Content: One of my favorite restaurants in the city Â Excellent food good service great ambiance and excellent cocktails Â My only complaint it is a little pricey relative to the portions compared to other traditional tapas restaurants but the food is delicious so its worth it Â Favorites bacon wrapped dates spicy potatoes scallops shortrib flatbread flash fried peppers and my absolute favorite  the arroz a la cazuela Â You have to try this  one of the best soups Ive had and hearty too

Author: Lauren W.
Content: Summary Great outdoor seating tasty food fun atmosphere Â The portions are tiny and the offerings are not exactly authentic  the dishes tend to lean more to the trendy side of things rather than the Spanish side Â The food was all overpriced given the dainty servings and the service was    limited Â Overall I had a great time and a couple dishes were memorable Â However I dont think Ill be going back anytime soon Â Heres how the meal went downNow I dont know a ton about Spanish white wines so I asked the waiter for a little help and described to him what I wanted crisp refreshing minerals on the dry side not sweet Â He pointed to two different whites helpfully stating that they would be less sweet than the others and then annoyingly saying that they were the two most popular whites on the menu Â Umm    Im not looking for what the most popular whites are  Im looking for crisp refreshing minerals    didnt we just go through this Â Anyway his suggestions were at a very reasonable price point which I appreciated and I ended up selecting one of them mostly because he didnt have anything really to say about the other whites Â It was the 2006 Gran Vinum Nessa Albarino and ended up being pretty good  not as dry as Id like but definitely worth ordering againMoving on Â We ordered 7 dishes  a number that I thought was going to result in leftovers since there were only three of us Â One of our choices was the mixto cheese plate that included a selection of three cheeses Â When I asked the waiter what the selected cheeses were like he looked like Id asked him a ridiculous question snickered and said ones goat ones sheep ones cow Â Now I wanted to murder this guy Â After some prodding he finally came out with the following Two are more mild and one is a little stronger Â Come on Â If youre going to devote a whole section of your menu to cheeses then your waiter better know how to describe them at least a little Â When our food finally came Id say it took about 30 minutes for the first dish to come out  even the cheese plate took that long the results were as followsMixto Cheese Plate Â Three good cheeses but all very similar Â All pretty mild no soft or semisoft cheese all wedged all about the same offwhite color Â Not much of a mixto Â But they were delish and the fruity tart relishes served with them were excellentSopa Â I cant remember the description of the soup we got  I wasnt part of that decision Â Suffice it to say the soup was excellent Â The broth was rich tasting and green but felt light and velvety Â There was some kind of delicious croquette served in the middle of the soup which was to die for Â And there was definitely truffle oil Â Enough saidEnsalada de Pulpo Â I love octopus Â And I love it char grilled at a Spanish restaurant Â But this was a big disappointment Â Despite the name the dish was a few pieces of octopus sitting on one side of a plate and a small pile of bibb lettuce and frisee on the other Â The octopus was a little too charred and had pretty much no seasoning Â It was blandTortilla Espanola This is my fave dish in any Spanish restaurant and I demanded that we order it Â Again a very small crabcake sized portion but delicious and dense Â Served with some kind of saffron sauce that was good but was too overpowering a flavor for the eggs and potatoes Â Bacon Wrapped Dates Â I fell in love with these things at avec and now when I see them on a menu I have to have them Â These were very good versions much smaller than avec about half the size and with no chorizo Â Instead there were slivered almonds in the center of each date which gave it a nice satisfying crunch Â Unfortunately before I could stop them they set down the plate of dates and poured some kind of white ranch sauce over all of them Â Bogus Â They were delicious but I wiped off most of the sauce Porcini Sausage and Manchego cheese flatbread Â This was neither Spanish nor flatbread Â It was pizza and pizza is delicious hence this was delicious Â I dont think they used Manchego cheese  tasted like good old mozzarella to meGrilled Barramundi Â Tiny portion not enough seasoning Â Boring overallDessert Â The croquettes are excellent  like little churros served with marshmallow Â But go for the homemade helados Â The cream cheese rosemary and sweet pea were AMAZINGThe bill came to 80 a person and we all felt satisfied but not stuffed Â I think in the future when I want tapas Ill save my money and go get the real thing at Cafe Iberico

Author: Pepe P.
Content: This is the third or fourth time I visit this place Â The food as usual was very good Â My big complaint tonight was the poor synchronization of the drinks with the food Â I ordered a martini and the two ladies with me asked for wine Â My drink arrived over 5 minutes before theirs with the food Â I expected better than this Â This was a Friday night so I guess we excuse more failings on amateur nights

Author: Chilin T.
Content: food 4 of 5value 15 of 5decorambience 4 of 5quick review a forgettable dining experiencefood was good  however you do not get what you pay for Â for example butternut squash which were about 15 square inch was 4 Â we ordered the following butternut squash good bacon wrapped dates very good short rib and scallop very good and shrimpscallop balls play on their meatballs  ok

Author: Kerry P.
Content: Let me preface by saying Ive been here twice Â The first time was several months ago and I thought it was really good Â The second time was less than desirable So Ill review the times separately since I had two totally different experiencesThe first time I went we had a group of about 10 people Â Tapas isnt really meant to accommodate large groups since the portions are small but we ordered a few things for the table and the individual things we wanted to try Â Our waitress was very good and extremely helpful Â She made sure anything we ordered individually got put right in front of us and that we knew it was ours Â The patatas bravas are the main reason to come here and I wasnt disappointed Â I also enjoyed the cheeses  if youre with a group get the Mixto platter to share Â Its chefs choice I wish you were able to pick which three you wanted to sample but I havent been disappointed with the chefs choices yet Â The atmosphere was wonderful the sangria was delicious and we had a great time Â We were also given a few freebies on the chef that were delicious which I thought was a nice touchI recently visited Mercat again this time with 4 other people Â This experience was much different Â They seated us at a table meant for 8 people even though there were plenty of other smaller tables available we had a 10pm reservation and the music was way too loud to try to hold a conversation Â Our waiter stood at the opposite end of the table and we could barely hear him Â When our food was brought out it was mostly just dumped in the middle of the table even though wed ordered specific things for ourselves and no one really said was anything was or if they did we couldnt hear them Â I ordered the bacon wrapped dates for myself and the portion was smaller than I remembered so I thought it was a freebie from the chef and told my friends to eat them because I was waiting for mine Â A friends dish was also brought out with the complimentary dish from the chef and no one told us what it was so we ended up eating his dish as well Â We had ordered patatas bravas and they never showed Â When the waiter came by later we asked him where the rest of our food was and he told us they were out of patatas bravas and that all our other food had been brought out Â We were pretty disappointed by the time we leftAt some point Ill probably give it another chance but the last experience totally evened out the awesome experience I had the first time I ate at Mercat Â I do have to say though the white wine sangria is delicious

Author: Sue F.
Content: Dined here by myself while on business in Chicago I initially made a reservation at 5pm then tried to change it to 530  no dice and I can see why By 530 they were packed And I do mean packed When the couple was seated next to me they were so on top of me that I could no longer look around the place as I would be looking right smack at them I felt like I was part of their birthday celebration  they even asked me if I wanted to share some of their tapasok that is way too close The hostess tried to seat another couple on the other end of tightly lined up 4 2toppers and they said no and got seated someone elsesmart cookies they were Otherwise the ambiance and all of that was perfectionNow the food The bread was great but I will get back to that Soup cazula  absolutely wonderful and very hotlove hot soup I highly recommend thisShort ribs with scallops  YUM it was so so wonderfulI had something for dessert and it was quite good  some chocolate and apricot thingNow back to bread The first round that I got had clearly just been baked It had just the right balance of crisp and warm topped by a cool topping So good that I wanted more  everything here is small servings and the bread was not different  I got two small slices When I asked the bus boy oh more on him later for more bread sometime later someone brought me one small slice  this one was not as warm and crispy So then I asked can I please have more breadand they brought me one small slice Why is something so delicious so rationed The 3rd slice was not warm not crispy and not worth eating moreThe bus boy There was something not quite right about him No eye contact by the time I could thank him for refilling my water he was gone by the time I could ask him for something he was goneMy empty soup bowl was lingering too long Finally the waiter had to take it away The waiter had to refill my water the bus boy would pass by me many times with the water pitcher but not approach my table The waiter I wish I would have noted his name He was one of the best waiters that I have had in a very long time So much so that I had to comment on the bill how great he was Of course I also commented about the bus boy  have not had someone with that much contrast to a great waiter and great food  usually they are all great or all badAnyways I would absolutely come back here It was so very good Why 4 stars The bus boy and the tables

Author: Sika C.
Content: We went here for the first time as a late Valentines Day date The place is really nice and not too big which I liked It is located downtown on Michigan Ave From the moment we were greeted to the end of our meal everything was fantastic The hostess our server and our food were all up to par We ordered a ton of tapas and a few drinks and dessert My favorite was the patatas bravas I order them whenever I go to a tapas restaurant But Mercats patatas bravas are my favorite so far Their presentation was very elegant and you could tell they took time in preparing them Very elegant touch to a traditional dish

Author: Aly R.
Content: My family and I loved mercat though a bit overpriced the food was excellent and so was the service I would for sure choose mercat over cafe baba reeba any day without a question The sangria was a bit weak but the tomato bread they give you the butternut squash dumplings bacon wrapped dates lamb meatballs patatas bravas razor clams scallops with short rib and much more definitely made up for it

Author: Ali H.
Content: Ate here while staying at the Blackstone Â Verrrry yummy Â Boyfriend and I both had absolutely delicious flatbreads  braised beef was amazing  and tried both the red and white sangria which we liked both Â White sangria was my favorite though Â Enjoyed the patatas bravas as an appetizer and they were very good Â Portions are rather small and very pricey but worth it Â Our server was incredibly knowledgeable about the menu and was attentive even though the night was busy Â Would definitely go back for a nice dinner in Chicago

Author: Robert G.
Content: The chef de cuisine Cory is great at his craft The tasting menu is the way to go  Oysters so light and bright they melt in your mouth the waygu tar tar is phenomenal as well  Everything I ate had a blast of flavor and kept me wanting more  The wild mushroom and truffle medley is a home run also I cant say enough about this restaurant and the atmosphere vibrant views like no other of grant park  Simply outstanding

Author: Anthony W.
Content: Went there with a coworker on a Tuesday evening The service was great and food was excellent A very diverse and extensive menu A must for tapas lovers

Author: Allyson C.
Content: This is the kind of place you want to take everyone who visits you from out of town and recommend to everyone you know I went here for lunch during Restaurant Week and it was still THAT good I wish I could afford to go back for dinner one night because Im sure that would be even more mindblowingly amazing The scallops I had could not have been more perfectly cooked or displayed i tried my friends meals too and each plate seemed better than the one before Everything about the meal was delicious and beautiful Even though it was lunch I found a way to try their wonderful white sangria too and Id highly recommend it Â Cant wait to go back In fact just writing this reminds me to start saving up for it

Author: Jeff R.
Content: Definitely a nice place with some good foodbut Its also on the pricey side and still cant beat Cafe Baba Reeba which is substantially cheaperThey do however have some really unique stuff like quail that you wont find elsewhereAll in all a nice place for Tapas in the South Loop

Author: Dan W.
Content: Wow Â Didnt know what to expect and I was blown away Â The Serrano Ham and fig salad with blue cheese of some kind and almonds and baby spinach was perhaps one of the most delicious things I have ever eaten Â Dates wrapped in bacon with blue cheese fondue was astonishing too Â Dessert of three heladossweet cream brown butter and pine nut toffeereplaces VanChocStrawWhen I left I felt like I had been wrapped in bacon Â In a good way

Author: Beatrice L.
Content: I stayed in the Blackstone hotel for a wedding and had been urged by the bridetobe to try the Mercat during my stay Â Im so glad I did Â My husband and I went for lunch Â The menu has options to order anything a la carte Â You can also select the Catalan express where you get a beverage 1 item from the first course offerings and 1 item from the second course offerings Â We decided to splurge and chose the chefs Tapas selections Â Basically for 35person the chef selects 3 items from each area of the menu Â We had a total of 9 dishes and were in love with each one Â Every dish was incredibly flavorful and filled with surprises for your palate Â By the 8th and 9th tapas dish we were both so stuffed and could not finish it allI highly recommend this restaurant

Author: Daniel K.
Content: Review in a nutshell Â Go to Mercat ask to be seated at one of Eddies tables eat everything ask him if you need help he will also say when it is too much food pay kind of a lot enjoy the living snot out of yourself Â RepeatMercat is just a wonderful dining experience Â Wifey and I celebrated our anniversary there last night and I just had to rave for a few minutes Â Eddie our waiter was outstanding really brought it home for us Â He was knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the menu but not in a pretentious or intimidating way Â If you are going to Mercat especially for a special occasion ask for Eddies section Â Also tell them that you are celebrating two years in a row weve gotten a seat next to one of the Michigan Avenuefacing windows for an awesome view Â And now the food not a total breakdown just what we had last nightQueso  Monte Enebro  get this it is superTapas de Siempre  Datiles con Almendras  Pulpo con Patatas  I dont eat these myself but Wifeys eyes glaze over while eating theseCocas  Costillas de Ternera  One of those things you didnt mean to order but divine inspiration must have struckFideos  Pelotas de Calabaza y Cordero  I would step over my own mother to get these and sort of forget my own name for a minute after eating themCarnes  Tocina con Cidra  Melt in your mouth good an amazing blend of flavorsPescados  Mar I Muntanya II  ordered on a whim had me over the moonVerduras  Patatas Bravas  the only disappointing part of the meal but that is definitely because we were in Spain in May I remember LOVING these last year this year  not as muchDessert  We ordered the Croquetas de Xocolata and the Crema Catalana Â Eddie actually brought and comped an Arroz con Leche when I noted that I had a difficult decision Â All deserts were great Â If you are not an enormous fat person like me just get the CroquetasEddie also comped us champagne to start our meal and our after dinner drink the name of which I cannot remember Â A couple of grilled prawns also showed up at the table very good very free

Author: diana r.
Content: We really loved this place  will be back the next time we get to Chicago We did the deluxe tasting menu and one each of the wine pairings Things that stand out were the bacon wrapped dates mushroom risotto with truffle and the jamon but everything was good I love a tasting menu because its fun to see what they bring next Â I actually liked the lower priced wine flight better than the deluxe one we shared everything Fun casual vibe and wait staff was very good

Author: K B.
Content: Very solid but a bit pricey

Author: A B.
Content: I love this place and its my new favorite Tapas restaurant It is so cute in there and the food is just amazing Â We ordered a bunch of stuff including the flat bread and Wagyu steak which were our favorites Â For dessert I ordered the Saffron rice pudding my mouth is watering just thinking about it it was amazing Â I definitely would go there again and again and again

Author: Scott J.
Content: Great food good service but it was noisy and also a bit pricey for the portion sizes yes I know tappas are small plates

Author: Addy C.
Content: AMAZINGAlthough pricey it was worth every penny spent Â I took my aunt and uncle there and my only complaint is that the waitress was not the friendliest she could have beenThe food was absolutely amazing

Author: Sarah M.
Content: Im not normally the biggest tappas fan but I really liked this place Normally I feel like Im always waiting for more food at places like this and I spend more time hungrily waiting than I do eating but the service here was great and the portions were large enough that I was always still eating before the next place arrivedAlso the food itself was fantastic Almost everything I ordered was either by accident or was a complete guess because I was focused on the wrong thing when the waiter explained how to navigate the spanish menu but no matter I personally picked out three plates and none of them were a disappointment It wasnt a cheap place but nothing was so expensive that it wasnt worth it and like I said before the portions were definitely much more than you normally get with tappasThe atmosphere was also very cool as well At first we were a little taken back at how small it was but that was because we mistook the bar downstairs as the whole thing The upstairs has a real cool look to it and has a very fun feeling to it Though I think that we were just as much relieved as impressed after mistaking the downstairs lobby for the whole thingIts overall a good place and everyone in our group enjoyed it

Author: Kelly K.
Content: I really enjoyed my first visit to this new restaurant Â The food was outstanding better than many restaurants in Barcelona Â The service was top notch Â It is very pricey and some Americans may be put off by the menubut I highly recommend the risotto with morel mushrooms and asparagus calzuela etc Â I liked the ambience and there is a great bar selection Â The only strange thing about the place is it looks closed when you arrive from outside Â It is all darkjust open the door and you will discover a small barhead upstairs for the dining room which is airy and has large windows overlooking Grant Park Â  The food includes typical Spanish tapas and novel tapa creationstry both

Author: Will R.
Content: I liked it I was just visiting Chicago and a friend talked me into stopping here We didnt have too much time and we needed to eat before Wicked started at the Ford Theater This place was MUCH more expensive than is usually my preference but it was good

Author: Joanne W.
Content: I had the tasting menu and enthusiatically admit that I tried all three flavors of sangria I enjoyed them all The tasting menu was neverending with a good variety for all of us to enjoy there were 4 of us The smoked meats  delicious especially the beef I loved the pimentos de padronsimple but so good I also enjoyed the complimentary tomato bread although it was a bit garlicky Nice loungelike atmosphere I knew when I walked in and heard the latest  greated Portishead album playing that it was going to be a good dining experience

Author: Stephen R.
Content: nice food nice atmosphere but the tables are so freakin smallI mean they squeeze 4 people at a table meant for 2 So if you have 6 or more youre actually ok because they have normal sized tables good date place and the hotel bar is niceThe steak was awesome but it was 65 bonesso you make the call it made our meal but was also 13 of the billSo we had the waygu steak salads dont get the salads not a good value chorizo fava beans bacon wrapped dates spicy potatoesa mushroom rice dish that was awesome but like a baby serving sizeSo yes good food the portio size is all over the place and range from dainty to appropriate

Author: Charlie B.
Content: Great meal We did the 68 chefs choice menu and enjoyed it Despite some comments we felt like it was a ton of food Service was spoton I am not usually a tapas fan but this place made me happy I didnt pay the bill so that might have changed my views But I am sure to be back at some point for a cocktail or two and a nibble on a couple of tapas

Author: Alan J.
Content: Excellent martini very good service One problem it appears that the chef used coarse salt to salt the food so that several people at our table complained that they would get a very tasty bite followed by a waytoosalty bite Other than that food was quite good though not the best Tapas I have had If it werent for the salting problem Id probably give them 4 stars Actually one other thing one of us ordered apricot sorbet another ordered mango and the gut that delivered them had them switched  they look identical Id suggest to the kitchen they need to do something to distinguish those two They were both delicious

Author: John S.
Content: Went here on a night out with a bunch of friends There were about 7 of us in my party One of my friends saw Mercat on Check please and decided that we all needed to go and try it out When we went in the menu had so many different items on it that we were a bit overwhelmed Our waiter was very helpful though and told us if we got the chefs selection he would let us know what was on it and let us substitute That is what we ended up doing We also ordered the Sangrea and it was amazing The Chefs special was also amazing and we got so much food The bacon covered dates were amazing The Kobe stake was also very good The spanish meats we got were great also So many great things While the food here is pricey it was also very good and worth every cent If you are out for a special night this is a great place to go you will not be disappointed

Author: Tammy L.
Content: This is one of my favorite places in the city Â The vegetable dishes are fantastic and as a vegetarian I really appreciate that Â I love eating ADD style so tapas is fun for me Â I love the spinach with apples and currantsI could eat it every day and not get tired of it Â Theyve elevated it from a simplesounding dish to a work of art with their mastery of the cooking method Â The incredibly high heat imparts the veggies with the taste of the pan theres actually a term for it in Chinese that is really hard to achieve at home Â I also love the octopus in potatoes the bacalao croquettes patatas bravas and pan con tomate Â The most recent time that I went we had a dessert called Peas and Carrotscarrot cake with sweet pea ice cream which is tastier than it sounds Â Our server was wacky and terrific Â Cant wait to go back again

Author: Dustin G.
Content: Best tapas in Chicago I have a very high standard for tapas This is the only place Ill eat at in Chicago They have some traditional favorites but also some unique Catalonian dishes Their seafood tapas are not my favorite but the menu is huge and there really is something for everyone its not cheap Its a special occasion place Once you see the imaginative decor and try some of their delicious sangria youll understand why The sangrias change with the seasons and even if tapas arent your thing you should go to the bar for a drink

Author: Diana W.
Content: my now fiance made reservations to this place as our dinner before he proposed Â The atmosphere is dark and great but damn it took the server so long to get to us I was about to get up and ask the hostess if we had a server when he came to us Other than that we got the chefs choice and each plate served to us with so rich with flavor butter and fat So good Â Not each dish was a hit and if you not a fan of fatty salty and MEATY food then this is not your place

Author: Nadia S.
Content: Finally tried mercat for brunch so for some reason i goofed up on opentable and made the reservation for a different date but they were really cool about it and still gave us a great table that i asked for hate communal seating  Â the food was really good i liked most of the dishes but the eggs and tomato sauce dish was not that great Â best dish was the eggs benedict but im a sucker for all benedicts so who knows Â but u def get a lot for ur money which is great Â service was alright but we had to ask several times to get our table cleared of empty glasses and plates Â this is def a place to come with the girls if u havent tried it u must bottomless drinksgood food Â what more could u ask for

Author: Matt B.
Content: The downstairs bar staff could use some workthere was a good 1015 minute stretch when there wasnt an employee in sightbut the restaurant is outstanding Â I went with a party of seven so I wont list off everything we ate Â Suffice it to say that nothing disappointed it was fairly pricey and the curried lamb was the big winner

Author: Mandy P.
Content: I chose to have my last meal at Mercat No Im not typing this from a heavenly cloud looking down upon the world of Yelpers reflecting on this South Loop selection Rather it was my last meal in my 20s and since attending the Mercat Yelp event in November I have been hoping to have a full meal here Saturday night the nearly four month thought came to fruition Our wonderful server Sally toured us through the menu highlighting some of the more popular tapas options there as well as her personal faves She didnt lead us astray on anything My group of 4 shared a very reasonably priced pitcher of white sangria It was some of the more flavorful sangria Ive ever had with a lovely peach taste to it Since we were planning on being up in da club after dinner we stuck to a few light options Here is the list chefs cheese selection very generous portion Verdosa salad baconwrapped dates with almonds butternut squash dumplings which melted in our mouths and short rib flatbread I loved that the dates had almonds it was a nice change to a tapas staple And the meat on the flatbread was about as tender as it gets We of course did not pass on dessert which included several excellent options Our choice was a delicious hazelnut chocolate ice cream delight and some Peg Bundy dessert du jour Bon BonsI would definitely recommend this fabulous place

Author: Natalie L.
Content: We went here for restaurant week and were really disappointed The only dish I really enjoyed was the croquettes Â Everything else was really average Â The experience reaffirmed my rule never to eat in hotel restaurants

Author: Jennifer G.
Content: Ever so tasty Â I was there last night for Food Network Magazine event but I recognized some of the appetizers they were passing around as part of the normal menu Â  Almond and blue cheese stuffed dates wrapped with bacon  YUM Â  Duck meatballsnever been a fan of duck but these bad boys were addictive Â I am not sure what it is usually like but it was a cool place to have an event and all the food was just tasty

Author: Galina M.
Content: Hands down our MOST favorite Catalonianspanish restaurant in the city Â I celebrated my birthday there and a couple of other occasions including showing off the great city dining to out of town friends The chef is an Iron Chef  nuff said when you order you really have to ask the waiter what dishes the Chef won the Iron Chef for  i forget which ones exactly but if you ask the waiter they will gladly tell you Â My favorites are the flat bread with beef shortrib and the shrimp one is also very good Â Potatoes bravas theyre little balls on a narrow plate with spicy mayo underneath lamb chops  amazing the jamonserrano ham salad dates wrapped in bacon grilled octopus jumbo shrimppretty much everything is awesome at this place Â It keeps me coming back and never disappoints Â Except for the service sometimes Â Usually you have to wait a long time for the bread that they bring you which is almost like a bruschetta  and recently they started charging if you ask them to bring extra Â  Â Its in south loop on 8th and Michiganstreet parking aplenty around there Â Its inside the Marriott Blackstone hotel Â Definitely recommend Thumbs up

Author: Shelby B.
Content: Ambience and interior were surprisingly fun and creative Service was well above average Everyone enjoyed the food and there was enough menu variety to suit everyones taste Â The drinks were pretty good but for the price I would recommend visiting this place mainly for the food

Author: Elina S.
Content: Came here for date night and had an absolutely fabulous time The place is sexy as can be love the lights fixtures and design of the place especially the super trendy mirrored colored bar The food was amazing everything we had was absolutely delicious starting off with the complimentary tomato bread very tasty We had the bacon wrapped dates which were phenomenal and my favorite item of the night you must get them here Â They are small and pricey but sooo incredible with this fondue cheese sauce all over them wow We had to splurge on the jamon iberico de bellota which was a tad pricey at 2500 but definitely enough for the two of us and totally reminded us of the streets of Barcelona Definitely tender and recommended Other yummy tapas we had were the potatas bravas which are the spicy potatoes with a spicy ailioli sauce Then we had the butternut squash and lamb ragu stuffed raviolis which were very tasty as well We werent sure which sangria to get so we got the Sangria flight which had a red a white and my fave the rose pink  Definitely a fun dining experience here and worth the hypeMy only complaint overall is that the portions are ridiculously small so you can easily spend over 100 for 2 people and thats without alcohol but I would say that the quality is good and in life you get what you pay for  My tip to Mercat make BIGGER bacon wrapped dates

Author: Chaos M.
Content: I tried the chicken sandwich it is good

Author: Vivi W.
Content: For saturday lunch it was pretty empty So service was perfect Had a lunch set waiter substitted the ice tea to sangria flight for us for free Food was good drinks were good Bill was only about 20 per person with the drinks Good place to go in this touristy area

Author: Ryan S.
Content: Some of the best tapas Ive had Awesome food the baby octopus w potatoes and paprika was excellent the mushroom flatbread was savory the divers scallops were fresh and delicious The presentation was beautiful as the portions left you wanting more Our service was impeccable My only complaint is that the wine prices are a bit higher than average about 354 times markup over wholesale but for a restaurant on Michigan ave its not a big shock restaurants have to make money somehow Overall an authentic tapas experience and Id go back in a heartbeat except next time Ill order the full chefs tasting menu to see what other culinary treasures theyre hiding

Author: liz d.
Content: Great yummy food OK drinks Service is friendly helpful and attentive A little pricey for the portions

Author: Mary Beth A.
Content: incredibly delicious and unique tapasstyle menu had a nice dinner here when i was in town for business and every plate that was ordered was DEVOURED unfortunately i do not recall the name of each dish i ordered Â started with an incredible cheese plate had a super unique salad a fish dish and some potatoessausage Â definitely save room for dessert if you can  the homemade ice cream was out of this world good Â as some other reviewers mentioned the food actually comes out VERY quickly Â we ordered a few rounds of tapas after our cheese plate and most of them came out nearly immediately Â i suppose better the food come out fast then very slow the presentation of each dish was nothing short of beautiful come to mercat just to see how beautifully the dishes come out Â and trust me everything will taste good too

Author: Mandy A.
Content: Go back and get the Chefs Tasting menu seriously so much food and three average glasses of wine for 85 Â Love love love Â The bacon wrapped dates with almond and cheese are heaven

Author: Michelle B.
Content: We went on a triple date to Mercat and decided to do the tasting menu Â With drinks and the tasting menu it came out to be a bit expensive per couple Â But I think it was well worth it Â A few highlightsDrink  we had Sangria and then several specialty cocktails Â After a big dinner like this you think you wouldnt be tipsy but we sure were Â We ordered a few pitchers of Sangria which we flew through Â They werent stingy with their liquor pours thats for sureFood  so many courses during the tasting menu Â At one point they cleared the table and I thought they were done Â Good think we didnt ask for the check because the next thing we knew they were bringing the next course Â It was A TON of food Â Lots for us to try Â A few of my favorites was a cheese plate bacon wrapped dates with an almond and lamb chops Â I would go back and just order these they were so goodService  the service was decent Â It wasnt overly great Â Maybe for a more upscale restaurant like this we should have had a little better service Â One of the girls we were with had nut allergies and we told them that if there was nuts in the plate or in the sauce to just tell us and she would just not eat it Â They brought out the bacon wrapped dates with the almonds with no warning and she was about to eat it Â Thankfully someone at the table cut into it first and warned her Â Close callAmbiance  great ambiance Â The music mood and lighting is true to any upper scale Michigan Ave restaurant in Chicago Would we come back  yes Â Would we do the tasting menu this time  probably not Â There was so much on the menu the 1st time that it was overwhelming Â But Im glad we did it because now I know what to order Â If its your first time maybe you should try the tasting menu Â Although it was pricey we got a great feel for all the different dishes and I think it was worth it

Author: Kit G.
Content: I cant say enough good things about Mercat Â There is a reason why the chef is an Iron Chef Â The food is spectacular Â Full robust flavors and tender meats Â This is what food is supposed to be

Author: S K.
Content: AWFUL STAY AWAY FOR SUNDAY BRUNCHWent for my birthday on 923 The food was terrible and the worst thing about it was cheese and meat trays for the brunch They were sitting out near the bar with obvious fruit flies on them Whats worse the pastries Â had even more flies all over them Not just one or two literally 30 flies on all the pastries muffins and desserts The 3 courses of the brunch were not that great In fact I have been dealing with some tummy troubles ever since I have been to Mercat for Lunch which was much better but Sunday Brunch is not a good idea

Author: Anavmy F.
Content: Nice food and atmosphere but a little pricey

Author: Peter H.
Content: Sampled a lot of the different Apps and Tapas and the Â were delicious Try the Sangrias they offer most refrfeshing and paired well with the food

Author: Emann B.
Content: Food was very very tasty and loved the fun desserts the deep fried chocolate croquetas were mind blowing Â Service with a smile but spotty at times

Author: Kelly G.
Content: Went here for Restaurant Week braving an awful cold and gross weather and boy am I glad that I didWe had the chefs tasting menu on special for 35 and it was incredible Started off with a spinach salad that had a gorgonzola like cheese a sweet vinaigrette serrano ham and bacon Smokey sweet and deliciousNext was a cheese apple sauce pairing The cheeses were tasty though not anything mind blowingFollowing this was an amazing soup the chicken broth infused with saffron giving it an incredible flavor and color It had delicious chorizo chicken potato and rice in it It was topped with a slice of toasted bread covered in their housemade smoked paprika aioli which paired amazingly well with the soup This was probably one of the stars of the mealNext was a skewer of their amazing chorizo and some tiny omelettes with spinach onion and potato this was the only thing I didnt really care for  but Im not a big omelette fan anyway  others at the table loved it Following this we had wilted spinach with black currants and pine nuts topped with shaved apple Perfectly charred steak with amazing flavor over shredded short rib meat on top of a potato pancake Gigantic tiger prawns with the heads still on  that was a little weird for me had to have someone else behead the beast haha And an AMAZING little cast iron skillet filled with a medley of garlicky mushroomsI was totally full at this point and worn out thanks to the stupid cold and did not partake in the chocolate croquettes which were apparently orgasmically goodMy friend who came with me said it was the best meal she ever had It certainly ranks high for me and I would definitely want to come back

Author: Brian G.
Content: The food and drinks here are great but I think the prices are a bit out of hand and Im used to places in Boston and NYC I had a halibut that was great but 17 for tapas seems to defeat the point Menu is from like 10 to 25 when it should be more 6 to 18 Doesnt seem big but it is since it changes the way you would eat here for one or two people Â  If you can deal with that I would highly recommend it

Author: Kelly K.
Content: Great restuaurant Â The caldo was awesome but the service was a bit lacking Â We were dining on a weekday and while we werent in a huge rush the service really dragged

Author: Ryan C.
Content: A little pricey but very good food

Author: Red G.
Content: Everything I get here is awesome Every year I return here with new people that I introduce to my favorite restaurant They all LOVE IT Its just the best Spanish Tapas ever I love you Mercat I wish there was one of you in LA

Author: Chris M.
Content: This does not live up to the quality that Chef Garces demands in his restaurants Â First of all I made my reservation a full month in advance of my trip Â I ended up having to wait over an hour to be seated because they never wrote my reservation down Â They suggested I may have missed up my dates when I booked but I just dont understand how dates are mixed up on a 4 day trip Â The food was mediocre Â I have eaten at Amada and Trading Company in Philadelphia and this place just doesnt compare Â I feel bad that the Chicagoans do not get to eat their native chefs best cuisine

Author: Chris B.
Content: We were a 630 Saturday night pretheater Auditorium Theatre walkin party of two and were lucky to get seats upstairs at the bar the dimly lit first floor lounge seemed cozy but was already filled Our bartenders Bobby  Nicole were prompt without being pushy worked well together they both answered questions for us and made suggestions and seemed genuinely friendly The main dining room is grand without being stuffy and had a good energy We found this place thanks to Yelp but didnt leave hungry or feel shortchanged on the food as some other reviewers have We had some Â vegetarian dishes and both the prawns and the shrimp in garlic what can I say Im crustacean crazy My wifes final say on our meal If the food in Spain was this good Id go back during a week in Seville she couldnt satisfy her radical veggie requirements

Author: Meggan R.
Content: You have to get the tasting menu with the wine pairing Â Have one of the outrageous cocktails too Â The room is huge table or booth both great Â Big open kitchen and fun staff You will leave happy full and with a smile on your face Â I would eat here once a week if I could afford it

Author: Michael D.
Content: I stayed in the Renaissance Blackstone on a business trip and this restaurant was in the hotel so I decided on a lazy night to give it a shot Â Some of the reviews on Yelp were pretty bad so I approached with caution I have to say the reviews that call out the small plates and expensive prices were dead on However the quality of the food is absolutely outstanding If you have a problem paying a premium for a smaller portions of amazing quality food then this isnt your place I had the luxury of a business travel expense account which softened the blow I ate at the bar two nights in a row and food price and size concerns aside they have a kick ass bartender named Bobby who not only knows his stuff about the menu everything he recommended was amazing but made me a handful of drinks that were so far off the wall that I cant even remember what was in half of them One had egg whites in it and was out of this freaking world I dont give stars lightly but given the quality if the food drinks and recommendations and conversation from Bobby I have to give this place 4 starsThe complaints about it being too dark to see are silly Â It has the right ambiance for a restaurant of this type and caliber

Author: bj f.
Content: i loved this place climbing the stairs into the creatively designed wide open space makes for a entrance that speaks attitude but the friendly greeter dispelled that fear as we were seated to begin a meal as unique as the surroundings our server was upbeat and helpful with suggestions a really pleasant guymy hub is an absinthe afficionado and enjoyed one of three offered while i savored their take on sangria via a sangriatini a blend of red wine brandy cava and fruit which was absolutely delicious the first course was a perfectly dressed salad with asparagus followed by a clam and bacon flatbread that was unlike anything wed ever tasted we chose our tapas from the specialty sections the duck with confit and fois gras and the lobster in butter sauce with flan a listing of ingredients doesnt reflect the artfully presented wonderful flavors of each serving and as small as tapas are we were really stuffed one surprising perk was provided by the gentleman seated on the bench to my left he had ordered a tasting dinner and had about four plates before him when we arrived while we began enjoying our dinner they brought out a spinach dish ribs and a lamb chop he groaned that he couldnt possibly eat another bite but was persuaded by his server to try at least one he reached over grabbed the platter of spinach deliciously prepared with pine nuts and fruit and the lamb chop and handed them to me insisting that they would be wasted if i didnt accept his offerings oh no twist my arm some more we loved the spinach but discovered that we couldnt eat another forkful ourselves so we had the lamb chop packed to go it was altogether one of the best dinners and tastiest most original tapas weve ever enjoyed the only reason i held back a star was the cost id suggest that you take advantage of the tasting menu because with drinks included our few dishes well exceeded the cost of that option and though youll be too full to finish youll be guaranteed some tasty snacks for a day or two

Author: Hayden B.
Content: We were in from out of town  staying at the Blackstone so the Mercat was the obvious place for drinks before going out on several occasions The bartenders were the friendliest in town literally the nicest people we met while on vacation They have some fantastic specialty drinks and I fell in love with the sangria AND its less than 2 a glass on Monday nights Unfortunately we did not eat during our stay so I can only comment on the drinks however the food did smell amazing

Author: Tiff H.
Content: First ballet in the big city Ballet to see at 730may get hungry before the showwhat to do what to do Google location of the the auditoriumgoogle restaurants within walking distanceless than 1 mile pleasemy feet will be on fire when walking more than that in heelsResults Mercat a la Planxa Reviews Average Â 4 stars Ding dingwe have a winner Reservations for 530pma little snack before going to the balletI walk in a bit early because I wanted to tell the server that we have to make the ballet Hate rushing dinner but my nightmares of the Joffrey usher slamming the doors in my groups face because we arrived at 731pm were just too vividThe waitress was very knowledgeable and very nice However my alarm bells went off because she suggested the Chef Selection for the group because thatd make it easy I didnt want too58 was already 15 more than I wanted to spend on actual foodbut had toEVERYONE at the table is required if anyone wants to do the chef selectionOk fine Ill do it Experience right Splurge A plusthey accommodated for the vegetarians at the table and brought out some fantastic veggie side dishes when the rest of us had meatWhat do I remember that was good The little chili pepper dipped in mayo sauce was tasty The lamb was excellent The veggie dishes that had Murielles spelling were awesomeI adore those mushrooms thobest fungus of all The beefI got stuck with a butt piece so I didnt get to taste the pieces that were cooked rareI like my meat bloody I guess it may have been goodI did stare longingly at the red red pieces but the little piggy in me said to share The chef brought out some complimentary tator tot things topped with spicy mayofine but they showed up on our table again Seriously If its complimentary send a salad or somethingsomething we wont see again Bacon wrapped datesbacon was seared and way blacker than I likeif thats possible Oh the prawnsthe size of my hand literallyI have small hands and the heads were still attached My Chinese self squealed with delighttoo bad I wasnt comfy enough around my party to ask for their prawn heads so I could eat the brains I think I grossed out the vegetarians that surrounded me Sorry Thats pretty much all I can rememberChef Selection didnt include dessert As with any large party there was some discrepancy over the bill but the waitress was nice about it I was more embarrassed than anything Charged a 19 gratuitythat was finewe had table of 7 and I thought itd be more along the lines of 20 The waitress did a great job bringing the bill when I asked for it and we split it among several cards Tip Ask your server for a pen and piece of paper so you can write down the appropriate amounts for each cardmake the servers life easy A to Mercat for accommodating At the end of the day for me alone tiptaxfood I was at 83I kept having to tell myselfits a special occasion We ran a bit late and werent out of there by 7pm like I wanted but no biggieBottom line I need a side job here 100 for a table of 7 when I hardly did anything Jeez I wish I had food runners bus boys water refillers when I was a waitress The food was goodsmall portions but there are tapas places that are more worth the  Come here for a splurge or special occasion or when a rich relative is paying I saw no other Asians therethey probably knew better I left hungrywent to Ping Pong later for calamari yum yum Oh yeah set aside 2 hours for dinnergreat rule of thumb Good food but you pay for the experience more Everyone else loved it I would have too if the hole in my wallet wasnt screaming at meif I had left full I think it wouldnt have been yelling quite as loudPS We did get out in time and my feet needed a cab Yes I was a lazy person and took a cab 4 blocks By the time it was time to go out and get crazymy feet didnt allow me to Im never wearing heels again

Author: L L.
Content: I am a salty girl Id rather have a grilled cheese and bacon or a meaty entree over dessert but for restaurant week I met the best dessert of my life Chocolate croquettes in rosemary caramel olive oil and banana marshmallow HELLO ARE YOU FUCKING KIDDING ME It was every bit if not more amazing than it sounds Will be going back for more than dessert but thats all I can write about for now

Author: Poof A.
Content: Service mattersAs everybody else has said the food here is fantastic I went with a group of friends during Restaurant Week and shared a bunch of Prix Fixe menus Delicious cheese plate mushroom soup was AMAZING loved the salad desserts were all topnotch maybe too rich after all the delicious food I cant comment on the meatseafood items but everybody seemed pleased I think they had scallops short ribs and a few other thingsThe problem was with our waiter We were a group of 20something grad students out for a prix fixe maybe he assumed we would be bad tippers In any case he seemed very frazzled and inattentive My salad didnt come for close to 20 minutes at which point I had to flag down a bus boy to ask for it Nonetheless I worked in the food service industry for long enough that I tip 20 standard unless something is really wrong So I did We had spread the tab equally across 5 credit cards I quietly tipped a couple dollars more than the others who it should be noted were all tipping at least 15 At the end of the meal our waiter came to the table where he blatantly read our credit cards slips RIGHT IN FRONT OF US ummm what Im no Emily Post but that is some bad etiquette He then said very pointedly thank you my name to me alone and left Last I checked you thank people for patronizing your restaurant when they could have chosen to go any number of places NOT because you consider their tip sufficient for your frankly subpar serviceAgain the food was delicious but the service left a bad taste in my mouth I will not be back

Author: Karen L.
Content: I was lucky enough to celebrate my birthday here My boyfriend took me and a few friends for a little surprise birthday dinner I loved the environment totally upscale and trendy but not overwhelming I wasnt dressed very nice but didnt feel out of place at all It is tapas but fancier than most and tastier than most We ordered about 23 tapas a person and we were so full by the end of the night I cant even remember everything we ordered but some of my favorites were the beef shortrib flatbread and the shortribs and diver scallops The bruscettatype opener they brought out was really tasty too Overall the dishes were very unique tasty and nicely presented We also had the pear sangria which was delicious I would definitely recommend Mercat for a special night out It is pricier than the typical tapas place but well worth it for the quality of food

Author: Dave K.
Content: Wonderful food decent decor better than average service Â Mercat has some of the most flavorful foods Ive ever eaten Â The baconwrapped dates are amazing

Author: Alex M.
Content: Went with friends on a Sat night Though we had a reservation we were seated 30 mins after we arrived  they offered us a drink Food is just ok but the presentation is great If you want better food with ambiance go to Avec If you want better food go to Tapas Barcelona in Evanston

Author: Tuba M.
Content: Drinks rock try the pinapple mojito to die for also the brunch is amazing 25 for four tapas and bottomless drinks  cant beat that

Author: Dina L.
Content: Good Spanish cuisine Every time Ive been here it has been with a big group and we shared everything which is the way to go

Author: nancy b.
Content: i was lucky enough to attend a magazine event here around the time that they opened Â whenever i go to these free events i expect some decent fare but mercat blew me away Â its a great spot for large groups i send work folks here a lot but be prepared to dish out some good money  not that its not worth it Â musteats Â lamb chops short ribs and setas del horno Â service is good nothing stellar but nothing bad Â the bartenders are all very friendly and had good recommendations while i was waiting including making me something to taste that wasnt on the menu Â the decor is amazing and makes for a very fun atmosphere

Author: Marisa S.
Content: Tried Mercat a la Planxa during restaurant week for lunch and was pleasantly surprised Â Lunch is a great value the catalan express 2 courses and soda for 18 or 22 is pretty filling even though its a tapas restaurant Â Go with a group of people and share the courses so you can try everything Â My favorite so far the mushroom soup

Author: Tina K.
Content: Been to Mercat several times for both lunch and dinner Â Every time Ive been there the service has been warm and friendly and the food has been excellent Â Love the sangria Â Also love the decor and atmosphere fun trendy and inviting

Author: Jill P.
Content: This place is just OK Â I would suggest Carnivale BabaReeba Iberico or Meza over this place anytime

Author: Lauren B.
Content: Ate here for brunch with a group of friends The restaurant itself is gorgeous The service is fantastic The drink menu is different and interesting in a good wayI had the Horchata Spike and it was DELICIOUS The food was tasty but a bit cold when it came outthis is the reason I gave Mercat 3 stars as opposed to 4 One thing is for sure I will be coming here again Thank you Iron Chef Jose Garces

Author: Donisha L.
Content: I really dont know how to feel about this start to my restaurant week Presidents Day off  taking advantage of a stress free Monday by consuming lots of calories Instead this was a stress filled dining experience My friend and I walked in today at lunch about 1215pm and were pleasantly surprised to see very few patrons Not completely empty but not obnoxiously crowded CHITOWN LUNCH SUCCESS Â  Â  We are seated immediately We chat scan the menu chat some more  Ok where is the waiter 15 minutes later he rushes to our table pen and pad in hand What would you like Ummmmok An explanation of your menu would be nice maybe even a recommendation or two After prompting He explained that Mercats restaurant week menu was the regular Catalan Express menu For 18 we soon learn there would be nothing express about this meal Â which included one choice from a list of options under 1st course and 2nd course Dessert could be included for 22 We order a few glasses of wine first and he immediately walks away from the table to put in the drink order Probably would have been more time efficient to put in everything together but whatever At this point we just want to get the ball rolling its now 1235pm To start we have the Arroz a la Cazuela essentially a spicy soup reminiscent of gumbo and Ensalada Verde simple salad Second course We order the Mercat Burger and Barri Gotic  hanger steak Â  Â  We sip we chat we sip some more Its 1250pm and still no first course Ooooooook We stop a busser and request our waiter We sip we chatwe then watch the table next to us receive their 1st course Its now 100pm But we were seated and ordered before them whats the issue We stop another person walking around hi weve been waiting for our foodhmmm FOREVER can we speak to our waiter to see whats the hold up Â They come back and say its coming right out and drop complimentary peppers on our table I dont want your peppers seÃ±or I want WHAT I ORDERED And I want you to apologize because the reality is you forgot to enter our order Im no fool Things started picking up a little after we walked in and you were overwhelmed just say it Â  Â  Finally we get our first course a salad and soup didnt realize salad and soup took 40 Â minutes to prepare Did you pick this fresh from the lettuce farm Was the soup flown in from some foreign country prior to So confused We annihilate the soup and saladWAITER would you like us to get your 2nd course started US Hell Yea Â  Â  We received our 2nd course shortly thereafter thank God It is now 140pm The waiter comes back to the table and asks if we would like to try dessert I ask if it will take long He laughs I straight face him It takes everything in me not to say Im fing serious is it going to take you another hour or can you make it quick We decide not to risk it pay immediately and leave Its now 155pm Â  Â  Im not a fan of two hour lunches servers neglecting tables and overall soso dining experiences The food was pretty tasty but overshadowed by the service Sorry Mercat I probably wont be back unless I have a bag of snacks in my purse and 4 hours to spare

Author: Jango O.
Content: Came here with 2 others and had the chefs choice deluxe 85 per Â If you can afford it this is the way to go Â The food was excellent

Author: Elizabeth A.
Content: A friend and I went to Mercat for Iron Chef Garces book debut dinner Â OMG delicious Â Every course was a recipe out if his new book that modernizes Latin foods Chef Garces was a super nice host for the evening to boot

Author: Kin L.
Content: Was not impressed by the restaurant The server explained the menu but failed to mention that they had a special menu for Chefs Week After asking about it he noted they dont bring it up until a customer asks for it The menu is very pricey for tapas and they have a lot of tourist that come there but I think to not mention it is disingenuous The server cleared our table a few times other servers did also and saw our drinks were empty and did not ask if we wanted more He did close to the end of the meal but our drinks were probably empty for close to 30 minutes The food was good but the reason I gave it a Fair grade is that I ended up with food poisoning and my date also felt ill overnight though not as bad

Author: Jeff M.
Content: Very excelent food and a good wine to boot Â the bacon wrapped dates were a huge hit They did a good job spacing the dishes over time Â But for four people the price was in excess if 300 a bit steep making this a special occasion only place

Author: Leang E.
Content: I came here with an old coworker for lunch and was a little surprised by how few people were in here We got in a little after noonish and you get a view of the bar right as you come in This area seems to be nice for those that are dining by themselves or with one other person for a quiet quick bite You go up the stairs for the main dining area which is very open and spacious We came for Chefs Week but there was no special menu We got the regular choice of the lunch options that they have available La Mesa de Jose where the chef creates his own special tapas menu for you or The Catalan Express where you get a choice of 2 options I was pretty disappointed by this because we could have come any other day for this It was misleading as the restaurant didnt specify that they were doing Chefs Week only for dinner here or I just made assumptions that they would have a special menu In any case we shared the Spanish omelette and the croquetas The portion of the croquetas were really small I had the salmon as my second and that was the item I probably enjoyed the most The patatas bravas were french fries with the spicy orange sauce that was not spicy at all We also split the hazelnut mascarpone gateau with apricots I would have liked to have tried more and would have liked a full menu of options I feel tainted and dissuaded to come back and try again The prices were average and the service was ok

Author: Jason F.
Content: For a restaurant situated on Michigan Ave land of every tourist that comes to Chicago  this place was right on for tapas great menu great drink selections great staff Order the tapas Grilled Shrimp and Bacon Wrapped Stuffed Dates w Almonds were awesome Spanish Omellette needed some help but everything else was awesome Spicy Potatoes were great too

Author: Marti G.
Content: This place was awesome The food was amazing The sangria could use some work thoughoverall the servers really took customer service to the next level they all new their stuff and really got everyone involved in the food I will certainly try this place again

Author: Marcos L.
Content: Tasty bar treats Very swank Euroswank Not bad if you want a little indulgence Dont overextend your expectations and everyone will be happy

Author: Judy L.
Content: Mercat is a beautiful restaurant serving expensive tapas The interior of the restaurant is gorgeous with a lot of fun artwork colors and mirrors surrounding its walls The tapas were good but I think I can eat much better tasting tapas at Emilios for 12 the price and double the portion My friend and I ordered bacon wrapped dates seafood skewers and a cheese plate The combination of bacon wrapped dates always taste heavenly no matter where you order it from but you have the urge to order another one upon discovering there were only about 4 pieces sitting on the plate Seafood skewer was great in terms of sauce that accompanied it and cheese plate was fine as well Drinks were a bit weak and service aokay

Author: Dallas T.
Content: It was OK but not spectacular as most reviews suggest Great service and it seems like a great hotel I want for lunch and I will say it was on the heavy side Gobs of mayonnaise on my sandwich dons of dressing on my salad Was too much for me Maybe dinner is better

Author: amanda g.
Content: The waitress was very knowledgeable and very nice However my alarm bells went off because she suggested the Chef Selection for the group because thatd make it easy I didnt want too58 was already 15 more than I wanted to spend on actual foodbut had toEVERYONE at the table is required if anyone wants to do the chef selectionOk fine Ill do it Experience right Splurge A plusthey accommodated for the vegetarians at the table and brought out some fantastic veggie side dishes when the rest of us had meatWhat do I remember that was good The little chili pepper dipped in mayo sauce was tasty The lamb was excellent The veggie dishes that had Murielles spelling were awesomeI adore those mushrooms thobest fungus of all The beefI got stuck with a butt piece so I didnt get to taste the pieces that were cooked rareI like my meat bloody I guess it may have been goodI did stare longingly at the red red pieces but the little piggy in me said to share The chef brought out some complimentary tator tot things topped with spicy mayofine but they showed up on our table again Seriously If its complimentary send a salad or somethingsomething we wont see again Bacon wrapped datesbacon was seared and way blacker than I likeif thats possible Oh the prawnsthe size of my hand literallyI have small hands and the heads were still attached My Chinese self squealed with delighttoo bad I wasnt comfy enough around my party to ask for their prawn heads so I could eat the brains I think I grossed out the vegetarians that surrounded me Sorry Thats pretty much all I can rememberChef Selection didnt include dessert

Author: Lori R.
Content: YUM This is one of my favorite spots Bacon wrapped dates muddled strawberry drink is to die for Its a bit pricey but worth it Also the complimentary bread is delish Love this place and highly recommend it for tapas and a fun time in Chicago

Author: Edward M.
Content: i really liked this place a great place for a nice night out with friends or a datewent with a group of friends for dinner we ordered just about everything on the menu but i wont list it all off among the highlights were the short rib  scallop flavor explosion mushroom risotto and octopus but really i thought everything was great except for the cauliflower psh vegetablesand im usually not into cocktails but after a strong recommendation from the server i got the cha cha which was great as well we ended up getting a few pitchers of sangria toothe restaurant space itself is pretty cool nice design and a lot of open space the restaurant was full and had a nice lively energy about it made you really feel like you were out and part of the city if that makes any sensethe service was good attentive friendly and helpful the only real issue i have is that its a bit too expensive to go to on a regular basis each dish is around 12 each add in the drinks which was half our tab i paid about 100 for the night worth it for a nicer night out with the buddies but just a bit unsustainable which is too bad because id love to come back often

Author: Katie G.
Content: I have eaten here several times and each time have really enjoyed myself Â I love the wine list Â Several good reasonably priced options Â I have also had the sangria which is also quite good Â Some favorites of mine Â bacon wrapped dates all of their salads lamb chops flatbreads and the pork belly Â A bit pricier than Iberico or BabaReeba but much better in my opinion

Author: Jared J.
Content: I thought it could have been better

Author: Christine W.
Content: Lovely small plates that have great interest and flair

Author: Trudy T.
Content: Love the ambiance If you dont eat beef or pork then u have a very limited selection of dishes to choose to from however the garlic shrimp are very good For those who dont know I just found out at the restaurant Tapa means small plate Therefore you have to order at least 34 plates to get the equivalent of a regular meal The potatoes are great basically smooth tater tots with spicy cheese and the bread they serve is divine Overall I love the place but it is not a place to go when you are starving because it can be on the pricey side

Author: Shalin D.
Content: Im very picky about what I wear to restaurants If its Italian I like dressing up something tailored by a Milanese man perhaps If its Indian I throw on a tunic and a shawl If its Mexican I wont go so far as to wear a sombrero but a little color never hurt anyone So when I went to Mercat dressed up like a flamenco dancer I felt like a complete moron The restaurant was dressed up enough It needed little help from me or my ruffled shirt The layout is a big oval with festivecolored walls and deep shades of fuchsia red and orange everywhere The decor a nice complement to the somewhatdim lighting and somewhatsophisticated clientele Needless to say this is not the place to dress up like a cultural stereotype Leave the fringe at homeThankfully the food distracted me from feeling too selfconscienceThis is to say the food is incredibly good and you really cant stop eating Instead of navigating the menu ourselves we all eight of us in the group ordered the six course tasting with the wine pairing It was a smart move We started with a creamy manchego and honey The cheese was smoother than most manchegos Ive tasted with a slight nuttiness that paired well with the cloyingly sweet honey We then moved on to a sizzling shrimp that I didnt care too much for the shrimp smelled fishy  never a good sign We were then given a salad tossed in an excellent vinaigrette which was wrapped in a casing of serrano ham It was perfect Unlike most salads this one was substantial in volume and taste The vinegar in the dressing cut the fattiness of the serrano in just the right way Next course patatas bravas These were served in single servings with a great spice paste resting on top We were also brought a lamb dish and baconwrapped dates that were to die for All in all an excellent mealTwo complaints First we made a reservation two weeks in advance and still had to wait fortyfive minutes before we were seated Second the wine portions in the pairing are bit austere If Im paying an additional 40 for wine I want to get a bottles worth Not that Im a lush or anythingHighly recommended

Author: caroline k.
Content: Came here on Sunday for their tasting menu showed up with no reservation at noon for 2 and was seated quickly as the place was rather empty Â The menu is comprised of 8 tasting dishes plus the carving station suckling pig charcuterie table 3 cheese 3 meats and bottomless dessert table nothing extraordinary Â  The served dishes themselves are remarkable  the baconwrapped dates with almonds which ive had before elsewhere were out of this world Â Heated to just the right temperature and served over a light salad with blue cheese dressing Â  Other courses included mussels buckwheat pancakes poached eggs all very flavorful and tasty Â Portions on the smaller side Â Decor is rather bland but I could imagine the place lights up better at night

Author: Bryan M.
Content: Do yourself a favor for the love of everything good in life Â Just beyond any useful description

Author: Eric F.
Content: We came here for an anniversary dinner a while ago with big hopes but received mediocrity We frequent Tapas Valencia and have ventured out to Ba Ba Reeba so we were familiar with tapas bars Wed heard great things about Mercat so we went in with high expectations All of the workers were nice the host sat us immediately and when he was around the server was friendly We found the food to be nothing special and the portions small even for tapas It wasnt a bad experience just nothing stood out

Author: Kevin D.
Content: Lovely atmosphere incredible tapas wish I could try them all but will be back again

Author: Sam W.
Content: One of the best meals Ive ever had in my entire lifeThat was what my dining companion said halfway through our meal even before dessert Â Mercat a la Planxa has been a musttry for me the past two years and I finally found the perfect time to try it out Â We made a 1215pm reservation for lunch and were seated immediately next to giant window overlooking Michigan Ave Â The dining room has a high ceiling with mirrors on both sides with painted birds on them Â Very decorative and trendy Â The tables near the outside of the restaurant can be close together probably during busy times the twotops can be frustratingly close but for the most part are well spaced out Â Our server was very professional and mentioned he also worked at Smith  Woolsenskys so you knew he knew his stuffFor lunch Mercat offers an 18 per person Catalan Lunch where you choose one item from the list of First Courses and one item from the list of Second CoursesI chose the Serrano Ham  Fig Salad and my companion chose the Pimentos de Padron Â The salad was huge Â check the photo uploaded and filled with fresh figs some type of fancy blue cheese and tossed with a sherry vinaigrette Â Any salad using spinach leaves is always good and other than maybe a tad too much dressing this one was great Â The Pimentos de Padron which were fried pimento peppers were very tasty and had just the slightest crisp
