to them and a hint of spice Â The thick specks of sea salt made them eve more enjoyableFor our Second Courses we chose the Black Angus Hangar Steak and the Vieires i AlbergÃ­nia grilled diver scallops Â The steak was ordered medium rare and came out close to rare but it wasnt a major concern Â The steak came topped with fresh beech mushrooms and was served on a thin layer of short ribs and a thick potato croquette Â The croquette tasted like a fancy hash brown and was perfectly crispy on the outside and moist in the inside Â One of the best dishes Ive ever had Â The scallops were flawless as well Â Four giant diver scallops a la planxa on the grill were cooked to perfection and almost melted in your mouth Â They are served on two wooden skewers and come with an addicting roasted eggplant puree and a confit of artichokes Â Muy deliciosoAll items on the menu can be orded a la carte so we decided to try a side order of the Setas al Horno wild mushrooms potatoes parsley and shallots It was served sizzling hot in a mini black cast iron skillet Â If you order one thing at Mercat a la Planxa make sure it is these mushrooms Unbelievable flavor and if this was served in a giant bucket I would have no problem finishing itFor dessert we ordered both available options the Pastissos Davellana HazelnutMascarpone Gateaux Apricot Dulche de Leche Salted Hazelnuts and the Croquetas de XocolataMilk Chocolate Croquettes Banana Marshmallow Rosemary Caramel Arbequina Olive Oil I gave the full descriptions because they read exactly as they taste We destroyed both of them and left no sauce or crumbs on the plate check the photos to see how they are composedI cant wait to return here for dinner one night and try the rest of their items Do yourself a favor and stop in Mercat a la Palnxa and if you follow my ordering advice you will not be disappointed

Author: Grant C.
Content: We went here on the day before New Years and splurged on the Chefs Luxury Tasting Menu with wine flight for 2 at 135 apiece That was done largely because we hadnt tried anything there before and wanted to get immersed in the full dining experience The interior design of this place is quite magnificent to behold Our server was super attentive and even gave us both an extra glass of wine for our final item not coming out with the rest of the 3rd course We received 12 plates total for 3 courses It probably did help a lot that we arrived for early seating too My biggest pleasant surprise were how well the exotic mushrooms tasted just by themselves and Im normally not a fan of mushrooms by themselves We would certainly come back here again when staying downtown and next time just to try out a few individual items on the menu Of course it is pricey so plan to save up

Author: Anthony B.
Content: Nice menu nice environment good food Â I recommend for a fun evening of Spanish Tapas

Author: Larry P.
Content: This was a real find Â Wonderful small plates Â A foodies paradise on S Michigan Ave Smoked quail with polenta was awesome Butternut squash dumplings with lamb ragout  another great dish Spinach a la catalina with currents pine nuts and apple was wonderful Beef shorty rib flatbread  amazing Chocolate croquettes with banana marshmallows  what a way to finish things off

Author: Michael K.
Content: Flatbread w Sardines was unlike anything Ive seen in a tapas place Very very good Peach infused vodka is great as well

Author: Joel W.
Content: Was brought her by my mom because it belongs to Iron Chef Jose Garces Was not disappointed Ive had a variety of dishes at this fine establishment with my family and have not been disappointed Everything is tasty and satisfying Especially love the meat dishes like the Wagyu Zabuton Iberico Secreto and the Cordero Would recommend this to anyone who is visiting Chicago or lives there

Author: Jackie M.
Content: Im not sure if we hit a bad night but of all we ordered 80 was way over cooked The bacon wrapped dates the spicy potatoes and the pork belly Wes so over cooked and dry we couldnt finish any of them My favorite dish we had was the halibut which was cooked nicely and had good flavor I have to agree with other Yelpers that it was very loud but the place is beautifully decorated  We tried the red and white sangria which were not good enough to order again so we switched to wine But the spicy potatoes  which for me were like bad tater tots and dry over cooked dates did this place in for me We will not be returning

Author: LARRY k.
Content: I became a huge fan of this place after just one visit Its a Catalan tapas restaurant operated by iron chef Jose Garces The atmosphere is a quiet subduded and elegant The four of us shared about 56 courses all of which were excellent Â The price including drinks and a tip was around 20000 which I think is a bargain for a restaurant of this quality

Author: Peter M.
Content: We went to mercat last night after we had dinner at home We wanted dessert and a drink a decided the short bike ride to mercat would be worth while Our waiter was nice at first We ordered two drinks and a cheese plate Later we mentioned we would like to see a dessert menu that is when the service essentially stopped He dropped off the menu then didnt check back for about a half hour He walked past our table multiple times and didnt pay any attention Finally he stopped by to take the dessert order He never asked how it was in fact he never came back to the table Our dessert check and receipt all brought by a different person When we were leaving my girlfriend said thanks bye He didnt respond and kept walking I understand our check total was only around 60 but that doesnt mean we should be ignored Wont be going there again

Author: Christine S.
Content: I went here with a group of girls and we had the Chefs tasting menu with the wine pairing It was amazing I love the decor the wine list and for 75 you get plenty of food and wine They recently added outdoor seating off the bar on Michigan Ave and its just a great place to have a drink and people watch Ill be going back soon

Author: Ellen A.
Content: Warning Huge Â Loud Â If youre looking for something intimate this is not it Â Half the tables seem to be groups that insisted the server take pictures of them Â Seriously so very loud with kind of loud techno music playing loudly and two stories of space above the loud crowd for noise to loudly reverberate around Â Also really big Â Not lettuce entertain you big but it sort of still felt that wayA note about the space the dining room has enormous arched windows that face east onto Michigan so the room is flooded with that orange sodium light Â A plus in my book Â Also there are several bar  lounge areas to wait in with lots of nooks for chatting with a small group So if youre up for a kind of big restaurant experience the food is fantastic Â The normal smallplate place caveats apply here Â Its probably more fun with more people because you can taste more things it can probably get quite expensive in that way etc Â Since we were only two we did the tasting menu Â It was well tasty but they dont give you much of the distinctive food and the portions were really too big Â My favorite part was the wine pairings there were three and they were all really interesting andor delicious Â I asked for a list of the choices and our server forgot itThe wee tater tots patatas bravas with spicy aioli are great Â The grilled scallops were good but crazy salty Â The flatbread was flavorful and complex Â Octopus was outstanding  tender and spiced in a really nice balanced wayI will happily go back if a group of friends suggests it

Author: Eric R.
Content: Mmmmmmlove it

Author: Noel K.
Content: Nice place with Â great presentation Â We were there for lunch Had the apple pork sausage with beans croquetas deep fried breaded fish shaped in marble sized balls grits with shrimp and short ribs and a cheese platter

Author: Mercedes S.
Content: I scheduled this lunch with a few coworkers and it was a new place for all of us Â We all tried a different dish and everyone seemed to like it Â I had the Hanger Steak and it was delicous as well as the Ensalada Verde Â I would totally go again but this time for dinner and would love to try the place for breakfast as well Â The environment is very clean and colorful Â Staff was very welcoming and quick to our needs

Author: Brian P.
Content: I would not recommend dining here If it were only a matter of the food my rec would probably be to give it a shot In fact we had a number of very tasty dishes The short rib flat bread pork belly mushrooms and black lentil concoction were all standouts The starter meat plate was very weak they choose three jamons or something similar for you  none was particularly good the halibut was not that flavorful nor were the mussels We did enjoy the desserts a lot Terrible brewed coffee the Golden Nuggets is betterHoweveras a dining experience I wanted to get the hell out of there as quickly as possible as did everyone at the table A lot of things to note  It was a very rainy night and generally S Michigan Ave is a dumpy location for a nice restaurant maybe all the tourists around dont know better but no valet parking that we could identify in retrospect maybe the Blackstone hotel where its located had it but the point is it wasnt in front of the restaurant and we circled for street parking  As several other reviewers noted it was way too noisy and pounding house music wore us down through the evening I actually like house music when its a great mix this was really generic The place was the opposite of hip if thats what they were going for it was mostly older couples guilty and a bunch of tourists in shorts and golf shirts at 8pm on a Saturday I just dont get that who probably stumbled over from the Hilton  Towers next door The menu was really hard to figure out I mean really confusing Hard to describe without actually seeing it and then having it explained for 10 minutes Supposedly everything was small plate and there was supposed to be some sort of progression we were told three stages but nothing on the menu would suggest that but then you had meats at 34 different parts of the menu and generally the price range on these small plates was massive ranging from  6 to  50 We got it but it took too long It also led to other problems The service was very mixed Oddly the restaurant had very few bus boys so it was our server who was always filling our waters More importantly we had dirty plates and silverware this is small plate tapas with lots of different flavorssauces coming at us sitting in front of us with no one coming by for more than 1015 minutes At one point I insisted on a clean plate and the helper we found brought just one for me and not the others at the table Re the menurelated issues we ordered WAY too much because our server pushed more and more food Not having any sense from the menu of sizing we ordered a ton and somewhat predictably walked out too stuffed She seemed to be going by a script that we had to order a certain amount of food at each stage and was a bit aggressive about it Most aggravating she kept pushing that we order the 45 8 oz wagyu beef dish or the 48 lamb chops four small chops which by the way were listed up near the small starters and not near the mains at the bottom  If she tried to upsell it once but it was more than once and as our wives noted it was all too pushyFor a bunch of reasons dont eat here

Author: Frank M.
Content: Holy crap is this place amazing Â The waiter recommended the lamb chops and it came with these two great sauces on the side The chops were so good I didnt even want to use the sauce but then I felt bad because the sauce was so good So we ordered another round of chops Unbelievable The lamb chops are expensive 48 for 4 but so damn worth it Everything else we had was great with the exception of the paella which the rice seemed a bit overcooked Â Scallops were amazing They even brought a few items out for free which was a nice thing Very expensive place but worth every penny Mmmmmmmmmmmmm

Author: Henry C.
Content: We were excited after reading stellar reviews about this Iron Chef owned restaurant We had selected this restaurant since it claims to be the only Catalan tapas restaurant in the cityMercat a la Planxa does not serve what the other Tapas restaurant in the city have  in fact we were very impressed with the flavor and presentation of each and every one of them 4 stars for the food However we were utterly unimpressed with the service I can understand a laid back style to service or I can understand if the server is busy with a full dining room However when neither is the case and when you are paying a relatively higher premium for the food the expectation is elevatedAs a result I will not be returninig soon

Author: Luci L.
Content: Unusual tasty food I didnt have my socks blown off by the sheer awesomeness of the food but they were adventurous in flavor combinations and the quality was very good Unpretentious service fun and hip atmosphere We had baconwrapped dates yummy warm green bean salad yummy goat cheese with garlic sauce yummy yummy and a sausage pizza thingy not so yummy The dessert chocolate croquettes with banana infused marshmallow was the reason we came in the first place and it was tasty and different bordering on delicious but stopped right on the edge of yummy Come with middling expectations and your tastebuds will be very happy indeed

Author: Nora N.
Content: One of my favorite restaurants in Chicago Â Great food service and ambiance Â Highly recommend it to those visiting Chicago

Author: John W.
Content: I dont know if I just had to high of expectations or what but this was just a very trendy place with trendy food that wasnt anything specialIts possible that I didnt order correctly but I wasnt blown away by anythingWe didnt want to eat much before going out so we just ordered a few small plates to splitservice was outstanding though

Author: Joe L.
Content: Im a big fan of Iron Chef America and Jose Garces so I decided to check this place out Very impressed Besides being a little on the pricey end you get what you pay for It is one of the best Spanish restaurants in the city I recommend the braised short rib flatbread and the spinach was awesome too I would definitely go back

Author: Piyush K.
Content: I was really impressed by the place We came in early around 6 As its tapas the portions are very small But the food is pretty carefully prepared and is very flavorful Spicy potatoes is highly recommended

Author: Analicia E.
Content: Good food and fancy went there for my birthday It was a special since I went right after chef Garces won the next Iron chef competiton

Author: david l.
Content: Super Amazing flavors and variety at dinner Liked it so much that we went back for brunch the next morning Â Didnt disappoint with a cheese board and carving station to boot

Author: Sian C.
Content: Best Spanish tapas Ive ever had Â The view is lovely too at night Â Very romantic

Author: josie w.
Content: Drinks are stiffgreat pregame place This place Is better than Xocalo But wish they had carne asadaDont stay too late tho becuz the crowd gets like most places  closing time

Author: Laura N.
Content: The best meal of my life Â I recommend the chefs tasting and ask the waiter for a wine pairing recommendation You cant go wrong

Author: Paul T.
Content: Came here with some of my wifes clients for a night out Â Atmosphere is a nice blend between restaurant and lounge and with the tapas menu we were comfortable sipping and eating casually for over 3 hours Â A unique space for making a night of it without stuffing yourself with too much rushed food

Author: R F.
Content: Great location on Michigan Aveneu and beautiful decor Â We were a medium sized group 6 people and they were very accommodating Â Service was very good providing interesting suggestions Â The food was very good much of it excellent Â There was a type of after dinner port that was incredible with a silky texture and tased of figs

Author: Stu S.
Content: The food and ambiance here were amazing

Author: Michael S.
Content: Every plate we had and we had many was great Â Favorites were the short rib flatbread the prawns and the braised rabbit agnolotti Â They offer a flight of all 3 sangria varietals as well which is nice if youre having trouble making up your mind

Author: Eva J.
Content: I am really not sure what to think about this place You know when you are perfectly balancing on the fence and not sure which side to swing toI thought my husband described it very well Perfectly impersonalThe room is absolutely stunning From the dramatically oversized windows to the open kitchen and the honeycomb staircase Quite impressiveOur server was very nice and knowledgeable She explained the menu very well and answered our questions But there was no personal touch no connection You can tell the company knows how to run a restaurant the staff was well trained things were done right but it felt a little mechanicalFood was a Â hit or miss Some things were delicious My favorite was the American Wagu skirt stake Perfectly seasoned And unfortunately overcooked We didnt get a chance to tell anyone about it  Â a manager walked by but didnt stop and our server came by the table to bring our wine but didnt check on our food And by the time I could open my mouth which doesnt take that long believe me she had disappeared Even so the steak was very tender and delicious The rabbit ravioli was super yummy too The portions are small so just get a few extra items And seriously what brainiac came up with a name that nobody can pronounce or remember So you see what I mean Im still on that fence

Author: Leah A.
Content: a few friends of mine work at this sprawling and awesome south loop hotel restoand every time i go they spoil me and i love it Â the portions for small plates are great Â and the food and cocktails are absolutely stellar Â not to be missed Â the sangria especially if they have the one with pomegranate the short ribscallop combo the russian roulette peppers and the melon soup with ricotta sorbet Â and the piece de resistancethe rabbit agnolotti which is definitely in the top 5 dishes i have had the pleasure of eating try iti dont think it will disappoint Â  ask to be seated in the lower part of the room you get a great view of the park and you can still see the open kitchen

Author: jane r.
Content: Mercat is a terrific place Â Wonderful fresh food great tasting nice place to bring friends Â Consistently good at dinner Â Once had a lunch that was not quite up to their great Â quality which was disappointing as I brought an out of town friend there I shared this on my next lunch there The staff was very concerned and made sure that this experience was not repeated Â One other negative is the music Â We brought a group there to enjoy the foodwhich we didbut the music was pounding and way too loudwe could neither hear each other nor the waitressWe loved the cheeses breads scallops mushrooms etcand the presentation which is very pretty Â All in all if the music problems are addressed this place will be perfect

Author: C M P.
Content: Great place for a group The upstairs Bartenders were great friendly and informative as we waited for our group to assemble Youve got to try the bacon wrapped dates we had seconds I had the the avocado margarita and loved it Many different tapas to chose I say have at it and have fun discovering different tastes It is pricey though Upstairs is where to eat

Author: Jenn K.
Content: I would give Mercat a la Planxa five stars for food  decor and three stars for service  so I compromised on an overall fourThe food is amazing Â Every plate was delicious and worth every penny its pricey Â The portions arent huge which we love for tapas Â We were able to try lots of things without getting full Â The drinks were great although on the expensive sideIt also has a modern unique and bright aesthetic Â Lots of mirrors and colors Â We really enjoyed itIm going to quote two other reviews in saying the staff was too cool for school and amateur Â The hostesses were downright rude Â Our server  who seemed inexperienced but was also nice friendly and funny  put in our order wrong and we were served in odd courses with our intended appetizer coming after dessert Â We sent it back and they did not charge us for it to their creditDespite the flaws in the service the food and overall experience were so great we have recommended this restaurant to friends and plan to return ourselves

Author: Michael S.
Content: One of the better tapas places in the city though pricey Drinks are tasty and interesting had something involving avocados that actually worked impressive stuff food is greatnice mix of classic tapas and things i had never seen before and the second floor dining area is outstandingworth stopping in for a drink just to see that

Author: Kalli S.
Content: oooh do the tasting yum yum yummy i had a really great experience here all three times i have been good service inventive food and great drinksi think the best route is the tasting because you get sort of a greatest hits of their tasty food cool atmosphere too

Author: Ashish G.
Content: I really like their take on tapas Â Although I love Cafe babareba this was a nice change of pace Â The portions are pretty small and dishes are pricey so it is probably better suited for a special occasion rather than casual everyday dining Â My only qualm would be the service Â Our waiter was not very attentive nor friendly Â We described our likes but yet he was unable to formulate any recommendations

Author: Kathryn G.
Content: My husband and I ate here last year for Valentines day and had a fantastic experience Â I had seen it on Check Please Â It is beautiful and the food and drinks were fantastic Â This is not a cheap place but for a romantic date night it was wonderful

Author: Jennifer F.
Content: Absolutely phenomenal Â We came with a party of six and ordered the chefs menu Â Everything was outstanding Â The kitchen was willing to accommodate a couple special requests Â There were two items on the menu we wanted to be sure we didnt missSpendy yes but well worth it Â Great atmosphere Â You might not be able to tell from the lobby and bar but the dining room which is upstairs is a lot of fun Â Excellent attentive service Â Outstanding food Â Definitely check it out for a special occasion and make reservations a couple weeks out

Author: Kurt N.
Content: Everything from the appetizers to the flatbread was delicious but the suckling pig stole the show Â Im not a big fan of brain but every other part of the pig was simple seasoned with nothing more than some salt and drizzled with oil and packed with flavor including the cheeks Â The restaurant reminded me of NYC Â As you walk in there is a small bar and a humble entrance but then you walk up the stairs to be seated and the actual restaurant is one giant room where the ceiling never comes into view surrounding you with a lively atmosphere Â Definitely a good change of pace from the typical chicagostyle restaurants around town Â I would go there again

Author: Ryan B.
Content: A fantastic environment and delightful cuisine Â Mercat is located inside the Blackstone Hotel  a terrific revival Â Ive have only enjoyed lunch at Mercat but will be back for dinner soon Â The pre fixe menu perfectly compliments all taste buds from savory to sweet

Author: Tony P.
Content: We went here with 4 other friends based on reviews from Yelp and other friends Pros Location on Michigan Ave outdoor seating nice upbeat ambience The food was good  some dishes better than others Try the mango sorbet  it has a spicy kick that Ive never tasted before Cons overpriced The portions are small and the prices are inflated  even for a tapas place Service was okay  theyre busy and the waiters seem to have their attention diverted And we were constantly rushed The waiter even took my bill before I had placed my credit card inside the holder Talk about hints Overall The place was meh Ive experienced better Worth trying but not going back

Author: Anne K.
Content: The food was really good I like the bacon wrapped dates and the potatoes with paprika

Author: Philip C.
Content: You pay for the location and the name of the chef not the food The food was just ok We got four or five tapas and a ribeye It just wasnt all that great I wouldnt eat here again Atmosphere is great service is ok but the food is lackingThere are better options only a few steps away

Author: Brooke A.
Content: yummy I liked the food every portion seemed just enough Its a higher price point for tapas and nothing really knocked me off my feet I liked the decor and the service was ok but nothing to write home about which is why i gave them 4 stars rather than 5

Author: Keith O.
Content: Went here for restaurant week so we were able to sample 3 courses for 22 Â At that price it was a real steal Â The food was good portions were big for a tapas restaurant but the were not huge Â We also had the white sangria which was perfect for lunch

Author: Glenn M.
Content: Great food great serviceexcellent wine selection

Author: Grace L.
Content: I hated this place My bf and I meant our friends here for brunch since they made reservations here At first walking in it was dead downstairs walked up the spiralgrand staircase and wad greeted by a hostess and sat at our table The restaurant seemed to share the bathroom with starbucks and the hotel attached to it Then our waiter was an older gentleman and he was a bit rude not sure if he was having a bad morning but he wasnt very attentive Also the food was way over salted I kept drinking my water by the time we were done eating I was so bloated with water weight I felt sick

Author: Reg W.
Content: overrated Â In fairness this review is for the dinner portion and I have not tried the brunch at this place yet Â The food was not memorable at all

Author: Trevor S.
Content: Delicious food Beautiful dining room Great service This is a special restaurant that really does the whole small plate thing really well Â Attention to detail and flavor are in every bite and after several visits here I have yet to find anything not up to par Â I am not a seafood eater and the Chef always takes that into accomodation when creating my experience Â We go every year to celebrate our anniversary and enjoy a wonderful Cava and really celebrate a great meal Â This is a very authentic Catalan restaurant in a city that doesnt have many options in that genre

Author: Pecorino P.
Content: Planned a surprise party for my hubby  10 friends on a Friday night Â Everything was flawless Â Food was delicious service was attentive but Â not overbearing or nosey Â We cleaned up all the tapas  share plates  drank every last drop of sangria Â Deeeelish Â The atmosphere was perfect  lively Â So happy to have been recommended Mercat Â Thanks for a wonderful surprise birthday Â Looking forward to returning to enjoy brunch

Author: Boston L.
Content: Everything we had was absolutely amazing Service was excellent as well

Author: Narmina G.
Content: Love this place Â Really a pleasant jazzy environment Â Really enjoyed the many tasty sangria options Â Imagine the food is so good Ive eaten there 3 times in 4 weeks tapas here are insane

Author: Gina N.
Content: Best mojito ever and excellent service but the food was only okay There was nothing that blew me away for the price we were paying

Author: Raquel S.
Content: Great food with a lounge atmosphere in the heart of Chicago

Author: faline m.
Content: The food is def 5 stars unbelievably yummy4 stars though because of the noise level really too loud also why do they make it so hard to find the entrance

Author: Terris A.
Content: We went there for their brunch and were pleasantly surprised for the price we paid the quality of service and food Â Sometimes you go to places that are typical tourist spots you get bad service and sub par food Â Not here Â Make your own bloody mary bar awesome Â Every dish that cameyum Â The attendant at the cheese and meat bar hilarious and really made our morning

Author: Mark L.
Content: The food at this establishment was simply fantastic A little more pricey than some of the other Chicago tapa staples but more upscale and certiantly on par with the food

Author: Tia W.
Content: Recently dined here for a business lunch and was really impressed I will say that if you are new to tapas this may not be enjoyable or if you are a vegetarian I ordered the Hangar Steak Sandwich and it was seasoned and cooked to perfection I will definitely return to try the drink menu Service was great as well

Author: Katie K.
Content: First the positives ambiance great although a bit noisy  dont bring a job interview here food outstanding Â Wide range of choices and interesting specials Â Quite pricey even for downtown tapas but we kind of expected that Â The big negative was the service Â Our waiter did not seem inexperienced but he took the order without writing it down which always causes some worry and then surprise some of our items failed to show up Â Since we had some very specific preferences in the group and had ordered accordingly this was a problem Â Since we live in the suburbs and are wedded to the train schedules this was a bigger problem Â We waited an extra hour and took a later train in order to finally get my meatless meal and the food was great but we wont be returning here

Author: Kirsten H.
Content: Decided to do the tasting menu Some great dishes although my one complaint was that a lot of bread was served with the dishes Go easy on the bread otherwise you wont have room for all the good stuff

Author: Garth G.
Content: The food was absolutely amazing Â Tried this place twice while staying at the Chicago Hilton and it was amazing Â How you get Octopus that tender while grilling is unknown Â The portions are not huge but the food is excellent and the service good

Author: Tiff J.
Content: I had my first visit at Mercat this past saturday We made reservations for 8pm we arrived ten minutes early and were told to wait at the bar until our table was ready no biggie because we were ahead of schedule We waited until about 810 and checked on our table Still not ready and the hostess told us there was one table ahead of us A table ahead of us Were not on the wait list We have reservations which means there should be no one ahead of us since our reso was for 8pm and its 810 Clearly they were behind on wait times but she didnt seem too apologetic which was even more annoying So back to the bar we went I had some kiwi cocktail which was very refreshing We sat at the bar until 840 when someone finally came to get us On a positive note our server wish I remembered his name was pretty awesome He knew the menu inside out and was efficient We had a pitcher of sangria which was delicious and ordered 6 small plates cheese mixto plate jamon serrano garlic shrimp scallops bacon wrapped lamb and short ribs on flat bread Each dish was amazingwith the exception of the scallops they fell a little flat but still edible For dessert we had chocolate and marshmallows Sweet and just the right portion little flavorful bites Overall the food was pretty good but Mercat might want to have a talking to their hosts If youre behind on times communicate that Dont make the guest feel as if its their problem Maybe check on the guests a few times to reassure them youre working on their table Apologize The point of making a reservation is not to wait 10 minutes okay 40 minutes is ridiculous Mercat would definitely earn another star had this not been an issue

Author: Samantha R.
Content: Came here one hot summer night for an anniversary dinner We got some fantastic sangrialove that they offer several unique kinds The small plates are super small and pretty pricey but we really enjoyed what we ordered The dessert was out of this world housemade lemon cheesecake with blueberry ice cream Service was friendly and attentive and the restaurant has great ambiance

Author: B B.
Content: First the four stars didnt quite get five due to price The food is outstanding but the prices are quite high Â I am visiting from out of town and have been to Mercat twice in four days I might go again tomorrow before I leave if for nothing else than to have the mushrooms and red sangria I dont know if I have ever had a mushroom dish that tasted so heavenly Â I tried the flight of sangria to see what they each tasted like I prefer notsweet so the red was the winner for me There were SAGE leaves in it OMG who would have thought that would be such a perfect flavor Â The eggplant was also great Â The second night I took two friends and we had a LOT of different dishes I think the mushrooms were again my favorite but the bacon wrapped dates with almond were incredible Â We shared a pitcher of red sangria and that was plenty for three of us Friends said the scallops were wonderful and we all thought the rabbit was good We tried different cheeses octopus and several other dishes The patatas bravas were very tasty but this dish was one where I really felt like the fancy presentation was what we paid for Great food and beautiful presentation but the flavor should carry the dish and it felt almost pretentious for the small amount on the plate no matter how beautiful it looked If finances are not a problem this is a terrific place to enjoy many different flavors Every single bite of food was wonderful

Author: Louis L.
Content: I hosted a corporate dinner here last week and it was perfect The food was excellent and the staff made sure they did everything they could to make sure that we were taken care of We had a private bar and the bartender always made sure everyones glass had something in it The food was quick to the table and tasted as amazing as it looked Its a little hard to spot when your going down the street maybe they should look at getting better signage out front but thats my only issue Great place You should go

Author: Kappa Y.
Content: Very good although perhaps a little pricey if you walk in thinking tapas Â The restaurant space is well done although if enter through the hotel it feels as if you are using a Â staff entrance Â There is definitely a little excess in staff activity however everyone was pleasant and prompt and attentive to my wifes food allergies Â We tried the tasting menu which probably contributed to the cost however seemed the best way to really get a feel for what they were serving Â Some of the most memorable things the salad w bacon and prosciutto salty but good the lamb tunaand spicy shrimp Â Sitting here writing this is exciting me to go back so I guess get on over there and try it

Author: Jennifer S.
Content: The food and service was superb Â Our server helped us with my wine selection and she was spot on Â All the dishes were wonderful and I cant wait to go back Â We didnt get the table we had wanted but that was the only flaw in evening Â I highly recommend this restaurant

Author: Joe I.
Content: Fine dining tapas experience I recommend trying the duck out of this world Cool atmosphere not too stuffy Excellent service

Author: Lizzie R.
Content: Mercat is a Super fun place to go with a large group Â Fabulous dining room Â They have a great set menu for a party of ten or more and its well worth it Â The food is really good Â If you havent been I highly recommend it Â Great for birthday parties

Author: Christopher B.
Content: Really quite good innovative tapas Â Great mix of quality traditional fare with fresh takes on old standards Â Highly recommended  especially if like me youre tired of most of the Chicago tapas fare which is soso at bestAs far as comments on service Im baffled Â Maybe its because they wore black put some folks off Â Our waiter was attentive and professional and made some genuinely good suggestions Â no posing at all Â I was also sensitive to this from other comments and every table nearby seemed to be having friendly helpful service  back waiters not bad either Â  I was also impressed that they seated us promptly at 900 on a Saturday eveningWe had basic Jamon Serrano Chorizo both classics and well done with the baconwrapped dates very good Â The Barramundi was superb and the pork belly sublime Â The shellfish Croquettes were also a nice alternative to typically denser and heavier croquettes Â I also highly recommend the Catalan spinach which I wouldnt normally have ordered if not for the recommendation of the waiter  a nice surprise Â The Butifarra homemade sausage was deftly seasoned  piquant without being overpowering To top it off the chocolate Croquette dessert was really amazingI also have to give Mercat credit for a substantive and moderately priced wine list offering many options by the glass half carafe and larger all at very reasonable prices Â The halfcarafe option also lets you mix things up a bit and try various winesHighly recommended42909  Changed my vote to 5 stars after seeing Arco De Cuchilleros averaged to 4 stars rating Â in NO WAY should diners confuse the quality of the two

Author: Chris L.
Content: This place is a gem Â  Â  Great Sangria and the weekend brunch is really Â good Â  On a nice day the outdoor seating is wnderful

Author: Jen K.
Content: Three friends and I stopped by Mercat for dinner We started at the bar and asked the bartender for her favorite spicy red wine It was very good and went well with all the food we ended up getting When it came time to eat everything looked so good we couldnt decide so we had the waitress bring all of her favorites Everything we had was delicious especially the bacon wrapped dates and chocolate dessert Our first order of food was delivered to the wrong table some of the servers seemed to be distracted by the presence of a former baseball player but the waitress made up for it by buying us a round of drinks

Author: Ed W.
Content: The location caught our attention very close to the Chicago Auditorium and the venue sealed the deal Spanish tapas is a treat when it is done right  and this is done right  for the most part The gambas al ajillo  garlic shrimp was excellent Sauce was bubbling on delivery and plenty of it soak up with the excellent bread that was served ask for More bread  they accommodated us The wine selection is good  but expect to pay over 60bottle for something other than cheap red wine but maybe that is the wine snob in me talking The beef short rib flatbread was disappointing in that it tasted like ordinary BBQ sauce  we were expecting something unusual The shaved cauliflower salad was excellent  as were the bacon wrapped dates The cheese was good  but they brought us the wrong selection  we were trying to figure out how the walnuts turned to jelly  until wee realized we had jelly  no walnuts We sat in the upper section which miffed us at first  no view  but the noise was less and we could talk easily Â We made our show  but were hungary later that night  such is the nature of tapas Â Ill go back for drinks at the bar to get the full atmosphere

Author: Natasha M.
Content: 5 Star for food and decor 1 star taken for quantityA restaurant for small stomach with a big wallet This is probably the most RIDICULOUS restaurants Hungry Chicago has ever been to out of the 90 restaurants in Chicago in terms of quantity of food and price proportion A tilapia that is smaller than half of your palm is 17 Five thin slices of duck is size of your thumbslice is 16 All the dishes are ridiculously small We have been there twice and every time we saw peoples eyes popping out when they saw the dishes One couple sitting next to us actually ordered 3 dishes and only finished half of their think sliced steak plate which is priced 48 We peaked at their bill and its about 161 SO I am sure there are people appreciating the concept of Â fine dining in the Mercat way Of course here is not the place to get full Its just for an experience or small eatsIf you want to impress your date with your wallet here is the place to go The atmosphere is unbelievably amazing very modern luxurious classy and sexy

Author: Alan K.
Content: The atmosphere is upbeat and restaurant is well designed Â The main dining area is two stories tall and overlooks Grant Park through giant windows Â Although its is part of the recently restored Blackstone Hotel it is built out in a modern and simplistic fashion and has an open kitchen as well Â Service was great for the most part Â Our waiter was just ok I had to ask about the specials and he took an eternity to bring the desert menus and our check Â That being said the food came out promptly dishes were warm when they were supposed to be and not all at one time which can be a problem with tapas Â The menu is not as expansive as some other tapas restaurants but they more than made up for it with the high quality ingredients and unique dishes Â Tip try the Serrano Ham and Fig Salad

Author: Casey M.
Content: The food was very Iron Chef Not my style I am a meat and potatoes girlbut it was yummy Lots of garlic and I love garlic My tummy was happybut my mental need for comfort food was not Hubbie doesnt eat seafoodduckor lambso our choices were slimbut what we ordered was good

Author: YULIA M.
Content: Great place The entrance was underwhelming but upstairs is breathtaking huge hall beautifully designed The menu is very well thought through all items on the plate really compliment each other Almond gazpacho is incredible as well as pork belly pulpo con patatas and olive oil cake with wild blueberries The wine is really overpriced although the selection is decent I would bring my own the next time

Author: Scott C.
Content: To those who complain about small portions That is what Tapas is Very tasty stuff we were there for Sunday lunch so they had the brunch menu a smaller but heavily discounted menu I agree with previous reviewers the bacon wrapped dates are a very interesting dish We also had the Spanish meat and cheese station yummo very very tasty goats cheese partnered wonderfully with Spanish Cabernet

Author: Chirag P.
Content: Amazing

Author: Andy V.
Content: I thought Mercat a la Planxa was good at best Although the food was delicious I thought the service and management need severe help Â We arrived early for a 730 reservation and were told they could seat us earlier By the time we were shown to our table it was 750 We wouldnt have cared if the bartender wasnt horrible The bald asian bartender needs some serious help Not only was he rude he poured the weakest 75 ounce of tequilla 13 I have ever had Even the young hostess was Â pathetic At one point another party complianed to her about the bartender and she just rolled her eyes At our table we had a pleasant waitress who really didnt provide assistance with the menu However Â the food quality was great We are large foodies and ordered a wide assortment of the plates which were all delicious Â We did have a manager come to our table to check on how things were going but she showed up 2 minutes after we sat down The waitress never checked on us until all of our plates were finished Overall I dont think we will rush back I really liked the food but did not like the whole experience For our party of four we spent 250 and I would have appreciated a better experience Even on our way out another manager asked about our night When we explained our issues he rolled his eyes they must teach that and walked away There are better restaurants in Chicago I am really surprised by the number of positive reviews They must not eat out often

Author: Lilian R.
Content: Best tapas I have ever had in the us

Author: Maggie C.
Content: Marcat was an amazing food experience Â Everyone suggested the serrano ham and fig salad I was hesitant to give it a shot but it was SO worth it Â Yum Â The Patatas Bravas were what we expected but the Paella Negra Shortrib Flatbread and Dates exceeded our expectations Â I will definitely go back

Author: alex c.
Content: I wish they would not take reservations within a half hour to their kitchen closing We arrived for our 930pm reservation The host did not look at us at all Not once Somehow he managed to keep looking at his monitor while he felt our presence in front of him We told him we had a reservation and gave him our name Then  while still having not lifted his head to look at us  looked over at the girl who showed up next to him and instructed her to sit us We sat at our table for a good 15 minutes at least The place was nowhere near packed and there were a handful of servers just kinda standing around looking around Turned out that none of them was our serverOur server finally arrived and we ordered drinks and food  Mixto Chefs Selectio of 3 Cheeses  16  Datiles Con Almendras BaconWrapped Dates Stuffed with Almonds  7  Verdosa Mixed Baby Greens with Green Asparagus Avocado Confit Cherry Tomatoes and Shaved Mahon Cheese  12 When the dates came out it was two sticks each one with two baconwrapped dates Definitely not worth the 7 Then another server came and put the cheese down on the table then quickly walked away Thats out it was with all our dishes We werent even informed what the cheeses were The Verdosa was probably the best dish but still nothing to write home about All the while we were watching as servers came around and cleared the tables of their dinnerware and set out what looked like glasses and plates for breakfast Even another diner a couple of tables away from us we could tell was having a terrible experience He came in after us and left before us When his server came to pick up the bill he looked around to see if the diner was still around somewhere then shook his head Looked like he got not tip

Author: Robin D.
Content: Theres a reason why this place is always packed and its because the food is really good Â  Ive been to Barcelona and have tried different catalonian dishes and this to me is the closest you will ever get without flying to Spain Â We ordered the followingBraised Rabbit  SuperbGarlic Shrimp  GoodMixed Ham  The kids will love thisScallop and Shrimp meatballs  nothing special we should have ordered another seafood dish like the halibut or the alaskan salmonChorizo on sticks  it was ok too salty for my tasteBut the best dish was the Paella Valenciana ive never had paella that was as good other than the one in Madrid Â It says serves 4 but if ur ordering other stuff we found that this is more than enough Â There was 6 of us and we had to take home some of it Â Also theres a 45 min wait for this dish Â The prices are on the higher side compared to Cafe Iberico but the quality Â speaks for itself Â I would go back to this restaurant just to have the Paella and to try other stuffThe only thing that I disliked about this place is our server dunno his name but he wears glasses and acts like the stereotypical gay guy with diva attitude Â Restaurants need to tell their servers that regardless of how upscale a restaurant is servers need to serve their customers and that includes you Priscilla Â If we werent a big group where tip was added onto the bill I would have left a penny for this guy

Author: Esther A.
Content: I had the best dinner in Chicago here Â We got the chefs tasting menu and I dont exactly recall what the dishes were there were 9 but every dish was exactly what I wanted Â We were there for 3 hours not because we had to wait but because we were having such a good time Â I remember leaving the place warm and happy Next time I go I want to get the whole suckling pig Â Those who may be interested let me know

Author: Natalie C.
Content: Outrageously yummy Â Go for the tasting menu

Author: Larry K.
Content: This place was great I went with my wife and had a wonderful meal I consider myself somewhat of a foodie but never actually tried a tasting menu We had it here and it was AMAZING There was so much food that I couldnt even enjoy the amazing steak that came last We must have had 15 different items and they were delicious The place is not cheap but the food and the ambiance were great I would definitely go again

Author: Stacey B.
Content: The food is so good it almost kills me not to givve them a higher rating but the service was really pretty bad Â No other way to say itMercat  get your staff in line otherwise your amazing food is destined to never be tasted

Author: Amb S.
Content: My boyfriend and I came here on a whim a couple of weeks ago  what a great experience Â Delicious and seemingly healthy food exotic and trendy atmospherefun Try Garlic Shrimp and Yellow Fin Tuna Â They were seriously good

Author: Nezar Z.
Content: The food was amazing went for lunch with my wife and ordered 2 appetizers and 3 entrees Â  I didnt expect to eat everything but was really interested in trying several menu items Â I must say that i was really disappointed with the portions that were given Â I dont mind paying a lot of money for a great meal but when you order a scallop entree and get 2 scallops at 17 its a bit pricey

Author: John K.
Content: what can i say i live 3 block from this place and go often food is great prices are good and the sangria is greatI really like the deserts but if u go u have to get the croquettes both ham and chocolate Youll see what i mean when u get there1

Author: Ian S.
Content: It was ok Be warned its really more of a 4  than a three Yes there are some tapas that are in the ten dollars range but my server advised me against most of them He was great and gave me a yummy red to drink Most of the meat tapas ranged from 2535 dollars a piece you could eat at least 3 so with a wine prepare to spend about 100 per person Some tapas ranged as high as 75 Nothing was bad per se but with a 55 dollar bill I had nothing that wowed me Basically ok but Ive eaten at better for less Gourmet for the sake of it rather than the quality

Author: Samantha B.
Content: Mediocre experienceI booked the restaurant for my boyfriends birthday dinner I left a message on Open table and called a few hours before requesting a special table Instead they sat us literally on top of an older couple who had to yell at each other to hear What should have been an intimate experience was awkwardThe portions were incredibly small Im a tiny girl but I left still hungry after ordering 4 plates for my boyfriend and me While every bite of food was delicious they were exactly that bites If I pay 20 for a dish it shouldnt be three bites worthThe drinks were excellent so no complaint thereThe service was terrible The first three dishes came fast almost too close together However then we had to wait 30 minutes or longer for the last dish When we asked the waiter if it was still coming he responded It will come when it comesIf youre looking for a fun upscale experience skip the high prices of Mercat and go to Nacionale 27 insteadA year later and the management never followed up on my poor review and experience I expect a restaurant that charges upward of 80person to followup on a disappointing experience This restaurant does not care about you so why give them your business

Author: Joe E.
Content: Ever since Jose Garces became an Iron Chef I have been wanting to try his restaurant Â Mercat a la Planxa is a Spanishstyle tapas restaurant with their speciality involving the a la planxa pronounced a la plancha cooking style Â This simple preparation is done on almost every type of seafood or meat imaginable Â After arriving at the restaurant the decor was amazing Â A huge open air kitchen exposes the entire dining room to the food preparation scene Â Overall I thought the food was very complex with huge variety of flavors that complimented each other Â The dishes are small and the prices quite high but what can you expect for an iron chefs restaurant Â Definitely come with a group so you can try a huge variety of his dishes Â While I was writing this review I kept flipflopping between a 4 and a 45mile rating Â I decided on the 4mile rating mainly because of the overall service Â I felt as if the waiter kept trying to make us order more and more sometimes suggesting we double our order of a dish and then insisting after we would decided not to Â Also for eating at the restaurant for a couple hours and watching tables come and go I still felt as if we were somehow being rushed Â Hopefully others didnt experience the same

Author: Joan M.
Content: Arrived in early afternoon to wait out a delayed flight leaving ORD Â What a delightful surprise Â Food was amazing delicious beautifully presented interesting combinations that complemented each other Â Service was fabulous of course it wasnt too crowded when we were there but they did everything perfectly Â Highly recommend it Â Well be back

Author: Adam S.
Content: Mercat is phenomenal To die for really but not really because in reality if someone told me Id have to die in order to eat at a place I probably wouldnt go there Thats just bad for businessBut This restaurant is incredible It opened back in March 08 Ive been there twice and I havent had a bador even mediocreplate yet Its my favorite place in Chicago to go The menu is tapas and small bites done so so well The chef does a great job of pairing a variety of flavors and textures which makes everything really enjoyable Some items Id suggest bacon wrapped dates baby squid and angel hair pasta shellfish croquettes beef shortrib flatbread jamon serrano any of the cheese plates the catalan sausageahh everything is DELICIOUSGreat atmosphere too the space is really open and contemporary Lots of activity depending on the night you goand the wait staff is on top of things Really attentive and friendlyI would definitely go back and you should go too

Author: Countess B.
Content: So much better than any tapas restaurant in Chicago Â Excellent ambiance the Sangria rocked I used to make my own in the 60s70s and the menu is full of perfect little creations to fill you upWent here 3 nights in a row but during the week stayed at the Hilton nextdoor  went to Bluesfest09 Â Saw this place packed on the weekend so stayed away Definitely go during the week Â You will probably see some celebrities here Â Sit at the little bar if you go aloneAll the waitstaff are friendly  fun  goodlooking too

Author: David A.
Content: WoW i recommend the Chefs tasting for 55 or 75 with wine pairing great service but the show all belongs to the FOOD

Author: David C.
Content: My two trips here  one a business dinner for ten the other an evening for two  both resulted in great meals Â Over these two visits I tried many of the dishes on the menu and each was quite good Â The service was spotty and the bar less than fully stocked however

Author: Bill Z.
Content: I hardly get out of Lincoln Park but I do go here for lunch often Some folks love the look of the room I wonder why they have curtains on the big windows looking out to the park On Michigan Ave theres seating  but bus fumes are not my idea of an entree Im a lunch fiend and get the same thing Chefs 2 meat misto 3 if you go for dinner and the serrano and fig salad with blue cheese Wow Two glasses of Cava the Prosecco of Spain The place has a frequent dining card and you can quickly rack up credits to pay the bill Chef also does group tours of the GreenCityMarket on certain days and then cooks what was bought for the group afterward There is a nifty downstairs bar with sofa seats and tables but not available for lunch

Author: Lauren B.
Content: Mercat how did you do it I went for a simple summer lunch happy just to sit outside and sip some sangria and instead had one of the best meals ever From the surprise of the cheese plate apple slices and dulce de leche really contrast with the creaminess of the cheese the divine baramundi with tiny but luscious smoked pine nuts and celery root puree to the housemade sausage I dont even usually like sausage but these were sublime  so delicious The herbinfused sangria belongs on the same celestial plane as the food  superb and then some

Author: Stratton C.
Content: Great for a special occasion Just be prepared to spend  Overall the food was excellent Each dish was prepared and presented exquisitely and carried some unique twist that marked a departure from similar dishes had elsewhere A couple of the ten or twelve dishes we shared we just soso The rest were each stellar and very unique The scallops should probably be avoided IMO I found them rubbery and bland Â Highlights Service Food Presentation Atmosphere  In that order all four fantasticLow light Portions are TINY even for tapas I mean this in all sincerity if you are hungry eat before you go or be prepared to spend heartily to match your appetite Extreme Low Light The wine list is fairly boring and overpriced Most of the bottles can be found browsing even a modest Spanish wine section for 15 or so and sell at Mercat in the 50 range If its a special occasion and you dont care about such things then have at it and enjoy the meal Its a shame to let that get in the way of what is otherwise a pretty artful experience I had a hard time getting past it But then Im kind of a cheap ass insert grain of saltI knocked a star off for the wine list and another for the portion size

Author: Sarah J.
Content: This place was great Â It is somewhere to go for dinner when you are looking for an assortment Â Four of us went there for the prix fixe menu Â It was amazing Â We let the chef determine what we would most appreciate Â Two of us selected the wine pairings which were great Â The only drawback experience was that my friend newly pregnant wanted to ensure that all meat was well cooked well done all seafood was kept to a minimum and that all potentially unpasteurized cheese was removed andor not present Â I love my friendI wanted her to be comfortable with our dinner Â The desserts were somewhat disappointing Â Perhaps plan another destination for dessert Â Overall this was a wonderful dining experience

Author: Silvia J.
Content: OK Jose Â Now that you are an Iron Chef the least you could do is invest a little more money into Mercat to hire some more servers Â My family and friends went there for Easter Brunch yesterday Â First of all the menu which they just changed and you could only order from that Easter menu was confusing Â It took at least two times for our server Charles to explain it to us Â He was so stressed and frustrated with us that I actually gave him The Hand as if to say take a breath Â There was no bread too Â We didnt get any until my friend managed to get a hold of a manager to bring us some Â No spoons to stir our coffee as well Â As I have read elsewhere it looked like only two servers on the floor that the bussers and managers ended up serving our dishes Â Also they really pushed the alcohol so if you are not a big drinker or cant have alcohol for some reason it can feel a little pressureNow comeon Â This is ridiculous Â This is a really nice place and could really kick ass if they could up their service Â But first of all you actually need more servers Â Is this a restaurant or a sweat shop you are running Jose

Author: Drews G.
Content: Went there recently with my date and had a great time Â yes it was very expensive but the food was very good Â i would say dont order drinks as they are extremely overpriced and do order the sampler not sure what it was called but they give you about 30 different dishes Â our waiter was unbelievable believe his name was CJ Â the ham they have is out of this world and everyone should get to try it at least once Â i could eat it everyday Â having the chef come out and talk to us about the food was also a great touch

Author: Matt B.
Content: Jose Garces has taken his Philadelphia act to the windy cityJose always does a great job with his sangrias and cocktails including Chicagos own HUM liqueur I strongly recommend the Charcuteria and Queso plates to start similar to his offerings at the Garces Trading company in Philly The chocolatehazelnut and marmalade dipping sauces that the cheese plate comes with are particularly scrumptious Additionally the waitstaff is very knowledgeable about the menu and seems to enjoy their job which makes for a fun atmosphere regardless of the dining occasion

Author: Don A.
Content: Totally loved it got the chefs tasting with wine and was very impressed

Author: Paul R.
Content: Probably more like a 15 Â The food was mixed Â Some things were great the bacon wrapped dates as others have mentioned and some of the cheeses others were not some mushroom thing and the tuna Â I would say that I really enjoyed 1 out of every 3 dishes Â You would think that a good server would have helped us to better navigate the menu but sadly ours did notThe service was horrible Â We were a group of 9 Â 18 gratuity was included and we were treated accordingly Â Our server was unfriendly and unhelpful Â Get the chefs selection at 65 a person was her only real suggestion when asked to recommend food from the menu Â When we declined and started ordering she kept telling us we needed more Â At the end of the meal we had way more than we needed and if we had kept listening to her we would have had 4 or 5 dishes on top of what we had left over Â Ridiculous Â At 70 a person I expected a little more professionalism Â Maybe she wasnt feeling well or something I almost hope that was the caseIn any event I wont be going back Â I bet you COULD have a good or even very good meal here though under the right conditions Â But at this price the stars shouldnt have to align to get a great meal

Author: Debra F.
Content: Going to keep this short and sweet We decided on the tasting menu because we couldnt make up our mind with what to choose andOHMY GOD Best meal of my entire life Bacon wrapped dates croquettes and everything else on the menu was phenominal Would recommend this place in a heart beat Wish they would open this in NYC

Author: Gina C.
Content: BEST BRUNCHIve been to Mercat maybe 5 times for dinner and its always SO YUMMY We almost always do the Chefs Tasting menu to make it simpler because we are usually a party of 6 to 8 The servers are always attentive and accommodating They know exactly how much to bring out with perfect timing and if there is a special request like someone doesnt eat shellfish they will bring a substitution for that person HINT ask what is new for the season For example last winter we had an amazing tapa made from chestnuts not on the summer menu The servers will then be sure to incorporate any tapas that you specifically want into the tasting menuI dont understand the people who complain about the small portions Um theyre tapas They are supposed to be small and no one is limiting your order Ive brought some friends here with caveman sized appetites and even they came away stuffed after the Chefs Tasting True the restaurant isnt cheap but what good Chicago restaurant is Whatever our final bill we have always thought it totally worth it and so has everyone else I know whos been to Mercat  especially when weve spent just as much at other restaurants very mediocre foodBut I digress  this review is really about BRUNCH Went for brunch last Sunday with a few friends and we all loved it and will definitely be back Its an amazing deal  for 25 you get a choice of four tapas and that includes bottomless mimosas sangria or bloody marys For brunch they have a special section to choose from with eggy selections in addition so to some of their best tapas from the dinner menu Additionally for an extra 6 I think you can go up to the carving station for the suckling pig and charcuterie selection Trips are unlimited so I suggest some creative ordering if you get my drift We started with coffee and our eggy selection with mimosas for course Then had the more savory selections brought out Service was great We never ONCE had to ask for our mimosa glasses to be refilled Our server must have been on autopilot with thatYOU MUST TRY THE ALMONDSTUFFED BACONWRAPPED DATES SITTING ON SLAW  DRIPPING WITH BLEU CHEESE EMULSION Forget the baconwrapped dates you had at any other Spanish restaurant or tapas bar  NO COMPARISON These are little nuggets of heaven

Author: Alison F.
Content: I dont remember the last time I ate food this delicious Â Truly phenomenal Â We were there for a private party and had a room to ourselves with a fixed menu Â We chose the smallest amount of food offered in the fixed menus and still had more than we could eat Â Service and atmosphere were also topnotch Â Price is high but you know that going inBaconwrapped dates Â IncredibleButternut squash dumplings Â So good we asked for morePaella Â My mouth is watering just thinking about it Â Woodfired taste tender chicken tasty riceChocolate croquettes Â The person who thought these up should get a medal Â Really really exquisite Â Chocolate marshmallow gooey full of flavorThanks to all of the people who made our dinner memorable

Author: Lalla E.
Content: I finally went to Mercat last weekI was not disappointed The food was delicious very authentic Spanish tapas The sangria was delicious and the wine list looked promising My boyfriend is vegetarian and our waiter was very good with his suggestions to him he was very professional and friendlyI am giving 4 instead of 5 stars because Its very pricey The plates are very small and not worth the price I would go back there but not very often

Author: Kerri M.
Content: i have been to this restaurant twice the first time i loved it the food was delicious and offered a different take on typical tapas fare the second go around well i wont be going back when my date and i were seated to our table we waited long enough for a server that we were able to pick out all the tapas we wanted when the server did arrive we put in for drinks and i suggested to the server that we would order the cheese to start and then continue to order he said he could take it all at once and they would space out the dishes fine we did just that all of our food came at the same time BEFORE the drinks arrived the food wasnt as good as the first time when the restaurant had only recently opened Â we had the hazelnut and manchengo cheese plate and the hazelnut was delicious but the barbeque octopus that was a stand out before was completely different and fell flatjust drowned in a sauce that was rather flavorlessour third dish was a flatbread so forgetable that i dont even remember what was on itand finally when the server came to bring us our drinks this being the only time we saw him since we ordered we felt as if we were being hustled to make a quick turn aroundi like my dining experience to be at my own pace especially when sharing tapas the whole experience left me unsatisfied and worsehungry

Author: Alice B.
Content: Im sorry to give this restaurant two stars because some of the food was good and the space is nice However the service was seriously horrible Horrible From the hostesses the bartender our servers we had two  one awkwardly passed us on mid meal to another server who had no explanation for the switch Weird Our first server acted annoyed and exasperated when we asked for recommendations and was defensive when we asked questions about the restaurant and how long hed been there juts making small talk dude Our second server could not make eye contact with us The vibe was really really off I went there expecting a total package and a great experience Instead I felt snubbed and rushed over Unprofessional What a waste Im not going back

Author: Kathleen A.
Content: OK I dont know what all the naysayers are complaining about Â We had great unobtrusive service with Doc thats how he introduced himselfperhaps hes the Doctor of Tapas the food was great albeit some items were a tad salty and we had a great timeThe Arroz a la Cazuela was finea little salty though Bacon wrapped figs were fabulous esp the salad at the bottom Â Nice pairingThe mushroom rice was awesomeThe mushroom and potatoes were amazingThe shrimp in garlic was perfectThe flatbreads were pretty goodMy one complaint is that they could have brought the food items out in a better sequence Â We had a vegetarian at our table and they brought out all of the meat items first Â They could have grouped everything with at least one veggie dish coming out along with the meat tapas Â But other than that it was greatYou do need a reservation thoughmy sister in law tried to drop in on three occasions and it was full each time Â And tapas generally arent cheap so expect to spend about 1015 on regular tapas and more on the meats

Author: Frank W.
Content: We had a reservation for noon on Saturday but didnt need it as only a few tables were in use The sangriaoftheday was terrific filled with fruit All four of us opted for the 35 chefs choice tapas If we had been any less gluttonous we could not have finished the dishes I think a couple onions may have been left on one plate Nobody left hungryThe food was spectacular None of us had any complaints except perhaps for our own lack of selfcontrolWe also went with the Chefs Luxury Tasting Menu Flight which included three remarkably tasty glasses of wine I dont recall the price but might call it steep except for the topnotch qualityService was friendly and efficient We had a window table but the rain and fog kept us from enjoying the view of the park in those few moments when we had emptied the plates and lifted our headsWe probably spent a ridiculous amount of money on lunch but Ive spent that much on lunch for two in Paris and left no happierAfter writing this Ill start planning my next visit to Chicago

Author: Joy F.
Content: Excellent inventive intriguing food and wonderful margaritas and Spanish wines Â The waiters are very helpful with explaining and suggesting plates to try Â This is a wonderful place to get together with friends Â The room is funky and the view of the south end of Grant Park very special Â Enjoy Â JOY

Author: Emily M.
Content: Im happy to see this place is finally getting the reviews it deserves Â For a long time it consistently had a 3 star average which annoyed me when I discovered that most of the reviews were based on the fact that it was too expensive Â Perhaps a result of its Grant Park adjacent location Â No idea but this is no 3star restaurant to meIve been for both lunch and dinner and both were fantastic Â I would recommend getting anything from the a la planxa menu Â Ive had the scallops octopus and several of the meat dishes Â Everything was phenomenal and the sauce that came with the scallops and octopus really was great Â I also love the tapasstyle food but its much higherend than a traditional tapas restaurant Â For that reason some people may be surprised by the cost either they may think the portions are small or the cost doesnt fit the portions but people need to keep in mind that this is a NICE restaurant and youre not expected to get one dish per person Â Its much higherend than your typical tapas restaurant so dont expect to pay the same amount of money but the food is better Â Is it authentic Â No idea Â I dont really care as long as its yummyNext up I am going to plan ahead and try the suckling pig

Author: Michael P.
Content: The food is out of this world and the sangria is outstanding

Author: Amber R.
Content: This is my FAVORITE restaurant in the city Â All I can say is that you have to try this place

Author: Terry L.
Content: Cannot wait to go backThis is the best Tapas I have had outside Barcelona and even better than some we had there

Author: Mary F.
Content: I went here with my mother for brunch while in Chicago for a girls weekend Â I was really excited about trying it as I have heard so many great things about it Â I was a little disappointed Â We made 10am reservations right when brunch started as we were hoping to leave town right after Â The night before we has confirmed our reservations and that brunch was served at 10 We arrived at exactly 1000 only to be told that due to some issues in the kitchen brunch would be delayed and we could come back in 30 minutes if wed like Â We were determined to eat here so we asked if they would give us some coffee and let us wait in the bar Â The hostess was very sweet and apologetic about the delay so the wait wasnt as annoying as it could have been Â We sipped coffee and waited to be seatedHalf an hour later we were seated and greeted by our server Â We were told that pastries cheese meat and some suckling pig were available at a buffet we could help ourselves to and the other items 7 tapas would be served from the kitchen Â We wondered to the buffet only to discover that nothing was set up on it yet but some dessert items Â Not meat cheese or pig Â Why did they seat us if the food wasnt ready Â We were perfectly comfortable waiting sipping coffee Â And also why did out server not inform us the buffet wasnt set up yet Â Eventually it did all come out and the pig was to die for Â The other items were okay too but half of them were lacking serving utensils Â Anyway back to the tapas1 Spanish omelet  this came out first but was cold Â Not a good start to the meal2 fried peppers  Amazing and made up for the cold omelet Â They were perfectly seasoned 3 Bacon wrapped dates  the most amazing thing I have ever eaten4 Shrimp and grits with short rib  AWEFUL The grits were lumpy the shrimp bland and word of all the short rib on my plate was a wad of slimy fat Â I wanted to spit the meat out so badly but i didnt want to embarrass my mom Â Worst of all I couldnt get the awful taste out of my mouth Â My moms short rib meat was much better5 Chorizo  Amazing6 Egg with veggies  Yummy Â especially the little onions7 Blueberry pancakes  my moms favorite Â Yummy fluffy and not overly sweet Overall the food was great Â Some items were disappointing but most were great Â I could eat the suckling pig and dates every day Â If I ever saw the shrimp and grits again though I would run away screaming Â One other little pet peeve was that our water glasses were empty rather often Â I would like to try this place again but definitely not for brunch

Author: Ilir A.
Content: In the beginning we ordered several tapas but bacon wrapped dates were especially great As main dish we chose a paella but it looked like a deconstructed onechicken was on top not incorporated It tasted good but was not what I expected Sangria was not goodthe first one that they brought us had so much ice it tasted like water The ambience was very niceoverall I would say was a nice experience

Author: James S.
Content: We ordered a bunch of small plates Â The Bacon Dates were amazing Â Lamb Skewers rocked Â Good wine Â Loved the Sangria Â Service was excellent

Author: Patricia L.
Content: I have been to Mercat twice and the food is outstanding  highly recommend it I am deducting a star because I find it overly loud

Author: Liz C.
Content: Our food was fabulous but definitely BYOB Wine prices were ridiculousFive times retail is not appropriate anywhere

Author: Robyn D.
Content: My partner and I try to eat here every time we are in Chicago On our most recent trip early May we were too late to sneak in for dinner without a reservation so we sat at the bar and ordered The bartenders were both talented and pleasant and even though they were exceptionally busy explained what they were making That was great funThe seasonal sangria was excellent We had several appetizers the Verdosa salad always yummy roasted cauliflower the padron peppers the dressing on these is fantastic and a butternut squash dumplings We had a lovely light dining experience If we were new to the restaurant I would have needed and appreciated the guidance of a server but as it worked out I couldnt have been happier

Author: Diane A.
Content: I ordered the setas al horno mushrooms patatas bravas potatoes with spicy aioli tocino pork belly and the short rib flatbread as takeout since I was staying in the hotel across the street for business Â Everything was amazing Â The mushrooms were really rich but delicious Â The pork belly was my favorite Â I cant wait to come back to Chicago so I can try more dishes from here

Author: Diane K.
Content: Visiting from Indianapolis and met friends from Chicago who are foodies and big fans of Mercat Â The meal was OUTSTANDING and fun and we had a beautiful seat by the window overlooking Grant Park Â Condusive for discussions and I would highly recommend Â In particular the octopus lamb razor clams and vegetable tapas wer phenomenol Â Sorry I dont know the dish names but very enjoyable evening

Author: mark l.
Content: Serious disappointment I brought my wife here for her 44th birthday We were given the best table in the house and thats where the fun ended Our service was slow and apathetic once it was clear we werent going to spend 40000 We did spend 20000 and got two glasses of wine two beers and the chefs tasting menu of the most disconnected flavors I have ever experienced When we complimented the one decent dish rabbit w sour cherries the servers response was yeah everyone likes that one We ordered lobster and were served the most pathetic langostine I have ever seen In shortpretty much everything was over cooked and then set to luke warmand we both found ourselves being able to make only so much conversation and complimenting of the surroundings between tastings before we felt that we would fall asleep NOT recommended

Author: Gary E.
Content: First  the rating of 3 Stars is not for the food  it was great Â It was not for the service  it was excellent The three stars are for the portion size small and the physical restaurantPortion size  I know this is a Tapas restaurant and portions are supposed to be small Â And they were Â Too small in my opinion Â I think about 50 bigger would be similar to other tapas restaurantsPhysical Restauarant  the room is very big and very spread out with exceptionally high ceilings Â It is no an intimate place Â I felt like I was in a train station lobby or hotel lobby rather than a restaurant Â Not much they can do about the high ceilings  maybe hang some banners or put in a tentWhile i liked the food I would not go here again

Author: Clare K.
