Content: this was not a great experience at ALL Â the service was horrible overall and we got a 5 minute speech on what tapas were when we sat down Â annoying Â the restaurant was really busy especially considering that it was a wednesday night but it almost seemed that there were more waiters than people Â the people who sat down next to us waited about 45 minutes  to get someone to take their drink order Â yikes Â the tapas were goodnot great but good Â my only real complaint about the actual tapas is that without fail watercress was sprinkled all over every single dish Â seriouslyeven my dessert essentially the orange creme brulee had watercress covering it Â it really gave the impression that there were sprouts planted on top of each piece of food Â despite the bad service and apparently ubiquitouswatercress this really would have been a 3 or 4 star review Â after we paid our check our waiter brought out these complimentary chocolates Â so we popped them in our mouth and they were DISGUSTING Â they were salted chocolates which they had told us so we were prepared Â i also happen to really like salted sweets Â howeverit really tasted like these chocolates were dipped in sea water or dipped in morton salt and then just thrown on our table Â the salt was NOT a complementary flavor and was completely overpowering Â after we got over the shock of that disgusting chocolate we decided to try the little white chewy thing that the chocolate was on top of Â it was apparently really sour lemon Â i am still not completely positive beause it was just so disgusting Â it was insanely saltly incredibly sour and really ruined the entire meal Â trulyit almost made us nauseous Â i can inmagine that the only worse flavor than those 2 things alone would have been those 2 things together which is i believe how they were meant to be eaten Â dont do it people Â those 2 innocuous looking little chocolates will ruin your entire meal

Author: Alma C.
Content: great tapas and everything we had datiles con almendra pintxos muranos truita patata albondingas short rib lamb curry etc etc was perfectly seasoned and left us wanting and ordering more and more and more its a little pricey but the festive ambiance delicious sangria pitcher and outstanding service made for a fun night on the town with friends

Author: Maria M.
Content: Wonderful in every way

Author: Dan L.
Content: The food was very very good Â The ambiance was trendy and wonderful Â The service was very attentive Â The prices were a bit too high but not bad Â Ive been to Spain several times and I find the food here at Mercat a la Planxa is is on par with authentic Spanish food especially Barcelona faire Â For an awesome refreshing cold drink ask for a Kalimoxo Â Its half coke and half Rioja red wine and it is fantastic with a spray of lemon

Author: Mary B.
Content: Get the bacon wrapped dates This place is SO good

Author: Emily G.
Content: We headed to Mercat on our way into town today and it did not disappoint We are huge Jose Garces fans so were excited to try this place Our appetizers were both excellent the watermelontomato gazpacho was perfectly spiced and perfectly creamy and the goat cheese and crab saladtopped toast was a fantastic addition to it My husband loved the spinach serrano and fig salad it also had spiced slivered almonds and some crumbled Spanish cheese and was dressed with a lovely sherry vinaigretteFor our mains I opted for the freerange chicken grilled with two sauces and rosemary white beans Both parts of this dish were quite good but I couldnt figure out why youd pair these Italianate beans with the chicken An odd tango if you will My husband ordered the hanger steak sandwich and thought it was perfection Our waiter was nice but definitely the weak link He forgot the spinach side dish I requested brought our tea and soda to the table but then walked away with them never to return and brought me my wine in a dirty glass The restaurant was very nice about everything but that waiter might want to try and focus moreOverall a very good meal

Author: Lindsay A.
Content: Stopped into Mercat the other night for a glass of wine before trivia at Grace OMalleys Â Id been meaning to check it out for quite some time since the chef owns one of my favorite restaurants in Philly Amada  check it out next time youre breezing through the city of brotherly love Â Anyway we went in and secured the last 2 seats at the bar of the downstairs lounge Â At first I was a little skeptical because the bartender had one of her friends sitting at the bar so I was worried we wouldnt see much of her but she was actually extremely knowledgeable about wine the chef the food and so on Â What do you get for a 15 glass of wine Well you get a huge pour and an extremely knowledgeable bartender who will pour you ample samples until you find one you like hmm maybe I should open some sort of business called Ample Samples because thats sort of a great name but bah ive gotten off subject yet again I told her that I have been on a long and arduous hunt for the Smokiest red wine I could find and she let me try their reds until I found one I liked which was great Then she brought out some complimentary bar snacks some sort of foccacia with tomato puree on top It was delightful Â Who doesnt love some complimentary bar snacks We ordered the chefs selection of cheeses which came with these wonderful jams Â So fresh and dynamic tasting It was great Id love to go back for dinner sometime

Author: Triphena W.
Content: Had lunch here with a friend during the week Only a few tables were occupied during our time there and everyone seemed to be relaxing taking their time Â The service was friendly and professional Â Our server recommended the 18 Catalan Express option that includes a fountain drink first course and second course so we went with that The Ensalada Verde mixed greens asparagus avocado green beans shaved mahon cheese and Mixto Croquetas serrano ham and chorizo croquettes with romesco were our choices for course 1 and both were really tasty I wouldnt mind having them again For the second course my friend chose the Mercat Burger 8oz black angus burger padron peppers red wine onion jam and I ordered the steak which came atop shortrib and potato croquette and was topped with mushrooms Â Both were good but unexceptional The server was correct in stating that the plates are on the petite side and that alone one plate with the exception of the burger might not be a sufficient lunch This held true for the steak dish Â This might be a good option if youre looking for quiet less crowded leisurely lunch in the South Loop but I feel there are restaurants that put out more delicious remarkable food for less Id be interested to try dinner but I dont feel the need to return for lunch

Author: Lubna A.
Content: We went to the restaurant last evening the food was really yummy I love tapas cuz I like to be able to try many things without feeling too full I like light desert and you dont usually expect cheesecake to be light but their cheesecake with lemon curd was a delight I rated it 4 only because i compared it with Cafe Baba Reeba which is my top favorite tapas restaurant in Chicago Mercat would come second

Author: K P.
Content: What a disappointing experience Save for my experience at the bar I would totally skip it in the future The view over Michigan Ave and the park are amazing but the food and service were lacking in the refinement one would expect from a place like this I went with a friend to try their dine around menu prior to the GFF I was immediately impressed that they offered to accommodate my dairy sensitivity but that fell flat Courses were served unevenly at one point they sent a rabbit ravioli with cream to my dining partner and I received roasted spring onions Sorry but that just doesnt even come close to a relative substitute Between the 2nd and 3rd course they completely forgot about us for 45 minutes Not even the waitress came by to check on us When youre treated that poorly no matter how good the food is and in this case it wasnt Id rather spend my fine dining dollars elsewhere

Author: Abby S.
Content: I came here for my 21st birthday a year ago and was amazed at the incredible service I came in today and was amazed at how downhill they went I suffer from Celiac disease and was astonished by the condescending if not downright malicious  tone the server took with me I erred on tears After feeling pressured on our orders the server took them and went along He spent significant time dwelling at other tables while ignoring ours and while I drained my water glass the server addressed my family members fuller glasses while I waited a good 15 minutes before he took heed and filled my glass This isnt even the worst part it took him 45 minutes to deliver our lunch and he delivered my lunch last In most cases a server will generally augment the flaw of bad service with a special consideration towards the table ie wine dessert anything to reflect better on him or her However this waiter was quite arrogant displaying hazardous traits that guaranteed him a very scarce tip in return for his poor poor service My conclusion being the Mercat a la Planxa hires ageist servers that are insensitive towards the glutenintolerantCeliac community and for this reason the service they hire reflect horribly on the restaurant itself thus giving the restaurant a veneer of pretension that illsuits it

Author: Christine K.
Content: Tapas were good not great but the ambiance was really bad Â Felt like I was eating in a dining hall Â Went on a Saturday night at 530 and it was already very crowded Â We requested a quiet table by the window when we made the reservation but that wasnt honored Â Wouldnt matter anyway no such thing as a quiet table Â Tables are right on top of each other the kind where everyone is listening to your conversation Â To go to the bathroom you leave the restaurant go through the hotel down two flights of stairs and into the bar Â Just awkward

Author: Valerie D.
Content: I have to admit Im into the celebrity chef trend so that somewhat drove my decision to select this place for a dinner with two very special ladies We were blown away by the flavors of every single dish If I had only had a large bowl of the spinach with apples and pine nuts I could have ended my dinner satisfied and happy But that was only the beginning Other standouts were the scallops langoustine and oh my goodness the lambchops were cooked to perfection the accompanying sauces were not even needed The hostesses were charming and wonderful Whitney who confirmed my res couldnt have been nicer And our waiter was friendly but not obtrusive A great time I will go back again and again

Author: Daniel S.
Content: This Iberian themed spot is located in the refurbished Blackstone Hotel and I am sure you will find it as much of a delight as I did On the ground level is a rather unremarkable bar area decked out in the current modish fashion But venture upon a spiral staircase into an impressive mirrored dining room I think this mustve been a former ballroom and you have an apt entree into a culinary adventure We dined on a Monday evening for a business event and partook of the chefs tasting menu Not know what to expect we were delighted in every way This allowed us to sample a wide array of starters and some of the better entrees The white wines which I found a bit sweet to pair with Spanish were nonetheless high quality I might substitute the sangria on the next visit Desert options are nice and there is a nice menu of desert wines and ports to sample Overall this was an enjoyable session for all the senses and with nice and unobtrusive service to round the experience I will surely visit again

Author: Gail I.
Content: I have gone to Mercat for lunch and for a bite at the barand enjoyed it tremendously Â Certainly a 5 star experience Â I wanted to warn people though not to go to Mercat for dinner in the eveningeven a weekday eveningif you want to enjoy the company of your friends and peacefully enjoy the food Â I dont understand why some of the money spent on decor was not spent on any simple expedients to muffle noise Â They exist I felt like I was eating in a huge aircraft hanger filled with screaming nursery school children Â Added to this noise was pounding music with a relentless dance beat Â The place is a dining roomnot a 1980s disco for heavens sake Â My party of five was also seated around a huge tableso that any conversation was impossible Â Our poor waitress and waiterwho were more than excellenthad to yell to be heard Â I hate to think what their throats must feel like at the end of their shift Â The food was goodif uneven Â Sometimes it was fabulous Â Unfortunately it came out of the kitchen with very strange pacingso that dishes that were ordered together for a reason came out at very different times and the intense flavors of the small plates often warred with each other Â The service was wonderfully graciouswe were given generous samples of a number of wines before we chose our bottleand the waitress noticed and accomodated my nephews teenage metabolism Â It is a shame that this graciousness was nearly negated by the assaultive atmosphereand that interesting and expensive food could not be appreciated fully

Author: david b.
Content: good overall experience Â  i probably will be back Â  service was just adequate Â  but the food is worth it  Â doubt i would make a special trip to go Â   but next time i have a meeting in the south loop it will be on the short list Â  Â jose garces has created a fantastic menu and i look forward to seeing how it evolves Â  i was surprised though that they didnt have licor 43  Â  i didnt get this feeling of catalan Â  Â which you apparently are supposed too Â  i guess the barcelona influences went over my head Â

Author: Brian S.
Content: Went in here for a pretheater quick dinner early on a Sunday Â Restaurant was nearly empty which was scary Â But then the food started coming out and it was excellent Â Ive munched on a lot of tapas in my time and every single dish was nearly perfect Â Which shocked me given I have low expectations for nearly all Loop restaurants and certainly anything this far south Â Favorites included the pulpo y papas also the sea bass was fantastic and the rock shrimp with popcorn was amazing Â Great service as well Â Well come back with a larger group for sure Â The tapas were expensive but the flavors were exceptional and completely justified the price in my mind

Author: Kush D.
Content: Great place though a little loud Â Came here because I like what Jose Garces does on Iron Chef Â Great place for small plates Excellent selection of flatbreads Â We had one with chorizo and shrimpdelicious Â Tip order less than the server suggests Â You can always order more Â  Another tip Cocktails are great sangria is average

Author: Christina T.
Content: The food is absolutely delicious My friend and I went during restaurant week The atmosphere is very warm welcoming and the restaurant has a little eclectic feel to the design My favorite tapas were the Benedict over a perfectly crispy I believe it was halibut and the salmon dish The salmon dish was cooked medium along with a lightly crisped skin and was set on top a green sauce that was so delicious I also love arugula and I loved how they used arugula sprouts to garnish most of the dishes The chef is very friendly personable and caters to his customers we are pescatarian and the prefixed menu had meat on it He served us the salmon and introduced the dish and gave us some interesting info on the salmon It was an awesome experience and we plan to come here again soon The only reason I gave this restaurant four stars is because the waiters did not ask if we wanted more sangria or refill our water and they didnt check up on us The Chef coming out to talk to us was great and this is why I gave this restaurant four stars otherwise I would have given it five

Author: Cathy B.
Content: Ive been wanting to try this place after I read about the awesome reviews and boyyyyyyy was I disappointed I came here on a Saturday for my bf and my 5 year anniversary AWWWW and our reservation was for 1230PM We went upstairs and it was dead maybe twothree other tables were occupied I mean thats cool its kind of early for lunch ya know For my first course I had the arroz con la cazuela  the broth with shrimp and chicken and the first tasting was good but I realized it was way too salty Can you say sodium overload My second course was the Mercat burger  Decent but too greasy and again too salty I also ordered the patatas fritas which was nothing extrodinary at all  tasted OK like McDonald fries Shoot I think I rather eat McDonalds fries Overall I was super disappointed in the lunch menu  there was not a variety at all The service here was terrible also we both had soft drinks and no one came to ask if we needed a refill except toward the end when we were paying our bill This place wasnt even packed I mean maybe 3 more tables joined after us but it was like 20 percent occupied UGH I might come back and give this place another try for the dinner menu but I highly doubt it

Author: Furman L.
Content: Fantastic restaurant that is within walking distance for anyone staying at the Hilton located inside the Renaissance Blackstone The dishes were great and dinner only cost me about 75 per person including tip Not bad for delicious food and convenience

Author: R M.
Content: Stopped in for Sunday lunch and was impressed with the view of Michigan Ave and the park funky decor and attentive service at first Â We were the second or third table in the entire restaurant and enjoyed some outstanding mushroom soup cheese flight and quite goodalthough a tad overcookedbay scallops Â As lunch went on the restaurant filled up and our service slowed to a crawl Â It was difficult to flag someone down just to refill our water glasses and ask for the check Â Prices for lunch were reasonable but looking at the dinner menu Id venture to say its overpriced Â The chairs are not comfortable enough our table had scuff marks all over it and nobody offered to take our coats Â Bottom line the food makes the grade but the service is below average

Author: Christy V.
Content: I really enjoyed the dining experience here Its open yet intimate at the same time Great for a date I had high expectations for the food and was disappointed by most of the tapas my boyfriend and I ordered The only one I could classify as delicious was the chorizo a la planxaso much flavor packed into each bite The others ranged from good to marginal except for the patatas bravas which were like soggy tater tots soaked in oil Its clear that Mercat is all about taking risks in reinventing traditional tapas For me these risks just dont pay off

Author: Petros P.
Content: Wowfaced

Author: Desiree W.
Content: Food was fantastic and excellent service Omar was our waiter He was not only attentive but also very knowledgeable His wine recommendation was perfect for what we told him we liked We go here often and this was the best time yet The room is also beautiful

Author: Julia M.
Content: I went to Mercat with some friends on 101108 Â My purse was stolen from the premises and the management was less than helpful Â Unless you want to lose your wallet and have thousands charged to your stolen credit cards I dont suggest this place Â Food was OK  but you can certainly get the same at other places in Chicago

Author: jamie k.
Content: good place great service food is good not great prices are high Â im not cheap but prices here are definitely high

Author: Kristine d.
Content: This place hits the nail on the head Its a Garces restaurant so you can expect quality and presentation The atmosphere is a little strange with honeycombs but thats not at all whats important about this restaurant My fiance and I took a trip to Chicago for my birthday and we went here for my birthday dinner We got the tasting with wine pairing This is the only way to go here Our first course was a cheese bread apple and bacon sauce  which was incredible you couldnt go wrong with this one any and all combinations worked apple and cheese cheese and dip dip and appleALL GOOD We also got a meat plate with crispy breads and an assortment of mustard jalapenos and pickles We also got a bowl of olives which we didnt care for since neither of us are into olives They could have brough us something else when they noticed we didnt eat it but they didnt Our next few courses sort of melded together but i remember little potato pieces with a roumelade type of sauce a black beanlentil soup with lettuce leaves so much better than it sounds steak bacon wrapped dates with a blue cheese dressing bruchetta and more The wine pairings complemented each course in its own unique way Some of the dishes we had seen before at Amada but regardless they were still enjoyed We had two desserts but I cannot remember what we had by that point i know there were banana marshmallows in one of them Regardless this is a place to impress Great location and seating is comfortable Service was impeccable

Author: Leilo P.
Content: The only reason I am not going to give Mercat a la Planxa 5 stars is because it is too pricey and the waiters are inconsistent but this is an amazing place Let me start out by saying that I love Chef Garces Ive eaten at all of his restaurants including my favorite Amada in Philadelphia I ate at Mercat for the first time four years ago when I first moved to Chicago Garces was not an Iron Chef yet so the place was less packed than it is now I still go to Mercat any chance I get The menu changes twice a year and I prefer the Autumn menu My favorite things on the menu the mushroom soup with caviar and crÃ¨me fraiche Wagyu beef patata bravas and the chocolate croquettas This places is expensive because the portions are so small you need to order a lot to walk out satisfied and the alcohol is also expensive Ive gone to Mercat several times and the quality of the food never changes The wait staff however is hit or miss Ive had two bad occasions there once when the waiter wouldnt leave us alone and was being too pushy and the other time when the waiter mocked me for not knowing that the menu changed when I asked for the soup I loved he was relentless and brought it up the whole time during dinner Also Mercat has a tight seating layout you sit VERY close to other people so if youre looking to have a romantic dinner you have to specifically request a table

Author: Illi F.
Content: My boyfriend and I went here for our anniversary dinner on a recent trip to Chicago We picked Mercat over several other tapas places in the area because it billed itself as Catalonian fare Having sampled many delicious tapas in Barcelona last year we were pumped However I think we would have enjoyed the meal much more if the restaurant avoided drawing that comparison We made a reservation for 930 PM but when we arrived we were told that there were no open tables What There isnt really a great spot to wait upstairs and we were afraid that if we went to the bar downstairs we would miss being seated So we stood and waited next to the hostess stand for about 20 minutes The atmosphere was awesome though Great interior decorating house music playingWhen we finally did get seated our waiter was slow to take the order and seemed very pushy about getting us to order everything we would want at the beginning of the meal While in Spain we ordered tapas a few at a time eating and drinking slowly to savor the food so this was a little disconcerting To start we ordered the bacon wrapped dates patatas bravas jamon pato and a pitcher of the seasonal sangria To Mercats credit the food did come out promptly The bacon wrapped dates were phenomenal and we ordered a second helping almost immediately The jamon was good but we needed additional bread The patatas bravas were a letdown little more than glorified tater tots We also wondered why the aioli and the spicy paprika sauce were mixed together and why the portions were so darn small Still we are suckers for anything with mayonnaise so we ordered a second helping of those too To finish we tried a trio of sorbets the mango sorbet is a real shocker Id advise anybody to try it once Our chief complaint was our waiter He clearly snubbed us because he felt that our 100 pretip tab was not up to his standards It was extremely difficult for us to get ahold of him throughout the meal to order more courses although he doted on the tables on either side of us who ordered the overpriced tasting menu We are young professionals and regularly leave a 20 tip for good service but his nasty attitude cost him Also why dont they train their servers to correctly pronounce the names of their dishes I did not order bravo potatoes The seating is very tight so if you get jerks seated next to you like we did your experience could be affected The women next to us were going on and on about how ones daughter just came out as a lesbian and constantly yelled about how the food was horrible So be aware Overall we got much better tapas at a much better price in Spain even in touristy spots and even with the crappy exchange rate I was really expecting something more authentic than this if its not authentic dont say it is Id advise anyone interested in tapas to get a cookbook and try it at home because if this is what Americans will rave about you can do much better at home

Author: Tricia K.
Content: Holy moly the food here is sooooo good Â Every bite every morsel was delish Â I went here for the first time with a group of 6 and we were seated at a great table right by the 2 story window with views of Grant Park Â We ordered a bunch of plates to share as a table  after all this is a tapas place you gotta shareOur waiter was very attentive and started us off with some tomato bread kind of like a spanish bruschetta Â The unique and robust flavor was due to sherry vinegar Â Yum Â And we began with a pitcher of the red sangriavery good and a MUST Â Our tapas meal started off with my alltime favorite  Â Datiles con Almendras bacon wrapped dates stuffed with almonds Â Omg the sauce they put pour on top when the bring it to your table is yummy Â Then we had the Gambas al Ajillo garlic shrimp Â Im not much of a shrimp person so I didnt try this one but Ill have to take my friends word for it that it was good as well Â After that we had the Gambas con Garbanzos flatbread with shrimp chorizo  garbanzo bean puree Â Wowvery flavorful and just wonderful Â The next dish was Â Albondigas de Venera scallop  shrimp meatballs marinated grapes  shaved idiazabal Â This was probably my favorite dish of the night Â The texture of the meatball was amazingvery smooth Â And the grapes added just the right amount of acidity to this dish Â I wanted to soak up the sauce that was left in the dish it was so good Â That dish was the fastest to empty Â We also ordered Patatas Bravas spicy potatoes with spicy paprika aioli and that was tasty toonothing too different than other places that Ive been to in tasteflavor but the presentation was beautiful all of the dishes were presented beautifully very simple and classy Â The Setas al Horno wild mushrooms confit potato shallot  parsley dish was amazing too Â The flavor they pulled from the mushrooms was outstanding very savory Â The last tapas dish we had was Tocino con Cidra slowcooked pork belly cider glaze green apples  truffle Â This was my secondfavorite dish of the night Â The dish had this parsnip puree on it that was to die for Â Such a great textural addition to the dish Â And the green apple  truffle salad was a nice and light compliment to the savory flavorful wellbalanced pork belly Â Melt in your mouth wonderfulnessWe ended the meal with a fantastic sweet note Â Croquetas De Xocolata milk chocolate croquettes banana marshmallow rosemary caramel arbequina olive oil You have to try this Â Talk about an experienceI highly highly HIGHLY recommend this place Â Its a bit pricey more than Cafe Iberico but I think its worth it Â I loved every dish that we ordered Â And there are so many more on the menu that I am dying to come back and try Â The sexy ambiance with high ceilings swanky decor and friendly staff makes it a great place for a date or a get together with friends Â Our waiter Fred was especially awesome Â So attentive and friendly Â He made a point to explain everything that came to the table Â You could tell he believed in the food supported the chef and loved working at this restaurant Â Just listening to his descriptions of each dish made your mouth waterIf youre ever downtown and want something amazing to treat yourself withcheck this place out

Author: Shelley A. D.
Content: A fun place for a ladies night out Â Staff is friendly Â Tapas menu allows for lots of options for tasting Â Just beware the price of lots of small plates with drinks adds up quickly Â Ive been several times and have never spent less than 100pp

Author: Tom T.
Content: I like this placeGreat foodgood vibeNice place to go with a group of friendsMy best dish was porkbelly and chorizzo plater

Author: Frank L.
Content: very good food Very good

Author: David N.
Content: Arrived with reservations and were seated right away The beer menu is lame but my wifes Sangria was tasty and their specialty drinks were a little more extensive and expensive Tried a bunch of stuff most of which were above average The Bacon Wrapped Dates Empanada con Espinaca and Patatas Bravas really stood out as well as the Chefs Cheese Mixto Plenty of flavor in the dishes and like anywhere else you have to try as much as you can until you figure out what you like the best Of course this approach will allow you to ingest some less savory dished but Ive yet try something I absolutely disliked Wasnt a huge fan of the Verdosa Salad My wifes Gambas Jumbo Prawns were intimidating staring back at her LOL but she liked them Definitely worth checking out if you have some cash to burn and want to try something new Call ahead make reservations and leave the kids at home for this one

Author: Christina K.
Content: On a whim I suggested to a girlfriend who works down in the Loop that we go and while thats not necessarily everyones sort of impulse move I had a wish for tapas that really delivered on the promise of little plates lighter fare and a broad slate of palate pleasures Mercat a la Planxa delivered on all of this the spreads of chefs choices for charcuterie and cheeses were both delicious a spinach salad with fig and ham was nothing short of wonderfulthe presentation in particular was rather clever with the salad wrapped within the prosciuttothe stuffed dates in blue cheese sauce were scrumptious and the scallops special delivered up my favorite shellfish in an excellent bit of spice And while it wasnt cheap it really did end up being a bit filling The house martinis and the sangrias were also agreeable and the decor pleasant with a semiretro early 60s mod vibe in rich dark orangeredgold overtones which sounds ridiculous but it works In short while I wont make a habit of going regularly I will make a point of coming back if an when the opportunity arises

Author: Annie K.
Content: Funky and fun this restaurant is delightful We ordered drinks hubs had the Bolero and I had the Merengue Loved both Didnt care for the sangria sorry too sweet Ambiance is great felt Mediterranean with funk browns oranges reds deep purples and loud music which got old and loud after it became quite crowded We ordered the Chefs tasting Our server right off the bat asked for food allergies or preferences Hubs is wheatgluten intolerant not celiac so the server garnered points from us right there Â Our meal had zero gluten options and if so it was on the side Plus the Hawks were playing at 7 so he honored our time constraints for that as well they lost Each course was better than the last Most memorable were the shrimp and the giant prawns The beef was tasty but a bit too rare The sliced cured meat portion for the appetizer was large possibly 12 slices and melt in mouth yummy and the cheese w the caramel sauce was splendid Â Wed go back if for a few of this that and the other and for the fig gelato Â Itd be fun with another couple

Author: Brian C.
Content: I just loved the dining experience here Â The tapas plates were out of this world Â I wish I could write more about the food Â Its hard to remember it all Â Octopus serrano ham bacon wrapped dates a cheese assortment chocolate croquettes and some other stuff Â Amazing presentations for all the dishes Â They had a wine list with a lot of reasonably priced selections Â I decided to venture into the great unknown and have a menciagarnacha blend Â The garnacha was only 40 of the blend but just like in senatorial politics 40 can be enough to be a majority sometimes Â The only thing Id like to see changed is the noise level Â Having a conversation that cuts through the din can be challenging Â We were able to have a wonderful anniversary dinner in spite of that though Â There are so many dishes I want to try that I wasnt able to try this time Â A return trip will be necessary at some point

Author: Jordan I.
Content: What can I say Wawawewa This place was delicious First and foremost The creativity is superb when it comes to this tapas joint Jose Garces is genius and has picked a very well trained staff to maintain Mercat A La Planxa Came here for the first time in April for my birthday and still think about it It also doesnt help that I work across the street and around six to seven oclock the vents are pouring out savory smoke from the kitchens that just smells like heaven I was with 8 people when I went and we all had the chefs tasting menu which I recommend We decided to just have excessive amounts of sangria and Absinthe for desert instead of the additional wine pairings I do have to take ONE star off for service When spending over a G on a meal you want start to finish steady service I do think that an automatic gratuity over parties of six doesnt help that situation So all throughout about 85 percent of the meal the service was impecable But for the last fifteen percent it tailed off to lets say nonexistence Couldnt get the check let alone see the server anywhere inside the restaurant Couldve been in the bathroom or havin a smoke but either way unacceptable So in conclusion go here for dinner not lunch or brunch Make reservations have the tasting menu and dont be suprised if the service has a tendancy to lack during your dining adventure

Author: sandhya k.
Content: Yea A wonderful evening and food made up for last nights disappointment and was a perfect meal to celebrate my dads birthday We had a wonderful assortment of dishes from the cheese to the short ribs and arroz Some yummy sangria to start things off and wonderful desserts sorbet and ice cream with a candle for dads birthday and the croquettas to finish everything off

Author: Mrs. E.
Content: My husband took me to Mercat a la Planxa for my birthday and the food was unbelievably delicious Â We tried the chefs tasting and received 13 different dishes Â The flavor combinations were so interesting and even the traditional tapas dishes had a new modern twist Â The plating was beautiful the service was warm and helpful and the whole experience overall was outstanding Â Its probably the best tapas I have had in the city of Chicago

Author: Junie B.
Content: My sweetheart brought me to Mercat a la Planxa for Valentines Day over the weekend and it was a memorable evening In the beautiful Blackstone Hotel the restaurant glows with romantic dim light with warm tones throughout The atmosphere was internationally swanky A lot of times tapas places try too hard to achieve that Spanish feel and this was no exception  still though  swank We were a little put off by where we were seated table for 4 right by the bar but it was a busy night so we forgave them The Coles De Bruselas brussels sprouts  divine Super tasty The bacon wrapped dates were to die for It was an explosion of flavor The Mixto selection of 3 cured meats was served with tiny peppers and grain mustard A little different for tapas but very good We ordered the goat cheese with the pear coriander jam and we werent too sure about the cheese Our server noticed right away and was not only willing to offer us a different cheese at no charge but he compd us the dish and brought us a surprise plate of delicious grilled octopus It was so wonderful to have someone so astute and courteous serve us on such a romantic and wonderful evening It really made our night To end our meal we had the Chocolate Croquettes  omg Yum Its like a warm melty cocopuff surrounded in a gooey marshmallow cream Unreal I will not hesitate to come here again We lucked out Great experience great service and delicious food Bravo to Mercat a la Planxa Thanks

Author: Charlie J.
Content: this place is offthehook 199 sangria in the lounge on mondays is a real find but order the chefs tasting menu and sit back and enjoy four courses  3 or so tapas per course its a little over the top but each and every presentation is unbelievable the braised rabit pasta with cherry sauce is just plain old naughty just go herenow

Author: sarah l.
Content: Let me start off by saying that my husband and i went in thinking we were going to have a great experience Â Got the last table outside on a beautiful summer Saturday night with high hopes Â Got the menu and it is really kind of boring as nothing really popped out  us Â We wound up ordering a bunch of tapas recommended to us by our snooty waiter Â Bland is a good way to describe most everything Â Edible but bland Â Until we got the lobsterwhich came not fully cooked Â Told the waiter and he sent it back and came back w the same one my husband had taken a bite out of Â At least could have given us a new piece Â I ordered a glass of wine which was 13 on the menu but when we got the bill each glass was 20 Â Questioned this and he said he thought he would give me the bigger size glass iemore money Â Beware people this place sucks Â There are so many other great places in the city Â Our bill was 200 w tip and our tip was not that plentiful Â And we left hungry Â Very diappointed

Author: Unknown K.
Content: So Ive been twice now I really wish this place was better because its in a nice spot and has a nice view of the park but it just doesnt measure up Nothing is particularly bad it just all comes off as indifferent It kind of feels like a Midwestern attempt at a fancy restaurant They are definitely aiming at the business crowd so maybe thats the problem I dont know However I wont go back Id rather walk a little further or settle for less ambiance especially at this price point

Author: Mopsie B.
Content: Our first visit was last night after the Joffreys Don Quixote Were subscribers and Mercat a la Planxa is one of the rewards participants Its truly a great idea to get patrons in the door Anyway I love tapas and had somehow never heard of this restaurant Trust me when I say we will be back The dining area was contemporary and festive The drinks food and service were truly exemplary It was all delicious but the standouts for me were the scallop and shrimp meatballs the patatas bravas which may resemble Tater Tots but were absolutely above and beyond And the white sangria which has pear in it Yum Add to all of that an extensive Spanish wine list and youve got a real winner The crowd was diverse and happy and its a bit like a speakeasy because its deep in the recesses of the Blackstone Fair warning though the bathroom is DARK As in even the toilets are black and you cant see a thing Everything is lit by candlelight I dont necessarily dislike it but it could be tricky if youre not prepared for that We were too full for dessert but will definitely be back Thank you Joffrey for partnering with this gem

Author: Garnet S.
Content: Good if you are looking for exotic Spanish dishes and are willing to accept high prices and more misses than hits the Chefs tasting menu More of an experience than a great meal Pleasant upscale ambiance but it is packed very tight and you may have to seat next to your dining companion and you will definitely be within an arms reach of the diners at the next table

Author: laura heather h.
Content: Ah the luxury The only thing they dont have is decent accustic managing It gets loud with all the hard surfaces and high ceilings I loved the food though and the drinks were tasty I hated the TV in the bar I mean really the atmosphere there was ruined with the glowing screan and faces of football This actually might become a recuring thing I will be yelping about I hate TVs in places I go to especially if they are littered with sports Unless I am at a sports bar then fine I dont go to those places though because I hate sports so there I just wish establishment owners had the common courtesy to not have a glowing screen in front of me ugh that went nowhere So Mercat is good and tasty nice staff great decor I wouldnt complain if a guy took me to dinner there Also there is this cute private kinda table that overlooks the restaurant and I want to sit there sometime I love when restaurants have those

Author: Luke F.
Content: very nice place Â only my second tapas place the food was much better than iberico Â the complimentary bread with sea salt was amazing along with the complimentary chocolate for desert Â the white sangria was extremely good Â a little pricey but it was a great experience Â the atmosphere is great and the service was quick Â we went on a friday night around 930 had no reservations and was seated within 15 minutes

Author: James C.
Content: delicious paella great short ribs mushrooms cheeses and plenty more Â good variety of tapas pass on the patatas good service and staff great decor unfortunately the portions are tiny and the food still takes as while to come out Â went with a big group and the small plates were not good for sharing unless you order a plate of each dish for everyone Â not that we didnt think the food was good but after spending 50 on dinner we ate a second dinner elsewhere cuz no one was full

Author: Erik B.
Content: This place is expensive Â The small plates are really small and just ok Â The scallops were overcooked I know now why the website doesnt list prices Â We were there for my girlfriends birthday with a big group Â We ordered a handful of appetizers to start Â The bread was better than the food we ordered Â We got the check and finished our meal at another restaurant

Author: Bella Bunny B.
Content: A bit noisy and a tad pretentious but the food is good and the sangria is great The seemingly ubiquitous Patatas Bravas were fabulous as was the sauteed spinach Service was a bit strained even for a weeknight but it WAS busy Location is great right on Michigan Ave and convenient since we were staying right in the historic Blackstone Hotel

Author: J M.
Content: Chicken and chorizo paella was good for sharing We shared it with 4 people and also had some tapas Not a cheap dinner but tasty and fun Definitely get the bacon wrapped dates

Author: MM N.
Content: Nice food and atmosphere but a little pricey

Author: Thomas S.
Content: 4 stars for the food 5 stars for service We had the tasting menu with wine pairings Very enjoyable and nice wine choices Would certainly return

Author: Avi G.
Content: Great experience We arrived 45 minutes early to enjoy a wine flight Whoever is doing the wines should be given a 5 star The wine flights were exceptional We had the white wine flight at the bar Our waiter was fantastic He knew his wines We had a great discussion on the varietals Not only that he gave us a taste of a unique wine from the Basque region A great start to an exciting evening Our table was ready at exactly the time we made our reservation The hostess could not have been more accomodating The upstairs dining room was right out of an Almadovor movieit felt modern Spain I like being able to choose my tapas You must have the lima and fava bean with Serrano ham and cheesefresh herbs and a tasty vinagrette The bread with tomato topping much like a bruschetta was tasty and fresh The barramundi fish tapa was sparkingly fresh Its creamy texture and crisp skin was perfect The pulpus octopus and potatoes was very tasty spiced with smoked paprika We finished up with the short ribs and diver scallopsvery rich and delicious The staff could not be more attentive It is difficult on timing in a large restaurant Some dishes came too soon The staff had no problem in returning them and bringing a new plate later in the meal I am looking forward to coming back and having more of their exceptional tapas and interesting and exciting wines

Author: Aly O.
Content: I was staying at the Hiton Chicago while on a recent business trip and discovered Mercat a la planxa next door What a find Chef Jose Garces really does live up to the hype with some amazing combinations Everything I had was very good but two of the dishes blew me away the slow cooked short ribs  diver scallops dish was absolutely amazing Melt in your mouth beef with a perfect salty smoke to complement scallops Also the wild mushrooms a staple for any tapas restaurant was very well done The perfect balance of spices garlic onions a nice medly of wild mushrooms and a drizzle of truffle oil for the extra punch Like many of the other reviewers I had to try the chocolate croquetes but they are honestly nothing to write home about and I will agree with anyone who says this place is expensive The food is very good with some truly exceptional dishes but many of the dishes are frankley priced too high for what they are I will also warn you that the servers need to do a much better job of describing the dishes so dont be shy to ask them a lot of questions to tease out important details

Author: Matthew M.
Content: everything is very tastee service is soso best tapas in Chicago in my opinion

Author: Emily M.
Content: The tapas are very good and the atmosphere is fun Â We loved the sangria Â I wish that we would have tried a dessert because they looked amazing Â This is one of the better tapas places I have been to

Author: Penny F.
Content: Let me start off by saying that I have NEVER written a bad review about a restaurant Â Generally speaking my thoughts are that things happen and for the most part my past bad experiences at restaurants have not warranted such an extreme act as I see it Â I like to focus on the positive Â In this case I cant get past the service Â I am giving this restaurant 2 stars because the food was pretty good Â and the atmosphere was cool and interesting Â However the service needs some serious help Â Our waiter was clearly disinterested to say the least but hes not the reason for my beef Â During our meal albeit towards the end of the meal a manager actually had us move tables so that they could sit a larger table Â Again this alone is not my beef Â  Â Who really cares I can stand up and move tables if that helps them out Â I thought the request was odd but it really didnt bother me much Â The last straw was the REPEATED subtle checks by the hostess to see if the bill had been paid within about a 20 minute time span Â Then when we paid and stood up from the table the immediate and I mean immediate pounce on the table running over one of my party members while getting to the coveted table Â Pushing patrons out the door is not a good business practiceplain and simple Â We were there for 25 hours not excessive especially for a tapas restaurant Â I will not be returning to this restaurant as there are too many other wonderful establishments in the Chicago area case in point BOKA which I was at last night which provided stellar service and awesome food Â It goes without saying that I am not recommending this restaurant to any of my friends based on the service experience Â Call me old fashion but service matters Â In a word my experience wasdisappointing

Author: Eric L.
Content: This is one of the better tapas places ive been to in chicago Â almost everything we ate here was excellent Â the squash dumplings were especially excellent Â The only complaint is that its a fairly expensive place and the service is only ok waiter partially spilled my drink and never came to clean it up Â But overall this place was very good

Author: Alex C.
Content: If you can make it to Mercat for Restaurant Week do it They grill their seafood perfectly calamari a la planxa and the grilled octopus allowing the flavor of the food to speak for itself They are incredibly accommodating we were in a bit of a rush All I can think is yum yum yum and if you can make it during restaurant week then your wallet will be singing too

Author: Shanna R.
Content: This is one of my favorite restaurants and definitely my favorite tapas place Ive been there four or five times and have yet to find better tapas This place is beautiful too I especially love the patatas bravas bacon wrapped dates and the sauces that come with the cheese sampler My boyfriend was more adventurous and ordered something with rabbit and a quail dish I had never had either but they were really good The sangria flight was also a hit The prices are a bit steep so its more for special occasions but I choose it for every birthday or anniversary dinner When I make online reservations and mention that were celebrating a birthday or anniversary Ive always gotten a free dessert Service is always amazing too Love Love love this place

Author: Luis R.
Content: Food was excellent Â Service was great Â Rick took care of us Â Never felt rushed and the food kept coming at an excellent pace Â Wine was excellent also Would return in a second

Author: Mindi N.
Content: We have been hear many times The atmosphere is just amazing Chic and edgy Â We were seated promptly in a corner booth which I love The food and drinks were amazing as usual  Â They bring out the tapas as it is ready a pretty fast pace but we eat fast Some people might not like this so much Â Our downfall with the place is the service Our waiter thought he was hot shit  for lack of better words Â  He was borderline rude at times when we asked questions Examplemy boyfriend asked if we could order a few plates and go from there The waiter informed him that the restaurant encourages people to order there whole meal at one time Â Really Â  Been to a lot of tapas style places and the usually encourage you to order as you go Â Whatever Â  Â The time I came hear before this I brought my 11 year old here He is such a little foodie he loved the food Â The waiter that night pissed me off soo bad when me left I asked to speak to a manager Â Rude rude rude Â I think the management need to look at who is in the front of the house because again the food is wonderful the wait staff leaves a very bitter taste in your mouth

Author: Sophie L.
Content: I went here for Restaurant Week and the food was great as was the price Â My only complaint is that the service was extremely slow Â I visited during lunch and there were only 4 other tables yet somehow our meal lasted 2 hours Â Based on food alone I would have given this 4 stars but a 2 hour lunch for 2 people is ridiculous

Author: a s.
Content: Reading the menu on the website I wanted to eat everything Â When we arrived I had a hard time deciding what to get but eventually decided on six items to share for two Â 1 Garrotxastuffed cippollini onions in a savory tomato sauce were simply amazing Â 2 Octopus and potatoes in olive oil with lemon and paprika Â Octopus was more tender than i could have imagined and paired beautifully with the confit potato Â 3 Â Crab rice was a perfect size portion of risottostyle rice with large chunks of crab a crispy crab cake and tiny quail egg on top Â 4 Â Shrimp chorizo garbanzo flat bread was served with some sort of sweet fresh cherry tomato salad on top Â 5 Â Duck breast with a crispy salty skin diced Cabernetmarinated apple on top of a swoosh of La Peral cheese and a foie grasduck confit crepe Â 6 Â Lobster rabbit chicken and chorizo rice soupThe soup came first and was good enhanced with a slice of bread and neon orange piquillo pepper aioli Â Everything got better from there Â Octopus is a must have served on a round wood plate and garnished with a lemon slice Â So fresh so tender and delicious Â The crab rice was generously laden with crab meat and a refined touch of perfectly cooked english peas Â The flat bread was amazing Â The flavors of each ingredient vibrantly individual yet harmonizing into something new and spectacular Â The duck was cooked perfectlysalty on the outside which mixed with the sweetness of the sauce and the creamy le peral cheese underneath the wine soaked applesThen desert Â Liquid chocolate croquettes with a vanilla marshmallow and rosemarycaramel came on a beautiful plate with just a dash of really fine olive oil Â Sweet pealavender ice cream sounded insane and wasBut i like that kind of thing Â Rosemaryolive oil ice cream was the best of the three while the mangochili sorbet took third place as the spice from the chilies was surprisingly absent Â Some of the best food in townnot to mention fast intelligent service as well as a beautiful dining room Â I will certainly be back

Author: S M.
Content: I had been wanting to try this place for so long and foodwise it did not disappoint Â All the dishes we ordered tasted amazing baconwrapped dates serrano ham and fig salad steak and scallops ciderglazed pork belly There were more that I cant remember but it was all delicous Â I was totally disppointed with the seasonal sangria though It was completely watered down Â Also at the risk of sounding like a geezer it was so loud in there If you go with a group be prepared to only talk to the people to the left and right of you bc you wont be able to hear anyone else Its just the acoustics of the place  its not like they have loud music blaring Â I would def recommend sitting outside to avoid this

Author: BurtK D.
Content: Mercat was delicious Â Everything we had on the tasting menu was sooo good Â After sitting down trying to decide to order a la carte or the tasting menu we went with the tasting bc we couldnt decide Â we made a great decision and I would recommend to anyone Â The service was very good as well the server knew his food and wine which was helpful in us deciding which wine to choose I thought it was a bit pricey but worth it Â Definitely a special occasion place I would go again

Author: Vanessa V.
Content: My husband and I treated my future motherinlaw to dinner her just to check it out What a great time I basically grew up in the area of Spain represented at this restaurantit was like I was back home The food was great the service was top of the line and the atmosphere was outstanding We noticed that they had a private dining room so we began investigating holding the rehearsal dinner for our wedding here We contacted the restaurant made the reservation and picked our menu Nothing was a disappointment Even though our group of 15 has very different cuisine preferences everyone enjoyed everything We had two servers who made sure our glasses and plates were always full It was amazing from beginning to end Either of us will recommend this restaurant for drinks dinner or private dining

Author: Susan E.
Content: Went to Mercat for breakfast and had a wonderful meal  it was grits with rock shrimp and braised ribs  delicious Â And the wait staff was extremely attentive

Author: Beth W.
Content: My husband and I went here for dinner last night a Friday We arrived a little early so we had a drink in the bar to start I had the sangriatini which is a sangria served with is a combination of wine a sparkling wine brandy and fruit It was really tasty My husband had a dirty martini that was also good Our bartender was really down to earth and friendly The atmosphere in general is a little hip for me but it was also a Friday Â The restaurant itself is very pretty Â I love the decor and the high vaulted ceilings Â We waited about 20 minutes after our reservation time so not too bad After being seated we were brought a crunchy bruschetta like bite this was fabulous Next we ordered wine and some starters I asked the server to recommend me a dry white wine She chose the most expensive glass on the menu which ended up being sweet My husband ordered a middle of the road temperanillo which he enjoyed We ordered the olives the sardine dish and the bacon wrapped figs We loved these three dishes although my husband thought the bacon figs were a little too sweet Next we ordered the brussel sprouts the patatas bravas and the pork belly The brussel sprouts tasted as though they were drenched in oranges The patatas bravas tasted fake we hated them The pork belly was really tasty We finished with the chocolate croquetas which were not very good tasted like the outside of a mozzarella stick with a yucky chocolate inside Being people that love Spanish food and have been to Spain this food was nothing that special It was also pricey Our bill was expensive for decent food and decent wine

Author: Jason W.
Content: I went here for valentines day with my gf and we had a great time Â The most memorable tapas were the cheese whazelnut chocolate the rabbit ravioli and the grilled shrimp Â If I went back I would get more of the grilled items Â The decor is unique Â Only downside would be that it is a bit pricey but I think it is worth it on a special occasion or if someone is visiting from out of town since it is right near the park

Author: John R.
Content: My wife and I went to Mercat based on a Taste of Chicago tv review in our hotel room  which was only a block away The atmosphere was open and the dinning area large with many tables We got there early around 530 It was jammed by the time we left We picked 5 dishes to start My wife hates green beans but she really liked the jam and green bean salad It had a great flavor The few other dishes we had were favorable but not top notch Some of the food was only warm not hot I just remembered that the shrimp appetizer was really good I guess if you are at one of the south loop hotels this would be a good place to eat One other thing our waiter never asked me if I wanted another drink Even though I was done with it before the 3rd plate arrived

Author: Megan M.
Content: I had a wonderful time in their lounge Â My boyfriend and I came for sangria special and stayed for the food Â The bartender served us and was extremely helpful Â The sangria was seasonal and excellent Â We had a wellbalanced cheese platter Â Then moved on to the best pork belly Ive ever tasted  not too fatty and was really well searedcaramelized Â I cant speak to the other days of the week but it was not crowded on Monday Â The vibe is nice too  trendy but not overly so

Author: Rachel P.
Content: This is an amazing culinary experience I cant believe I have lived in the south loop this long without trying Mercat a la Planxa The highlights were this delicious salad with spinach Serrano ham fresh figs lardon and other yummy bitssweet savory and delicious mushrooms with lots of butter garlic and some potato and onion and the a la planxa scallops The sangria was delicious the atmosphere was relaxing yet you feel like you are out to dine well and the service was very nice I will go back and enjoy this gem again now that know how delicious it is

Author: d b.
Content: Based on the food alone it was a 4 and probably one of the better tapas in the city However the prices were way too high After 100 dollars of tapas and sangria I was still hungry I had to keep ordering Â Three 2x1 inch raviolis for 9Really really Otherwise the space is pretty cool with a view of the park I would rec grabbing a high top in the rather large bar like area ordering a pitcher of sangria and just a couple of tapas and enjoy the view out the huge windows Dont go for dinner Its a little touristy with the prices to match

Author: Chris H.
Content: Everything here was delicious I had reservations which was a good thing since the place was full It is pretty large and is on the second floor A little deceiving as there is a bar on the first floor I loved everything at this place You must try the chorizo stuffed olives

Author: Kimberly S.
Content: I had heard great things about this place from a friend  which was why I was doubly disappointed when Mercat fell WAY short of expectations Â Portions were minuscule the food was mediocre the drinks were interesting but too heavy on the mixers and the bill was more than it ought have been Â I left still hungry not vaguely buzzed and feeling robbed Â With all of the incredible tapas places in Chicago do yourself a favor and skip Mercat

Author: Sarah A.
Content: For those of you who adore their Sunday brunch be aware it has greatly changed Last time I went the suckling pig had been taken off the buffet which I was ok with since they still served it as a course on the tasting menuThe cheese and meat has also been greatly reduced Before there was about three choices of meats and cheese each Now only one meat and meat There were other cheeses on display but when asked I they could be cut into we we were told no As well the bottomless bloody Marys sangria and mimosas are no longer but to il law Very sad turned our normal Sunday brunch bill from 45 to 80 per person  more money for less offerings Yet a lot of other places in Chicago still run bottomless specials Sad to say use to be one of our go to brunch places but will probably look around to see what else Chicago has to offerI do have to say our waitress was was awesome Great service and smile

Author: Jocelyn R.
Content: Having been to Barcelona and sampling authentic tapas there I know what good tapas taste like Â I thought everything I had at Mercat a la Planxa was amazing Â The ham prosciutto we started melted in your mouth and the cheese pairing suggested by our waitress was a great compliment Â Our waitress was attentive and very helpful  she brought out three wines to try on the house and after having sampled we could choose the one we liked the best Â She had great taste too Â She also brought us a sample of the lamb prosciutto and the ham prosciutto which was so good we had to order a full dish Â We also had mushroom risotto baby octopi and great bruschetta Â The stuffed caramelized dates over a cabbage salad with a blue cheese dressing was the best thing we had all night I would highly recommend this restaurant for the adventurous types wanting to try something new

Author: Tish V.
Content: this dainty food was very tasty i went there for lunch w a friend for their Catalan express menu and thought i was going to be starving after my plates were served portions are small its not quantity but quality here  kudos to the chef the service was good and although i dined at their outdoor patio i snuck a peek at the main dining room and was impressed ill make sure to go with fatter pockets to get the full dining experience at dinner time in their main dining room itll be worth it for that special occasion

Author: claudia l.
Content: I do love the food here but the management is lacking in consideration of their customers Â I was entertaining guests at the Auditorium and booked brunch at the restaurant prior to the performance about 3 weeks ahead of time Â  Â I called to reconfirm a couple days prior as I had received an email in error confirming my attendance at an Iron Chef event that evening Â I did not get the call regarding the calcellation of my brunch until the afternoon before  incredibly inconvenient and inconsiderate

Author: MC B.
Content: We headed there with a group of 8 and I would say thats the way to go Â The food was awesome and with so many of us we got to try a little of everything Â No complaints at all on the good Â Although our server had some really good suggestions our service was a little slow Â Other than that great place to go with a group Â The lamb was phenomenal along with both chocolate desserts

Author: ilove m.
Content: For 2 months I Â listened to my husband go onandon about how awesome this Mercat is after he went as part of a business dinner Â A month ago when the weather was a bit nicer we decided to take a walk to Mercat for dinner Â Oh man the food here is delicious Â We went with the tasting menu and could barely finish the third course Â It can be kinda pricey but in my opinion worth it Â Weve gone back for lunch on the weekend and their lunch menu is definitely reasonable

Author: Maggie P.
Content: Mercat was very highly recommended to me by a coworker and it lived up to its expectations Between me and my husband we had patatas bravas garlic shrimp spanish omelette the short rib flatbread and the croquettes for dessert Everything was great The waiter swayed us into the croquettes for dessert and I was so glad he did because they were the best part of the meal It is definitely worth going to this restaurant

Author: Andrea S.
Content: I have trouble giving this place any stars because it really deserves zero Â The waiter basically disappeared after taking our orders so for most of the night no one had any drinks at the table Â They also forgot to bring the main course of our tasting to the table and skipped right over to dessert the dessert also left something to be desired  a small chocolate square that tasted like nothing more than a fudge popsicle Â Then when it came time for the check the waiter was once again missing so we had to go up to the hostess Â We even had to ask her for it twice Â For a high end restaurant the service was one of the worst Ive seen in Chicago Â If you are going to spend 100 per person you expect to get some service Â Save your money and go somewhere else

Author: Susan E.
Content: Bar was packed but drinks were excellent Â Table service was outstanding honest and real Â Food was delicious Â It was loud and busy but the Chefs tasting dishes were well paced and we left stuffed  which isnt always the case with Tapas Bars Â Excellent party atmosphere and feel free to dress to impress or not Â Its a good sized room with a little bit of everything going on

Author: Mel L.
Content: We came here for lunch this past Saturday after seeing a blurb in the Red Eye regarding the chocolate croquette Â dessert fried chocolate ballshow could I have not known of this sooner Â I had made a reservation for noon but didnt really need to Â There were only 2 or 3 other tables with diners when we arrived Â Its a cute place with a lot of natural light But on to the food They have a Catalan Express special for lunch with includes 2 courses and a fountain drink For the first course we had a serrano ham  fig salad and the mixto croquettas Â Im usually not a big salad fan but this was amazing Â I wish they bottled the dressing and sold itit was sooo good I think this was the highlight of the meal The croquettes filled with ham and chorizo were also very tasty Â The second course my friend ordered the Las Ramblas grilled chicken sandwich Â He thought it was good being a big bacon fan but thought the bread was kind of dry Â For me I had the Black Angus hanger steak Â It was cooked just the way I liked it mediummedium wellbut if you like your steak more rare definitely tell them Â The waiter didnt ask how I wanted it actually he was pretty nonexistentthus the drop in star But the busboy was cool and answered some of our questions Â Then the waiter came with our check before we even ordered dessertthe MAIN reason I picked the restaurant Â We quickly corrected him Â Unfortunately the chocolate croquettes didnt blow me away Â Dont get me wrongit was tasty but maybe I built it up in my head too much Â  But either way well definitely be back Â We heard good things about the Sunday brunch too

Author: John F.
Content: Been here several times  and the food is always good Â Todays food was no exception but the service was just so poor that it ruined the entire experience Â Over 15 minutes from the time that we sat until someone came to our table Â The server spilled sangria on my sister  no excuse me no apology  just sent the bus boy over to clean up Â  Water glasses left unfilled Â Needed to ask for bread Â Ordered a group of tapas finished those  order another group Â Our plates were dirty  needed to ask for clean plates Â I finished my wine only wanted one glass  it sat on the table for over an hour empty  still there when we left Â Not offered coffee Â Maybe okay in a low end diner  not in this caliber of restaurant Â Since the service component is as important as the food  i have rated it this low

Author: el O G.
Content: I found myself here for a friends birthday and was immediately wowed by the decor While nothing outlandish it was very welldone and provided a very urbane background for the dinner with a lot of energy Since we were in a large group we tried various tapas as well as sharing a half pig amongst our group The pig was excellent as it was juicy and well cooked and the crispy skin was a hit The tapas while excellent were not very large or even very sharable though multiple plates were ordered amongst our group That is my only complaint about the restaurant as the staff was very accomodating and on top of things with a group of 14 and noisy background When I find myself back in Chicago I will make it point to have another meal here

Author: Alia K.
Content: This place has good food and a fun vibe Â With its location off of Michigan near where they do the summer dancing its a GREAT date spot if youve been wandering the park enjoying your summer nights

Author: Paul C.
Content: Service and food were fantastic Â I felt my personal space was slightly invaded by the folks next to me I think Mercat has fallen victim to the temptation to put in a few too many tables Â However its not possible to fault the food Take the white sangria over the red

Author: Patricia D.
Content: Enjoyed my dinner at Mercat a la Planxa very much It is a bit expensive but the dishes were very good You can splurge or just get a few dishes with drinks The bacon wrapped dates were fabulous as well as the grilled calamari The tables next to us ordered the suckling pig  seafood paella which smelled out of this world as well Would not hesitate to go back again

Author: Miguel g.
Content: Cant go wrong tasting menu or individual items sangria or awesome mojitos save room for dessert

Author: Tess K.
Content: This restaurant holds a place in my and my husbands heart Â We go every year for our anniversary Â The food is great Â It is easy to get carried away but there are things like jamon Iberico de belota and the patatas bravas that you just cant find as good elsewhere Â  We live in the South Loop so we eat great and walk home Â Its a perfect combo Â The only reason I didnt give it 5 stars is the cost

Author: Denis M.
Content: Very tasty food along with the presentation of it Slightly pricey

Author: Mary Ann F.
Content: Average food and the waiter when we could find him continued to try to sell highpriced items at every turn Pacing of the arrival of the food was sporadic and not timed to arrival of cocktails Cold in the restaurant one friend had to wear her coat When we asked for more of the bread that is first put on the table we were charged an additional 150 Would not go back

Author: Kelly A.
Content: 5 stars for food 3 stars for service The food is absolutely incredible I have always wanted to go here Its very easy to eat gluten and dairy free here and they were extremely helpful about food allergies Our server was great The problem was it was empty and it took us 2 12 hours to eat I think they forgot to put half our food orders in The kitchen is open and you could see the chefs just standing around doing nothing I really dont know what happened and they didnt seem to either Besides that being totally aggravating the food was superb I ate anchovies AND lamb and loved them both These are things I never eat And also the flash fried peppers were amazing I had a Verdosa salad which was out of this world And the grilled octopus was outstanding The only thing we didnt like was the grilled shrimp Mushy and fishy Not fresh tasting Im hoping they were just having an off night Would go back again because the food was so great

Author: Tam T.
Content: For a dining experience you pay for service and food The service Â at Mercat Â did not live up to the food of Mercat My wife and I entered the upstair seating and was greeted nonchalantly by the hostess She informed us that we can wait for a table or be seated in the lounge area as she pointed in a general direction of the lounge My wife and I just wanted a nice drink and some snacks so I headed over to the lounge area After being seated we waited for 10 minutes for the menu along with another couple who was waiting for their dessert After 10 minutes of waiting and about 45 waiters passing us without acknowledging that we were even there I got up and asked the hostess if she had menus for us to order She seemed shocked and realized that she had menus in front of her I gladly retrieved the menu and began to look over the available list Price is on the higher end and portion is skim We were finally greeted by a waiter and I ordered a red sangria While waiting for the sangria the waiter brought out a complementary pan con tomato but without silverware or napkins I suppose lounge means lack of competent service After we ordered our food and drinks I finally had to ask the waiter for silverware and napkins We had the Tiger Shrimps and Ahi Tuna with 3 drinks altogether Both dishes were perfectly cooked and seasoned Our bill came out to be about 110 with tax and tip I just cant find the reason to come back when service is poor and price didnt meet the dining experience despite great food Quite a shame when service ruin the dining experience

Author: K H.
Content: Overratedentirely We had 730 pm reservations on a Thursday night  for just two people 815 rolled around so we asked how long until our table would be ready We were told that none of the tables seemed to be budging We waited another 20 minutes before asking again We were told itd be at least another 20 After giving the hostess the evil eye she finally offered us some free tapas and told us we were next on the list As we ate that about to eat our hands as well we noticed that a couple who arrived at least 20 minutes after we had was being seated We complained to the hostess who gave us a lame apology Finally around 905 we were seated The foodsoso Certainly not scrumptuous enough to make up for the wait To their credit the restaurant didnt charge us for our drinks eitherso between the free tapas and drinks they tried to make up for the wait but all in all I wouldnt return

Author: Shari D.
Content: Intended to go for the restaurant week special but opted for their tasting menu 65pp wout wine 85 with where you tell the server what you dont care for allergies etc and the chef creates something special for you said our server Not really the case they just select items off the menu Perhaps I misunderstood and that would be ok except that nothing that came out was stellar The lamb chops were very good and a cheeseapplecaramel plate had perfectly blended flavors otherwise nothing to get excited about Omlettepotato mushroom flatbread bacon wrapped datesall very basic Two dishes were just badhead on shrimp was literally mealy Something was wrong And overcooked octopus Fantastic wines great bartender  hostvery flexible on a snowstormy night Server focused a little too much on how much food you get for the money trueI actually felt a little ill totally my own fault and the Top Chef chef but didnt really seem to care if we liked the food And bewarethe advertised 14 valet goes up to 26 after 3 hours Overall very expensive night for a whole lot of nothing

Author: Amit B.
Content: Went there for dinner on Christmas Day and with very low expectations and they delivered right on We did not want to do Christmasinspired special menus at other Â places and Mercat seemed to be the only reasonable place that wasnt offering one and neither were they closed To our surprise when we were seated we were given a Christmas Special Menu 15 courses of small plates to be shared Â When we asked for the regular menu they gave us one why not just give both at the same time Â No pressure to go for the special menu however later on during the meal we heard our waiter trying to sell the special to other tables We got the Arroz a la Cazuela with lobster chicken and some other meats in a saffron broth the Chorizo with paprika and garlic the Ropa de Cabra Â stringy goat meat with goat cheese and the sausage flatbread with roasted garlic and manchego we probably ordered another dish but I cant seem to remember guess it was the least memorable of all The waiter disappeared after we got served the first three dishes the flatbread took what seem an eternity We attributed it to the fact that perhaps they were not expecting very many flatbread orders almost every other table was doing the special menu The goat was the only one I would go back for  it was delectable given that it isnt easy to get that right stringy consistency Â We found service lacking but like I said we went with very low expectations so we shielded ourselves from disappointment Our waiter even brought us the wrong check and I couldnt imagine why anyone would spend upwards of 300 bucks on this kind of food I guess Jose Garces can get away doing what he does in Philly it really is a onerestaurant city but he seems to be doing fine in Chicago as well It was our first meal in Chicago Â and we knew it could only get better

Author: Made N.
Content: wow wow wow this food was incredibly good we stopped in on a late whim on a warm summer night Â we ate outside which only amplified the experience Â we had the white and seasonal sangria both good although we agreed the white was tastier bruschettalike bread came free of charge while reviewing the menu and was very very good Â we ordered three dishes and each bite was amazing the mushroom rice with asparagus was so incredibly good we immediately wanted more the flavors were just wow Â the patatas bravas were unique and adorable and super yummy too we also ordered a wild mushrooms which were very good but did pale in comparison to the other two dishes which were out of this world Â because the food was so good we decided to go with a dessert though all but one option on the menu was nearly indecipherably exotic the one we got was also so so good chocolate hazelnut mouse with some dollop of ice cream and i dont even know what else but goodGod it was good we were so glad we risked it Â the presentation was excellent the service very good and the food delectable Â I cant WAIT to go back inside looked very swank though i only saw the bar and the bathroom

Author: Jeudi J.
