Content: Dinner last night was amazing Every single bite every taste was absolutely delicious Met Exec Chef Michael before we sat down and chatted food for awhile I used to cookcater gourmet so maybe thats why he sent over some extra plates for us but we got out for 60 for two we did skip drinks didnt want to snooze off in the ballet Had the spinach salad incredible Pork belly with apple twas like meatcandy delicious Lamb chops were perfect much better than I had at Emils the night before Bread with tomato spread sort of like bruschetta but easier to eat amazing I could have eaten a pound of just that Topped off with chocolatefilled croquettes that were positively orgasmic we literally wiped the plate clean with our fingers couldnt let one bit go to waste Wonderful service although as others have mentioned several times dishes that werent ours were brought to our table All in all a spectacular meal and I WILL be back to try everything else on the menu Bravo Michael

Author: Sarah B.
Content: This was hands down by far the best restaurant experience I have ever had PERIOD Â I was here on a date one Sunday afternoon and Bobby was our server Bartender Â He was incredibly knowledgeable about the restaurants history the menu and food drinks in general Â He was very attentive but super chill as well Â Each dish we had was beautifully prepared and equally every bit as delicious Â I wish I had a favorite but I loved them ALL Â We had the seared ahi tuna roasted peppers the cheese and pine nut flat bread cauliflower and broccoli and desert WHOA Â This took it to the next level Â I adore sweets and this definitely was the perfect way to end the meal Â It was a coconut ice cream coated in chocolate topped with a candied walnut accompanied with a warm croquette and ganache Â Talk about heaven on Earth Â I would recommend this to anyone who loves amazing food and appreciates a nice dining ambience with amazing service

Author: Alexis S.
Content: My fiance and I met another couple here for dinner the other night and I have to say I was blown away We go out to eat often and honestly this was the best dining experience Ive had in a very long time Both the atmosphere and our waitress were incredibly hip and fun It was the perfect ambiance for our group and we laughed with our server the entire evening Â My fiance was the only one in our group who had been to the restaurant before and he suggested we all go for the chefs tasting which we were up for Our waitress was very considerate of the fact that I dont eat seafood and someone else in our party didnt eat pork If there was ever a dish with one of those proteins featured she would switch it up for us with a vegetarian option Needless to say the food was DELICIOUS We were all saying yum after each course was served and by the time the end of the meal meat and potatoes course we were all so stuffed Its too bad the food was so delicious we kept on eating anyways We all left this restaurant happy full and excited to return for another 3 hours dinner at a new favorite

Author: Mary D.
Content: Lets start with my basis for comparison which is Barcelona however unfair that may be Â Also all four of us have pretty high food standards and eat out often and find Chicago to be a great food city Â Summary of review Â I was embarrassed that I brought my friends here Â  We came for the Rioja Wine Dinner part of the Restaurant Week rioja promotion  pre fixe with a glass of wine from Rioja Â Lets start with the wine markup  400 over retail on the three bottles I checked  norm is 250  300 Â The tasting menu billed as 4 appetizers 2 entrees and dessert was all in single bites  5 tiny bites of appetizers per person 2 were potato one was deep fried peppers very oily and bland and the 4th was bacon wrapped dates which were the high point  just delicious and for this one we got 2 small dates per person entrees were one single squash dumpling per person and one tiny piece of pork belly per person Â So literally the entire dinner was 7 tiny bites counting dates as 2 bites of mostly not their best food items mostly starches Â Dessert was mediocre at best pasty rice pudding bad Catalan Crema  here a curdled egg custard and an OK chocolate mousse thing with a skin on top like it had been sitting for a while and I forget the 4th because it was declared gross by everyone else so I didnt try it Â Its not that were cheap or into huge portions  quite the opposite  we go to good restaurants all the time and happily pay big bucks for quality and little portions we tip well plus we each ordered another glass of 21 wine which bumped the bill up considerably Â This was simply beyond acceptable and even at 35 of which 12 was wine it was a rip off Â If you had told me it would be 7 bites of something starchy plus a glass of wine and a gluelike dessert I wouldnt have ordered it Â This experience cost them a repeat customer and I suspect they are hurting for profits or they wouldnt have done such blatant costcutting on the food Â I also think based on my last few visits that the quality in general has slipped considerably since the first year it was opened while the price skyrocketed mostly on the wine and drinks Â The quality is now too uneven for me to bring business clients and quite frankly Chicago has much better places for the money like Purple Pig or Province which also participated in the Rioja promotion Â For the same price as a regular dinner at Mercat I could go to Bonsoiree and bring my own much better wine or Blackbird and get good food and great wine Â Yes Mercat has the energy of a cavernous raucous New York restaurant Â If you want to pay dearly for energy this is your place

Author: Tiffany G.
Content: OMG  Anytime you go to a restaurant two days in a row your either really greedy or the food is EXCELLENT Ill go with the food is EXCELLENT Ive been here about 3 times in 4 months and will probably go again before the snow melts Its just that good Ive never had garlic spinach with pine nuts shredds of green apples sprinkled on top It sounds very different and it is but its very good I went with my sister on the 1st trip and the chocolate balls we had for desert were soooo good I had to come back the next day with my husband for desert only Ive never had fried chocoalte balls with melted marshmallow and some type of sauce drizzled on top melt in my mouth until eating here It was the best desert Ive ever had in my entire lifeIm not exaggerating Â It was a little more expensive than your average tapas restaurant but Â it was worth it When you go try to get a table next to the window and youll have a beautiful view of michigan ave During the weekends Mercat is busier but you can still get a seat in a reasonable amount of time The only thing that didnt please my palate was a rice dish It was too dry and lacked flavor

Author: Stephanie B.
Content: Great food Horrible service We arrived 10 minutes late for a reservation We apologized for our tardiness and checked in with the hostess After waiting a couple of minutes the hostess came over and without even a smile told us they dont hold a reservation past fifteen minutes Since this was still now just twelve minutes past our reservation time we figured that was still ok Instead we were informed we could sit at a high top table in the bar but shed need the table back in 45 minutes Â We asked to see a manager and suddenly there was a table available for us Â We were so frustrated with the horrible service we couldnt stay to eat Â We have been to Mercat previously and have always waited at least 15 minutes for a table when weve had a reservation so you would think they could have been more understanding Â We love the food but there are too many great places in Chicago to spend our money at such a rude place

Author: liza o.
Content: The food at this restaurant is pretty good Â unfortunately this fact is tempered by a waitstaff and management who treats their customers like they are too cool to do their job Â I have had several bad expereinces there finally adding up to more than just coincidence Â I have been several times and everytime Im met with incompetency and arrogance  a bad combination Â Once my reservation was lost on arrival even after I had called to confirm it And instead of trying to fix it the hostesses tried to convince me that it must have been my fault in some way Â Another time I ordered a drink in the downstairs bar but the bartender didnt feel like getting one of the missing ingredients from the upstairs bar so he told me to order something else This was followed by a dining experience where the waiter introduced himself by saying so do you know what you want yet Â Not worth the moneygo to some of the other good tapas in Chicagothey are aplenty
